definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “outpoint”: to score more points than an opponent, especially in boxing or other judged/point-based sports.
definition.zh: “outpoint”的过去式/过去分词：在计分比赛中得分超过对手；尤指拳击等按点数判胜的运动。

examples.en: She outpointed her opponent in a close, tactical fight.
examples.zh: 她在一场势均力敌、讲究战术的比赛中以点数胜过对手。

examples.en: He didn’t score a knockout, but he outpointed his rival over ten rounds.
examples.zh: 他没有把对手KO，但在十个回合里凭点数赢了对手。

definition.en: More generally: to gain an advantage by earning or accumulating more points (in any scoring system).
definition.zh: 更广义：在任何计分体系中通过拿到更多分数而取得优势。

examples.en: Our team outpointed them in the second half.
examples.zh: 我们队在下半场得分超过了他们。

examples.en: The home side outpointed the visitors 98–90.
examples.zh: 主队以98比90在得分上压过客队。

extraExplanation: “outpoint”常见于拳击报道：强调“靠点数取胜”，通常意味着比赛打满回合、没有KO/TKO。中文体育新闻里常译为“点数获胜/点胜”。
构词法：out-（超过）+ point（得分/点数）。所以 outpointed = “得分比对方多而赢”。

summary.en: “Outpointing” means beating someone by scoring more points, especially in sports; it can also be used figuratively to mean outperforming someone in a measurable way.
summary.zh: “outpointing”指在分数上胜过对手（尤指体育比赛）；也可引申为在可比较、可“计分”的方面胜过他人。

definition.en: scoring more points than an opponent; surpassing someone in points (often in sports, games, or voting).
definition.zh: （多用于体育、比赛或投票中）得分超过对手；在分数上胜过某人。

examples.en: By halftime, the home team was outpointing their rivals 42–35.
examples.zh: 到中场时，主队以42比35的比分领先对手。

examples.en: She kept outpointing him in every round of the debate.
examples.zh: 在辩论的每一轮里，她都在“得分”上压过他。

definition.en: present participle of “outpoint”; used to describe an ongoing action of beating someone by points.
definition.zh: “outpoint”的现在分词；用于描述正在进行的“以分数取胜”的动作。

examples.en: He is outpointing the field with consistent, steady play.
examples.zh: 他凭借稳定的发挥，正在以分数优势领先其他选手。

extraExplanation: “outpoint”常见于拳击（boxing）或带回合计分的比赛：表示不是靠击倒（knockout），而是靠裁判计分获胜（win on points）。
在非体育语境中也可比喻“在论点/表现上更占优势”，但仍带有“可以计分的比较”这种感觉。
写作中常见形式：outpoint（动词原形）、outpoints（第三人称单数）、outpointed（过去式）、outpointing（现在分词/动名词）。

summary.en: “Outpoints” means “scores more points than” and wins by points.
summary.zh: “outpoints”表示“得分超过对手”，以点数占优取胜。

definition.en: to score more points than an opponent; to win by having a higher points total (often in sports like boxing or in judged competitions).
definition.zh: （在比赛中）得分超过对手；以点数更高取胜（常用于拳击等按点数判定的项目）。

examples.en: She outpoints her opponent in the final round and wins the match.
examples.zh: 她在最后一回合得分超过对手，赢得了比赛。

examples.en: In boxing, a fighter can outpoint a stronger opponent by landing more clean punches.
examples.zh: 在拳击中，拳手可以通过打出更多有效、干净的拳击来以点数胜过更强壮的对手。

definition.en: (statistics, analysis) to have more points than someone or something in a comparison.
definition.zh: （统计、分析中）在比较中“点数/分数”更多。

examples.en: Our team outpoints theirs by 12 points per game on average.
examples.zh: 按平均每场计算，我们队比他们队多12分。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。因此 outpoint = out-（超过）+ point（得分）。
这个词最常见于体育报道，尤其是拳击：如果没有击倒（KO/TKO），裁判常按点数判胜负，就会说某拳手“outpointed”对手。

summary.en: Outpoise means to outweigh or surpass, tipping the balance in weight, strength, or importance.
summary.zh: Outpoise 指在重量、力量或重要性上胜过，从而“压倒”对方、使天平倾向一侧。

definition.en: to outweigh; to be heavier or stronger than something so that it tips the balance
definition.zh: （在重量或力量上）超过；使失衡；压倒

examples.en: The cargo on the left side outpoised the cargo on the right, so the boat leaned.
examples.zh: 左侧的货物比右侧重，船就倾斜了。

examples.en: Her calm argument outpoised his anger in the meeting.
examples.zh: 在会议上，她冷静的论证压过了他的愤怒。

definition.en: to surpass in importance or influence; to outweigh in effect
definition.zh: （在重要性或影响上）胜过；更有分量

examples.en: In the long run, trust outpoises short-term profit.
examples.zh: 从长远看，信任比短期利润更重要。

examples.en: One strong piece of evidence can outpoise many weak guesses.
examples.zh: 一条有力证据可能胜过许多薄弱猜测。

extraExplanation: “outpoise”较少见，语气偏书面或文学；日常更常用“outweigh”“overbalance”。
词源上由“out-（超过）+ poise（平衡、重量）”构成；“poise”本义与“秤的平衡”有关，所以“outpoise”常带“把天平压向一边”的画面感。

summary.en: Outpoison means to poison more than something else, or (figuratively) to be more malicious or corrupt than others.
summary.zh: outpoison 指“比……更毒/毒害更厉害”，也可作比喻，指“在恶毒或腐败上胜过他人”。

definition.en: to poison more than someone or something else; to surpass in poisonousness or harmful effect
definition.zh: 比……更毒；毒害得更厉害；在毒性或伤害效果上超过

examples.en: Some toxins can outpoison traditional pesticides even in tiny amounts.
examples.zh: 有些毒素即使剂量很小，也可能比传统农药更“毒”、危害更大。

examples.en: The new chemical was designed to outpoison older formulas used on crops.
examples.zh: 这种新化学品被设计成在作物上比旧配方更强效、更具毒性。

definition.en: (figurative, often literary) to be more corrupt, cruel, or malicious than someone else
definition.zh: （比喻，常见于文学）在腐败、残酷或恶毒方面胜过他人

examples.en: In the novel, the villain tries to outpoison his rivals with rumors and betrayal.
examples.zh: 在小说里，反派试图用谣言和背叛在“恶毒”上压过对手。

examples.en: Their arguments grew so bitter it felt like each side was trying to outpoison the other.
examples.zh: 他们的争吵变得极其尖刻，仿佛双方都在比谁更“毒”。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 工作得更努力、outsmart 更聪明）。outpoison 属于较少见/较文学化的构词，用来强调“在毒害程度或恶意程度上更甚”。
日常英语中更常用的表达包括：be more poisonous（更有毒）、be more toxic（毒性更强）、poison more severely（更严重地毒害）、outdo in cruelty/malice（在残酷/恶毒上胜过）。

summary.en: Outpoll means to receive more votes than another person or group in an election or poll.
summary.zh: outpoll 指在选举或民调中获得比对手更多的选票（或支持率），即“得票超过”。

definition.en: to get more votes than someone else in an election or poll
definition.zh: （在选举或民调中）获得比他人更多的选票；得票超过

examples.en: She outpolled her main rival by more than 10,000 votes.
examples.zh: 她比主要对手多获得了一万多票。

examples.en: The incumbent outpolled the challenger in most districts.
examples.zh: 现任者在大多数选区的得票都超过了挑战者。

examples.en: In the final survey, the party outpolled its competitors among young voters.
examples.zh: 在最终民调中，该党在年轻选民中支持率（得票/占比）超过了竞争对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过人数、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outpoll 字面意思就是“在投票/民调中胜过”。
常见搭配：outpoll + someone（得票超过某人）；outpoll + a party/opponent（得票超过某党/对手）；outpoll by + number/percentage（多出……票/……个百分点）。

summary.en: “Outpolled” means someone received more votes than another person or group.
summary.zh: “Outpolled”指在选举中某人/某方的得票数超过对手。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of “outpoll”) to get more votes than another person or group in an election.
definition.zh: （outpoll 的过去式/过去分词）在选举中获得比另一位候选人或团体更多的选票；得票数超过。

examples.en: She outpolled her main rival by 10,000 votes.
examples.zh: 她比主要对手多获得一万票。

examples.en: In the final count, the incumbent was outpolled in several urban districts.
examples.zh: 在最终计票中，现任者在几个城市选区的得票数落后于对手。

examples.en: The party outpolled expectations, winning more seats than predicted.
examples.zh: 该党得票表现超出预期，赢得的席位比预测更多。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过/胜过”，如 outnumber（数量超过）、outperform（表现超过）。因此 outpoll 常用于新闻报道或选举分析中，强调“得票数更高”。
注意区分：poll 既可指“民意调查”，也可指“投票/选举中的计票结果”。outpolled 在语境中通常指“实际投票结果得票超过”，不是“民调里领先”。

summary.en: Outpolling means getting more votes (or higher support in a poll) than someone else.
summary.zh: outpolling 指在选举或民调中得票（或支持率）高于他人。

definition.en: (present participle of outpoll) getting more votes than another candidate, party, or option in an election or poll.
definition.zh: （outpoll 的现在分词）在选举或民调中获得比另一位候选人/政党/选项更多的票（或支持率）。

examples.en: The incumbent is outpolling her main rival by five points.
examples.zh: 现任者的支持率比主要对手高出5个百分点。

examples.en: In the first round, the new party was outpolling expectations.
examples.zh: 在第一轮中，这个新政党的得票表现超出了预期。

examples.en: Several smaller candidates are outpolling the front-runner in this district.
examples.zh: 在这个选区，几位小候选人的得票反而超过了领先者。

definition.en: the act or result of receiving more votes than another person or group; being ahead in votes.
definition.zh: 得票（或支持率）超过他人的行为或结果；在票数上领先。

examples.en: Their outpolling of the governing party surprised many analysts.
examples.zh: 他们得票超过执政党让许多分析人士感到意外。

examples.en: Outpolling in rural areas helped decide the election.
examples.zh: 在农村地区的得票领先帮助决定了选举结果。

extraExplanation: “outpoll”常见于政治新闻与选举分析中，既可指正式选举的“得票数更多”，也可用于民意调查的“支持率更高”。
写作中常与数字或比较对象连用：outpolling + someone/by + number（如 by 3 points）。
注意：poll 在这里是“投票/民调”，不是“杆子（pole）”。

summary.en: “Outpolls” means gets more votes (or higher support in a poll) than an opponent.
summary.zh: “outpolls”指在选举或民调中得票（或支持率）高于对手。

definition.en: (of a candidate or party) to receive more votes than an opponent; to beat someone in an election or opinion poll.
definition.zh: （候选人或政党）获得比对手更多的选票；在选举或民调中胜过对方。

examples.en: In the latest survey, Chen outpolls her closest rival by five points.
examples.zh: 在最新的民调中，陈以5个百分点领先（得票/支持率高于）最接近的对手。

examples.en: The mayor outpolls the challenger in most districts.
examples.zh: 市长在大多数选区的得票（或支持率）都高于挑战者。

examples.en: If turnout is high, the incumbent often outpolls expectations.
examples.zh: 如果投票率很高，现任者往往会拿到高于预期的得票。

extraExplanation: “outpolls”是动词“outpoll”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it outpolls）。常见于新闻报道与选举分析中，可指真实选举得票，也可指民意调查中的支持率更高。
构词上是 out-（超过）+ poll（投票/民调），语气较正式，常搭配 by + 数字（领先多少）或 in + 地区（在哪些地区领先）。

summary.en: Outpomp means to outdo someone in pomp or showy splendor (often with a critical or humorous tone).
summary.zh: outpomp 指在排场或华丽程度上胜过他人，常带讽刺或调侃语气。

definition.en: to surpass someone or something in pomp, showiness, or ceremonial splendor
definition.zh: 在排场、铺张或仪式的华丽程度上胜过（某人或某事）

examples.en: The smaller city tried to outpomp its rival with a grand parade and fireworks.
examples.zh: 这座较小的城市试图用盛大的游行和烟火表演在排场上压过竞争对手。

examples.en: At the awards night, several guests seemed determined to outpomp one another in extravagant outfits.
examples.zh: 在颁奖之夜，几位来宾似乎铁了心要用夸张的穿着在排场上彼此压过对方。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outshine 超过/胜过光彩；outperform 表现更好）。“outpomp”把它加在“pomp（排场、盛典的华丽）”前面，语气往往带一点讽刺或批评，暗示过度讲排场。
该词较少见、偏文学/修辞用法；日常表达更常用“outdo someone in extravagance / be more showy than … / try to outshine …”。

summary.en: Outpop means to have more people (often more players) than another group, especially in gaming or crowd-size talk.
summary.zh: outpop 指在人数上超过对方（尤其常用于游戏语境，表示“人数优势/人数碾压”）。

definition.en: to have a larger population or number of people/players than another group or place (often used in online games or discussions about crowd size)
definition.zh: （人数/人口）比另一方更多；在网游语境中常指“人数压过对方/人数碾压”。

examples.en: Our faction outpopped the enemy at the base, so they backed off.
examples.zh: 我们阵营在据点人数压过对面，所以他们撤了。

examples.en: That server is outpopping the others during peak hours.
examples.zh: 那个服务器在高峰时段的人数比其他服务器多。

definition.en: to exceed something in the number of people present; to draw a bigger crowd than
definition.zh: 在人群数量上超过；比……更能聚集人。

examples.en: The main stage outpopped every side event all weekend.
examples.zh: 整个周末主舞台的人数都超过了所有分会场活动。

extraExplanation: “outpop”多见于网络与游戏社区（例如 MMO、阵营对战类游戏），由 out-（超过）+ pop（population 的口语缩写）构成，强调“人数优势”而不是“更受欢迎”。
常见搭配：outpop the enemy / outpop them (at X)；相关词：outnumber（人数超过，较正式）、overpopulated（人口过多/过度拥挤）。

summary.en: “Outpopped” means “suddenly popped out/appeared,” and is a less common, story-like way to describe something appearing quickly.
summary.zh: “outpopped”表示“突然蹦出来/突然出现”，较少见，常见于故事化描写。

definition.en: (informal) Past tense of “outpop”: to suddenly appear or come out from somewhere, often quickly and unexpectedly.
definition.zh: （非正式）“outpop”的过去式：突然出现或从某处蹦出来，通常又快又出人意料。

examples.en: Outpopped a little rabbit from the hat.
examples.zh: 一只小兔子突然从帽子里蹦了出来。

examples.en: When I opened the drawer, a note outpopped and fell to the floor.
examples.zh: 我一打开抽屉，一张纸条突然冒出来掉到地上。

extraExplanation: “outpopped”比较少见，更常写成两词“out popped”，或用更自然的表达“popped out”。这种倒装结构在故事/童话里很常见：Out popped + 名词（强调“突然出现”的画面感）。
多用于叙述场景、儿童读物或带幽默感的描写；正式写作里建议用“appeared suddenly / popped out”。

summary.en: “Outpopping” usually means suddenly appearing or popping out (informal).
summary.zh: “outpopping”通常指（非正式）突然出现、冒出来。

definition.en: (informal) Appearing or coming out suddenly, often from inside something or from behind something; the -ing form of “outpop.”
definition.zh: （非正式）突然出现或从里面/后面冒出来；“outpop”的 -ing 形式。

examples.en: A little lizard was outpopping from under the rock.
examples.zh: 一只小蜥蜴突然从石头下面冒出来。

examples.en: New cafes keep outpopping in this neighborhood.
examples.zh: 这片社区不断有新咖啡馆冒出来。

definition.en: (rare) Surpassing someone or something in “popping” (for example, making more popcorn or getting more “pops”); the -ing form of “outpop.”
definition.zh: （少见）在“爆/弹出/发出砰声”等方面胜过（某人或某物）；“outpop”的 -ing 形式。

examples.en: This brand is outpopping the others in our popcorn test.
examples.zh: 在我们的爆米花测试里，这个品牌的爆裂效果胜过其他品牌。

extraExplanation: “outpopping”在真实语料中多为口语/网络用法，更常见的标准表达是“popping out（冒出来）”或“popping up（突然出现）”。
写法上也可能见到分开或加连字符的形式：out popping / out-popping，意思通常不变。

summary.en: Outpopulate means to exceed another place or group in population size.
summary.zh: Outpopulate 指在人口数量上超过另一个地方或群体。

definition.en: to have a larger population than another place or group; to exceed in population size
definition.zh: （在人口数量上）超过；人口多于（另一个地方或群体）

examples.en: The city now outpopulates the surrounding rural areas.
examples.zh: 这座城市现在的人口超过了周边的农村地区。

examples.en: In some regions, younger age groups outpopulate older ones.
examples.zh: 在一些地区，年轻人口数量多于老年人口。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“比……更、超过”。因此 outpopulate 的核心意思就是“在人口上超过”。常用于人口统计、城市化与人口结构（年龄层、族群等）讨论中。
更常见、语气更中性的表达包括：have a larger population than / be more populous than。

summary.en: Outpopulated means a place has more people than it can support, or that it has more people than another place.
summary.zh: outpopulated 指某地人口超出承载能力；也可指某地人口数量超过另一地。

definition.en: Having more people than a place can support comfortably (more people than its resources, space, or jobs can handle).
definition.zh: （某地）人口过多、超出承载能力的（资源、空间或就业难以支撑）。

examples.en: Some rural areas became outpopulated after new factories opened nearby.
examples.zh: 附近新工厂开工后，一些乡村地区出现了人口过多的情况。

examples.en: The small island was outpopulated, so fresh water was strictly rationed.
examples.zh: 这个小岛人口超出承载能力，所以淡水被严格配给。

definition.en: Past form of “outpopulate”: to have a larger population than another place; to be more populous than.
definition.zh: “outpopulate”的过去式/过去分词：人口数量超过（另一地）；比……人口更密集。

examples.en: By 1950, the city had outpopulated most nearby towns.
examples.zh: 到1950年，这座城市的人口已超过周边大多数城镇。

examples.en: In a few decades, the suburbs outpopulated the old downtown area.
examples.zh: 几十年间，郊区人口超过了老城区。

extraExplanation: “out-”常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outperform 表现胜过）。因此 outpopulated 常有“比另一地人口更多”或“人口多到超载”的语感。日常英语里更常见的近义词是 overpopulated（人口过剩），而 outpopulated 有时会强调“与别处相比更多”。

summary.en: “Outpopulate” means to have a larger population than another place or group.
summary.zh: “outpopulate”指某地或某群体的人口数量超过另一方。

definition.en: to have a larger population than (another place or group); to become more numerous than
definition.zh: （人口数量）超过（另一个地方或群体）；人数变得多于

examples.en: In recent decades, the city has outpopulated many nearby towns.
examples.zh: 近几十年来，这座城市的人口超过了许多附近城镇。

examples.en: Some coastal regions are outpopulating inland areas because of new jobs.
examples.zh: 由于新工作机会，一些沿海地区的人口增长并超过了内陆地区。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过……的数量）。因此 outpopulate 通常用于人口学、经济发展或城市化语境。
这个词相对偏书面，日常表达中也常用更常见的说法：have a larger population than / become more populous than。

summary.en: “Outporch” means an exterior porch (more commonly written “out porch” or just “porch”).
summary.zh: “outporch”指房子外面的门廊（更常写作“out porch”，或直接说“porch”）。

definition.en: (Not very common as one word; usually written “out porch” or simply “porch”.) A porch that is outside the main structure of a house—an exterior covered area by an entrance.
definition.zh: （不太常见的连写形式，通常写作“out porch”，更常直接说“porch”。）指房屋主体结构外的门廊/走廊——在入口处的室外、有顶的空间。

examples.en: We left our muddy shoes on the out porch before coming inside.
examples.zh: 我们进屋前把沾泥的鞋子放在外门廊上。

examples.en: The mail is on the out porch table.
examples.zh: 邮件在外门廊的桌子上。

extraExplanation: “outporch”作为一个单词在现代英语里很少见；更自然的说法是“the porch / front porch / back porch”。如果你在旧文本或某些地区写法里看到“out-porch / out porch”，通常就是强调“在外面的门廊”，相对室内的“porch/entryway”。

summary.en: An outport is most commonly a small, remote coastal community (especially in Atlantic Canada); it can also mean a secondary port outside a main harbor.
summary.zh: outport最常指偏远的小型沿海社区/渔村（尤见于加拿大大西洋沿岸）；也可指主港之外的次要港口。

definition.en: a small, usually remote coastal town or fishing community (especially in Atlantic Canada, notably Newfoundland and Labrador).
definition.zh: （尤指加拿大大西洋沿岸、特别是纽芬兰与拉布拉多的）偏远小型海岸城镇/渔村。

examples.en: She grew up in an outport on the north coast of Newfoundland.
examples.zh: 她在纽芬兰北海岸的一个偏远渔村长大。

examples.en: Many outport communities depend on fishing and seasonal work.
examples.zh: 许多偏远沿海社区依靠渔业和季节性工作维生。

definition.en: a smaller or secondary port outside a main port city; a port used for shipping goods out.
definition.zh: 主港之外的较小/次要港口；用于对外出口货物的港口。

examples.en: Goods were sent through an outport to avoid congestion at the main harbor.
examples.zh: 为避开主港拥堵，货物通过一个外港运出。

extraExplanation: “outport”在加拿大英语里很有地域色彩，常指纽芬兰与拉布拉多沿海分散的小渔村社区。它不仅是地理概念，也常带有文化联想：社区紧密、生活朴素、与海洋和渔业高度相关。
相关表达：outport community（偏远沿海社区）、outport village（偏远渔村）。

summary.en: An outporter is a person from a small coastal community (an outport), especially in Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada.
summary.zh: outporter 指来自小型沿海“外港社区（outport）”的人，尤指加拿大纽芬兰与拉布拉多地区。

definition.en: (Canada, especially Newfoundland and Labrador) A person who lives in an outport—a small coastal community outside the main town/city.
definition.zh: （加拿大，尤指纽芬兰与拉布拉多）住在“outport（偏远沿海小社区）”的人；外港居民。

examples.en: She’s an outporter from a small fishing community on the coast of Newfoundland.
examples.zh: 她是纽芬兰海岸一个小渔村的外港居民。

examples.en: Many outporters moved to St. John’s for work, but still visit home in the summer.
examples.zh: 许多外港居民为了工作搬到圣约翰斯，但夏天仍会回老家探亲。

extraExplanation: “Outport”在纽芬兰与拉布拉多很常见，指远离主要港口/城市（如 St. John’s）的较小沿海聚落，历史上多以渔业为生；“outporter”带有明显的地域身份意味。
这个词在当地有时是中性自称（强调出身与社区文化），但在特定语境下也可能带有“乡下/偏远地区的人”的刻板印象；使用时注意语气与场合。

summary.en: Outportion is a rare verb meaning to distribute something in portions, or (very rarely) to give someone a smaller share than others.
summary.zh: outportion 是个罕用动词，主要指“按份分配”；极少情况下也可指“在份额上超过/让别人分得更多”。

definition.en: (Rare) To give someone a portion or share of something; to distribute by portions.
definition.zh: （罕用）把某物按份额分给某人；按份分配。

examples.en: The steward outportioned the daily rations to each sailor.
examples.zh: 管事把每日口粮按份分给每位水手。

examples.en: Food was outportioned carefully during the long journey.
examples.zh: 在漫长的旅途中，食物被谨慎地按份分配。

definition.en: (Very rare) To exceed someone in the size of a portion or share.
definition.zh: （极罕用）在份额/配给的大小上超过某人。

examples.en: He complained that others outportioned him at dinner.
examples.zh: 他抱怨晚餐时别人分到的份量比他多。

extraExplanation: outportion 这个词在现代英语里非常少见，很多学习者和母语者也不常用。日常表达里更常说 portion out（把……分配/分成份）、dish out（分发/端上，较口语）、allocate rations（分配配给）。
这个词由 out-（有“分发出去/超过”之意）+ portion（份额）组成，因此语感上容易理解，但实际写作与口语中建议用更常见的搭配。

summary.en: “Outports” are small coastal communities outside the main towns/harbors, especially in Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada.
summary.zh: “outports”指主要城镇/大港口之外的沿海小社区，尤用于加拿大纽芬兰与拉布拉多。

definition.en: Small, often remote coastal communities (especially fishing villages) located outside the main towns or harbors—most commonly used in Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada.
definition.zh: （尤指加拿大纽芬兰与拉布拉多）位于主要城镇或大港口之外的沿海小社区/渔村，常较偏远。

examples.en: Many families in Newfoundland grew up in the outports, where fishing shaped daily life.
examples.zh: 在纽芬兰，许多家庭在外港小社区长大，捕鱼塑造了日常生活。

examples.en: She moved from an outport to St. John’s to find work.
examples.zh: 她从一个外港小社区搬到圣约翰斯去找工作。

examples.en: The storm cut power to several outports along the coast.
examples.zh: 暴风雨导致沿海几个外港小社区停电。

extraExplanation: “outport(s)”是加拿大英语中的地域词，最常见于纽芬兰与拉布拉多（Newfoundland and Labrador）。它通常带有历史与文化意味：与传统渔业、海岸线分散聚落、以及相对“主城/主港”（如St. John’s）而言的“外边小港口社区”相关。
在当地语境里，“the outports”有时不仅指地理位置，也隐含一种生活方式与社区文化（紧密的邻里关系、对海的依赖等）。在写作或新闻中常用复数形式表示“外港地区整体”。

summary.en: An outpost is a small, distant station—especially a military base or a remote branch of an organization.
summary.zh: outpost 指远离中心的小型驻点，常见为军事前哨，也可指机构/公司的偏远分支据点。

definition.en: a small military base or a place where soldiers (or guards) are stationed, usually far from the main army or in a remote area
definition.zh: （通常远离主力或在偏远地区的）前哨/前哨基地；哨所

examples.en: The soldiers were sent to an outpost near the border.
examples.zh: 士兵被派到边境附近的一个前哨。

examples.en: Life at the desert outpost was hot, quiet, and lonely.
examples.zh: 沙漠前哨的生活炎热、安静而孤独。

definition.en: a smaller or more distant branch of an organization or business
definition.zh: （机构/公司设在外地的）分支机构；据点

examples.en: The charity opened an outpost in the rural area to help more families.
examples.zh: 这家慈善机构在农村地区设立了一个据点，以帮助更多家庭。

examples.en: They treated the café as an outpost of their home culture abroad.
examples.zh: 他们把那家咖啡馆当作在海外延续本国文化的一个“据点”。

definition.en: to place (someone or something) at a distant position, especially for guarding or monitoring (less common)
definition.zh: （较少用）把……派驻到前方/偏远处（多指警戒或监视）

examples.en: The commander outposted scouts along the road.
examples.zh: 指挥官把侦察兵派驻在路旁。

extraExplanation: 词源上，outpost = out（在外）+ post（岗位/哨位）。因此它常带有“远离中心、用于警戒或扩展影响力”的感觉。
在文学或新闻里，outpost 也常被比喻为“文化/价值观/势力范围的前沿据点”，比如“an outpost of civilization”（文明的前沿据点）。

summary.en: Outposts are remote stations or settlements—often military—or smaller distant branches representing a larger organization.
summary.zh: Outposts 指偏远的驻地/前哨（常见于军事），也可指组织在外地设立的较小据点或分支。

definition.en: (plural) Remote places where people are stationed or settled, especially small military bases or towns far from a country’s center.
definition.zh: （复数）前哨；边远驻地（尤指远离中心的小型军事基地或偏远城镇）。

examples.en: The soldiers were sent to several outposts along the border.
examples.zh: 士兵被派往边境沿线的几个前哨。

examples.en: In winter, supplies can take weeks to reach the mountain outposts.
examples.zh: 冬天时，补给可能要好几周才能送到山里的边远驻地。

definition.en: (plural) People or groups placed in a distant area to represent or support a larger organization (for example, a company’s branch office).
definition.zh: （复数）外站；分支据点（指在外地代表或支持某个更大组织的机构或团队，如公司的外地办事处）。

examples.en: The university created outposts overseas to support international research.
examples.zh: 这所大学在海外设立了据点，以支持国际研究。

examples.en: The brand opened small retail outposts in airports.
examples.zh: 这个品牌在机场开设了小型零售网点。

extraExplanation: “outpost”常见于军事与边疆语境：out-（在外）+ post（岗位/哨位），强调“远离中心、面向前线”的位置。也可用于比喻义，指“某种势力/文化/机构在外地的据点”。在历史与文学中，常用来营造“孤立、艰苦、与外界联系有限”的氛围。

summary.en: Outpouching means a bulge or pouch-like part that sticks outward, especially in medical descriptions.
summary.zh: Outpouching 指向外鼓出的囊状突起，常见于医学描述。

definition.en: a bulging or pouch-like part that sticks out from a surface, organ, or structure
definition.zh: 从表面、器官或结构向外鼓出的囊状突起；外突

examples.en: The scan showed a small outpouching on the wall of the artery.
examples.zh: 扫描显示动脉壁上有一个小的囊状外突。

examples.en: An outpouching of the stomach lining can cause pain or bleeding.
examples.zh: 胃黏膜的囊状外突可能引起疼痛或出血。

extraExplanation: 这是医学英语里很常见的词，常用于影像学/内镜报告，描述“壁向外鼓出的一小段”。常见相关疾病名包括 diverticulum（憩室，常见于结肠）和 aneurysm（动脉瘤，血管壁局部扩张）。但 outpouching 本身偏“描述性”，不一定直接等于某种具体诊断。
构词提示：out-（向外）+ pouch（袋子/囊）+ -ing（名词化，表示“……的东西/现象”）。

summary.en: Outpour means to pour or flow out in a large amount, or (figuratively) to express emotions or words freely.
summary.zh: Outpour 指（液体）大量倒出/涌出，也可比喻为（情感或言语）大量倾吐表达。

definition.en: to pour out (liquid) from a container; to flow out in a large amount
definition.zh: （液体）倒出；大量流出

examples.en: She outpoured the soup into bowls for everyone.
examples.zh: 她把汤倒进碗里，分给大家。

examples.en: Water outpoured from the broken pipe.
examples.zh: 水从破裂的水管里大量涌出。

definition.en: (figurative) to express thoughts or emotions freely and in large amounts
definition.zh: （比喻）倾吐（想法或情感）；大量表达

examples.en: After the speech, people outpoured their gratitude in letters and messages.
examples.zh: 演讲之后，人们在信件和信息中纷纷表达感激之情。

examples.en: He outpoured his worries to a close friend.
examples.zh: 他向一位亲密的朋友倾吐自己的担忧。

extraExplanation: “outpour”作动词时不算特别常见；更常见的名词形式是“outpouring”（如：an outpouring of support/ grief）。在新闻和正式语境里，你更常看到“an outpouring of …（大量的……）”。
比喻用法里，“outpour”常与情感或言语搭配（gratitude, grief, anger, feelings, words），意思接近“倾吐、倾诉”。

summary.en: “Outpoured” means “flowed out in large amounts” or “expressed feelings/thoughts freely,” as the past form of “outpour.”
summary.zh: “outpoured”是“outpour”的过去式/过去分词，表示“大量涌出/流出”，也可表示“倾吐感情或想法”。

definition.en: (Past tense/past participle of outpour) To flow out in large amounts, often suddenly.
definition.zh: （outpour 的过去式/过去分词）大量（常突然地）涌出、流出。

examples.en: After the storm, water outpoured from the broken pipe.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，水从破裂的水管里大量涌出。

examples.en: People rushed outside as smoke outpoured from the building.
examples.zh: 当烟雾从大楼里涌出时，人们冲到了外面。

definition.en: (Past tense/past participle of outpour) To express thoughts or feelings freely and in great quantity.
definition.zh: （outpour 的过去式/过去分词）倾吐（感情/想法）；大量表达。

examples.en: She outpoured her worries to a close friend.
examples.zh: 她向一位密友倾吐了自己的担忧。

examples.en: Grief outpoured in letters and messages after the news.
examples.zh: 消息传出后，人们在信件和留言中倾泻般表达悲痛。

extraExplanation: “outpoured”常见于较正式或文学化的表达，既可写具体的“液体涌出”，也可写抽象的“情感倾吐”。在日常口语里，情感义也常用“poured out (my heart)”或“opened up”来替代。

summary.en: Outpourer means a person who pours out—most often someone who freely expresses emotions or thoughts; the literal ‘one who pours liquid’ sense is rarer.
summary.zh: outpourer 指“倾诉者/大量表达情感想法的人”；字面义“倒出液体的人或物”较少见。

definition.en: A person who pours something out, especially someone who expresses feelings, thoughts, or words freely and in large amounts.
definition.zh: 倾诉者；（尤指）大量、坦率表达情感或想法的人。

examples.en: After the crisis, she became an outpourer of gratitude, thanking everyone who helped.
examples.zh: 危机过后，她成了一个感恩的倾诉者，向所有帮助过她的人道谢。

examples.en: He’s an outpourer of opinions—once he starts talking, it’s hard to stop him.
examples.zh: 他是个“意见大放送”的人——一开口就很难停下来。

definition.en: A person or thing that pours out a liquid (a literal sense, less common).
definition.zh: 倒出液体的人或物（字面义，用得较少）。

examples.en: In the instructions, the outpourer should tilt the container slowly to avoid spills.
examples.zh: 说明书里说，倒液体的人应慢慢倾斜容器以免洒出。

extraExplanation: “outpourer”来自动词短语“pour out”（倾倒；倾诉）。在现代英语里，更常见的是名词“outpouring”（如：an outpouring of grief/ support 大量的悲伤/支持之情），而“outpourer”相对少见，常带一点文学或修辞色彩，用来强调“这个人总在倾诉/大量表达”。

summary.en: Outpouring means a strong, often sudden expression of emotion or support, and sometimes a large flow of liquid.
summary.zh: outpouring 指强烈且常常突然的情感或支持的倾诉/迸发；也可指液体的大量涌出。

definition.en: A strong, often sudden expression or release of feelings, support, or words (for example, love, grief, anger, or praise).
definition.zh: （情感、支持或言语的）强烈且常常突然的倾诉/迸发（如爱、悲伤、愤怒或赞美）。

examples.en: After the news, there was an outpouring of grief online.
examples.zh: 消息传出后，网上出现了大量的哀悼之情。

examples.en: The teacher received an outpouring of thanks from students.
examples.zh: 老师收到了学生们热烈的感谢。

examples.en: Her speech led to an outpouring of support for the cause.
examples.zh: 她的演讲引发了人们对这项事业的强烈支持。

definition.en: A large amount of something that flows or comes out, especially liquid.
definition.zh: （尤指液体的）大量涌出/流出。

examples.en: Heavy rain caused an outpouring of water from the drain.
examples.zh: 暴雨导致排水口涌出大量的水。

examples.en: The report described an outpouring of oil into the sea.
examples.zh: 报告描述了原油大量流入海中。

extraExplanation: “outpouring”来自动词“pour out”（倾倒/倾诉）。在新闻和正式写作里很常见，尤其用于“an outpouring of + 情感/支持/悼念”等搭配，语气通常强调“很多、很强烈、像洪水一样涌出”。常见搭配：an outpouring of grief/support/love/condolences/anger.
词语也可用于文学或修辞，突出情感像液体一样“倾泻而出”的画面感。

summary.en: Outpourings are strong, open expressions of emotion (and sometimes large flows of liquid).
summary.zh: outpourings 指强烈、公开的情感表达（有时也指大量液体的涌出）。

definition.en: strong expressions of feeling, thoughts, or words (often emotional or heartfelt), usually given openly
definition.zh: （常指情感强烈、真挚的）倾诉；真情流露；大量表达

examples.en: After the news, there were outpourings of grief on social media.
examples.zh: 消息传出后，社交媒体上出现了大量的悲痛表达。

examples.en: Her diary is full of outpourings about fear and hope.
examples.zh: 她的日记里满是关于恐惧与希望的倾诉。

definition.en: large amounts of something flowing out, especially liquid (used more in descriptive writing)
definition.zh: （尤指液体）大量涌出；倾泻

examples.en: Heavy rain caused outpourings of water from the hillside.
examples.zh: 大雨导致山坡上的水大量涌出。

extraExplanation: outpourings 是 outpouring 的复数形式。更常见的搭配是：an outpouring of grief/support/anger（对悲痛/支持/愤怒的强烈表达）。
在文学或新闻语境中，outpouring 往往带有“情绪像水一样涌出”的意象，因此语气比 neutral 的 expression 更强、更有画面感。

summary.en: “Outpours” is either the verb form meaning “flows out / bursts out,” or the plural noun meaning “strong, sudden expressions or releases (often of emotion or support).”
summary.zh: “outpours”可作动词（outpour 的第三人称单数），表示“（大量）涌出/倾泻而出”；也可作名词复数，表示“强烈突然的迸发/倾诉（常指情感或支持）”。

definition.en: (verb, 3rd-person singular of “outpour”) to flow out quickly and in large amounts; also used figuratively for feelings, words, or help given in a sudden, strong way.
definition.zh: （动词 outpour 的第三人称单数）大量、迅速地涌出；也可比喻感情、言语或援助突然强烈地倾泻而出。

examples.en: After the storm, water outpours from the broken drainpipe.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，水从破裂的排水管里大量涌出。

examples.en: When she starts talking about her hometown, her memories outpours in a rush.
examples.zh: 当她开始谈起家乡时，回忆一下子涌了出来。

definition.en: (noun, plural of “outpour”) strong, sudden expressions or releases—often of emotions, words, support, or liquid.
definition.zh: （名词 outpour 的复数）突然强烈的倾泻/迸发；常指情感、言语、支持或液体的涌出。

examples.en: There were many outpours of sympathy after the accident.
examples.zh: 事故发生后，人们表达了许多同情与慰问。

examples.en: The charity received outpours of support from local residents.
examples.zh: 这家慈善机构收到了当地居民大量的支持。

extraExplanation: “outpour”既可以指液体“涌出”，也很常见于抽象意义：outpour(s) of love/sympathy/support（爱/同情/支持的涌现）。在新闻与正式写作中更常见；日常口语里也常用“a lot of support/people showed support”来表达同样意思。

summary.en: Outpractice means to surpass someone by practicing more or better.
summary.zh: Outpractice 指通过练习更多或更有效而超越他人。

definition.en: to become better than someone at a skill because you practice more or more effectively; to outdo through practice
definition.zh: 通过练习更多或更有效而在某项技能上胜过某人；靠练习超越

examples.en: She outpracticed everyone on the team and earned the starting position.
examples.zh: 她比队里所有人练得都更狠，因此赢得了首发位置。

examples.en: If you outpractice your competitors, you’ll usually improve faster.
examples.zh: 如果你比竞争者练得更多（或更有效），你通常会进步更快。

examples.en: They didn’t have more talent, but they outpracticed us all season.
examples.zh: 他们未必更有天赋，但整个赛季他们练得比我们更刻苦。

extraExplanation: “outpractice”是由前缀“out-（超过、胜过）+ practice（练习）”组合而成的动词，语感上很直观，但在正式写作里不算特别常见。更常见、自然的表达有“practice more than… / outwork… / outperform…”等。

summary.en: Outpracticed means someone has practiced more than others and is therefore better trained; it can also be the past form of outpractice.
summary.zh: Outpracticed 指因练习更多而更熟练/训练更充分；也可作 outpractice 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: having practiced more than someone else; better trained through more practice
definition.zh: （因练习更多而）比别人更熟练的；训练更充分的

examples.en: They were simply outpracticed, so their timing looked sharper.
examples.zh: 他们只是练得更多，所以配合看起来更精准。

examples.en: I felt outpracticed in the interview because she had rehearsed her answers all week.
examples.zh: 面试时我觉得自己不如她熟练，因为她整整一周都在演练答案。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of outpractice: to practice more than (someone), becoming more skilled through greater practice
definition.zh: outpractice 的过去式/过去分词：比（某人）练习得更多，从而更熟练

examples.en: Their team outpracticed ours before the tournament and it showed.
examples.zh: 比赛前他们的队伍比我们练得更多，结果一看就知道。

examples.en: She outpracticed everyone in the class and won first place.
examples.zh: 她比班上所有人练得都多，拿了第一名。

extraExplanation: “out-” 是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（例如 outwork 工作得比别人多；outnumber 数量超过）。因此 outpractice 就是“练得比别人多/更勤”，常带有“因此更熟练”的含义。
“outpracticed” 作为形容词更常见于比较语境（体育、表演、考试、面试等），用来说明差距来自“练习量/训练程度”，而不一定是天赋。

summary.en: “Outpracticing” means practicing more than others so you gain an advantage or improve faster.
summary.zh: “outpracticing”表示练习量（或练得更勤）超过别人，从而更有优势或进步更快。

definition.en: practicing more than someone else, so you become better or more prepared; the -ing form of “outpractice.”
definition.zh: 比别人练得更多（因此更熟练/更有准备）；“outpractice”的 -ing 形式。

examples.en: She’s outpracticing everyone on the team, so her skills are improving fast.
examples.zh: 她比队里所有人练得都多，所以技术进步很快。

examples.en: By outpracticing his rivals every morning, he earned a starting position.
examples.zh: 他每天早上都比对手练得更勤，最终赢得了首发位置。

examples.en: They’re outpracticing other schools by adding an extra session each week.
examples.zh: 他们每周多加一节训练课，因此比其他学校练得更多。

extraExplanation: “out-” 是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outperform 表现更好）。因此 outpractice = “练习上胜过别人”。
“outpracticing”多见于口语、体育/技能训练语境；正式写作里也常用更常见的表达：practice more than / practice harder than / put in more practice than。

summary.en: Outpraise means to praise more than someone else does, or to praise excessively.
summary.zh: outpraise 指“比别人更称赞”，也可指“过度称赞”。

definition.en: to praise someone or something more than another person does; to surpass in praising.
definition.zh: 比别人更称赞（某人/某事）；在称赞方面胜过。

examples.en: Fans tried to outpraise one another, each calling the singer “the best of all time.”
examples.zh: 粉丝们互相“拼夸”，每个人都说这位歌手“史上最佳”。

examples.en: No review could outpraise the product as much as her heartfelt thank-you note did.
examples.zh: 再好的评论也比不上她那封真挚的感谢信对这款产品的称赞。

definition.en: to praise too much; to give excessive praise.
definition.zh: 过度称赞；夸得太多。

examples.en: Be careful not to outpraise a small achievement, or it may sound insincere.
examples.zh: 小成就别夸得太过头，否则听起来会不真诚。

extraExplanation: “outpraise”不是特别常见的日常用词，多见于较正式或带一点文学/修辞色彩的表达。它由前缀“out-（超过）+ praise（称赞）”构成，常用来强调“在某方面胜过别人”，类似的构词还有“outshine（更出风头）”“outdo（胜过）”。

summary.en: “Outpraised” means “praised more than others” or “received more praise than others.”
summary.zh: “outpraised”表示“比别人更称赞”或“获得的称赞比别人更多”。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of “outpraise”) to praise someone or something more than another person does; to surpass others in praising.
definition.zh: （outpraise 的过去式/过去分词）比别人更称赞（某人/某事）；在称赞方面胜过他人。

examples.en: In the reviews, she outpraised her teammates’ performances and focused on the lead actor.
examples.zh: 在影评中，她对主演的称赞超过了对队友表演的称赞，把重点放在了主演身上。

examples.en: The coach outpraised the captain, saying he set the tone for the whole season.
examples.zh: 教练对队长赞不绝口，说他为整个赛季定下了基调。

definition.en: (often passive) to be praised more than someone or something else; to receive the greater share of praise.
definition.zh: （常用被动）比别人/别的事物获得更多称赞；得到更多赞誉。

examples.en: Among the finalists, her novel was outpraised for its clear style and strong characters.
examples.zh: 在入围作品中，她的小说因文笔清晰、人物鲜明而获得更多称赞。

examples.en: Their small design change ended up being outpraised by the public.
examples.zh: 他们的小改动最终反而得到了公众更多的称赞。

extraExplanation: “outpraised”较少见，更常见的表达是：praised more than… / received more praise than…。
前缀 out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outshine 超过…更出色，outperform 表现优于）。
如果你在阅读文学或较正式的文章里看到 outpraised，通常是在强调“赞誉的比较/高低”。

summary.en: Outpraising means praising more than others do, or (less commonly) praising too much.
summary.zh: Outpraising 指“比别人更夸赞”，也可（较少见）指“过度夸赞”。

definition.en: praising someone or something more than another person does (the -ing form of “outpraise”).
definition.zh: 比别人更夸赞（“outpraise”的 -ing 形式）。

examples.en: Fans kept outpraising one another over who loved the band most.
examples.zh: 粉丝们不断互相比谁更夸这支乐队、谁更爱他们。

examples.en: In the review section, people were outpraising each other’s recommendations.
examples.zh: 在评论区里，大家不停地把彼此的推荐夸上天。

definition.en: praising too much or in an exaggerated way; overpraising (a less common use in modern English).
definition.zh: 过度夸赞、夸得太夸张（现代英语中较少见的用法）。

examples.en: Be careful—outpraising a small success can create unrealistic expectations.
examples.zh: 小心——把一点小成就夸得太过，可能会让人产生不切实际的期待。

extraExplanation: “outpraise”本身不算高频词，因此“outpraising”也较少见，更多出现在写作里用来强调“比别人更会夸/更夸张地夸”。日常口语更常用：praise more than…, praise someone more, outdo someone in praising, overpraise。
构词提示：out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outshine, outnumber）。因此 outpraise 直观意思就是“在夸赞这件事上胜过别人”。

summary.en: Outpray means to pray more, longer, or more intensely than someone else.
summary.zh: outpray 指（相对别人）祈祷得更多、更久或更虔诚。

definition.en: to pray more than someone else, or to pray longer/more intensely than someone else (often used in comparisons or in a slightly humorous/old-fashioned tone).
definition.zh: （与他人相比）祈祷得更多、更久或更虔诚；在祈祷上“胜过”别人（常带比较意味，略显幽默或旧式）。

examples.en: He tried to outpray his guilt, but it kept coming back.
examples.zh: 他试图用更强烈的祈祷压过内疚，但内疚还是反复出现。

examples.en: Some people think they can outpray every problem instead of facing it directly.
examples.zh: 有些人以为只要祈祷得更勤就能解决所有问题，而不是去正面面对。

examples.en: You can’t outpray kindness—help your neighbor and pray too.
examples.zh: 你不可能靠“更会祈祷”胜过善行——去帮助邻居，也一起祈祷。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。因此 outpray 的字面结构就是“祈祷得比……更多/更强”。类似构词还有 outwork（比别人更努力工作）、outshine（比别人更出彩）。
outpray 并不是日常高频词，更常见的表达是 pray more, pray longer, pray harder 或 outdo someone in prayer。它偶尔出现在宗教语境、文学化表达或强调“用祈祷与他人比较”的语气中。
使用时要注意语气：在很多文化与宗教传统中，“比较谁更虔诚/更会祈祷”可能显得不够谦逊，所以 outpray 有时带批评或反思意味。

summary.en: “Outprayed” means “prayed more or more fervently than someone else,” and it can also be used figuratively in literary or religious contexts.
summary.zh: “outprayed”表示“在祈祷上胜过他人（更久/更虔诚）”，也可在文学或宗教语境中作比喻用法。

definition.en: (Past tense / past participle of outpray) to pray more, longer, or more fervently than someone else; to surpass someone in prayer.
definition.zh: （outpray 的过去式/过去分词）在祈祷上胜过别人；比别人祈祷得更久、更频繁或更虔诚。

examples.en: She felt she had outprayed her fears, and the panic slowly eased.
examples.zh: 她觉得自己用祈祷战胜了恐惧，惊慌慢慢缓解了。

examples.en: In the story, the villagers believed the monk had outprayed the storm.
examples.zh: 在故事里，村民相信那位僧侣用祈祷压过了暴风雨。

examples.en: He never claimed to be holier—only that he had outprayed them that night.
examples.zh: 他从不声称自己更圣洁——只说那一晚他比他们祈祷得更久。

extraExplanation: “outprayed”来自动词“outpray”（out- 表示“超过/胜过”）。这个词在现代英语里比较少见，常见于文学、宗教语境或修辞性表达，用来强调“在祈祷这件事上更投入/更有力”。
有时也会引申为“用祈祷抵过（某种情绪或处境）”，属于比喻用法，比如“outpray one’s fears（用祈祷压过恐惧）”。

summary.en: Outpraying means praying more or more earnestly than others.
summary.zh: Outpraying 指“祷告得比别人更多或更虔诚”。

definition.en: to pray more, longer, or more earnestly than someone else; to surpass others in prayer
definition.zh: 比别人祷告得更多、更久或更虔诚；在祷告上胜过他人

examples.en: She spent the night outpraying everyone for her family’s safety.
examples.zh: 她整夜为家人的平安祷告，比所有人都更久、更投入。

examples.en: In the old story, the monk is described as outpraying his companions.
examples.zh: 在那则古老的故事里，那位僧人被描写为祷告胜过同伴。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作）。因此 outpray / outpraying 通常带有“在祷告的数量或热切程度上超过别人”的比较意味。
这个词在现代日常英语中不算常见，更常见于宗教语境、讲道、文学或较具修辞色彩的写作中。日常表达里也可用 pray more than (someone) 或 pray longer than (someone) 来替代。

summary.en: “Outprays” means “prays more than (someone)”—a rare verb form often used humorously or in religious writing.
summary.zh: “outprays” 意为“比（某人）祈祷得更多/在祈祷上胜过”，较罕见，多见于宗教语境或幽默表达。

definition.en: to pray more than someone else; to surpass another person in praying (often used humorously or in a challenging way).
definition.zh: 比别人祈祷得更多；在祈祷上胜过某人（常带幽默或“较劲”的意味）。

examples.en: He joked that he could outpray anyone in the group.
examples.zh: 他开玩笑说，他能比小组里任何人都更会祈祷。

examples.en: She didn’t try to outpray others—she simply prayed sincerely.
examples.zh: 她并不想在祈祷上压过别人，只是诚心地祈祷。

definition.en: (rare) to pray someone down or away; to use prayer to counteract another influence or request.
definition.zh: （罕见）用祈祷来压制、抵消或“祈祷到让……退去”（指用祈祷对抗另一种影响或请求）。

examples.en: In older religious writing, people sometimes spoke of trying to outpray temptation.
examples.zh: 在较早的宗教写作里，人们有时会说要用祈祷来“压过”诱惑。

extraExplanation: “outprays” 是动词 “outpray” 的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outprays）。这个词非常少见，日常英语里更常说 “pray more than someone” 或 “outdo someone in prayer”。
前缀 out- 常表示“在……方面超过/胜过”（如 outwork, outsmart）。因此 outpray 的结构很直观，但因为语境较窄（多见于宗教或修辞/幽默表达），所以不常出现在现代口语中。

summary.en: Outpreach means to extend reach or influence farther than someone else, often used in outreach/communication contexts.
summary.zh: Outpreach 指“触达或影响范围超过他人/他物”，常用于外展、传播或沟通语境。

definition.en: to reach farther than someone or something; to extend influence or contact beyond another’s reach
definition.zh: 比……伸得更远；（影响力、联系等）超出他人或他物的范围

examples.en: With better internet access, the program can outpreach older methods and connect with more students.
examples.zh: 有了更好的网络条件，这个项目能比旧方法覆盖更远，联系到更多学生。

examples.en: Their message outpreached local borders through social media.
examples.zh: 他们的信息通过社交媒体传播，影响范围超出了本地边界。

definition.en: to extend one’s reach or outreach farther than before (less common)
definition.zh: 把自己的触达范围延伸得更远（较少见）

examples.en: In the final months, the campaign tried to outpreach by adding more community events.
examples.zh: 在最后几个月里，竞选团队通过增加社区活动来扩大触达范围。

extraExplanation: “outpreach”不是特别常见的日常用词，更常见的表达是“reach farther than… / expand outreach / extend one’s reach”。在市场营销、公益项目、宗教/社区外展（outreach）等语境里更容易看到它。
构词上是 out-（超过）+ preach（原意“布道/宣讲”）。现代用法常弱化“宗教”色彩，更偏向“传播/触达范围更大”。有时也会写成“out-reach”（带连字符）来强调“reach”的意思。

summary.en: to outdo others in grooming or showy self-admiration.
summary.zh: 在打扮梳理或炫耀自得方面胜过别人。

definition.en: to preen more than someone else; to outdo another person (or animal) in grooming, showing off, or self-satisfied display.
definition.zh: 比别人更爱梳理打扮/更爱炫耀；在整理羽毛、打扮或自我得意的表现上胜过他人。

examples.en: At the reunion, he tried to outpreen everyone with his expensive suit and watch.
examples.zh: 在同学聚会上，他穿着昂贵的西装、戴着名表，想在打扮和炫耀上压过所有人。

examples.en: In the flock, one bird seemed determined to outpreen the rest before mating season.
examples.zh: 在鸟群里，有一只鸟在繁殖季前似乎铁了心要在理羽打扮上胜过其他鸟。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outshine 超越、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outpreen 直观意思就是“在 preen（梳理打扮/自鸣得意地炫耀）这件事上胜过别人”。
preen 原本多用于鸟类“整理羽毛、梳理”这一动作，后来引申为人“精心打扮、带点自得或卖弄的姿态”。outpreen 常带轻微讽刺语气，用来暗示对方过度爱表现。

summary.en: “Outpreened” means “surpassed others in preening or showing off one’s appearance.”
summary.zh: “Outpreened”指“在打扮/整理仪容或自我炫耀方面胜过他人”。

definition.en: (Past tense / past participle of “outpreen”) to groom, dress, or show off oneself more than someone else; to surpass others in looking neat, elegant, or self-admiring.
definition.zh: （outpreen 的过去式/过去分词）比别人更爱打扮、更会整理羽毛/仪容；在整洁、优雅或自我炫耀方面胜过他人。

examples.en: At the party, he outpreened everyone in a perfectly tailored suit.
examples.zh: 在聚会上，他穿着一套剪裁完美的西装，把所有人都比下去了。

examples.en: The rival roosters outpreened each other before the fight.
examples.zh: 那两只斗鸡在打斗前互相“比着整理羽毛、摆姿态”。

examples.en: She felt she’d outpreened her coworkers, then worried she looked too showy.
examples.zh: 她觉得自己把同事都比下去了，随后又担心显得太张扬。

extraExplanation: “outpreen”是很少见、偏文学或幽默的用法：out- 表示“胜过/超过”，preen 原指鸟类用喙整理羽毛，后来引申为“精心打扮、得意地整理仪容”。因此 outpreened 常带一点“爱炫耀、摆姿态”的语气。

summary.en: Outpreening means showing off or preening more than others—trying to outshine them in appearance or self-satisfied display.
summary.zh: outpreening 指“比别人更爱显摆/更得意地装点自己”，有时也可字面指“更频繁地梳理打理自己”。

definition.en: trying to look more impressive than others by showing off (often in a self-satisfied way); to outdo others in preening.
definition.zh: （常带自鸣得意的意味）比别人更爱显摆、更爱装点自己；在“得意炫耀/自我欣赏”方面胜过他人。

examples.en: At the reunion, he spent the whole night outpreening his classmates with stories about his job and travels.
examples.zh: 在同学聚会上，他整晚都在用工作和旅行经历来压过同学，拼命显摆。

examples.en: The two influencers kept outpreening each other in front of the cameras.
examples.zh: 两位网红在镜头前不断互相较劲，比谁更会摆姿态、秀形象。

definition.en: in a more literal sense, grooming oneself more than others (like a bird cleaning and arranging its feathers).
definition.zh: （更字面）比别人更频繁或更用力地梳理打理自己（如鸟类梳理羽毛）。

examples.en: In the aviary, one bird was constantly outpreening the rest, smoothing every feather.
examples.zh: 在鸟舍里，有一只鸟不停地比其他鸟更爱梳理羽毛，把每根羽毛都理顺。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outperform）。preen 原指鸟类梳理羽毛，引申为“自我欣赏、得意地摆姿态/打扮”。因此 outpreen 常带有轻微讽刺色彩：不是单纯“打扮得更好”，而是“更爱显摆、更自恋”。
outpreening 是 outpreen 的现在分词/动名词形式，可用于进行时（was outpreening）或作名词性用法（His outpreening annoyed everyone）。这类词较少见，更常见的表达有 showing off, preening, trying to outshine others。

summary.en: Outpreens means “surpasses others by preening or showing off.”
summary.zh: Outpreens 指“在装扮或炫耀上胜过别人”。

definition.en: to surpass someone in preening—showing off, grooming oneself, or acting proudly in a way meant to impress others
definition.zh: 在“装模作样/自我炫耀/讲究打扮”方面胜过某人；比别人更爱显摆或更会摆姿态

examples.en: At the reunion, he tried to outpreen everyone with his designer suit and loud stories.
examples.zh: 在同学聚会上，他穿着名牌西装、讲着夸张的故事，想在显摆上压过所有人。

examples.en: The two rivals kept trying to outpreen each other in front of the cameras.
examples.zh: 这两位对手在镜头前不断较劲，试图在摆姿态上胜过对方。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，意思是“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outshine）。因此 outpreen = out- + preen（打扮、梳理羽毛；引申为自鸣得意、爱显摆）。
这个词比较少见，更常用的表达有：outdo someone in showing off / outshine someone / try to impress others.

summary.en: Outpress means to outperform someone by pressing harder or, in publishing, to print/distribute more copies.
summary.zh: Outpress 指在按压/施压上胜过对方；在出版印刷中可指印量或发行量超过。

definition.en: to press more strongly or more effectively than someone or something; to outdo in pressing (often physical or figurative).
definition.zh: 在“按压/施压”方面胜过（某人或某物）；按得更用力或更有效（可指身体动作或比喻意义的施压）。

examples.en: In the final seconds, the defender outpressed the attacker and won the ball back.
examples.zh: 在最后几秒，防守队员的逼抢更强（更有压迫性），把球夺了回来。

examples.en: If you outpress the dough, it can turn dense instead of light.
examples.zh: 如果你把面团压得过头，它可能会变得紧实而不是松软。

definition.en: (publishing/printing) to print and distribute more copies than another publisher or edition; to outdo in press output.
definition.zh: （出版/印刷）印得更多、发行量更大；在印刷产量或发行数量上超过（另一家出版社或某版本）。

examples.en: The new paperback edition outpressed the earlier hardback within a month.
examples.zh: 新版平装书在一个月内的印量就超过了早先的精装版。

examples.en: Small presses rarely outpress major publishers in total copies.
examples.zh: 小型出版社在总印量上很少能超过大型出版社。

extraExplanation: “outpress”比较少见，更常写作“out-press”，意思是“在press这件事上胜过”。在日常英语里，表达“施压/逼抢更强”通常会用“outpressure / put more pressure on / press harder”；出版语境中也更常说“outprint (another edition/publisher)”。

summary.en: “Outpressed” is rare; it can mean “pressed more than” or “pushed outward by pressure,” but it’s often a misspelling of “oppressed.”
summary.zh: “outpressed”很少用：可指“压得更厉害/被向外挤压”，但常见情况是把“oppressed（被压迫的）”拼错。

definition.en: (Rare) Past tense/past participle of “outpress”: to press or squeeze more than someone/something else; to push outward by pressure.
definition.zh: （罕见）“outpress”的过去式/过去分词：比别人/别的东西压得更用力；因压力而向外挤压。

examples.en: The machine outpressed the juice more efficiently than the older model.
examples.zh: 这台机器榨汁（挤压）比旧型号更高效。

examples.en: The clay was outpressed against the mold, forming a sharp edge.
examples.zh: 黏土被向外挤压到模具上，形成了清晰的边缘。

definition.en: (Often a spelling mistake) People sometimes write “outpressed” when they mean “oppressed” (treated unfairly and kept down by power).
definition.zh: （常见拼写误用）有人会把“outpressed”误写成“oppressed”（被强权压迫、被不公平对待）。

examples.en: If you mean “oppressed,” you could write: “The oppressed workers demanded fair wages.”
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“oppressed（被压迫的）”，可以写：“被压迫的工人要求公平工资。”

examples.en: She spoke up for oppressed communities.
examples.zh: 她为受压迫的群体发声。

extraExplanation: “outpressed”在现代英语里非常少见，很多情况下是拼写错误或自动更正造成的。最常见的目标词通常是“oppressed”。
如果你能提供原句（前后各一两句），我可以帮你判断这里到底应当是“outpressed”、还是“oppressed/pressed out/expressed”等更自然的表达。

summary.en: “outpresses” is a rare verb form meaning “press harder/more effectively than” or “squeeze/force out by pressing.”
summary.zh: “outpresses”是较少见的动词形式，意思是“施压更强/更有效地压过”或“通过挤压把……压出来/榨出”。

definition.en: (rare) Third-person singular of “outpress”: to press harder or more effectively than someone/something; to surpass in pressing or applying pressure.
definition.zh: （少见）“outpress”的第三人称单数：比别人/别的东西压得更用力或更有效；在施压/压榨方面胜过。

examples.en: In the final minutes, the team outpresses its opponent and wins the ball back quickly.
examples.zh: 在最后几分钟，这支球队在逼抢上压过对手，很快就把球权夺了回来。

examples.en: If one side outpresses the other, the weaker material may crack first.
examples.zh: 如果一方施压更强，较弱的材料可能会先裂开。

definition.en: (rare/technical) Third-person singular of “outpress”: to force something out by pressing; to squeeze out.
definition.zh: （少见/技术用法）“outpress”的第三人称单数：通过挤压把某物压出来；榨出。

examples.en: The machine outpresses excess water from the fabric.
examples.zh: 这台机器把布料里多余的水分挤压出来。

examples.en: Heat helps the paste spread as the tool outpresses it into the gap.
examples.zh: 加热有助于膏体扩散，工具把它挤压进缝隙里。

extraExplanation: “outpresses”在现代英语中非常不常见；更常见的表达会用“press harder/more”或“apply more pressure”。
如果你想表达“压迫（人）”，常见词是“oppresses”；如果你想表达“在节奏/速度上超过”，可能是“outpaces”。可以告诉我你的句子，我可以帮你确认你要的词。

summary.en: Outpressing is a rare form meaning “pressing more than” or “pressing out by pressure,” depending on context.
summary.zh: Outpressing 很少见，通常指“按压得更厉害/超过对方地施压”，或“用压力把东西挤/压出来”。

definition.en: pressing more than someone/something else; surpassing another in the amount or force of pressing (rare).
definition.zh: 比别人/别的东西按压得更多或更用力；在“按压”这一点上超过对方（较少见）。

examples.en: The machine was outpressing the older model, producing tighter, more even bales.
examples.zh: 这台机器的压制效果超过了旧型号，打出来的捆更紧、更均匀。

examples.en: He kept outpressing his opponent in the final seconds, forcing a turnover.
examples.zh: 最后几秒他持续施压压过对手，逼出了失误。

definition.en: pressing out (removing or extracting) by applying pressure, especially in technical contexts (rare).
definition.zh: 通过施加压力把东西挤压出来（尤指技术/工艺语境，较少见）。

examples.en: After washing, they began outpressing excess water from the fabric.
examples.zh: 清洗后，他们开始把布料里多余的水分挤压出来。

examples.en: The process involves outpressing oil from the seeds at low heat.
examples.zh: 该工艺是在低温下把油从种子中压榨出来。

extraExplanation: “outpressing”通常是动词“outpress”的现在分词/动名词形式，但“outpress”本身在现代英语里非常少见，多见于技术描述或特定行业写法。
如果你想表达“压迫/欺压”，更常用的是“oppressing”。如果你想表达“在某方面超过”，更常用“outperforming / exceeding”。
有时也会写作“out-pressing”（加连字符）来强调“out-（超过）+ pressing（按压）”的构词关系。

summary.en: Outprice means either to undercut competitors by pricing lower, or (less commonly) to be priced higher than something else.
summary.zh: Outprice 指“以更低价格压过竞争对手”，也可（较少见）指“比其他东西更贵/定价更高”。

definition.en: to sell or offer something at a lower price than a competitor; to undercut on price
definition.zh: 以更低的价格出售/报价，从而在价格上压过竞争对手（压价、低价竞争）

examples.en: The new brand outpriced its rivals by offering similar quality for less.
examples.zh: 这个新品牌用更低的价格提供相近的品质，从价格上压过了竞争对手。

examples.en: Small shops can’t always outprice big retailers.
examples.zh: 小店并不总能在价格上压过大型零售商。

definition.en: to be more expensive than something else; to price higher than
definition.zh: 比……更贵；定价高于……

examples.en: That model outprices the basic version by about $200.
examples.zh: 那款型号比基础版贵大约200美元。

examples.en: Many imported products outprice local options.
examples.zh: 许多进口商品比本地选择更贵。

extraExplanation: “outprice”在真实语料中不算高频，且含义有时会让人混淆：out- 既可能表示“胜过、超过”（因此可能是更便宜也可能是更贵）。日常更常见、更明确的表达是：price lower than / undercut / beat on price（更便宜）以及cost more than / be priced higher than（更贵）。
商业语境里最常见的是第一义（用更低价格击败对手），但写作时建议用更明确的动词短语来避免歧义。

summary.en: Outpriced means priced higher than competitors or too expensive for a budget; it’s also the past form of outprice.
summary.zh: outpriced 指“比竞争对手定价更高”或“贵到超出预算”；也可作 outprice 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (Adj.) Sold at a higher price than competing products, so customers choose cheaper alternatives.
definition.zh: （形容词）价格高于同类竞争产品，因此顾客更可能选择更便宜的替代品。

examples.en: Their phones were outpriced by cheaper models from other brands.
examples.zh: 他们的手机价格高于其他品牌的更便宜机型，因此在竞争中处于劣势。

examples.en: The restaurant got outpriced when a new, affordable place opened nearby.
examples.zh: 附近新开了一家实惠的餐馆后，这家餐厅因为价格更高而失去优势。

definition.en: (Adj.) Too expensive for someone’s budget; beyond what people are willing or able to pay.
definition.zh: （形容词）超出某人的预算；贵到人们不愿意或无法支付。

examples.en: Many families feel outpriced in this neighborhood now.
examples.zh: 现在很多家庭觉得在这个社区已经住不起了。

examples.en: We were outpriced for front-row seats, so we chose the balcony.
examples.zh: 我们买不起前排座位，所以选了楼座。

definition.en: (V., past tense/past participle of outprice) To set a price higher than another seller or product; to price above.
definition.zh: （动词，outprice 的过去式/过去分词）把价格定得比另一家/另一种产品更高；定价高于。

examples.en: They outpriced their competitors and lost market share.
examples.zh: 他们的定价高于竞争对手，结果失去了市场份额。

examples.en: The company outpriced itself by raising prices too quickly.
examples.zh: 这家公司涨价太快，结果把自己“定价出局”了。

extraExplanation: “outpriced”在商业语境里常用来强调“因为价格更高而失去竞争力”，与“overpriced（标价过高）”相比，它更突出“相对于别人更贵”这一对比关系。
在住房与城市话题中，“feel outpriced”常指“被房价/租金挤出”，带有社会与经济压力的含义。

summary.en: “Outprices” means to price something higher than others or to be more expensive than competitors.
summary.zh: “outprices”表示（某物）定价高于他人/竞争对手，或价格更贵。

definition.en: to set a higher price than someone else; to be priced higher than competitors
definition.zh: 定价高于他人；价格高过竞争对手

examples.en: This brand outprices most local options, so many students choose cheaper ones.
examples.zh: 这个品牌的价格比大多数本地选择都高，所以很多学生会选更便宜的。

examples.en: If our product outprices the market, it may sell more slowly.
examples.zh: 如果我们的产品定价高于市场，它可能卖得更慢。

definition.en: to exceed another thing in price or cost
definition.zh: 在价格或成本上超过（另一事物）

examples.en: The deluxe model outprices the basic one by nearly $200.
examples.zh: 豪华款比基础款贵了将近200美元。

extraExplanation: “outprices”通常是动词“outprice”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outprices）。更常见的表达也包括“be overpriced（被定价过高）”或“price higher than（比……定价更高）”。

summary.en: Outpricing usually means pricing to beat competitors (often cheaper), but it can also mean being priced higher than others (too expensive), depending on context.
summary.zh: Outpricing通常指通过定价压过竞争对手（多为更便宜），但在某些语境中也可指价格高于他人（偏贵），需看上下文。

definition.en: the act of setting prices so that your product is more attractive than competitors’ (usually by being cheaper, sometimes by offering better value at a similar price)
definition.zh: （商业）通过定价使产品比竞争对手更有吸引力的做法（通常更便宜；有时同价但更划算）

examples.en: Their success came from outpricing bigger brands in the budget market.
examples.zh: 他们的成功来自在低价市场上以更低价格压过更大的品牌。

examples.en: The new app focused on outpricing rivals while keeping the basic features solid.
examples.zh: 这款新应用把重点放在用更低价格压过对手，同时保证基础功能可靠。

definition.en: pricing something higher than others; being too expensive compared with similar products
definition.zh: 定价高于同类产品；在价格上“比别人更贵”（显得偏贵）

examples.en: The hotel lost customers because of outpricing nearby options.
examples.zh: 这家酒店因为价格比附近的选择更贵而流失了顾客。

examples.en: Outpricing can hurt sales when customers can easily compare prices online.
examples.zh: 在顾客能轻松在线比价的情况下，定价过高会伤害销量。

definition.en: present participle of “outprice”: to beat competitors by pricing more attractively, or to exceed others in price
definition.zh: “outprice”的现在分词：用更有吸引力的价格压过对手，或在价格上高于他人

examples.en: They are outpricing competitors by offering the same quality for less.
examples.zh: 他们用更低的价格提供同样的质量，从而压过竞争对手。

examples.en: If you keep outpricing similar products, customers may switch brands.
examples.zh: 如果你一直比同类产品卖得更贵，顾客可能会转向别的品牌。

extraExplanation: “outprice / outpricing”常见于商业与市场营销语境，含义要看上下文：既可能是“定得更便宜从而打败对手”，也可能是“定得更贵而失去竞争力”。阅读时可留意是否出现by offering less / lower price（偏向更便宜）或because it’s too expensive（偏向更贵）。

summary.en: “Outpried” is a rare form meaning “pried out/open by force or leverage.”
summary.zh: “outpried”较罕见，大意是“用撬的方式撬出/撬开”。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of (rare) “outpry”: to pry something out or open by using leverage (often with a tool).
definition.zh: （罕见）“outpry”的过去式/过去分词：用撬的方式把某物撬出、撬开（常借助工具和杠杆力）。

examples.en: They outpried the nail with a flat screwdriver.
examples.zh: 他们用一字螺丝刀把钉子撬出来。

examples.en: With a crowbar, the lid was outpried from the crate.
examples.zh: 他们用撬棍把箱子的盖子撬开了。

extraExplanation: “outpried”在现代英语里非常少见，更常见的表达是：pried out / pried open / levered out（英式常用）或 pry out / pry open。
如果你的本意是“outpriced（价格高到把别人挤出市场）”，那是另一个词：outpriced /ˌaʊtˈpraɪst/，意思是“定价过高；在价格竞争中处于劣势”。你可以告诉我上下文句子，我帮你确认。

summary.en: “Outprodigy” means to surpass a prodigy—to be even more impressive or gifted than someone exceptionally talented.
summary.zh: “outprodigy”表示“胜过神童/天才”，强调在极高水平之上还更出色（较少见、偏修辞性的用法）。

definition.en: to surpass someone—even a talented “prodigy”—by being even more impressive or gifted
definition.zh: （在才能或表现上）胜过某个“神童/天才”，甚至比对方更出色

examples.en: People expected the child prodigy to win, but her teammate outprodigied everyone on stage.
examples.zh: 大家都以为那个神童会赢，但她的队友在台上表现得更惊人，胜过所有人。

examples.en: He tried to outprodigy his older sister, practicing piano for hours every day.
examples.zh: 他想在天赋与成绩上超过姐姐，于是每天练钢琴好几个小时。

definition.en: to exceed what is typical of a prodigy; to be extraordinarily excellent
definition.zh: 超出“神童级别”的水平；表现得异常卓越

examples.en: In that final round, the performance outprodigied anything the judges had seen that year.
examples.zh: 在最后一轮，那场表演的水准高到“神童都不一定能做到”，评委那年没见过更强的。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outshine 胜过、outperform 表现更好）。outprodigy 属于比较少见、偏创造性的用法，通常出现在文学、评论、或口语中为了强调“连天才都被比下去”的夸张效果。
更自然、常见的表达通常是：outperform（表现优于）、outshine（更耀眼）、surpass（超过）、be even more gifted（更有天赋）。

summary.en: Outproduce means to produce more than another person, company, or thing.
summary.zh: outproduce 指“产量超过（别人/别的事物）”。

definition.en: to produce more (goods, results, or output) than someone or something else
definition.zh: 比……生产得更多；产量超过……

examples.en: This factory can outproduce our older plant by 30%.
examples.zh: 这家工厂的产量比我们旧厂高出30%。

examples.en: With better irrigation, the farm began to outproduce its neighbors.
examples.zh: 有了更好的灌溉后，这个农场的产量开始超过周边农场。

extraExplanation: outproduce 常用于商业、制造业、农业等语境，强调“数量/产量”上的超越；如果强调“整体表现更好”，更常用 outperform；如果强调“超过销量”，常用 outsell。

summary.en: “Outproduced” means “produced more than another person or thing.”
summary.zh: “outproduced”表示“产量/产出超过别人或别的事物”。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of outproduce: to produce more (goods, results, etc.) than someone or something else.
definition.zh: outproduce 的过去式和过去分词：产量（或成果等）超过（某人或某物）；比……生产得更多。

examples.en: Last year, our factory outproduced the local competition by 15%.
examples.zh: 去年，我们工厂的产量比本地竞争对手高出 15%。

examples.en: The new model outproduced the older one in both speed and reliability.
examples.zh: 新型号在速度和可靠性两方面都胜过旧型号，表现更好。

examples.en: With better irrigation, the farm outproduced expectations.
examples.zh: 因为灌溉更好，这个农场的产量超出了预期。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过/胜过”（如 outwork 比……更努力，outnumber 在数量上超过）。因此 outproduced 常用于比较产量、产出、结果等。
outproduce 通常是及物动词，后面直接接比较对象：outproduce a rival / outproduce other countries。

summary.en: “Outproduces” means “produces more than another.”
summary.zh: “outproduces”表示“产量/产出超过另一方”。

definition.en: produces more of something than another person, company, country, or thing does
definition.zh: （在产量上）比另一方生产得更多；产量超过

examples.en: This factory outproduces the one across town.
examples.zh: 这家工厂的产量超过城另一边那家工厂。

examples.en: In some years, Country A outproduces Country B in wheat.
examples.zh: 有些年份，A国的小麦产量超过B国。

examples.en: The new system outproduces the old one with fewer workers.
examples.zh: 新系统用更少的工人就比旧系统产出更多。

extraExplanation: “outproduces”是动词“outproduce”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outproduces）。常用于比较两方的产量、产出或生产效率，语气偏中性，常见于商业、经济、农业等语境。

summary.en: Outproducing means producing more than others or being in a state of producing more than others.
summary.zh: outproducing 指“产量超过他者”，也可指“正在产出领先”。

definition.en: producing more of something than another person, company, or country; surpassing others in output.
definition.zh: （产量上）比他人/其他公司/国家生产得更多；在产出上超过。

examples.en: The new factory is outproducing the old one by nearly 30%.
examples.zh: 新工厂的产量比旧工厂高将近30%。

examples.en: This region has been outproducing others in corn for years.
examples.zh: 这个地区多年来在玉米产量上一直领先其他地区。

definition.en: (as an adjective/participle) currently producing more than others.
definition.zh: （作形容词/分词）正在比别人产出更多的；产量领先的。

examples.en: They invested in the outproducing plants to meet demand.
examples.zh: 他们投资于那些产量领先的工厂以满足需求。

examples.en: Outproducing teams often rely on efficient systems, not just harder work.
examples.zh: 产出更高的团队往往依靠高效系统，而不只是更努力工作。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 超过别人工作量、outnumber 数量超过）。因此 outproduce 就是“在产量上超过”。
在商业/经济语境中，outproduce 常暗示“供给大于对手”或“效率更高”。若用于负面情境，也可能含有“生产过剩”的风险提示（但“过剩”更常用 overproduce）。

summary.en: Outpromise means to promise more than others or to promise too much (often unrealistically).
summary.zh: Outpromise 指“比别人承诺更多”，也可指“过度承诺（难兑现）”。

definition.en: to promise more than someone else; to make bigger or more attractive promises than others (often in competition, politics, or marketing)
definition.zh: 比别人承诺得更多；用更大、更诱人的承诺压过他人（常见于竞争、政治或营销语境）

examples.en: In the election, some candidates tried to outpromise their rivals with bigger tax cuts.
examples.zh: 在选举中，一些候选人试图用更大幅度的减税承诺来压过对手。

examples.en: The two companies kept outpromising each other, but neither could deliver everything.
examples.zh: 两家公司不断互相“加码承诺”，但谁也无法兑现全部。

definition.en: to promise too much; to make promises that are unrealistic or hard to keep
definition.zh: 过度承诺；做出不切实际或难以兑现的承诺

examples.en: If you outpromise, you risk disappointing people later.
examples.zh: 如果你过度承诺，之后就容易让人失望。

examples.en: New managers sometimes outpromise because they want to make a strong first impression.
examples.zh: 新上任的管理者有时会过度承诺，因为他们想给人留下强烈的第一印象。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。所以 outpromise 的字面意思就是“在承诺上胜过别人”。类似结构还有 outwork（更努力工作）、outbid（出价更高）、outperform（表现更好）。
这个词比较少见，更常见的表达是 promise more than someone else（比别人承诺更多）或 overpromise（过度承诺）。其中 overpromise 更强调“承诺过头、难兑现”，而 outpromise 更强调“与他人比较时承诺更大”。

summary.en: Outpromised means “promised more than others” or “promised more than could be delivered.”
summary.zh: outpromised 指“比别人承诺更多”，也可指“承诺过头、超出可兑现范围”。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “outpromise”: to have promised more than someone else, or to have promised more than can realistically be delivered
definition.zh: “outpromise”的过去式/过去分词：比别人承诺得更多；或承诺过头、超出实际可做到的范围

examples.en: The candidate outpromised her rivals during the campaign, but struggled to deliver later.
examples.zh: 这位候选人在竞选期间比对手承诺得更多，但后来兑现起来很吃力。

examples.en: The sales team outpromised what the product could actually do.
examples.zh: 销售团队的承诺超出了产品实际能做到的能力。

definition.en: describing a situation in which expectations were set too high because of excessive promises
definition.zh: （作描述用）因过度承诺而把期望抬得过高的；“承诺过头”的

examples.en: It became an outpromised project with an unrealistic timeline and budget.
examples.zh: 它成了一个“承诺过头”的项目，时间表和预算都不现实。

extraExplanation: “out-”作前缀常表示“超过/胜过”（如 outgrow 长得比……快，outperform 表现胜过）。因此 outpromise 常带两层意思：一是“比别人承诺更多”（竞争语境）；二是“承诺超出能力”（带批评意味，常见于商业/政治写作）。
用法提示：更常见的相关表达是 overpromise（过度承诺）。outpromise 更强调“超过别人”或“在承诺上压过别人”，而 overpromise 重点是“超过实际能做到的程度”。

summary.en: Outpromising means making more or bigger promises than can realistically be kept, or trying to beat others by promising more.
summary.zh: outpromising 指承诺过多、超出可兑现范围；也可指在竞争中靠更大的承诺压过别人。

definition.en: (Present participle of outpromise) promising more than you can deliver; making unrealistic or excessive promises.
definition.zh: （outpromise 的现在分词）许下超出能力范围的承诺；夸下海口、承诺过多而难以兑现。

examples.en: The campaign was criticized for outpromising and underdelivering.
examples.zh: 这场竞选被批评为只会夸下海口，却无法兑现。

examples.en: Try not to impress clients by outpromising—set expectations you can actually meet.
examples.zh: 别为了取悦客户而承诺过多——把预期设在你确实能做到的范围内。

definition.en: (Present participle of outpromise) surpassing someone else by making bigger or more attractive promises, often in competition.
definition.zh: （outpromise 的现在分词）在竞争中以更大、更诱人的承诺压过别人（常带有不太踏实的意味）。

examples.en: The two companies kept outpromising each other to win the contract.
examples.zh: 两家公司为了拿下合同，不断互相“加码”承诺。

examples.en: Instead of outpromising your rivals, show proof of what you can do.
examples.zh: 与其靠更夸张的承诺压过对手，不如拿出你能做到的证据。

extraExplanation: “outpromising”多用于批评或提醒，常和“underdelivering（交付不足）”形成对比，强调“说得比做得到的多”。
在商业、政治语境中很常见：为了赢得支持/合同而不断加码承诺，但风险是损害信任与信誉。

summary.en: Outpry means to shout or complain louder than others, drowning out their voices.
summary.zh: outpry 指“喊得比别人更大声”，用更大的喊声压过对方。

definition.en: to shout or complain louder than someone else; to overpower another person’s voice by shouting or protesting more loudly
definition.zh: 比别人喊得更大声；以更大的喊叫或抗议声压过对方（使对方的声音被盖住）

examples.en: The two fans tried to outpry each other during the game.
examples.zh: 比赛中两名球迷试图比谁喊得更大声。

examples.en: A few angry voices attempted to outpry the speaker at the meeting.
examples.zh: 会上有几个人用愤怒的喊声想把发言者的声音压下去。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量、outwork 比别人更努力工作）。因此 outpry 的字面意思就是“在喊叫/呼喊上胜过对方”。
outpry 比较少见，现代英语里更常用 outshout（喊得比……大声）或 shout down（用喊声压制）。

summary.en: Outprying is a rare form meaning “prying out” (removing with leverage) or “being more prying/nosy than others.”
summary.zh: Outprying 很少见，表示“撬出/套出”或“比别人更爱打探、更爱窥探”。

definition.en: present participle of “outpry” (a very rare verb): to pry something out, or to pry more than someone else (be more nosy or intrusive).
definition.zh: “outpry”的现在分词（非常少见的动词）：把某物撬/ pry 出来；或在“打探/窥探”方面超过别人（更爱打听、更爱窥探）。

examples.en: They were outprying old nails from the boards with a small crowbar.
examples.zh: 他们用小撬棍把木板上的旧钉子撬出来。

examples.en: She stopped outprying into other people’s private lives and focused on her own work.
examples.zh: 她不再去打探别人的私生活，把注意力放回自己的工作上。

extraExplanation: “outprying”在现代英语里非常罕见，读者更常见的是“prying”（打探、窥探）或“pry something out”（撬出/套出信息）。如果你想表达“把信息套出来”，更自然的说法是“pry it out of someone”或“get it out of someone”。
有时学习者会把“outprying”误看成“outcrying”（大声喊叫、比别人喊得更大声）。如果你的语境和“喊叫/抗议”有关，可能你要的词是“outcrying”。

summary.en: “Outpull” means to pull better or with more strength than someone or something else.
summary.zh: “outpull”指在拉力或牵引方面胜过他人或其他事物。

definition.en: to pull harder, farther, or more successfully than someone or something else; to surpass in pulling strength or ability
definition.zh: 比（别人或别的事物）拉得更用力、更远或更成功；在拉力或牵引能力上胜过

examples.en: In the final round, she outpulled her opponent and won the tug-of-war.
examples.zh: 在最后一轮，她比对手拉得更有力，赢得了拔河比赛。

examples.en: This small tractor can outpull larger machines on steep hills.
examples.zh: 这台小型拖拉机在陡坡上能比更大的机器牵引得更强。

examples.en: The new engine is designed to outpull the previous model when towing heavy loads.
examples.zh: 新发动机的设计目标是在拖拽重物时比上一代型号更有牵引力。

extraExplanation: “out-” 是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork, outnumber）。因此 outpull 常用于比较语境，意思是“拉得比……更强/更远”。
写法上常见为 outpull（合写），也可能见到 out-pull（加连字符），尤其在较老的文本或为强调结构时。

summary.en: Outpulled means “pulled better/stronger than others” or “outperformed,” and it is the past tense of outpull.
summary.zh: outpulled 是 outpull 的过去式，表示“在拉力/拉动上胜过”，也可引申为“表现或销量等方面超过”。

definition.en: Past tense of outpull: to pull harder, farther, or more successfully than someone or something else; to outperform by pulling.
definition.zh: outpull 的过去式：在“拉”的力量、距离或结果上胜过（某人/某物）；引申为通过“拉动”而胜过、超过。

examples.en: In the final round, she outpulled her opponent and won the tug-of-war.
examples.zh: 在最后一轮，她把对手拉了过去，赢了拔河比赛。

examples.en: Our team outpulled the other boat during the race and took the lead.
examples.zh: 比赛中，我们的队把另一条船拉在后面，取得了领先。

examples.en: The new product outpulled older models in sales last month.
examples.zh: 上个月，这款新产品在销量上超过了旧款。

extraExplanation: “out-” 是常见前缀，表示“比……更……、超过”。因此 outpull 常见于比赛、体育或需要“拉力/牵引力”的语境（如拔河、划船、拖拽）。
书写上有时会看到 out-pulled（加连字符），尤其在较正式或需要强调构词时；现代用法中 outpulled 也很常见。
引申义常用于商业或数据对比：表示“在销量、表现等方面超过”，不一定真的发生“拉”的动作。

summary.en: Outpulling means pulling harder or better than others, or (figuratively) attracting more attention or results than a competitor.
summary.zh: Outpulling 指“拉得更强/更有效、胜过别人”，也可引申为“比竞争对手更能吸引关注或带来效果”。

definition.en: to pull more strongly or effectively than someone or something else; to win in a pulling contest or comparison
definition.zh: （比别人）拉得更有力/更有效；在“拉”的比赛或比较中胜出

examples.en: Their team is outpulling ours in the tug-of-war.
examples.zh: 在拔河比赛中，他们队正比我们队更占上风。

examples.en: With the new motor, the boat is outpulling the older model.
examples.zh: 换了新马达后，这艘船的牵引/拖拽能力比旧型号更强。

examples.en: She’s outpulling everyone on the rowing machine today.
examples.zh: 她今天在划船机上拉动得比所有人都强。

definition.en: (figurative) to attract more interest, attention, customers, or votes than a competitor
definition.zh: （引申）比竞争对手更能吸引（关注/顾客/选票等）

examples.en: Online ads are outpulling TV ads with younger audiences.
examples.zh: 在年轻人群体中，线上广告比电视广告更能吸引注意。

examples.en: This headline is outpulling the others in click-through rate.
examples.zh: 这个标题的点击率比其他标题更能“拉”流量。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 工作更拼、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outpull 就是“拉得比……更强/更有效”。
outpulling 是 outpull 的现在分词/动名词形式：可用于进行时（is outpulling）或作名词用（Outpulling others takes practice.）。
在商业与媒体语境里，outpull 常被用来指“更能吸引受众/带来销量/拉来关注”，属于比较口吻，常与竞争对象一起出现。

summary.en: “Outpulls” means “pulls better/stronger than” or, figuratively, “attracts more than” others.
summary.zh: “outpulls”表示“比……拉得更强/更好”，也可比喻为“比……更能吸引（客流/关注等）”。

definition.en: to pull with more force or effectiveness than someone or something else; to pull better in a contest or test
definition.zh: （在拉力比赛或测试中）比……拉得更有力/更有效；拉赢……

examples.en: In the final round, Maya outpulls her opponent and wins the prize.
examples.zh: 在最后一轮，Maya 比对手拉得更有力，赢得了奖品。

examples.en: This rope is stronger, so it outpulls the thinner one in our experiment.
examples.zh: 这根绳子更结实，所以在我们的实验中它比那根更细的绳子拉得更好。

definition.en: (figurative) to attract, draw, or bring in more people, attention, or business than a competitor
definition.zh: （比喻）比竞争者更能吸引/拉动（人流、关注或生意）

examples.en: The new café outpulls the old one because it’s closer to the station.
examples.zh: 新咖啡馆因为离车站更近，所以比老店更能吸引客人。

examples.en: Her video outpulls most others on the platform this week.
examples.zh: 这周她的视频在平台上比大多数其他视频更吸引关注。

extraExplanation: “outpulls”是动词“outpull”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outpulls）。构词是 out-（超过）+ pull（拉）。
字面义常见于力量/牵引测试；比喻义常见于商业或媒体语境，表示“更能带来客流/关注”。

summary.en: Outpunch means to hit more effectively than an opponent, or figuratively to outperform expectations.
summary.zh: outpunch 指在对抗中出拳更有效；也可比喻为表现超出预期、以弱胜强。

definition.en: to hit harder or more effectively than someone, especially in boxing
definition.zh: （尤指在拳击中）比对手出拳更重、更有效

examples.en: He outpunched his opponent in the later rounds and won by decision.
examples.zh: 他在后几回合出拳更占优势，最终以判定获胜。

examples.en: She looked smaller, but she outpunched the taller fighter with faster, sharper shots.
examples.zh: 她看起来更小，但凭借更快、更犀利的拳法压过了更高的对手。

definition.en: (figurative) to perform better than expected or better than a stronger competitor
definition.zh: （比喻）超出预期表现；战胜看似更强的对手

examples.en: The startup outpunched larger rivals by moving faster and serving customers better.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司靠更快的行动和更好的服务，击败了更大的竞争对手。

examples.en: Our team is outpunching its weight this season.
examples.zh: 我们队这个赛季的表现超出自身“级别”。

extraExplanation: “outpunch”常见于体育评论，尤其是拳击/MMA。最常搭配是“outpunch (one’s) weight”，源自拳击的重量级概念，意思是“实力或资源不占优，却打出超出身价的表现”。在正式写作中也可以用“outperform”替换更中性。

summary.en: “Outpupil” means to surpass someone in learning or school performance, but it is very uncommon in modern English.
summary.zh: “outpupil”表示在学习或成绩上胜过别人，但在现代英语中非常少见。

definition.en: to do better than someone as a student; to surpass another pupil in learning or school performance
definition.zh: （作为学生）比某人学得更好；在学习或成绩上胜过另一名学生

examples.en: In math class, she quickly outpupiled the older students.
examples.zh: 在数学课上，她很快就在学习表现上超过了年长的学生。

examples.en: He worked so hard that he outpupiled his classmates by the end of the term.
examples.zh: 他非常努力，到学期末时在学习上胜过了同班同学。

extraExplanation: “outpupil”非常少见，属于由前缀“out-（超过、胜过）”+“pupil（学生）”构成的造词。实际写作与口语中更常用“outperform (someone) at school / in class”“do better than”“outdo”“surpass”或“outshine”。
如果你想表达“某人在学习上胜过别人”，更自然的说法是："She outperformed her peers academically." 或 "He did better than the other students."

summary.en: “Outpurl” is a rare knitting verb meaning to purl better than someone or to purl more than another person.
summary.zh: “outpurl”是较少见的编织用动词，指反针织得比别人好，或反针织得比别人多。

definition.en: (knitting) To purl in a way that surpasses someone else, or to purl more than another person.
definition.zh: （编织）在反针（purl）技巧上胜过别人；或比别人织更多的反针。

examples.en: She can outpurl most beginners after just a few lessons.
examples.zh: 只上了几节课，她的反针技巧就能胜过大多数初学者。

examples.en: If you outpurl me on this scarf, I’ll handle the finishing work.
examples.zh: 如果这条围巾你织的反针比我多，收尾工作就交给我。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过、比……更……”。把它加在动词前面，经常能临时造出一个可理解的词（例如 outwork, outplay）。因此“outpurl”虽然不常见，但在编织语境里依然容易被理解。
在日常英语中更常见的说法通常是：purl better than someone / purl more than someone，而不是一定要用 outpurl。

summary.en: “Outpurse” means to spend or bid more money than others.
summary.zh: “outpurse”表示在花钱或出价方面超过别人。

definition.en: to spend more money than someone else; to outbid or outspend
definition.zh: （比别人）花更多钱；在出价或花费上胜过

examples.en: He tried to outpurse his rivals to win the contract.
examples.zh: 他想用比对手花更多钱的方式赢下这份合同。

examples.en: In the auction, a single collector outpursed everyone in the room.
examples.zh: 在拍卖会上，有位收藏家出价之高，压过了在场所有人。

extraExplanation: “outpurse”比较少见，带有一点旧式英语/文学用法的味道。它由 out-（超过）+ purse（钱袋，引申为金钱/花钱）构成，常用于强调“在花钱或出价上压过别人”。现代英语里更常用 outspend 或 outbid。

summary.en: “Outpursue” means to pursue or chase more successfully or more intensely than someone else, or to chase beyond a usual limit.
summary.zh: “outpursue”指在追赶/追求上胜过别人，或追得更久、更远（偏正式）。

definition.en: to pursue more successfully or more intensely than someone else; to surpass someone in trying to catch, achieve, or obtain something
definition.zh: 在追赶、追求或争取某事上胜过（别人）；比别人更积极或更成功地追求

examples.en: In the final quarter, the striker outpursued the defenders and reached the ball first.
examples.zh: 在最后一节，这名前锋比后卫更积极地追赶，率先抢到球。

examples.en: To win the contract, the company tried to outpursue its rivals by offering faster service.
examples.zh: 为了赢得合同，这家公司试图用更快的服务来胜过竞争对手的争取。

definition.en: to chase or follow for longer, farther, or beyond a usual limit (often used in formal or literary writing)
definition.zh: 追得更久、更远；追赶到（某个常规界限）之外（较正式或文学用法）

examples.en: The hunters outpursued the herd into the mountains.
examples.zh: 猎人把兽群一路追赶进了山里。

examples.en: He vowed to outpursue every doubt until he found the truth.
examples.zh: 他发誓要一路追下去，直到驱散所有疑虑、找到真相。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语中很常见的前缀，常表示“超过、胜过（别人）”，如 outwork（比别人更努力工作）、outperform（表现超过）。因此 outpursue 通常带有“比别人追得更猛/更成功”的比较意味。
这个词在日常口语里不算高频，更常见的表达包括: pursue harder（更努力追求）、chase down（追上）、beat someone to it（抢先一步）。正式写作或体育/商业语境中用 outpursue 会更自然。

summary.en: Outpursued means “pursued more successfully than others” (past form of outpursue).
summary.zh: outpursued 表示“在追赶/追求上胜过他人”，是 outpursue 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of outpursue) to chase, seek, or follow someone/something more successfully than others; to surpass others in a pursuit.
definition.zh: （outpursue 的过去式/过去分词）在追赶、追求或追踪方面胜过他人；比别人追得更有效、更成功。

examples.en: The police outpursued the suspect and caught him before he reached the highway.
examples.zh: 警方在追捕中胜过嫌疑人，在他上高速前就将其抓获。

examples.en: In the scholarship race, she outpursued her classmates by applying earlier and preparing better.
examples.zh: 在争取奖学金的竞争中，她因为更早申请、准备更充分而胜过同学。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“比……更、超过……”。因此 outpursue / outpursued 字面意思就是“追得比别人更厉害/更成功”。
outpursue 在现代英语里不算常用；更自然的表达常见于：“outpace (in the chase) / outrun / outperform / pursue more effectively”。根据语境选择会更地道。

summary.en: “Outpursuing” means pursuing someone or something more successfully or more intensely than others.
summary.zh: “outpursuing” 指在追赶或追求上胜过他人，更成功或更投入。

definition.en: Present participle of **outpursue**: to pursue someone or something more successfully, for longer, or with greater speed or effort than another person or group.
definition.zh: **outpursue** 的现在分词：比别人追得更成功、更久，或以更快/更大的努力追赶（追求）某人或某物。

examples.en: The police helicopter was outpursuing the cars on the highway.
examples.zh: 警用直升机在高速公路上追得比汽车更快。

examples.en: In business, the new company is outpursuing its rivals by expanding into new markets.
examples.zh: 在商业上，这家公司通过开拓新市场，比竞争对手追求增长更积极。

examples.en: She kept outpursuing her goals even after several failures.
examples.zh: 即使经历了几次失败，她仍然持续更努力地追求目标。

extraExplanation: “out-” 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outsmart 更聪明地胜过）。因此 outpursue = “在追赶/追求上胜过别人”。
“outpursue” 在日常口语里不算特别常见；更常见的表达有 “pursue more aggressively / chase down / outrun (在速度上)” 等，具体用哪个取决于语境（追赶还是追求目标）。

summary.en: Outpush means to push harder/farther than someone else, or (in business) to promote/distribute more aggressively than competitors.
summary.zh: Outpush 指在推的力度或距离上超过别人；也可指（商业上）比竞争对手更强势地推广或铺货。

definition.en: to push harder or farther than someone or something else; to surpass by pushing
definition.zh: （在用力或距离上）比……推得更用力/更远；通过“推”的方式超过对方

examples.en: Two players fought for the ball, but Mia outpushed her opponent and won it.
examples.zh: 两名球员争抢球，但米娅更用力把对手顶开，抢到了球。

examples.en: If we outpush the stuck drawer, it may break the track.
examples.zh: 如果我们把卡住的抽屉硬推得更猛，滑轨可能会断。

definition.en: (business/marketing) to distribute, promote, or sell more aggressively than a competitor
definition.zh: （商业/营销）比竞争对手更强势地铺货、推广或推销

examples.en: The brand tried to outpush rivals by offering better shelf displays.
examples.zh: 这个品牌试图通过更好的货架陈列来比对手更强势地铺货。

examples.en: Smaller companies can’t always outpush big firms in advertising.
examples.zh: 小公司并不总能在广告投放上“推得过”大公司。

extraExplanation: “outpush”由前缀 out-（在……之外；比……更）+ push（推）构成，意思直观，但在日常英语里不算常见。很多场景更自然的表达是：push out（把……推出去/排挤出去）、outperform（全面胜过）、outmuscle（用更大力气压过/制服）。
在商业语境里，outpush 常带“更强势地推动渠道/销量”的含义，接近“push harder (in sales/distribution)”。

summary.en: “Outpushed” means “pushed harder/farther than others” (past tense of outpush).
summary.zh: “outpushed”表示“推得比别人更用力/更远”，是 outpush 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “outpush”: to push farther, harder, or more successfully than someone else; to surpass in pushing.
definition.zh: “outpush”的过去式和过去分词：比别人推得更远/更用力/更成功；在“推”的行为上超过对方。

examples.en: In the final seconds, he outpushed his opponent and reached the button first.
examples.zh: 最后几秒，他比对手推得更猛，先按到了按钮。

examples.en: The front row outpushed the crowd behind them, so they got closer to the stage.
examples.zh: 前排的人把后面的人挤推得更厉害，所以更靠近舞台。

examples.en: Our team outpushed the others on the last hill and won the race.
examples.zh: 最后一个坡我们队比别人更拼、更用力，赢了比赛。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork, outnumber）。所以 outpush = “在推这件事上胜过”。
“outpushed”是过去式/过去分词，常用于叙述比赛、拥挤场景或比喻性的“更努力、更强势地推进”。不过在日常口语里，有时会更常用 pushed past / pushed through 等表达。

summary.en: “Outpushes” means “pushes harder/farther than others,” literally or figuratively.
summary.zh: “outpushes”表示“推得比别人更用力/更远”，也可比喻“在推进事情上更胜一筹”。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “outpush”) to push harder, farther, or more effectively than someone else; to surpass in pushing.
definition.zh: （“outpush”的第三人称单数）比别人推得更用力、更远或更有效；在“推”的动作上胜过对方。

examples.en: In the final seconds, she outpushes her opponent and reaches the finish line first.
examples.zh: 在最后几秒，她推得比对手更猛，率先冲过终点线。

examples.en: The new motor outpushes the old one, moving the cart up the ramp with less effort.
examples.zh: 新马达比旧马达更有力，把小车更轻松地推上斜坡。

definition.en: to pressure or drive something forward beyond what others can do; to outdo in effort or force (often figurative).
definition.zh: （常作比喻）在推进、施压或推动进展方面超过他人；更能“把事情往前推”。

examples.en: He outpushes the team to meet the deadline, even when everyone is tired.
examples.zh: 即使大家都累了，他仍推动团队赶上截止日期。

examples.en: Their campaign outpushes competitors by contacting more voters every week.
examples.zh: 他们的竞选活动每周联系更多选民，在推进力度上胜过竞争对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。例如：outperform（表现胜过）、outnumber（数量超过）、outwork（比……更努力）。所以 outpush = “在推/推进上超过”。
“outpushes”只是动词的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outpushes）。在真实语料中更常见的是 outpush / outpushed / outpushing，或用更常用的动词如 outdo、outperform、push harder。

summary.en: “Outpushing” means surpassing others by pushing harder or advancing more strongly; it can also mean the act of doing so.
summary.zh: “outpushing”指通过更用力/更强势的推进而超过他人；也可指这种超越性的推进过程。

definition.en: pushing harder, farther, or more effectively than someone else; surpassing others by pushing.
definition.zh: 比别人推得更用力、更远或更有效；通过“推”而超越他人。

examples.en: In the final seconds, she was outpushing her opponent to reach the finish line first.
examples.zh: 在最后几秒，她推得比对手更猛，率先冲过终点。
