examples.en: The company is outpushing its rivals by expanding into new markets faster.
examples.zh: 这家公司通过更快进入新市场，在“推进”速度上超过了竞争对手。

definition.en: the act or process of pushing beyond others or beyond a previous limit.
definition.zh: 超越他人或突破原有极限的“推进/推挤”行为或过程。

examples.en: Constant outpushing can cause burnout if there’s no time to rest.
examples.zh: 如果没有休息时间，持续的“拼命推进”可能导致精疲力竭。

examples.en: The coach praised their outpushing in the last quarter.
examples.zh: 教练称赞他们在最后一节的拼劲与推进。

extraExplanation: “outpushing”来自动词“outpush”（out- 表示“超过/胜过” + push）。它不算常见，更常出现在体育对抗、拥挤推挤的场景，或商业/学习等比喻语境中。日常表达里，人们也常用“push harder / outperform / outwork”来替换。

summary.en: Send a word or phrase to look up, and I’ll provide a full learner-friendly entry.
summary.zh: 请发送一个要查询的单词或短语，我会提供完整、适合学习者的词条。

definition.en: No target word or phrase was provided. Please send a word/phrase you want to look up (e.g., “resilient” or “break the ice”).
definition.zh: 你没有提供要查询的单词或短语。请发送你想查询的词/短语（例如“resilient”或“break the ice”）。

examples.en: Please type a word, and I’ll return its pronunciation, meanings, and examples.
examples.zh: 请输入一个单词，我会返回它的发音、释义和例句。

summary.en: “Outputs” usually means the results produced by a system (plural noun), or it can mean “produces” (verb).
summary.zh: “Outputs”通常指“（系统）产出的结果/输出”（名词复数），也可以表示“输出/产生”（动词三单）。

definition.en: The word “outputs” can be the plural noun of “output” (results produced) or the third-person singular verb of “output” (to produce results). Please tell me the sentence or context you mean, and I’ll give the exact meaning and examples.
definition.zh: “outputs”可以是名词复数（output 的复数：产出/输出的结果），也可以是动词第三人称单数（output：输出/产生）。请提供你看到它的句子或语境，我就能给出最准确的释义和例句。

examples.en: In this class, we compare the model’s outputs with the real data.
examples.zh: 在这门课里，我们把模型的输出和真实数据进行比较。

examples.en: The printer outputs 20 pages per minute.
examples.zh: 这台打印机每分钟输出20页。

extraExplanation: 在计算机与工程语境里，output/outputs 常指“系统产生的结果”（如打印内容、程序运行结果、模型预测值），与 input（输入）相对。若你是在写作或口语中看到 outputs，通常更常见的是名词复数“产出/输出”。

summary.en: “Outputted” means “produced and sent out,” especially of data or results; it’s the past tense/participle of “output.”
summary.zh: “outputted”意为“已输出/产生并输出（数据、结果等）”，是动词“output”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “output”: produced and sent out (information, results, data, etc.).
definition.zh: “output（输出）”的过去式和过去分词：已产生并输出（信息、结果、数据等）。

examples.en: The program outputted an error message.
examples.zh: 这个程序输出了一条错误信息。

examples.en: Yesterday, the sensor outputted data every second.
examples.zh: 昨天，传感器每秒输出一次数据。

examples.en: The report was outputted in PDF format.
examples.zh: 报告以 PDF 格式输出。

extraExplanation: “output”作动词时有两种常见过去式：output（不变形）和 outputted。两者都正确，但在技术写作/美式英语中，output（不变形）更常见、更简洁；outputted 也会出现，尤其在强调“确实已经输出过”的语气或在某些团队写作习惯中。
如果你写代码注释或技术文档，很多风格指南会倾向用：The system output the results（而不是 outputted）。

summary.en: “Outputter” means a person, device, or program that outputs something (often used in technical contexts).
summary.zh: 「outputter」指輸出者／輸出裝置／輸出程式，常見於技術語境。

definition.en: A person, device, or program that produces (outputs) information, results, or materials.
definition.zh: 輸出者；輸出裝置；輸出程式（指產生並輸出資訊、結果或材料的人／設備／軟體）。

examples.en: In this workflow, the data logger is the outputter that sends the results to a dashboard.
examples.zh: 在這個流程中，資料記錄器是把結果送到儀表板的輸出端。

examples.en: The app includes an outputter module that writes reports as PDF files.
examples.zh: 這個應用程式包含一個輸出模組，會把報告輸出成 PDF 檔案。

extraExplanation: 「outputter」在一般英語中不算常見，更常見的說法是依情境改用：output device（輸出裝置）、exporter（匯出工具／出口商，依領域不同）、producer（產生者／製作者）、printer（印表機）、sender（傳送端）、writer（寫入元件）。在軟體工程裡，「outputter」有時會被當作某個類別或元件名稱（例如 log outputter）。

summary.en: “Outputting” means producing or sending out results or information, especially from a computer, machine, or system.
summary.zh: “Outputting”指（尤指计算机、机器或系统）输出、产生并送出结果或信息。

definition.en: to produce or send out something (such as information, power, sound, or results), especially from a machine or system
definition.zh: （尤指机器或系统）输出、产生并送出（信息、电力、声音或结果等）

examples.en: The computer is outputting an error message.
examples.zh: 电脑正在输出一条错误信息。

examples.en: This solar panel is outputting enough power to charge the battery.
examples.zh: 这块太阳能板输出的电力足够给电池充电。

examples.en: The program keeps outputting the same result.
examples.zh: 这个程序一直输出同样的结果。

definition.en: to print or display information as a result of processing
definition.zh: （处理后）打印或显示信息

examples.en: The system is outputting today’s sales report.
examples.zh: 系统正在输出今天的销售报告。

examples.en: Press Enter after you finish; the calculator will start outputting the answer.
examples.zh: 你完成后按回车；计算器就会开始输出答案。

extraExplanation: “outputting”是动词“output”的现在分词/动名词形式，常用于进行时（is outputting）或作名词性用法（Outputting data takes time）。
注意重音：名词“output”常读作 /ˈaʊtˌpʊt/；动词“to output”也常读作 /ˈaʊtˌpʊt/，但有时也会听到把重音放在第二部分的读法。学习时记住常见读法即可，语境通常能区分名词或动词。

summary.en: “Outquaff” means to drink more than someone else (often in a boisterous, old-fashioned sense).
summary.zh: “outquaff”指（常带些夸张、古风语气地）喝得比别人多、在酒量上胜过别人。

definition.en: to drink more than someone else; to surpass (someone) in drinking, especially alcohol
definition.zh: （尤指喝酒）比……喝得多；在饮酒量上胜过……

examples.en: At the tavern, he tried to outquaff the older sailors, but gave up halfway through.
examples.zh: 在酒馆里，他想在酒量上胜过那些年长的水手，但喝到一半就放弃了。

examples.en: The poem jokes that no one can outquaff the giant at the feast.
examples.zh: 那首诗开玩笑说，在宴会上没人能喝得过那个巨人。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比……更努力工作；outsmart 比……更聪明）。outquaff 由 out- + quaff（痛饮、畅饮）构成，因此字面就是“喝得比……更猛”。
outquaff 属于比较少见、带一点文学/古风色彩的词，更常见的说法是 “drink more than” 或 “outdrink”。在正式或现代口语中，用 outdrink 会更自然。

summary.en: Outquarters is a rare word meaning outer quarters—accommodations or areas located away from the main building or central place.
summary.zh: Outquarters 是个较罕见的词，指“外部住处/附属宿舍”或“外围地区”，即远离主建筑或中心地带的地方。

definition.en: (rare) Living or working quarters located outside the main building or main area; outer lodgings or auxiliary accommodations.
definition.zh: （罕见）位于主要建筑或核心区域之外的住处/工作场所；外部宿舍、附属住处。

examples.en: The staff stayed in outquarters behind the main house.
examples.zh: 员工住在主宅后面的外部宿舍里。

examples.en: During the renovation, students were moved to temporary outquarters near the gym.
examples.zh: 装修期间，学生被安排到体育馆附近的临时外部宿舍。

definition.en: (by extension) The outer parts of a place; outlying areas or outskirts.
definition.zh: （引申）某地的外缘地区；郊区、边远地带。

examples.en: News from the outquarters reached the town days later.
examples.zh: 来自边远地区的消息几天后才传到镇上。

examples.en: They traveled through the outquarters of the city to avoid traffic downtown.
examples.zh: 他们穿过城市的外围区域以避开市中心的拥堵。

extraExplanation: “outquarters”在现代英语中非常少见，更常见的表达是“outlying quarters / outer quarters / outbuildings / the outskirts”。有时也会写作带连字符的“out-quarters”，尤其在较旧的文字或与庄园、军营、校园宿舍相关的语境中。

summary.en: Outqueen means to surpass a queen—or someone seen as a ‘queen’—in queenly qualities or performance.
summary.zh: Outqueen 指在“女王般”的气场、风范或表现上胜过女王（或被称作“女王”的人）。

definition.en: to surpass a queen in queenly qualities (such as dignity, beauty, or authority); to be more queen-like than a queen
definition.zh: 在女王般的特质（如威仪、美貌或权威）上胜过女王；比女王更“女王”

examples.en: In the costume contest, her posture and poise seemed to outqueen everyone on stage.
examples.zh: 在化装比赛中，她的仪态与从容似乎在舞台上“女王气场”碾压全场。

examples.en: The heroine’s calm authority almost outqueens the royal court.
examples.zh: 女主角冷静的权威感几乎胜过王室宫廷里的所有人。

definition.en: to defeat or outperform someone who is a queen (literally or figuratively)
definition.zh: 击败或胜过某位“女王”（字面或比喻意义）

examples.en: The challenger outqueened the reigning champion in the final round.
examples.zh: 挑战者在决赛中战胜了卫冕冠军（“女王”）。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outshine 超过光彩、outperform 表现更好）。outqueen 不是常用词，更常见于文学、幽默或修辞性的表达，用来强调“更有女王范儿/更具王者气场”。
在现代口语或网络语境里，类似含义更常用 rule, slay, serve（更偏流行语）或 outshine, outclass（更中性正式）。

summary.en: “Outqueried” means “asked/searched more than others” (past tense of outquery).
summary.zh: “outqueried”表示“在提问或查询上超过别人”，是 outquery 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “outquery”: to ask more questions than someone else, or to search/inquire more than someone else (often implying you did it better or more thoroughly).
definition.zh: “outquery”的过去式/过去分词：比别人问得更多，或比别人搜索/询问得更多（常含“更彻底、更胜一筹”的意思）。

examples.en: In the interview, she outqueried the other candidates and showed deeper preparation.
examples.zh: 在面试中，她比其他候选人问得更多，展现出更充分的准备。

examples.en: Our research team outqueried competitors by running broader database searches.
examples.zh: 我们的研究团队通过更广泛的数据库检索，在查询上胜过了竞争对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 数量超过、outperform 表现超过）。因此 outquery 就是“在提问/查询方面超过别人”。
这个词比较少见，更常见的表达有 “ask more questions than… / search more than… / outdo someone in questioning”。在正式写作中也可以改用这些更自然的说法。

summary.en: Outquery means to ask more questions than others or to make more search queries (a rare word, seen more in tech contexts).
summary.zh: Outquery 指“问得更多/盘问得更彻底”，也可指“发出更多搜索查询”（较少见，技术语境更常出现）。

definition.en: to ask more questions than someone else, or to question someone more thoroughly (rare usage).
definition.zh: 比别人问更多问题；更彻底地盘问（较少见用法）。

examples.en: During the interview, the journalist outqueried every other reporter and got the key detail.
examples.zh: 在采访中，那位记者问的问题比其他记者都多，拿到了关键细节。

examples.en: The detective tried to outquery the suspect, but the suspect stayed calm.
examples.zh: 侦探想更彻底地盘问嫌疑人，但对方一直很镇定。

definition.en: to run more search queries than another person/system; to search more actively (modern/tech context).
definition.zh: 比他人/系统发出更多搜索请求；更频繁地检索（现代/技术语境）。

examples.en: On busy days, power users can outquery the API limits quickly.
examples.zh: 在高峰期，重度用户很快就会让 API 查询次数超出限制。

examples.en: Our monitoring showed that one bot was outquerying all normal users combined.
examples.zh: 监控显示，有一个机器人发出的查询次数超过了所有正常用户的总和。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量、outperform 表现胜过）。因此 outquery 直译就是“问/查询得比……更多”。
这个词在日常英语中不常见，更常用的表达是 “ask more questions than … / question more closely / query more often”。在技术写作中，它有时会被用来描述“查询量更大”。

summary.en: “Outquerying” means asking more questions than others or making more search/database queries (present participle of outquery).
summary.zh: “outquerying”表示在提问上超过他人，或在技术语境中进行更多搜索/数据库查询（outquery 的现在分词）。

definition.en: asking more questions than someone else, or questioning more persistently/skillfully (present participle of “outquery”).
definition.zh: （outquery 的现在分词）比别人问得更多、问得更勤/更巧；在提问上胜过对方。

examples.en: During the interview, she was outquerying the other reporters and uncovered the key detail.
examples.zh: 在采访中，她比其他记者问得更深入，挖出了关键细节。

examples.en: The detective kept outquerying the suspect until the story changed.
examples.zh: 侦探不断追问嫌疑人，直到对方的说法出现变化。

definition.en: running more search queries than another system or user (computing/data).
definition.zh: （计算机/数据）发出更多检索请求（查询语句/搜索请求），在查询数量上超过另一方。

examples.en: Our script was outquerying the API limit, so requests started failing.
examples.zh: 我们的脚本查询次数超过了 API 限制，所以请求开始失败。

examples.en: They reduced costs by caching results instead of outquerying the database all day.
examples.zh: 他们通过缓存结果来降低成本，而不是整天频繁查询数据库。

extraExplanation: “outquerying”比较少见，通常来自动词“outquery”（out- 表示“超过/胜过” + query 表示“询问/查询”）。在日常英语里更常见的说法是“asking more questions than…”或“querying more than…”。
在技术语境（搜索/数据库/API）里，它更容易出现，用来强调“查询次数比对方多”或“请求过于频繁导致超限（rate limit）”。

summary.en: Outquestion (rare) means to surpass someone by asking more or tougher questions, or to strongly challenge something through questioning.
summary.zh: outquestion（罕用）指在提问上胜过他人，或通过强烈质疑来挑战某事。

definition.en: (rare) To question more than someone else; to surpass another person in asking questions, often in a competitive or debating context.
definition.zh: （罕用）比别人问得更多；在提问上胜过他人，常见于辩论或竞赛语境。

examples.en: In the debate, she outquestioned her opponent by pressing for clear answers.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，她不断追问，逼对手给出明确回答，从提问上压过了对方。

examples.en: Reporters tried to outquestion one another to get the best quote.
examples.zh: 记者们互相较劲，想在提问上胜过对方，好拿到最精彩的引用。

definition.en: (rare) To challenge or undermine something by questioning it strongly.
definition.zh: （罕用）通过强烈质疑来挑战或动摇某事。

examples.en: The new evidence outquestioned the old explanation.
examples.zh: 新证据强烈质疑并动摇了旧解释。

extraExplanation: “outquestion”是非常不常见的词，更多时候英语会用更自然的表达：question someone repeatedly（反复质问）、press someone with questions（追问）、outdo someone in questioning（在提问上胜过）。
学习时要小心别把它和常用短语“out of the question”（不可能；绝对不行）混淆：例如 That’s out of the question.（那是不可能的/绝对不行。）

summary.en: Outquibble means to outdo someone by arguing over small, picky points (to ‘win’ by nitpicking).
summary.zh: outquibble 指通过纠结细枝末节、抬杠式争辩来压过别人（用吹毛求疵“赢”）。

definition.en: to defeat or outdo someone by quibbling (arguing over small, picky points) or by using clever but trivial arguments
definition.zh: 用吹毛求疵式的争辩（纠结细枝末节）或耍小聪明的论点来压过/胜过某人

examples.en: He tried to outquibble his critics instead of answering their main question.
examples.zh: 他试图用抬杠来压过批评者，而不是回答他们的核心问题。

examples.en: Don’t outquibble your classmates—focus on the big idea.
examples.zh: 别跟同学抬杠较真——把注意力放在重点上。

definition.en: to argue in an overly detailed, petty way; to nitpick in debate (less common)
definition.zh: 过度纠结细节地争辩；在讨论中吹毛求疵（较少见）

examples.en: The meeting stalled because people kept outquibbling about wording.
examples.zh: 会议卡住了，因为大家不停在措辞上抬杠较真。

extraExplanation: “out-”表示“胜过/超过”，而“quibble”是“为小事争辩、抬杠”。因此 outquibble 的核心感觉是“用抬杠赢过别人”。
这个词比较少见，写作中更常用的表达有：outargue（在辩论中胜过）、outmaneuver（在策略上胜过）、nitpick（吹毛求疵）、split hairs（咬文嚼字）。

summary.en: “Outquibbled” means someone was beaten or surpassed by petty, overly clever arguing (past tense).
summary.zh: outquibbled 意为“（过去）在吹毛求疵、抬杠式的争辩上压过/驳倒了对方”。

definition.en: past tense of “outquibble”: to defeat or surpass someone by using petty, overly clever arguments (quibbles), often focusing on small details instead of the main point.
definition.zh: “outquibble”的过去式：用吹毛求疵、玩弄文字或过分机巧的小争辩压过/驳倒对方，常把注意力放在细枝末节而非重点上。

examples.en: In the meeting, she outquibbled him by arguing over tiny wording changes instead of the real issue.
examples.zh: 在会议上，她抓住措辞的小改动争个不停，从而在抬杠上压过了他，却没有讨论真正的问题。

examples.en: The lawyer outquibbled the witness, turning simple answers into long debates about definitions.
examples.zh: 律师用定义上的钻牛角尖压过了证人，把简单的回答变成了围绕词义的长篇争辩。

extraExplanation: “out-”作前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力；outsmart 更聪明地胜过）。因此 outquibble 带有“在抬杠/诡辩上胜过别人”的意思，语气通常偏负面。
quibble 指“在小细节上争辩、挑毛病、玩文字游戏式的争论”，常暗示回避重点。与 debate（辩论）或 argue（争论）相比，它更强调“琐碎”和“狡黠”。

summary.en: Outquibbling means trying to win an argument by being even more picky and nitpicky than others.
summary.zh: outquibbling 指在争论中比别人更爱抠字眼、抓小辫子，从而占上风。

definition.en: to defeat someone in an argument by being more skillful at quibbling (focusing on small, picky points instead of the main issue)
definition.zh: 在争论中用更会“挑刺/抠字眼”的方式压过对方（抓住细枝末节而非重点）

examples.en: Instead of answering the question, he kept outquibbling everyone about tiny wording differences.
examples.zh: 他不回答问题，反而一直在字眼上抠细节，用挑刺的方式压过所有人。

examples.en: She tried to outquibble the judge, but the court wanted clear facts, not word games.
examples.zh: 她想在法官面前抠字眼占上风，但法庭要的是清楚的事实，不是文字游戏。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart 以智取胜、outperform 表现更好）。outquibble 就是“在抠字眼这件事上胜过别人”。
quibble 本身常带贬义：指故意纠缠小问题来回避核心问题。因此 outquibbling 往往暗示一种不够真诚或不够建设性的争论方式。

summary.en: “Outquibled” is a nonstandard spelling; the usual form is “outquibbled,” meaning “defeated or evaded someone by quibbling.”
summary.zh: “outquibled”多为非标准拼写；常见形式是“outquibbled”，意思是“通过挑字眼/抬杠在争论中压过对方，或借此回避正面回答”。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “outquibble”: to defeat someone in an argument by making more clever or more trivial objections than they do.
definition.zh: “outquibble”的过去式/过去分词：用更“挑字眼、抬杠”的方式在争论中压过对方。

examples.en: In the meeting, she outquibbled every critic by focusing on tiny details instead of the main issue.
examples.zh: 在会议上，她抓住细枝末节反驳每个批评者，把重点问题带偏，从而在争论中压过了对方。

examples.en: He tried to outquibble his opponent, but the audience wanted clear answers, not word games.
examples.zh: 他想用抬杠的方式压过对手，但观众想要的是明确回答，而不是文字游戏。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “outquibble”: to avoid admitting a fault or giving a direct answer by arguing about minor points.
definition.zh: “outquibble”的过去式/过去分词：通过纠缠小问题来回避承认错误或回避正面回答。

examples.en: When asked about the mistake, he outquibbled the question and never actually apologized.
examples.zh: 被问到错误时，他一直纠缠小问题来回避提问，始终没有真正道歉。

extraExplanation: “outquibled”更常见的标准拼写是“outquibbled”（双写 b），因为动词“quibble”在加 -ed 时通常双写末尾辅音字母：quibble → quibbled。
“out-”有“胜过/超过”的意思（如 outsmart, outnumber），所以 outquibble 字面上就是“在抬杠/挑字眼方面胜过对方”。这个词较少见，写作中更常用的替换表达有：outargued（辩赢）、evaded the question（回避问题）、nitpicked（吹毛求疵）。

summary.en: Outquibble means to outdo someone in quibbling—winning an argument by focusing on petty details.
summary.zh: Outquibble 指在吹毛求疵的争辩中胜过别人——靠抓细枝末节来“抬杠取胜”。

definition.en: to defeat someone by arguing over small, picky points; to outdo someone in quibbling
definition.zh: 在吹毛求疵的争辩中胜过某人；在“抬杠/诡辩”上比某人更厉害

examples.en: Stop trying to outquibble your classmates—focus on the main idea.
examples.zh: 别再想用吹毛求疵的争辩压过同学了——把注意力放在重点上。

examples.en: He tried to outquibble the critic, but the audience cared more about the bigger issue.
examples.zh: 他想在抬杠上压过那位批评者，但观众更在意更大的问题。

extraExplanation: “outquibling”本身不是常见或标准拼写；更可能是“outquibbling”（动名词/现在分词）或动词原形“outquibble”。
构词法：out- 表示“超过、胜过”；quibble 表示“对细枝末节挑刺式争辩/抬杠”。合起来就是“在抬杠上胜过别人”。这个词比较少见，更常用的表达是 “argue over minor details / split hairs / nitpick”。

summary.en: “Outquote” means to quote more than someone else, or (in business) to quote a higher price.
summary.zh: “outquote”指（在引用上）比别人引用更多；或（在商业中）报出更高的价格。

definition.en: to quote someone more than another person does, or to quote more often than expected (often in discussion, journalism, or argument).
definition.zh: （在讨论、新闻或争论中）比别人引用（某人/某内容）更多；或引用得比预期更频繁。

examples.en: During the debate, she outquoted her opponent by citing three studies in every answer.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，她每个回答都引用三项研究，引用数量明显超过对手。

examples.en: Some articles outquote a single expert and ignore other voices.
examples.zh: 有些文章过度引用某一位专家，而忽视其他观点。

definition.en: to quote at a higher price than another seller or bidder.
definition.zh: （商业/竞标中）报出比他人更高的价格。

examples.en: They outquoted us by 10%, so the client chose their offer.
examples.zh: 他们的报价比我们高10%，所以客户选择了他们的方案。

examples.en: If you outquote the market, you may lose the contract.
examples.zh: 如果你的报价高于市场水平，可能会丢掉合同。

extraExplanation: “out-”常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过人数、outperform 表现更好）。“outquote”不是特别常见，写作中更常见的表达有：quote more than… / cite more than… / quote heavily（大量引用）。在商业语境里，常用的动词还有 bid higher（出价更高）或 quote a higher price（报更高的价）。

summary.en: Outquoted usually means “quoted more (or more often) than others,” and can also mean “quoted at a higher price than others” in business contexts.
summary.zh: Outquoted 通常指“被引用得更多/在引用上胜过别人”，在商业语境中也可指“报价高于他人”。

definition.en: quoted more (or more often) than someone else; surpassed another person or source in quoting.
definition.zh: 被引用得更多（或更频繁）；在引用次数/引用量上超过他人或其他来源。

examples.en: In the report, the senator was outquoted by the governor, who appeared in far more headlines.
examples.zh: 在这份报道中，这位参议员的被引用次数不如州长，因为州长出现在更多头条里。

examples.en: Our spokesperson was outquoted on social media, so our message didn’t dominate the conversation.
examples.zh: 我们的发言人是在社交媒体上被引用得较少的一方，所以我们的信息没有主导讨论。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of outquote: to quote more than another person or source, or to be quoted more than another.
definition.zh: outquote 的过去式/过去分词：引用次数/引用量超过他人或其他来源；或（某人/某方）被引用得更多。

examples.en: The journalist outquoted rival outlets by collecting more on-the-record comments.
examples.zh: 这位记者通过收集更多可公开引用的发言，在引用内容上超过了竞争媒体。

examples.en: During the debate, she outquoted her opponent with short, memorable lines.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，她用简短又好记的话更常被引用，从而压过了对手。

definition.en: given a higher price quote than others (used in sales/business contexts).
definition.zh: 报出的价格高于他人（多用于销售/商业语境）。

examples.en: We were outquoted on the project, so the client chose a cheaper vendor.
examples.zh: 我们对这个项目的报价高于别人，所以客户选择了更便宜的供应商。

examples.en: They got outquoted by nearly 15%, which hurt their chances.
examples.zh: 他们的报价比别人高了将近15%，这影响了中标机会。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过人数、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outquoted 通常表示“在引用/被引用上占优势”，在新闻、公关、社交媒体分析里很常见。
在商业语境里，outquoted 有时指“报价高于对手”（被对方在价格上压过）。是否是这个意思，要看上下文是否在谈 price quote（报价）而不是 quote（引语）。

summary.en: Outquote means to quote more than someone else or to surpass another person by using more quotations/citations.
summary.zh: Outquote 指“引用得比别人更多”，或在讨论/辩论中用更多引文与证据在引用方面胜过对方。

definition.en: to quote someone more often than another person does, or to quote more (lines, sources, or passages) than someone else
definition.zh: 比别人引用得更多；引用（台词/来源/段落）多于他人

examples.en: In class discussions, he often outquotes everyone else by bringing in many lines from the reading.
examples.zh: 在课堂讨论中，他常常引用大量阅读材料中的句子，引用量超过其他所有人。

examples.en: On social media, that movie is so famous that people outquote it compared with newer films.
examples.zh: 在社交媒体上，那部电影太有名了，人们引用它的台词比引用新电影更多。

definition.en: to surpass someone in quoting, especially in debate or argument (often implying you use more evidence or citations)
definition.zh: （尤指在辩论中）在引用证据方面压过对方（常含“引用更多依据/引文”的意思）

examples.en: She didn’t raise her voice—she simply outquoted her opponent with stronger sources.
examples.zh: 她没有提高音量——她只是用更有力的来源引用在证据上压过了对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过……的数量，outperform 表现优于）。因此 outquote 直译就是“在引用上超过”。
“outquote/outquotes”在日常英语里不算高频，更常见的表达是 “quote more than …” 或 “cite more sources than …”。写作或正式讨论中也常用 “out-cite”。
你输入的 “outquotes” 通常是动词 outquote 的第三人称单数（he/she/it outquotes）。词典条目一般用原形 outquote。

summary.en: Outquoting means giving a more competitive quote than someone else, usually a lower price; less commonly, it means outdoing someone by quoting more or better sources.
summary.zh: outquoting 指报出比别人更有竞争力（通常更低）的报价；较少见的用法是指在讨论中用更多或更有力的引文压过对方。

definition.en: to quote a price (or rate) that is better—usually lower—than someone else’s; to offer a more competitive quote
definition.zh: 给出比别人更有优势（通常更低）的报价；报出更具竞争力的价格

examples.en: Two suppliers are outquoting each other to win the contract.
examples.zh: 两家供应商互相压低报价来争取合同。

examples.en: Our competitor is outquoting us by 5%, so we may lose the deal.
examples.zh: 竞争对手的报价比我们低了5%，所以我们可能会丢掉这单。

definition.en: to quote someone more often or more impressively, especially in argument or discussion (less common)
definition.zh: （较少用）在辩论或讨论中引用（他人）更多或更有力的引文，从而压过对方

examples.en: In the debate, she kept outquoting her opponent with lines from famous historians.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，她不断引用著名历史学家的话来压过对手。

extraExplanation: “outquote / outquoting”在商业与金融语境里更常见，尤其指“报出更低/更好价”来抢单（例如供应商报价、保险报价、运费报价、外汇或债券的买卖报价等）。
第二个意思（在讨论中“引用得比别人多/更强”）能理解，但在日常英语里不如“quote more than…”或“outdo someone with quotes”常见。

summary.en: “outr” isn’t a standard standalone English word; it’s likely an incomplete word or a nonstandard abbreviation.
summary.zh: “outr”不是标准英语单词；多半是没写完的词或非标准缩写。

definition.en: Not a standard English word by itself; usually seen as an incomplete spelling or a nonstandard abbreviation in casual writing.
definition.zh: 本身不是标准英语单词；通常只是拼写没写完，或在随意写法里出现的非标准缩写。

examples.en: I think you meant “out” or “outer,” not “outr.”
examples.zh: 我觉得你想写的是“out”或“outer”，而不是“outr”。

examples.en: “outr” looks like a cut-off word—could you type the full word?
examples.zh: “outr”看起来像没打完的词——你能把完整单词打出来吗？

extraExplanation:
“outr”常见的可能性：
1）你想输入以“outr-”开头的词，如 outrage（愤怒/暴行）、outrageous（离谱的）、outrun（跑得比…快）、outreach（外展/推广）。
2）你可能想写法语借词 “outré”（英语里常写作 outré，意思是“怪诞的、夸张得出格的”）。
如果你告诉我你看到它的句子/上下文，我可以帮你锁定正确单词并详细讲解。

summary.en: OuTRACE means to go faster than others or to surpass them in progress or success.
summary.zh: outrace表示“跑/行驶得更快而超过”，也可引申为“在进展或成就上超越”。

definition.en: to run, drive, or move faster than someone or something else; to finish ahead
definition.zh: 跑得/行驶得比……更快；超过并领先到达终点

examples.en: He outraced everyone in the last 100 meters.
examples.zh: 在最后100米，他把所有人都甩在了后面。

examples.en: The sports car outraced the truck on the highway.
examples.zh: 那辆跑车在高速上超过了卡车。

examples.en: She tried to outrace the storm and get home before the rain started.
examples.zh: 她想赶在暴风雨前回到家。

definition.en: to surpass someone or something in progress, success, or development (not only physical speed)
definition.zh: （不一定是速度）在进展、成功或发展上超越……

examples.en: In recent years, the company has outraced its competitors in online sales.
examples.zh: 近几年，这家公司在网购销量方面超过了竞争对手。

examples.en: Technology often outraces the laws meant to regulate it.
examples.zh: 科技的发展常常快过用来监管它的法律。

extraExplanation: “outr-”是前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（out- + race）。因此outrace直观地就是“比……赛得更快”。
既可用于真实比赛（跑步、骑车、开车），也常用于抽象语境，表示“发展/进度领先”。

summary.en: “Outraced” means “ran or moved faster than” (past of outrace), often used for both literal races and figurative competition or progress.
summary.zh: “outraced”是“outrace”的过去式，表示“跑得/进展得更快而超过”，既可指真实比赛，也常用于比喻竞争或进度。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “outrace”: to run, move, or progress faster than someone or something; to leave them behind in a race or competition.
definition.zh: “outrace”的过去式和过去分词：跑得/移动得/进展得比……更快；在比赛或竞争中超过并甩开对方。

examples.en: She outraced the other runners in the final 100 meters.
examples.zh: 在最后100米，她甩开了其他选手。

examples.en: Our team outraced its rivals to finish the project first.
examples.zh: 我们团队进度更快，比竞争对手更早完成了项目。

examples.en: The storm outraced the evacuation orders and reached the coast early.
examples.zh: 风暴来得太快，疏散令还没完全落实就提前登陆了海岸。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语中常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。所以“outrace”直译就是“在race（竞速）中超过”。它既可以用于真实的跑步/赛车，也常用于比喻性的“进度、发展速度”更快（如公司、科技、计划）。

summary.en: “Outraces” means “moves faster than” or “surpasses,” literally in speed or figuratively in progress.
summary.zh: “outraces”表示“在速度上超过”或“在进展上胜过”，既可字面指跑得更快，也可比喻指发展更快。

definition.en: to run, drive, or move faster than someone or something; to beat in a race
definition.zh: 在速度上超过（某人或某物）；在比赛中跑赢

examples.en: She outraces most of her classmates in the 100-meter dash.
examples.zh: 在100米短跑中，她跑得比大多数同学都快。

examples.en: The sports car easily outraces the truck on the highway.
examples.zh: 在高速公路上，这辆跑车轻松超过卡车。

definition.en: to surpass or outdo (someone or something) in progress or development, often over time
definition.zh: （常指随着时间推移）在进展或发展上超过；胜过

examples.en: Technology often outraces laws meant to regulate it.
examples.zh: 科技的发展常常快过用来监管它的法律。

examples.en: Her ambition outraced her experience early in her career.
examples.zh: 她职业生涯早期，雄心一度超过了经验。

extraExplanation: “outraces”是动词“outrace”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outraces）。也可以用作过去式/过去分词“outraced”，现在分词“outracing”。
前缀“out-”常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 数量超过，outperform 表现超过）。因此“outrace”字面就是“跑得比……更快”。

summary.en: Outracing means moving faster than others in a race, or (figuratively) progressing faster than something else.
summary.zh: Outracing 指在比赛中速度胜过他人，也可比喻发展或进展速度超过其他事物。

definition.en: (present participle of outrace) running, driving, or moving faster than someone/something in a race; beating them by speed.
definition.zh: （outrace 的现在分词）在比赛中跑得/开得/移动得比某人或某物更快；以速度取胜。

examples.en: She was outracing the other runners by the halfway point.
examples.zh: 到比赛半程时，她已经跑得比其他选手快了。

examples.en: The motorbike was outracing the cars on the highway.
examples.zh: 那辆摩托车在高速公路上开得比汽车还快。

definition.en: (figurative) developing or progressing faster than something else; surpassing in pace or growth.
definition.zh: （比喻）发展或进展速度超过其他事物；在节奏或增长上超越。

examples.en: Technology is outracing the laws meant to regulate it.
examples.zh: 科技发展的速度正在超过用来监管它的法律。

examples.en: Inflation is outracing wage growth in many places.
examples.zh: 在许多地方，通货膨胀的速度超过了工资增长。

extraExplanation: “outracing”常见于新闻和学术写作中的比喻用法，强调“变化太快，制度/理解/准备跟不上”。例如：Technology is outracing regulation（科技跑在监管前面）。
字面义多用于体育或交通场景；比喻义则更抽象，常搭配 progress, change, inflation, costs, demand 等词。

summary.en: “Outrage” means intense anger and shock, or the act of causing such anger, often tied to a sense that something is morally wrong.
summary.zh: “Outrage”指强烈的愤怒与震惊（公愤/愤慨），也可作动词表示“激怒、冒犯”，常带有“这在道德上不该发生”的意味。

definition.en: A strong feeling of shock, anger, and moral offense, often caused by something seen as unfair or wrong.
definition.zh: （对不公或错误之事的）强烈震惊、愤怒与道德上的冒犯感；公愤。

examples.en: The decision caused public outrage.
examples.zh: 这个决定引发了公众的强烈愤怒。

examples.en: Many people expressed outrage at the unfair treatment.
examples.zh: 许多人对这种不公平的对待表示愤慨。

definition.en: To shock and anger someone greatly, especially by doing something considered morally wrong or unacceptable.
definition.zh: 使（某人）震惊并激怒；（尤指因道德上错误或不可接受之事）冒犯、激怒。

examples.en: The comments outraged many viewers.
examples.zh: 这些言论激怒了许多观众。

examples.en: She was outraged by the rude behavior.
examples.zh: 她对这种粗鲁的行为感到非常愤怒。

extraExplanation: “Outrage”常带有“道德层面”的愤怒：不仅是生气（angry），而是觉得“这不应该发生/太不正义”。因此常见搭配有 public outrage（公愤）、moral outrage（道德愤怒）、spark outrage（引发公愤）。
词形区分：outrage（名词/动词） vs. outrageous（形容词，意为“令人震惊的、离谱的/骇人听闻的”）。例如：That price is outrageous.（那个价格太离谱了。）
在新闻语境中，“outrage”很常用来描述社会对事件的强烈反应；在较正式写作里也可用于强调“严重冒犯”。

summary.en: Outraged means extremely angry or shocked because something seems very unfair or wrong.
summary.zh: Outraged 指因觉得某事非常不公平或错误而极度愤怒或震惊。

definition.en: Very angry, shocked, or upset because you think something is unfair or morally wrong.
definition.zh: 因认为某事不公平或违背道德而非常愤怒、震惊或不安。

examples.en: Many people were outraged by the unfair decision.
examples.zh: 许多人对这个不公平的决定感到愤怒。

examples.en: She was outraged that someone would lie about her.
examples.zh: 有人编造关于她的谎言，让她非常愤怒。

extraExplanation: “outraged”通常表示带有强烈道德判断的愤怒（不仅是生气），常用于新闻、公共事件与社会议题：be outraged by/at sth，be outraged that…
词源上与“out-（超过）+ rage（暴怒）”有关，语感上比“angry”更强烈，也更正式。

summary.en: “Outragely” is a rare/nonstandard adverb meaning “in an outrageous (shocking or extreme) way,” often replaced by “outrageously.”
summary.zh: “outragely”是罕见/不规范的副词，表示“离谱地、过分地”，现代英语通常用“outrageously”。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) In an outrageous way; extremely or shockingly.
definition.zh: （罕见/不规范用法）以荒唐或令人震惊的方式；极其、非常。

examples.en: The price is outragely high for such a small room.
examples.zh: 这样小的房间，这个价格高得离谱。

examples.en: He was outragely rude to the staff.
examples.zh: 他对工作人员无礼得过分。

definition.en: (Rare / literary) With violent or abusive behavior; in a way that treats someone badly.
definition.zh: （罕见/文学）以粗暴或虐待的方式；以恶劣方式对待他人。

examples.en: They were treated outragely by those in power.
examples.zh: 他们被当权者以粗暴的方式对待。

extraExplanation: “outragely”在现代英语里几乎不用，很多情况下是把 **outrageously**（离谱地/过分地）写错或省略了。正式写作与考试中建议用 **outrageously**。
如果你想表达“让人生气/引发公愤地”，更自然的表达是 **offensively**（冒犯地）或 **in a way that outrages people**（以激起公愤的方式）。

summary.en: “Outrageous” describes something shockingly unreasonable/offensive, or extremely exaggerated and wild (sometimes amusing).
summary.zh: “outrageous”可指“离谱到令人震惊/冒犯、不可接受”，也可指“夸张离奇、很疯狂（有时还挺好笑）”。

definition.en: Very shocking, unacceptable, or offensive; beyond what most people think is reasonable.
definition.zh: 非常令人震惊的；不可接受的；冒犯性的；超出多数人认为合理的范围。

examples.en: The company charged an outrageous fee for a basic service.
examples.zh: 这家公司对一项基本服务收取了离谱的费用。

examples.en: Her outrageous comments offended many people.
examples.zh: 她那些出格的言论冒犯了很多人。

definition.en: Extremely unusual, exaggerated, or wild (sometimes in a funny or entertaining way).
definition.zh: 极其不寻常的；夸张的；疯狂的（有时带幽默或娱乐效果）。

examples.en: He wore an outrageous hat to make everyone laugh.
examples.zh: 他戴了一顶夸张的帽子来逗大家笑。

examples.en: That’s an outrageous story—are you sure it’s true?
examples.zh: 那个故事也太离奇了——你确定是真的吗？

extraExplanation: 词源上与“rage（愤怒）”有关：out + rage，原义带有“激起公愤、引发愤怒”的感觉，所以常用来形容“令人气愤到不可接受”的事（如价格、行为、言论）。
语气提示：outrageous 可以是强烈负面（离谱、可恶），也可以是偏中性/正面（夸张但好笑、很有戏）。要看语境：outrageous price（负面） vs. outrageous costume（可能好玩）。
常见搭配：outrageous prices/fees（离谱的价格/费用），outrageous behavior（恶劣/出格的行为），outrageous lie（荒唐的谎言），outrageous joke（尺度很大/很夸张的玩笑）。

summary.en: “Outrageously” means “extremely and shockingly,” often describing something unreasonably excessive; it can also be playful praise in informal contexts.
summary.zh: “outrageously”表示“极其、离谱到令人震惊”，常指不合理地过分；在口语里也可用于夸张式称赞。

definition.en: In an extremely excessive, shocking, or unreasonable way (often used for prices, behavior, or claims).
definition.zh: 以极其过分、令人震惊或不合理的方式（常用于价格、行为或说法）。

examples.en: The tickets were outrageously expensive for such a short show.
examples.zh: 那么短的演出，票价却贵得离谱。

examples.en: He behaved outrageously at the meeting and insulted everyone.
examples.zh: 他在会议上举止太过分了，把所有人都侮辱了一遍。

definition.en: In a bold, playful, or humorously extreme way (sometimes used as praise in informal speech).
definition.zh: 以大胆、玩笑式或夸张到好笑的方式（口语中有时带赞赏意味）。

examples.en: She’s outrageously talented for someone so young.
examples.zh: 她年纪这么小，却才华横溢得夸张。

examples.en: That joke was outrageously funny.
examples.zh: 那个笑话好笑得离谱。

extraExplanation: “outrageously”来自“outrage”（暴行/愤怒/冒犯）+ -ously（副词后缀），语气很强，常表达“让人无法接受”的程度，比如 outrageously high prices（离谱地高的价格）。
语境会决定褒贬：谈价格、行为时多为负面；形容才华、幽默时可能是夸张的正面称赞，但通常仍带“夸到不真实”的感觉。

summary.en: Outrageousness means the quality of being extremely shocking, unfair, or wildly excessive.
summary.zh: Outrageousness 指“极其离谱、令人震惊或不可接受”的性质/程度。

definition.en: The quality of being outrageous—very shocking, extreme, or unacceptable (often in a way that makes people angry or amazed).
definition.zh: “离谱/荒唐/令人震惊”的特质；指行为、言论或情况非常极端、令人难以接受（常让人愤怒或惊讶）。

examples.en: People were upset by the outrageousness of the price increase.
examples.zh: 人们对这次涨价的离谱程度感到很不满。

examples.en: The film uses humor to highlight the outrageousness of corruption.
examples.zh: 这部电影用幽默来凸显腐败的荒唐与可憎。

examples.en: Everyone laughed at the outrageousness of his story, even though it wasn’t true.
examples.zh: 大家都笑他故事太离谱，尽管那并不是真的。

extraExplanation: “outrageousness”= outrageous（离谱的/令人愤怒的） + -ness（名词后缀，表示“……的性质/状态”）。因此它常用于更正式或书面表达，口语里更常说“how outrageous it is / how crazy it is（有多离谱）”。
语义上既可以表示“令人愤怒的冒犯”（强调不公与不可接受），也可以表示“夸张到惊人的程度”（有时带幽默或戏谑）。具体情绪取决于语境。

summary.en: “Outrage-proof” means unlikely to cause offense or outrage, or (of people) not easily offended.
summary.zh: “outrage-proof”指不太会引发冒犯或众怒的；也可指人/受众不容易被冒犯。

definition.en: Unlikely to cause public anger or offense; designed or phrased so people won’t feel outraged.
definition.zh: 不太可能引发公众愤怒或反感的；经过设计或措辞处理、让人不易“被冒犯/被激怒”的。

examples.en: The company tried to write an outrage-proof apology, but people still criticized it.
examples.zh: 公司试图写一份“不会引发众怒”的道歉声明，但人们还是批评了它。

examples.en: He chose outrage-proof language for the announcement to avoid misunderstandings.
examples.zh: 他在公告中选择了不易引发争议的措辞，以避免误解。

examples.en: There’s no such thing as a completely outrage-proof joke.
examples.zh: 并不存在完全“不会引发冒犯”的笑话。

definition.en: Not easily shocked, angered, or offended (about a person or audience).
definition.zh: （指人或受众）不容易被激怒、震惊或冒犯的。

examples.en: After years online, she felt almost outrage-proof.
examples.zh: 在网上待了多年后，她觉得自己几乎对“愤怒情绪”免疫了。

examples.en: The show is aimed at an outrage-proof audience.
examples.zh: 这档节目面向的是不太容易被冒犯的观众。

extraExplanation: “outrage-proof”多见于新闻评论、社交媒体与公关语境，带有一点讽刺意味：想把话说得“滴水不漏”、避免被骂。
写法上常见带连字符（outrage-proof）；也有人写作不带连字符的 outragedproof/​outrageproof，但带连字符更清晰、也更符合英语构词习惯（名词+proof）。
这里的 proof 是“防……的、耐……的”（如 waterproof 防水、bulletproof 防弹），不表示“证据”。

summary.en: An outrager is a person who commits an outrage or causes strong public anger.
summary.zh: outrager 指实施暴行/恶行的人，或引发强烈愤怒与公愤的人。

definition.en: A person who commits an outrage (a shocking, cruel, or violent act), especially one that harms others or public order.
definition.zh: 实施暴行/恶行的人；作出令人震惊、残忍或暴力行为的人（尤指伤害他人或扰乱社会秩序者）。

examples.en: The community demanded that the outrager be brought to justice.
examples.zh: 社区要求将这名施暴者绳之以法。

examples.en: History remembers him not as a hero but as an outrager.
examples.zh: 历史记住的不是他作为英雄，而是他作为施暴者的一面。

definition.en: A person who strongly angers or offends others; someone who causes outrage.
definition.zh: 激怒他人或冒犯他人的人；引发公愤的人。

examples.en: Online, he became known as a constant outrager who enjoyed provoking people.
examples.zh: 在网上，他以总爱挑衅、引发众怒的“惹怒者”而出名。

examples.en: The columnist was seen as an outrager for his insulting remarks.
examples.zh: 由于侮辱性的言论，这位专栏作家被视为“引发公愤的人”。

extraExplanation: “outrager”由“outrage（暴行；愤慨）+ -er（做……的人）”构成，但在现代英语里并不算常用词；更常见的表达包括“offender（违法者/冒犯者）”“perpetrator（作案者）”“abuser（施虐者/施暴者）”。
在法律或新闻语境中，如果强调对他人造成伤害或犯罪行为，通常用“perpetrator/offender”；如果只是强调言论或行为引发愤怒，更自然用“someone who outrages people”或“provocateur（挑衅者）”。

summary.en: “Outrages” can mean shocking acts (plural noun) or the verb form meaning “deeply angers/offends.”
summary.zh: “outrages”既可作复数名词表示“暴行/骇人听闻的行为”，也可作动词第三人称单数表示“使极其愤怒/震惊”。

definition.en: (plural noun) shocking or offensive acts; things that cause strong anger or moral shock.
definition.zh: （复数名词）令人震惊或冒犯的行为；引发强烈愤怒或道德震撼的事情。

examples.en: Many people protested against the outrages committed during the war.
examples.zh: 许多人抗议战争期间发生的暴行。

examples.en: The report listed several outrages against civilians.
examples.zh: 报告列出了数起针对平民的暴行。

definition.en: (verb, third-person singular) to make someone feel very angry and shocked; to deeply offend.
definition.zh: （动词第三人称单数）使某人极其愤怒和震惊；严重冒犯。

examples.en: The unfair decision outrages many students.
examples.zh: 这个不公平的决定激怒了许多学生。

examples.en: It outrages the community when rules are broken without consequences.
examples.zh: 当有人破坏规则却不受惩罚时，社区会感到愤怒和震惊。

extraExplanation: “outrage”既可以指“强烈的愤怒”（不可数）也可以指“骇人听闻的行为/暴行”（可数）；“outrages”常见于新闻或历史语境，强调严重侵犯人权或公义的行为。
在语气上，“outrage”比“anger”更强，通常带有“道德上不可接受、令人震惊”的意味。

summary.en: “Outraging” means “causing outrage,” often describing something shocking or offensive.
summary.zh: “outraging”表示“引发公愤/强烈愤怒”，常形容令人震惊或冒犯的事物。

definition.en: shocking or deeply offensive; causing strong anger or disgust.
definition.zh: 令人震惊的；极其冒犯的；引起强烈愤怒或反感的。

examples.en: The outraging comments sparked widespread criticism online.
examples.zh: 那些令人愤怒的言论在网上引发了广泛批评。

examples.en: Many people found the ad outraging and disrespectful.
examples.zh: 许多人觉得那则广告非常冒犯、缺乏尊重。

definition.en: present participle of “outrage”: causing people to feel outrage; or violating an accepted rule or standard.
definition.zh: “outrage”的现在分词：激起公愤/强烈愤怒；或违反公认的规则、标准。

examples.en: The decision is outraging residents who feel ignored.
examples.zh: 这项决定正激怒那些觉得被忽视的居民。

examples.en: He was accused of outraging public decency.
examples.zh: 他被指控“有伤风化”（违反公众体面/公德）。

extraExplanation: “outraging public decency”是法律/新闻语境里常见搭配，意思接近“有伤风化”。不同地区法律用语略有差别，但通常指严重冒犯公众的行为。
日常表达里更常说：“It’s outrageous.”（太离谱/太过分了）或“People are outraged.”（人们很愤怒）。“outraging”常用于描述正在引发公愤的言行或决定。

summary.en: “Outrail” is a rare verb meaning to derail (go off the rails) or to cause something to derail; very rarely, it can mean to outdo someone in loud criticism.
summary.zh: “outrail”是较少见的动词，主要指（火车等）脱轨或使其脱轨；极少情况下也可指在猛烈指责/抱怨方面压过别人。

definition.en: (Of a train or rail vehicle) to run off the rails; to derail.
definition.zh: （火车或轨道车辆）脱轨；出轨。

examples.en: The car outrailled on the sharp curve after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，车厢在急弯处脱轨了。

examples.en: Inspectors checked the track to learn why the train outrailled.
examples.zh: 检查人员检查了轨道，以查明火车为何脱轨。

definition.en: To cause a train or rail vehicle to run off the rails; to derail.
definition.zh: 使（火车或轨道车辆）脱轨。

examples.en: A damaged switch can outrail a train if it isn’t repaired.
examples.zh: 道岔损坏如果不维修，可能会导致列车脱轨。

examples.en: The collision outrailled the front cars.
examples.zh: 碰撞使前面的车厢脱轨了。

definition.en: (Rare) To outdo someone in railing—complaining or criticizing loudly.
definition.zh: （罕见）在“怒骂/抱怨/猛烈批评”方面胜过某人。

examples.en: In the debate, he tried to outrail his opponent instead of answering the question.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，他试图用更猛烈的指责压过对手，而不是回答问题。

extraExplanation: “outrail”较少见，常出现在铁路/事故报告等技术语境中；日常英语里更常用的说法是“derail”（脱轨）或“run off the rails”（出轨）。
第三个义项来自动词“rail”（严厉指责、抱怨）的用法，但现代英语中很少使用“outrail”表达这一意思。

summary.en: “Outraise” means to raise more (especially money) than someone else or than a previous amount.
summary.zh: “Outraise”指（尤其在募款/筹资中）筹得比别人更多，或超过以往的筹集金额。

definition.en: to raise (something) to a higher level than someone or something else; to raise more than another amount or standard
definition.zh: 把（某物）提高到比他人或他物更高的水平；（金额等）筹得/募集得比另一方更多

examples.en: The company outraised its competitors by securing twice as much funding.
examples.zh: 这家公司筹集到的资金是竞争对手的两倍，因而在融资上超过了他们。

examples.en: In the charity drive, our team outraised last year’s total in just one week.
examples.zh: 在这次慈善募捐中，我们团队仅用一周就筹得了超过去年总额的善款。

extraExplanation: “outraise”常用于资金、募款（fundraising）或筹资（funding）的语境，表示“筹得更多/筹得高于对方”。在一般语境中也可指“把某项指标或水平提高得更高”，但最常见还是和钱、捐款、资金有关。

summary.en: “Outroaised” means “raised more than others,” most often used for raising money (fundraising).
summary.zh: “outraised”表示“筹得比别人更多/在募款上超过对方”，最常用于募款语境。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of “outraise”) to raise more money than another person or group; to surpass others in fundraising.
definition.zh: （“outraise”的过去式/过去分词）筹到的钱比别人或别的团体更多；在募款上超过对方。

examples.en: The campaign outraised its closest rival in the final month.
examples.zh: 这场竞选在最后一个月的募款额超过了最接近的对手。

examples.en: She had outraised everyone on the team by the end of the week.
examples.zh: 到周末时，她的募款额已经超过了团队里的所有人。

definition.en: (adjective) raised to a greater amount than another; higher in the amount raised (especially money).
definition.zh: （形容词）筹得更多的；募集金额更高的（尤指钱）。

examples.en: The outraised candidate gained more attention from donors.
examples.zh: 那位募款额更高的候选人获得了捐赠者更多关注。

examples.en: In the report, the outraised total was highlighted in bold.
examples.zh: 在报告中，筹得更多的总额被用粗体标出。

extraExplanation: “outraise”= out-（超过）+ raise（募集/筹集）。在新闻和政治语境里最常见，尤其指“募款/筹款（raise money/funds）”而不是“把东西举起来”。
写作中也常见作两词或带连字符的形式来强调比较：out-raised / outraised；现代新闻写作更倾向于合写 outraised。

summary.en: “Outraises” means raises more money than others (most common), especially in fundraising.
summary.zh: “Outraises”主要表示“筹到的钱比别人多”，常用于募款/竞选/慈善筹款语境。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “outraise”) to raise more money than someone else, especially in fundraising (e.g., campaigns, charities).
definition.zh: （“outraise”的第三人称单数）筹到比别人更多的钱，尤指在募款、竞选或慈善筹款中。

examples.en: She outraises her opponent every quarter.
examples.zh: 她每个季度的筹款都超过对手。

examples.en: The charity outraises its goal thanks to many small donations.
examples.zh: 因为许多小额捐款，这家慈善机构的筹款超过了目标。

definition.en: (less common) to raise something higher than something else; to lift above.
definition.zh: （较少见）把某物举得比另一物更高；抬高到……之上。

examples.en: The platform outraises the stage by several inches.
examples.zh: 这个平台比舞台高出几英寸。

examples.en: In the new design, the roofline outraises the older building’s height.
examples.zh: 在新设计中，屋顶线高于旧建筑的高度。

extraExplanation: “outraise”最常见于美国政治与公益语境，强调“筹款表现更强”。在新闻报道中常见搭配：outraise an opponent（筹款胜过对手）、outraise expectations/targets（超过预期/目标）。
词形提示：outraise（原形）→ outraises（第三人称单数）→ outraised（过去式/过去分词）→ outraising（现在分词）。

summary.en: “Outraising” means raising more money/support than someone else, often in fundraising or politics.
summary.zh: “outraising”指在筹款或争取支持方面筹得比别人更多，常见于政治竞选和公益筹款语境。

definition.en: (present participle of out-raise) raising more money, votes, or support than someone else; surpassing others in how much you raise.
definition.zh: （out-raise 的现在分词）筹得比别人更多的钱/票/支持；在“募集、筹集”方面超过他人。

examples.en: The campaign is outraising its main rival in small donations.
examples.zh: 该竞选团队在小额捐款筹款方面超过了主要对手。

examples.en: By midyear, the charity was outraising last year’s total.
examples.zh: 到年中时，这家慈善机构筹到的款已超过去年的总额。

examples.en: They’re focusing on online events to keep outraising other teams.
examples.zh: 他们专注于线上活动，以持续在筹款上领先其他团队。

definition.en: the act or process of raising more than others (used as a noun/gerund).
definition.zh: 筹得更多（相对于他人）的行为或过程（作名词/动名词用）。

examples.en: Outraising the opposition became a key goal for the candidate.
examples.zh: 在筹款上超过对手成了该候选人的关键目标。

examples.en: Their outraising of competitors helped fund more community programs.
examples.zh: 他们在筹款上超越竞争者，从而资助了更多社区项目。

extraExplanation: “out-raise”常见于美国政治与非营利组织语境，尤其指fundraising（筹款）：out-raise someone = 筹到的捐款总额比对方多。也可更广义指“筹到更多支持/资金”。书写上常见out-raise / outraising，也可见到带连字符out-raise / out-raising。

summary.en: Outrake is a rare verb meaning to surpass in raking/gathering, or (in older/technical use) to slant/project outward more than something else.
summary.zh: Outrake 是个罕用动词，指在耙起/拢起方面胜过；或在较旧/技术用法中指比……更外倾或更外伸。

definition.en: (rare) to surpass or exceed (someone or something) in raking, gathering, or sweeping up.
definition.zh: （罕用）在“耙起、拢起、扫起（如落叶、草等）”这类动作上超过（某人/某物）；把……耙得更多/更快。

examples.en: He tried to outrake the other workers by clearing the yard faster.
examples.zh: 他想比其他工人更快清理院子，用更快的速度把落叶耙走。

examples.en: With a wider rake, she could outrake her partner in half the time.
examples.zh: 用更宽的耙子，她能在一半时间里比搭档耙得更多。

definition.en: (technical/rare) to have a more outward slant or projection than something else (used when comparing angles or “rake,” especially in older writing).
definition.zh: （技术/罕用）在倾斜角度或外伸程度上比……更向外倾/更外伸（用于比较“rake/倾斜、外伸”，多见于较旧的用法）。

examples.en: In the older description, the front edge was said to outrake the rear by a few degrees.
examples.zh: 在较早的描述中，前缘被说成比后缘更外倾几度。

extraExplanation: “outrake”不是现代英语里的常用词，更多出现在较旧的文本或非常特定的技术语境中。日常表达里，人们通常用更常见的动词来替代，比如：outperform（表现更好）、outdo（胜过）、clear more/faster（清理得更多/更快）。
构词上，out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber, outgrow），rake 本义是“用耙子拢/刮/扫”。合起来就是“在 raking 这件事上胜过”。

summary.en: “Outran” is the past tense of “outrun,” meaning either ran faster than someone or exceeded a limit (like time or money).
summary.zh: “outran”是“outrun”的过去式，可表示“跑得更快把人甩开”，也可表示“超出限制（如时间、预算等）”。

definition.en: past tense of “outrun”: to run faster than someone and leave them behind.
definition.zh: “outrun”的过去式：跑得比别人快，把对方甩在后面。

examples.en: She outran the other runners in the last 100 meters.
examples.zh: 最后100米她跑得比其他选手都快，把大家甩在了后面。

examples.en: The thief outran the security guard and disappeared into the crowd.
examples.zh: 小偷跑得比保安快，钻进人群就不见了。

definition.en: past tense of “outrun”: to be greater or go beyond something (such as time, money, or limits).
definition.zh: “outrun”的过去式：超出、超过（如时间、金钱或限制）。

examples.en: The project’s costs outran our original budget.
examples.zh: 项目成本超出了我们最初的预算。

examples.en: Rumors outran the facts, and people panicked.
examples.zh: 谣言传播得比事实更快，大家就恐慌了。

extraExplanation: “Outrun”是不规则动词：outrun（原形）– outran（过去式）– outrun（过去分词）。例如：I have outrun my competitors.（我已经超过了竞争对手。）
除了字面“跑得更快”，outrun也常用于抽象表达：costs outran the budget（成本超预算）、events outran our ability to respond（事态发展超出应对能力）。

summary.en: Outrance means “the extreme limit,” especially in formal/literary phrases like “to fight to the outrance.”
summary.zh: Outrance 指“极限、极端程度”，多见于较正式/文学性的固定说法，如“to fight to the outrance（战至最后）”。

definition.en: an extreme degree; the farthest limit of something (often used in set phrases like “to the bitter outrance” or “to fight to the outrance”).
definition.zh: 极端程度；极限（常见于固定搭配，如“to fight to the outrance”表示“战至最后/拼到极致”）。

examples.en: Their loyalty was carried to outrance, even when the decision was clearly harmful.
examples.zh: 他们的忠诚被推到极致，哪怕这个决定明显有害。

examples.en: In the novel, the rivals fight to the outrance, refusing any compromise.
examples.zh: 在小说里，宿敌战至最后，拒绝任何妥协。

definition.en: (rare) an extreme style or position; excess.
definition.zh: （罕见）极端的风格或立场；过度。

examples.en: Critics accused the movement of outrance rather than thoughtful reform.
examples.zh: 评论家指责这场运动走向极端，而不是深思熟虑的改革。

extraExplanation: “outrance”来自法语，常与法语短语“à outrance”（意为“到极端、到最后”）有关。在英语里更常见的用法是固定表达，如“to fight to the outrance”（拼到最后一刻、决战到底）。日常口语中更常用“to the extreme / to the limit / all-out”来表达类似意思。
在文学或历史叙述中，“to the outrance”带有一种更庄重、戏剧化的色彩，常用来描写不妥协的对抗或把某种态度推到极端。

summary.en: “Outrances” is the plural of “outrance,” meaning extreme limits or extreme actions; it’s rare and somewhat old-fashioned in modern English.
summary.zh: “outrances”是“outrance”的复数，表示“极限/极端程度”或“过激行为”；在现代英语中较少见，略偏旧式。

definition.en: the utmost limit or extreme point; an extreme degree (rare/old-fashioned in modern English)
definition.zh: 极限；极端程度（现代英语中较少见/偏旧式）

examples.en: The debate pushed the two sides to outrances neither expected.
examples.zh: 这场辩论把双方都推到了谁也没预料到的极端。

examples.en: In grief, he spoke in outrances that later embarrassed him.
examples.zh: 在悲痛中，他说了些极端的话，后来让他很难堪。

definition.en: violent or excessive actions taken to an extreme (often plural: “outrances”)
definition.zh: 极端行为；过激举动（常用复数 outrances）

examples.en: The leader warned his followers against political outrances.
examples.zh: 领袖警告追随者不要采取政治上的过激行为。

examples.en: Her friends tried to calm her before she did anything in outrance.
examples.zh: 朋友们试图在她做出任何过激之举前让她冷静下来。

extraExplanation: outrance 源自法语（常见于短语 à outrance），意思是“到极限、到最后一刻”。英语里最常见的相关表达是 fight to the bitter end（战斗到最后/拼到最后）。
“outrances”在现代日常英语中很少用；写作时更常用 extremes, excesses, radical actions 等更自然的词。

summary.en: “Outrang” means “surpassed/outdid” (the past tense of the rare verb “outring”).
summary.zh: “outrang”表示“胜过/超过”，是较少见动词“outring”的过去式。

definition.en: past tense of “outring”: to do better than someone; to outdo or surpass (often in ability, achievement, or performance).
definition.zh: “outring”的过去式：胜过（某人）；在能力、成就或表现上超过。

examples.en: In the final match, she outrang her opponent with faster reflexes.
examples.zh: 在决赛中，她凭更快的反应胜过了对手。

examples.en: He tried to outrang his classmates in every subject.
examples.zh: 他试图在每一门课上都胜过同学。

extraExplanation: “outrang”在现代英语里非常少见，多数情况下人们更常用 **outdid / outperformed / surpassed** 来表达“胜过”。

容易与 **outrank**（在等级/职级上高于）或 **outrange**（在距离/范围上超过）混淆：
- outrank: She outranks him in the company.（她在公司级别比他高。）
- outrange: This radar outranges the old one.（这台雷达探测范围超过旧的。）

summary.en: Outrange means to have a greater range than something else, especially in shooting, detection, or distance.
summary.zh: Outrange 指在射程、探测距离或覆盖范围等方面超过别的事物，常见于军事或技术语境。

definition.en: to have a greater range than something else (for example, to shoot, see, or reach farther).
definition.zh: （在射程、覆盖范围、可及距离等方面）比……更远；超过……的范围。

examples.en: This rifle can outrange most handguns.
examples.zh: 这支步枪的射程比大多数手枪更远。

examples.en: Their radar could outrange ours, so they detected us first.
examples.zh: 他们的雷达探测距离比我们的更远，所以他们先发现了我们。

definition.en: (military) to be able to fire farther than an enemy weapon; to outdistance in firing range.
definition.zh: （军事）射程压制；武器射程超过敌方，从而能在对方无法还击的距离开火。

examples.en: The artillery was designed to outrange enemy guns.
examples.zh: 这种火炮被设计用来在射程上压过敌方火炮。

examples.en: They tried to outrange the opponent and stay out of danger.
examples.zh: 他们试图用更远的射程压制对手，并保持在危险之外。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量，outperform 表现更好）。所以 outrange 字面意思就是“在 range（范围/射程）上超过”。
在新闻和军事语境中，outrange 常和 guns / artillery / missiles / radar 等搭配，强调“射程或探测距离的优势”。在日常生活中也可用于更泛的“覆盖范围更大”。

summary.en: Outranged means being at a disadvantage because someone else can reach farther (often with weapons), or it’s the past form of outrange meaning to surpass in range or reach.
summary.zh: outranged 指（常与武器相关）射程不如对手、处于射程劣势；也可作 outrange 的过去式/过去分词，表示在射程或触及范围上超过。

definition.en: having a shorter range than an opponent (especially of weapons), so you cannot reach them as far as they can reach you
definition.zh: （尤指武器）射程比对方短的；被对方“射程压制”的

examples.en: Their tanks were outranged by the enemy artillery.
examples.zh: 他们的坦克射程不如敌方火炮，处于射程劣势。

examples.en: The team felt outranged and had to change tactics.
examples.zh: 这支队伍感觉处于劣势，只好改变战术。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “outrange”: to have a longer range than; (figuratively) to surpass in reach, effect, or ability
definition.zh: 动词“outrange”的过去式/过去分词：射程超过；（比喻）在影响范围、能力或效果上超过

examples.en: The new missile outranged older models by hundreds of miles.
examples.zh: 新型导弹的射程比旧型号远了数百英里。

examples.en: Her curiosity outranged her experience.
examples.zh: 她的好奇心超过了她的经验所及。

extraExplanation: “outranged”常见于军事/体育评论语境：强调一方“打得到对方，但对方打不到你”的距离优势或劣势。比喻用法中，range 可理解为“影响范围/触及范围”，如 knowledge, influence, imagination 等也可以被说成 outrange。

summary.en: “Outranges” means “reaches farther than” or “goes beyond a limit,” often about range or coverage.
summary.zh: “outranges”表示“射程/范围更远”或“超出界限”，常用于射程、覆盖范围等语境。

definition.en: to have a longer range than something else; to reach farther (often used for weapons, radios, or abilities).
definition.zh: （射程、覆盖范围等）比……更远；超出……的范围（常用于武器、无线电或能力）。

examples.en: This missile outranges older models by several miles.
examples.zh: 这种导弹的射程比旧型号远好几英里。

examples.en: Their radio outranges ours, so they can communicate from farther away.
examples.zh: 他们的无线电覆盖范围比我们的更远，所以能在更远的地方通信。

definition.en: to exceed or go beyond a limit or boundary.
definition.zh: 超出（限制或界限）；越出范围。

examples.en: Her interests outrange her current job, so she’s looking for a new role.
examples.zh: 她的兴趣范围超出了目前的工作，所以她在找新岗位。

examples.en: The discussion outranges the topic we planned for today.
examples.zh: 讨论已经超出了我们今天原本计划的主题。

extraExplanation: “outranges”是动词“outrange”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outranges）。常见搭配有：outrange a rival（射程/覆盖范围压过对手）、be outranged by…（被……的射程压制）。
这个词在军事或技术语境里最常见（如火炮、导弹、雷达、无线电），引申义也可用于“能力/兴趣范围更广”。

summary.en: “Outranging” means exceeding someone or something in range (distance/coverage) or in overall scope.
summary.zh: “outranging”指在射程/覆盖范围上超过，或在整体范畴、规模、影响力上胜过。

definition.en: going farther or reaching farther than (someone or something), especially in distance, effectiveness, or coverage
definition.zh: （在距离、射程、覆盖范围或效力上）超过、远远胜过（某人或某物）

examples.en: The new radar system is outranging the older model by hundreds of miles.
examples.zh: 新的雷达系统比旧型号多覆盖了数百英里。

examples.en: Their artillery was outranging ours, so we had to move to a safer position.
examples.zh: 他们的火炮射程比我们远，所以我们不得不转移到更安全的位置。

definition.en: surpassing someone or something in ability, influence, or overall scope
definition.zh: （在能力、影响力或整体规模/范畴上）超越、胜过

examples.en: Her ambition was outranging what the small town could offer.
examples.zh: 她的抱负远远超出了这个小镇所能提供的机会。

examples.en: The project is outranging its original goals and becoming a national effort.
examples.zh: 这个项目正在超出最初目标，逐渐发展成一项全国性行动。

extraExplanation: “outranging”是动词“outrange”的现在分词形式，常用于进行时（is/are outranging）或作形容词式的分词用法（an outranging signal）。
“range”在英语里既可以指“射程/覆盖范围”（如武器、雷达、信号），也可以指“范围/跨度/涉及面”（如计划、能力、野心）。理解它的具体含义要看上下文。

summary.en: “Outrank” means to be higher in rank or authority, or to be more important than something else.
summary.zh: “Outrank”表示在级别/权力上高于他人，或在重要性上胜过某事。

definition.en: To have a higher rank, position, or authority than someone else.
definition.zh: （在等级、职位或权力上）高于；级别比……高。

examples.en: In the company, the director outranks the manager.
examples.zh: 在公司里，主管的级别高于经理。

examples.en: Even though she is younger, she outranks him because she has a higher title.
examples.zh: 虽然她更年轻，但因为头衔更高，她的级别在他之上。

definition.en: To be better, more important, or stronger than something else (often about needs, priorities, or features).
definition.zh: （在重要性、优先级或影响力上）胜过；更重要；更突出。

examples.en: For many people, safety outranks convenience.
examples.zh: 对很多人来说，安全比方便更重要。

examples.en: In this job, communication skills often outrank technical skills.
examples.zh: 在这份工作中，沟通能力往往比技术能力更重要。

extraExplanation: “outrank”由 out-（超过）+ rank（等级）组成，常用于军队、政府、公司等有明确层级的场合。也常用于抽象比较：A outranks B（A 比 B 更重要/更优先）。
常见搭配：outrank someone；outrank something；A outranks B；outrank by + 数字/级别（如：He outranks me by two grades. 他比我高两个级别）。

summary.en: “Outranked” means someone (or something) had a higher rank or priority than another.
summary.zh: “outranked”表示（某人或某事）在级别/地位或重要性/优先级上高于另一个。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “outrank”: to have a higher rank, status, or authority than someone else.
definition.zh: “outrank”的过去式/过去分词：级别、地位或权力高于某人。

examples.en: In the meeting, the director outranked everyone else, so she made the final decision.
examples.zh: 在会议上，主任的级别高于其他人，所以她做最终决定。

examples.en: Even though he was older, he was outranked by his younger supervisor.
examples.zh: 尽管他年纪更大，但他的上司更年轻却级别更高。

definition.en: (of something) to be more important or take priority over something else.
definition.zh: （指事物）比……更重要；优先于……。

examples.en: Safety outranked speed during the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨期间，安全比速度更重要。

examples.en: For her, family outranked work.
examples.zh: 对她来说，家庭比工作更重要。

extraExplanation: “outrank”常见于军队、警察、公司等有明确等级制度的语境；也可用于抽象比较（如重要性、优先级）。“outranked”作过去式或过去分词，常出现在被动语态（be outranked by…）或完成时态中。

summary.en: “Outranking” means being higher in rank or authority than others (also used as the -ing form of “outrank”).
summary.zh: “outranking”表示（在级别或权力上）高于他人，也可作“outrank”的-ing形式使用。

definition.en: having a higher rank, position, or level of authority than someone or something else
definition.zh: （在级别、职位或权力上）高于……的；级别更高的

examples.en: She is the outranking officer, so she makes the final decision.
examples.zh: 她是级别更高的军官，所以由她作最后决定。

examples.en: In this meeting, defer to the outranking manager.
examples.zh: 在这次会议上，要尊重那位级别更高的经理的决定。

definition.en: the act of being higher in rank than; surpassing in status or authority
definition.zh: 在级别上高于；在地位或权力上超过

examples.en: His outranking of senior staff caused tension in the team.
examples.zh: 他在级别上高于一些资深员工，这让团队气氛紧张。

examples.en: The policy explains the outranking between departments.
examples.zh: 该政策说明了部门之间的级别高低关系。

definition.en: present participle of “outrank”: to be higher in rank than; to have higher status or authority than
definition.zh: “outrank”的现在分词：级别高于；地位或权力高于

examples.en: She is outranking her former supervisor now.
examples.zh: 她现在的级别已经高于她以前的上司了。

examples.en: In the organization chart, directors are outranking managers.
examples.zh: 在组织架构图中，董事的级别高于经理。

extraExplanation: “outrank”常见于军队、政府、公司等有明确等级制度的语境。结构是 out-（超过）+ rank（级别）。
写作中也可用于更抽象的比较：A outranks B（A在重要性/优先级上高于B），例如：Safety outranks speed（安全比速度更重要）。

summary.en: “Outranks” means (1) has a higher rank or authority than, or (2) surpasses in importance or quality.
summary.zh: “outranks”表示（1）级别/权力高于……，或（2）在重要性/质量上胜过、超过。

definition.en: to have a higher rank, status, or authority than someone else
definition.zh: （在级别、地位或权力上）高于；比……级别更高

examples.en: In the company, the director outranks the manager.
examples.zh: 在公司里，主管的级别高于经理。

examples.en: A captain outranks a lieutenant in the army.
examples.zh: 在军队里，上尉的军衔高于中尉。

definition.en: to be better or more important than something else; to surpass
definition.zh: （在表现、质量或重要性上）胜过；超过

examples.en: For many travelers, safety outranks comfort.
examples.zh: 对许多旅行者来说，安全比舒适更重要。

examples.en: Her experience outranks mine in this field.
examples.zh: 在这个领域，她的经验比我更丰富。

extraExplanation: “outranks”是动词“outrank”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outranks）。常用于组织结构、军衔、职位等明确“上下级”关系的语境。
除了“级别更高”，它也常用于表达“重要性更高”（例如A outranks B）。如果想更口语一点，可以用“is higher than / is above / is more important than”。

summary.en: Outrant means extremely excessive or beyond limits (archaic).
summary.zh: Outrant 指“极端、过度、越界的”（较古旧用法）。

definition.en: (Archaic) Extreme or excessive; going beyond reasonable limits.
definition.zh: （古义）极端的；过度的；超出合理限度的。

examples.en: The pamphlet attacked the minister in outrant language.
examples.zh: 这本小册子用极端激烈的措辞攻击那位大臣。

examples.en: Some critics dismissed the play as outrant melodrama.
examples.zh: 一些评论家认为这出戏是过度夸张的煽情剧。

extraExplanation: “outrant”在现代英语中非常少见，主要出现在较早期的文学、评论或历史文本里，语气常带有“夸张到离谱、越界”的批评意味。
它与“outrageous / extreme / excessive”意思接近；在日常写作中通常用这些更常见的词来替代。

summary.en: “Outrap” means to outperform someone in rapping.
summary.zh: “Outrap”指在说唱方面胜过某人。

definition.en: to rap better than someone; to outperform someone in rap (skill, speed, lyrics, or performance)
definition.zh: 在说唱（rap）方面胜过某人；在技巧、速度、歌词或舞台表现上压过对方

examples.en: In the final battle, she outrapped her opponent with sharper lyrics.
examples.zh: 在决赛的 battle 里，她用更犀利的歌词 outrap 了对手。

examples.en: He tried to outrap the crowd favorite, but his flow wasn’t as tight.
examples.zh: 他想 outrap 那位观众最喜欢的选手，但他的 flow 没有那么稳。

extraExplanation: “outrap”是由前缀 out-（“超过、胜过”）+ rap（“说唱/打节拍式念词”）构成的动词，常见于嘻哈文化语境（如 rap battle）。日常英文里更常用的表达是 outdo/outperform someone in rap，或在比赛语境里用 beat someone。

summary.en: “Outtrapped” usually means “trapped more successfully than others” (rare in everyday English).
summary.zh: “Outtrapped”通常指“在设陷捕捉方面胜过别人”，但在日常英语中较少见。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “outtrap”: to trap more successfully than someone else; to outdo another person in trapping.
definition.zh: “outtrap”的过去式/过去分词：比别人更擅长设陷阱捕捉；在捕捉（设陷）方面胜过他人。

examples.en: In the contest, she outtrapped every other hunter by using better bait.
examples.zh: 在比赛中，她用更好的诱饵，捕获数量胜过其他所有猎人。

examples.en: The older fox had outtrapped the younger one for years.
examples.zh: 那只年长的狐狸多年来一直比年轻的更会捕猎设陷。

definition.en: trapped in a way that prevents escape (used as a descriptive adjective, usually in context).
definition.zh: （描述性用法）被困住、难以脱身的（常见于特定语境中的形容性用法）。

examples.en: By the rising water, the hikers were effectively outtrapped on the rock ledge.
examples.zh: 由于水位上涨，徒步者实际上被困在岩架上，难以脱身。

extraExplanation: “outtrapped”在现代英语里非常少见，更多时候人们会用更常见的表达来替代，比如：caught more / trapped more, outdid someone in trapping，或在比喻意义上用 outsmarted（智胜）、outmaneuvered（策略上压过）。
构词上是 out-（超过、胜过）+ trap（设陷阱捕捉）。因此它通常需要一个比较对象（outtrap someone）。

summary.en: “Outrapping” means trapping more successfully than others; it’s the -ing form of “outtrap.”
summary.zh: “outrapping” 表示“在设陷阱捕捉方面胜过别人”，是 outtrap 的 -ing 形式。

definition.en: the act of trapping more animals (or catching someone) more successfully than another person; present participle of “outtrap.”
definition.zh: 比别人更成功地设陷阱捕捉（动物或人）；为动词 outtrap 的现在分词/动名词形式。

examples.en: In the competition, she was outrapping everyone by sunrise.
examples.zh: 在比赛中，天一亮她就比所有人抓到更多猎物。

examples.en: They were outrapping their rivals by using better bait and safer traps.
examples.zh: 他们用更好的诱饵和更安全的陷阱，比对手抓得更多。

definition.en: the result of trapping more than others (used as a noun-like activity word).
definition.zh: “抓得比别人多”的行为或成果（可作名词化用法）。

examples.en: His outrapping this season surprised the whole team.
examples.zh: 他这个季节抓得比别人多，让全队都很惊讶。

extraExplanation: “out-” 是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作；outsmart 更机智地胜过）。因此 outtrap / outrapping 字面意思就是“在设陷阱捕捉方面胜过别人”。
“outrapping” 不是非常常见的日常词，更常见的表达是 “catching more than … / trapping more than …”。如果你是在特定领域（狩猎、野外研究、竞赛语境）看到它，用法会更自然。

summary.en: “Outrate” means to rate something higher than another, or to surpass it in judged value or reputation.
summary.zh: “outrate”指在评分上把某物评得比另一物更高，或在评价/口碑/价值上胜过对方。

definition.en: to give something a higher rating than something else; to rate higher
definition.zh: （在评分中）给……更高的评价；把……评得比……高

examples.en: Critics often outrate the book’s first edition over later versions.
examples.zh: 评论家常常认为这本书的第一版比后来的版本评价更高。

examples.en: In many surveys, viewers outrate comedies for rewatch value.
examples.zh: 在很多调查中，观众在“重看价值”上会给喜剧更高的评分。

definition.en: to be better than something else in the way people judge it; to surpass in reputation or value
definition.zh: （在评价、名声或价值上）胜过；超过

examples.en: For some readers, the sequel outrates the original.
examples.zh: 对一些读者来说，续集比原作更出色。

examples.en: Her live performances outrate her studio recordings for many fans.
examples.zh: 对很多粉丝而言，她的现场演出比录音室作品更精彩。

extraExplanation: “outrate”由前缀“out-”（超过、胜过）+“rate”（评价、评分）构成，常用于比较两者在评分或口碑上的高低。它更偏书面或评论语境，日常口语里也常用“rate … higher than … / like … better”。

summary.en: “Outrated” means rated too highly (often better expressed as “overrated”).
summary.zh: “outrated”表示“被评价过高/被高估”（更常用说法是“overrated”）。

definition.en: (Usually in the phrase “overrated” or “outrated”) judged to be better or more important than it really is; rated too highly.
definition.zh: （常见于“overrated / outrated”）被认为比实际更好或更重要；评价过高。

examples.en: Some people think that restaurant is outrated—it’s famous, but the food is just okay.
examples.zh: 有些人觉得那家餐厅被捧得太高——很有名，但食物只是一般。

examples.en: That movie is outrated; the acting didn’t impress me.
examples.zh: 那部电影被吹得太厉害；演技并没有打动我。

definition.en: past form of “outrate”: to rate someone or something higher than is deserved.
definition.zh: “outrate”的过去式/过去分词：把……评得过高；高估。

examples.en: Critics outrated the product at first, but later reviews were more honest.
examples.zh: 评论家一开始把这款产品评得过高，但后来的评价更客观。

extraExplanation: “outrated”比较少见；更常用的说法是“overrated（被高估、被捧过头）”。
前缀“out-”常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量，outperform 表现胜过），所以“outrate”字面上有“把评分评到超过应有水平”的意思。

summary.en: “Outrates” means ‘is rated higher than’ or ‘exceeds in rate.’
summary.zh: “Outrates”表示“评分/评级更高”或“在速率/增长率等方面超过”。

definition.en: to be rated higher than someone or something; to receive a better rating than
definition.zh: （在评分/评级上）高于；比……评价更高

examples.en: In customer reviews, this model outrates the older version.
examples.zh: 在顾客评价中，这款机型的评分高于旧款。

examples.en: Their service consistently outrates their competitors’.
examples.zh: 他们的服务评分一直高于竞争对手。

definition.en: to exceed in rate, speed, or frequency
definition.zh: （在速率/增长率/发生频率等方面）超过

examples.en: This quarter, exports outrate imports by a wide margin.
examples.zh: 本季度，出口增长率远超进口。

examples.en: In some years, wage growth fails to outrate inflation.
examples.zh: 在某些年份，工资增长未能超过通货膨胀。

extraExplanation: “outrates”通常是动词“outrate”的第三人称单数形式（He/She/It outrates ...）。“outrate”本身不算常见，更常见的替代表达有 outscore（得分更高）、outclass（明显胜过）、surpass（超过）。
在书面语或商业/数据语境里更容易见到：例如比较“评级/评分（rating）”或“增长率/发生率（rate）”。

summary.en: “Outrating” means giving a higher rating than something else, or getting higher audience ratings than competitors.
summary.zh: “Outrating”指在评分/评级上高于别的对象，或（节目等）收视率/热度高于竞争对手。

definition.en: to rate (someone or something) higher than another person or thing; to give a better score, ranking, or evaluation than.
definition.zh: 给（某人或某物）评更高的分/等级；评价高于另一人或事物。

examples.en: Reviewers outrated this phone compared with last year’s model.
examples.zh: 评测者给这款手机的评分高于去年的型号。

examples.en: In customer surveys, the newer service is consistently outrating the old one.
examples.zh: 在客户调查中，新服务的评分一直高于旧服务。

definition.en: to achieve higher audience ratings than another show, channel, or content.
definition.zh: （节目/频道/内容）收视率或热度高于另一个。

examples.en: The comedy series kept outrating its competitors on Friday nights.
examples.zh: 这部喜剧在周五晚上一直比竞争对手收视更高。

examples.en: Live sports often outrate talk shows.
examples.zh: 体育直播的收视率常常高于脱口秀。

extraExplanation: “outrating”通常是动词“outrate”的现在分词/动名词形式。这个词在日常口语里不如“outrank / outscore / rate higher”常见，但在媒体收视、排行榜、产品评分、金融评级等语境中更可能出现。
注意区分：outrank 多指“职位/级别/名次更高”（例如军衔、公司层级），outrate 更偏向“评分/评级更高”（例如星级、分数、收视率、信用评级）。

summary.en: Outraught means “outstretched/extended,” a rare literary word.
summary.zh: Outraught 指“伸展开的、向外伸出的”，是较少见的文学用词。

definition.en: (literary/archaic) stretched out; extended outward (often of arms, hands, or a body).
definition.zh: （文学/古语）伸展开的；向外伸出的（常指手臂、手或身体）。

examples.en: He stood with outraught arms, as if asking for help.
examples.zh: 他站着，双臂向外伸展，仿佛在求助。

examples.en: In the painting, an outraught hand reaches toward the light.
examples.zh: 在那幅画里，一只伸出的手朝着光亮处伸去。

examples.en: The hero lay outraught on the ground after the battle.
examples.zh: 战后，英雄四肢伸展开地躺在地上。

extraExplanation: “outraught”是非常少见的文学用词，现代英语里更常用“outstretched / extended”。它常用来营造一种戏剧性画面：伸手求助、向光伸展、或疲惫倒地四肢摊开等。
词源上与古语“raught”（相当于现代的“reached/extended”）有关，所以在老诗歌或旧译本风格的文字中更可能见到。

summary.en: “Outrave” is a very rare verb meaning to outdo someone in raving or wildly excited talk; it’s often a misspelling of “outrage.”
summary.zh: “outrave”是非常罕见的动词，指在狂热/胡言乱语式的言谈上压过别人；很多时候其实是把“outrage”拼错了。

definition.en: (Very rare/archaic) To surpass someone in raving or wild, excited talk; to outdo in “raving.”
definition.zh: （非常罕见/古用）在胡言乱语、狂热激动的言谈上超过某人；在“发狂式”言语上胜过、压过。

examples.en: In old satirical writing, one speaker tries to outrave the other with wilder claims.
examples.zh: 在一些早期讽刺作品里，一个说话者会用更离谱的说法来压过（outrave）另一个人。

examples.en: The debate turned chaotic as participants tried to outrave one another.
examples.zh: 辩论变得混乱，因为参与者互相攀比谁更激动、更夸张（outrave）。

extraExplanation:
“outrave”在现代英语中几乎不用，很多情况下是拼写错误或误读。你可能想写的是：
- **outrage** /ˈaʊtˌreɪdʒ/（名词/动词）：“愤怒；暴行；使震怒”。例如：*The decision caused public outrage.*
- **out-rave**（带连字符，临时造词）：在派对/音乐节语境里可理解为“比别人更会嗨/更会蹦”，但通常不算规范词汇。
如果你告诉我你看到“outrave”的句子或上下文，我可以帮你判断它到底是罕见用法，还是应该改成更常见的词（如 outrage / outpace / outdo 等）。

summary.en: “Outraved” means “outdid others in raving (wild praise or emotion).” It’s rare in modern English.
summary.zh: “outraved”指“在狂热赞美或情绪化表现上胜过别人”，但在现代英语中很少用。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “outrave”: to outdo someone in raving—speaking or acting with extreme enthusiasm, praise, or wild emotion.
definition.zh: “outrave”的过去式和过去分词：在“狂热地说/做”方面胜过别人——比别人更激动地赞美、夸张地表达，或更放纵地情绪化表现。

examples.en: Fans outraved each other online after the singer released the surprise album.
examples.zh: 这位歌手突然发专辑后，粉丝们在网上互相“狂吹”，谁也不服谁。

examples.en: At the party, he outraved everyone with his nonstop shouting and dancing.
examples.zh: 在派对上，他又喊又跳，闹得比所有人都更夸张。

extraExplanation: “outrave”非常少见，更多时候英语会用更自然的表达：outdo (someone) in praise/enthusiasm、praise more wildly、go wilder than… 等。
词缀 out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outshine, outrun），因此 outrave 字面意思就是“在 raving（狂热/胡言乱语）方面超过”。在正式写作中并不常用，更像是为强调效果而临时造词或文学化用法。

summary.en: “Outraves” means “raves more than someone else” or “outdoes others in raving,” but it’s very rare in modern English.
summary.zh: “outraves”表示“比别人更狂热地夸/说”，但在现代英语中非常少见。

definition.en: to rave more than someone else; to surpass in excited, irrational, or wildly enthusiastic talk or behavior (rare).
definition.zh: 比别人更“狂热/语无伦次”；在激动、失控或过度热情的言行上超过他人（较少见用法）。

examples.en: Online, some fans try to outrave each other with bigger and bigger claims.
examples.zh: 在网上，有些粉丝会用越来越夸张的说法来彼此“比谁更狂热”。

examples.en: He outraves his friends whenever the topic turns to his favorite band.
examples.zh: 只要话题一转到他最喜欢的乐队，他就会比朋友们更兴奋、更夸张。

definition.en: (literal, very rare) to outperform someone in raving—used like “outdo” in the specific sense of “rave.”
definition.zh: （字面义，极少见）在“rave（狂热地说/做）”这件事上胜过某人；相当于在特定语境下用“outdo”。

examples.en: No one can outrave her when she starts praising a new restaurant.
examples.zh: 她一开始夸一家新餐厅，就没人能在“夸到爆”的程度上胜过她。

extraExplanation: “outraves”通常是动词“outrave”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outraves）。这个词非常少见，多数情况下人们会用更常见的表达，如：outdo someone in enthusiasm（在热情上胜过某人）、rave more than someone（比某人更狂热地夸/说）、go on and on（没完没了地说）。
构词上由前缀 out-（超过、胜过）+ rave（狂热地说/失控地吵闹）组成，因此语义很直观，但并不常用。

summary.en: Outraving means raving more wildly or intensely than others; it’s a rare word.
summary.zh: outraving 指“比别人更疯狂地叫嚷/狂欢”，属于少见用词。

definition.en: (present participle of out-rave) to rave more loudly, wildly, or intensely than someone else; to surpass another in wild speech or behavior.
definition.zh: （out-rave 的现在分词）比别人更大声、更疯狂或更激烈地胡言乱语/狂欢；在疯话或失控行为上胜过别人。

examples.en: He kept outraving everyone at the party until the host asked him to calm down.
examples.zh: 他在派对上一直比所有人都更疯闹，直到主人请他冷静下来。

examples.en: On social media, some users try to win attention by outraving each other with extreme opinions.
examples.zh: 在社交媒体上，有些人用极端观点互相“比疯”，想赢得关注。

definition.en: acting in a wildly excited or frantic way; raving beyond normal limits (rare).
definition.zh: 行为极度亢奋、近乎癫狂的；超出常态地狂乱（少见）。

examples.en: The outraving crowd shook the stands with nonstop shouting.
examples.zh: 那群近乎疯狂的观众不停呐喊，把看台都震得发抖。

extraExplanation: “outraving”在现代英语中非常少见，更多是临时造词：out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ rave（胡言乱语/狂欢）。在写作里通常带有批评或讽刺意味，暗示某人为了情绪宣泄或博关注而“比别人更疯”。
更常见、更自然的表达包括：ranting（咆哮式抱怨）、raving（胡言乱语/狂热）、going wild（失控）、outdoing others（胜过别人）。

summary.en: OuTRAY is a rare verb meaning “to outshine” or “to emit rays/shine outward.”
summary.zh: “outray”是一个罕用动词，表示“比……更耀眼（outshine）”或“放射光线、向外发光”。

definition.en: (rare) To shine more brightly than something else; to outshine.
definition.zh: （罕用）比……更明亮地发光；使……相形见绌（胜过其光彩）。

examples.en: Against the dark sky, the lighthouse seemed to outray the distant stars.
examples.zh: 在漆黑的夜空下，灯塔的光似乎比远处的星星更耀眼。

examples.en: Her smile outrayed the candles on the table.
examples.zh: 她的笑容比桌上的蜡烛更明亮动人。

definition.en: (rare) To send out rays; to shine outward.
definition.zh: （罕用）放射光线；向外发光。

examples.en: At sunrise, the mountains outrayed with a soft golden light.
examples.zh: 日出时，群山向外散发柔和的金色光芒。

extraExplanation: “outray”非常少见，常见写法和常用词是“outshine”（更常用）。“outray”由“out-”（超过）+“ray”（光线）构成，字面意思就是“在光线/光芒上胜过”。
学习时要注意不要和“outrage”（愤怒；暴行；使震怒）混淆：拼写相近，但意义完全不同。

summary.en: Outraze is a rare, poetic verb meaning “to outshine” (and by extension, “to surpass greatly”).
summary.zh: Outraze 是一个罕见的诗歌用动词，意思是“比……更耀眼”，并可引申为“远远超过”。

definition.en: (Rare, poetic) To outshine; to shine more brightly than someone or something.
definition.zh: （罕见、诗歌用语）比……更耀眼；光芒胜过……。

examples.en: The morning sun outrazed the streetlights, and the city woke in clear gold.
examples.zh: 清晨的太阳光芒胜过路灯，城市在澄澈的金色中苏醒。

examples.en: In the poem, her smile outrazes the stars.
examples.zh: 在诗中，她的微笑比群星更明亮。

definition.en: (By extension, rare) To surpass by a wide margin; to excel beyond others.
definition.zh: （引申义，罕见）远远超过；大幅胜过。

examples.en: His generosity outrazed all expectations.
examples.zh: 他的慷慨远远超出了所有人的预期。

examples.en: The new design outrazed the old one in both speed and comfort.
examples.zh: 新设计在速度和舒适度上都大幅胜过旧设计。

extraExplanation: “outraze”非常少见，多见于古体或诗歌语境，可理解为“out- + raze/ray（光线）”一类的构词效果，强调“光芒压过/胜过”。日常英语里更常用的是 outshine（更常见）、surpass、excel。
也常有人把“outraze”误写成更常见的“outrage”（愤怒/暴行）。如果你想表达“愤怒”，通常应使用 outrage /ˈaʊtˌreɪdʒ/。

summary.en: Outre means unusually strange or shocking, often in an exaggerated or avant-garde way.
summary.zh: outre 指非常古怪或令人震惊，常带夸张、前卫的感觉。

definition.en: Unusual, strange, or shocking—often in a slightly theatrical or humorous way.
definition.zh: 古怪的；离奇的；令人吃惊的（常带一点夸张或戏谑的感觉）。

examples.en: The movie’s plot was so outre that some people laughed and some were confused.
examples.zh: 这部电影的剧情太离奇了，有的人笑了，有的人却看懵了。

examples.en: Her outfit was deliberately outre, meant to challenge people’s idea of “normal.”
examples.zh: 她的穿着刻意走怪诞路线，是为了挑战人们对“正常”的定义。

extraExplanation: “outre”源自法语 outré，原意与“越界/过头”有关，所以它常带有“过分到显得怪”的语感。它比“weird”更偏向“夸张、前卫、离经叛道（但不一定是坏的）”。在艺术、时尚、电影评论中很常见。

summary.en: Outreach means organized efforts to connect with people (often in the community) or the range of people you can reach.
summary.zh: Outreach 指组织主动联系并服务社区人群的外展活动，也可指影响/触达范围。

definition.en: the act of an organization or group reaching out to people (especially the community) to offer help, information, services, or build relationships
definition.zh: （组织/机构的）外展服务；主动接触社区人群以提供帮助、信息或服务、建立联系的活动

examples.en: The library expanded its outreach to seniors by delivering books to retirement homes.
examples.zh: 图书馆扩大了对老年人的外展服务，把书送到养老院。

examples.en: Our outreach team visited local schools to talk about internet safety.
examples.zh: 我们的外展团队走访了当地学校，宣传网络安全。

examples.en: Community outreach can improve trust between residents and public agencies.
examples.zh: 社区外展活动可以提升居民与公共机构之间的信任。

definition.en: the extent or range of someone’s influence, contact, or ability to reach people
definition.zh: 影响范围；触达范围；能接触到的人群/区域

examples.en: Social media increased the campaign’s outreach dramatically.
examples.zh: 社交媒体大大扩大了这次活动的触达范围。

examples.en: The charity has national outreach, not just local support.
examples.zh: 这家慈善机构的影响范围是全国性的，不只在本地。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：outreach program（外展项目）、outreach efforts（外展努力/活动）、community outreach（社区外展）、youth outreach（青少年外展）、health outreach（健康外展）。
易混点：outreach 是名词；动词通常用 reach out（主动联系/伸出援手），如 “We reached out to new partners.”（我们主动联系了新伙伴。）

summary.en: “Outreached” most commonly means “exceeded or reached farther than,” and less commonly means “reached out to a community to offer support or engagement.”
summary.zh: “outreached”最常见指“超出、达到得更远/更多”；较少见可指“对社区主动联系与服务（外展）”。

definition.en: (Past tense/past participle) Reached farther than someone or something; exceeded in distance, amount, ability, or achievement.
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词）比某人或某物伸得更远、达到得更多；在距离、数量、能力或成就上超过。

examples.en: Her performance outreached everyone else in the class.
examples.zh: 她的表现超过了班上其他所有人。

examples.en: The new road system has outreached what the old map shows.
examples.zh: 新的道路系统已经超出了旧地图所显示的范围。

definition.en: (Past tense/past participle, less common) Reached out to people—contacted, supported, or engaged a community (often in social services, education, or public health).
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词，较少见）向人群伸出援手/开展联系与服务；对社区进行接触、支持或动员（常见于社会服务、教育、公共卫生等语境）。

examples.en: The clinic outreached to seniors who couldn’t travel for care.
examples.zh: 诊所主动联系并服务那些无法出行就医的老年人。

examples.en: Volunteers outreached in the neighborhood to share information about free meals.
examples.zh: 志愿者在社区里开展宣传联络，告知免费餐食的信息。

extraExplanation: “outreached”最常见是动词“outreach”的过去式/过去分词，但日常英语里更常说“reached out (to…)”表示“联系/关心/伸出援手”。
名词“outreach”非常常用：outreach program / outreach services（外展项目/外展服务），常用于政府、学校、医院、非营利组织等面向社区的服务与宣传。

summary.en: “Outreaches” most often means multiple outreach programs/efforts; less commonly, it’s the verb form meaning “exceeds” or “reaches beyond.”
summary.zh: “Outreaches”最常见是名词复数，指多项外展/外联活动；较少见时是动词，表示“超过、超出范围”。

definition.en: the plural form of “outreach”: organized efforts to contact and support people, especially to offer services, information, or help
definition.zh: “outreach”的复数：外展/外联工作；指有组织地接触并支持他人（尤其是提供服务、信息或帮助）的活动

examples.en: The library runs several outreaches for seniors and new immigrants.
examples.zh: 图书馆为老年人和新移民开展了多项外展服务。

examples.en: These outreaches focus on health education and prevention.
examples.zh: 这些外展活动重点是健康教育与预防。

definition.en: third-person singular of “outreach” (verb): to reach beyond something in distance, ability, or influence; to exceed
definition.zh: “outreach”（动词）的第三人称单数：超过；比……更远/更强/影响更大

examples.en: Her influence outreaches the boundaries of her hometown.
examples.zh: 她的影响力超出了家乡的范围。

examples.en: This new phone battery outreaches the older model by hours.
examples.zh: 这款新手机电池续航比旧款多出好几个小时。

extraExplanation: 在美式英语里，“outreach”最常见的是名词用法，常见于社区服务、公共卫生、教育、公益机构等语境（如 community outreach、student outreach）。动词用法“to outreach”存在，但相对少见；更常用的表达是 “reach out (to someone)” 表示“主动联系/伸出援手”。
写作提示：当你想表达“开展外展活动”，常用搭配是 “do outreach” 或 “conduct outreach”，而不是直接说 “outreach people”。

summary.en: Outreaching means extending outward or doing outreach—actively contacting and engaging people, often to offer services or support.
summary.zh: Outreaching 可指“向外延伸”，也可指“外展工作”——主动联系并接触人群，常用于提供服务或支持。

definition.en: reaching out beyond a usual limit; extending outward (often used literally or figuratively).
definition.zh: 伸向外面、超出通常范围的；向外延伸的（可指实际或比喻意义）。

examples.en: The tree’s outreaching branches formed a natural roof over the path.
examples.zh: 那棵树向外伸展的树枝在小路上方形成了天然的“屋顶”。

examples.en: Her outreaching ambition pushed her to apply for opportunities abroad.
examples.zh: 她那种“向外拓展”的雄心促使她申请海外机会。

definition.en: the activity of contacting and engaging people—especially in communities—to offer help, information, or services (common in schools, healthcare, nonprofits, etc.).
definition.zh: 外展工作；主动联系并与人群（尤其是社区）建立联系，提供帮助、信息或服务（常见于学校、医疗、公益组织等）。

examples.en: The clinic is outreaching to migrant families to explain free vaccination services.
examples.zh: 诊所正在对流动家庭开展外展联系，说明免费疫苗服务。

examples.en: Outreaching takes time because trust is built through repeated conversations.
examples.zh: 外展需要时间，因为信任往往要靠一次次交流建立起来。

extraExplanation: “outreaching”既可以是形容词（向外延伸的），也常作为“outreach”的动名词形式，用来强调“正在进行的外展/联络工作”。在正式写作中，更常见名词“outreach”（如：community outreach）。
在公益、教育与公共卫生语境里，“outreach/outreaching”通常带有“主动走出去接触原本不容易获得服务的人群”的含义。

summary.en: Outread means to surpass someone in reading—by reading more, faster, or better.
summary.zh: outread 指在阅读方面胜过别人（读得更多、更快或更好）。

definition.en: to read more than someone else, or to read better/faster than them; to surpass in reading
definition.zh: 比别人读得更多；（在阅读数量、速度或能力上）胜过别人

examples.en: She outread most of her classmates in middle school.
examples.zh: 她在初中时阅读量超过了大多数同学。

examples.en: If you want to outread your peers, set a daily reading goal.
examples.zh: 如果你想在阅读上超过同龄人，可以给自己设定每天的阅读目标。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“在某方面超过/胜过”。所以 outread 就是“在阅读方面超过”。类似构词还有 outwork（比别人更努力工作）、outperform（表现更好）。
outread 不是特别常用的日常口语词，更常见的表达是 read more than…（读得比……多）或 read faster/better than…（读得更快/更好）。

summary.en: “Outreading” means surpassing others (or your past self) in how much, how fast, or how well you read.
summary.zh: “Outreading”指在阅读量、速度或能力上超过别人（或超过过去的自己）。

definition.en: (present participle of outread) reading more than someone else, or reading better/faster than others.
definition.zh: （outread 的现在分词）比别人读得更多，或在阅读能力/速度上胜过别人。

examples.en: She is outreading most of her classmates in vocabulary and comprehension.
examples.zh: 她在词汇量和理解力方面胜过班里大多数同学。

examples.en: By the end of the month, he was outreading his previous pace by a lot.
examples.zh: 到月底时，他的阅读进度比以前快了很多。
