examples.en: They planned carefully at the outsetting of their journey.
examples.zh: 他们在旅程出发之初做了周密的计划。

definition.en: (As a form of “set out”) Starting or preparing to begin a trip, task, or plan; setting off.
definition.zh: （作“set out”的一种形式）开始或准备开始（旅程/任务/计划）；动身。

examples.en: She was outsetting early to avoid traffic.
examples.zh: 她打算很早动身以避开交通。

examples.en: The group talked excitedly while outsetting for the hike.
examples.zh: 大家出发去徒步时兴奋地聊着天。

extraExplanation:
“outsetting”不是现代英语里常见的标准词。学习与写作中更自然的表达通常是：
- 名词：the outset（在……之初）
- 动词短语：set out / set off（出发；开始着手）
如果你是在文章里看到“outsetting”，它可能是较旧/较少见的用法，或是作者/排版把“outset”误写成了“outsetting”。

summary.en: An outsettlement is a small, outlying community away from a main town.
summary.zh: outsettlement 指远离主要城镇的边远小社区/外围定居点。

definition.en: a small community or group of houses located outside a main town or established settlement; an outlying settlement.
definition.zh: （在主要城镇或既有聚落之外的）边远小聚落；外围定居点。

examples.en: The fishermen lived in an outsettlement miles from the nearest town.
examples.zh: 渔民住在离最近城镇几英里外的一个边远小聚落里。

examples.en: Supplies had to be delivered by boat because the outsettlement had no roads.
examples.zh: 由于这个边远聚落没有公路，补给只能靠船运。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代通用英语里不算常见，更常见的说法是 outlying settlement / remote settlement / hamlet。
在加拿大大西洋沿岸（如纽芬兰与拉布拉多）相关的历史语境中，outsettlement 有时用来指远离城镇、分散在海岸线上的小社区（与“集中到城镇”的政策与迁移历史有关）。

summary.en: An outsettler is a person living and settling outside an established settlement, often in a remote or frontier area.
summary.zh: outsettler 指在既有聚居点之外（多为偏远/边疆地区）定居的人。

definition.en: a person who settles (moves to live) outside an established town, colony, or official settlement area; an outlying settler.
definition.zh: 在既有城镇、殖民地或官方聚居区之外定居的人；在边远地区定居的拓荒者/移民。

examples.en: Early outsettlers built cabins along the river, far from the main town.
examples.zh: 早期的边远定居者在河边建起小木屋，离主镇很远。

examples.en: The government tried to provide roads and schools for outsettlers in remote areas.
examples.zh: 政府试图为偏远地区的边远定居者提供道路和学校。

extraExplanation: “outsettler”不是现代日常高频词，更常见于历史或殖民/边疆开发语境，用来强调这些人住在“settlement（聚居点）之外”的边缘地带。
构词上是 out-（在外、外部）+ settler（定居者/移民）。在一些历史记述里，这类人可能生活条件更艰苦，也常与“frontier（边疆）”“outpost（前哨）”“outlying areas（偏远地区）”等词一起出现。

summary.en: Outshadow means to overshadow—being so prominent that another person or thing seems less important or noticeable.
summary.zh: Outshadow 指“使黯然失色/掩盖”，因自身更突出而让他人或他物显得不重要或不显眼。

definition.en: to make someone or something seem less important, less noticeable, or less impressive by being more noticeable, successful, or impressive; to overshadow
definition.zh: （因更显眼/更成功/更出色而）使某人或某事显得不重要、不突出；使黯然失色

examples.en: Her performance outshadowed the rest of the cast.
examples.zh: 她的表演让其他演员都黯然失色。

examples.en: The scandal quickly outshadowed his years of public service.
examples.zh: 这场丑闻很快就掩盖了他多年公共服务的功绩。

examples.en: On social media, one mistake can outshadow a lot of good work.
examples.zh: 在社交媒体上，一个错误可能会让很多努力都被掩盖。

extraExplanation: “outshadow”在现代英语中不算常见，更常用的词是“overshadow”。在写作中用“outshadow”会显得较文学化或更强调“在比较中胜过对方而使其失色”的感觉。
有时会写作“out-shadow”（较少见），含义不变。

summary.en: Outshake means to shake more effectively than others, or (rarely) to shake something completely out/off.
summary.zh: Outshake 表示“在摇动方面胜过别人/更有效地摇”，也可（较少见）指“把某物彻底抖掉/抖出来”。

definition.en: to shake more, harder, or more effectively than someone or something else; to surpass in shaking (often used in comparisons or competitions).
definition.zh: 比……摇得更厉害/更有效；在“摇动”方面胜过……（常用于比较或竞赛语境）。

examples.en: In the dance battle, she managed to outshake everyone with faster moves.
examples.zh: 在舞蹈对决中，她用更快的动作把所有人都“摇”赢了。

examples.en: This washer can outshake the old model, so clothes come out less wet.
examples.zh: 这台洗衣机甩干效果比旧型号更强，所以衣服出来更不湿。

definition.en: to shake something off or out completely, so nothing remains (rare).
definition.zh: 把……彻底抖掉/抖出来，使其不再残留（较少见）。

examples.en: He tried to outshake the sand from his shoes, but some still stuck.
examples.zh: 他想把鞋里的沙子彻底抖出来，但还是粘了一些。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比……更努力，outperform 表现更好）。因此 outshake 的结构意思很直观，但它不是高频标准词，更常见的表达是 “shake more / shake harder / shake better” 或用具体动词如 “outperform”。
如果你想表达“把某物抖掉”，更自然的常用说法是 “shake off”（抖掉、摆脱）或 “shake out”（把……抖出来）。

summary.en: Outshame means to shame someone by surpassing them—often through better behavior—so they look bad by comparison.
summary.zh: Outshame 指用更好的表现（常是更高尚的行为）让对方相形见绌，从而感到羞愧。

definition.en: to surpass someone in making them feel ashamed; to shame someone by being better, more generous, more honest, etc., so they look bad by comparison
definition.zh: 在使人羞愧这方面胜过某人；用更好（更慷慨、更诚实等）的表现让对方相形见绌、感到羞愧

examples.en: Her calm, honest apology outshamed his angry excuses.
examples.zh: 她冷静而真诚的道歉让他愤怒的借口相形见绌，反而显得更丢脸。

examples.en: The community’s kindness outshamed the politician’s harsh words.
examples.zh: 社区的善意让那位政客的刻薄言论显得很可耻。

definition.en: to outdo someone in the feeling or display of shame (rare)
definition.zh: 在羞愧的感受或表现上超过某人（较少见）

examples.en: He tried to outshame everyone by calling himself the worst person in the room.
examples.zh: 他试图通过说自己是房间里最糟的人来“比谁都更羞愧”。

extraExplanation: “outshame”由前缀 out-（超过、胜过）+ shame（使羞愧）组成，常带有“用更高尚的行为让对方自觉惭愧”的含义，语气偏文学或正式场合。日常英语更常用 shame, embarrass, make someone feel ashamed, show someone up 等表达。

summary.en: “Outshamed” means someone was surpassed in a way that made them feel (or look) more ashamed; it’s the past form of “outshame.”
summary.zh: “Outshamed”表示“在对比中被胜过，从而更感羞愧/更显丢脸”，是动词“outshame”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “outshame”: to make someone feel more ashamed by being more honorable, brave, kind, etc., or to surpass someone in a way that highlights their shame.
definition.zh: “outshame”的过去式/过去分词：以更正直、更勇敢、更善良等方式让对方更感羞愧；或在对比中胜过对方，从而凸显对方的羞耻。

examples.en: Her calm honesty outshamed the people who were spreading rumors.
examples.zh: 她冷静而坦诚的态度让那些散布谣言的人更觉羞愧。

examples.en: He apologized publicly and, in doing so, outshamed the critics who had mocked him.
examples.zh: 他公开道歉，这反而让曾嘲笑他的批评者更感羞愧。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “outshame”: to disgrace or humiliate someone by making them look worse in comparison.
definition.zh: “outshame”的过去式/过去分词：通过对比使某人显得更不堪，从而使其受辱/丢脸。

examples.en: The team’s discipline outshamed their opponents’ reckless behavior.
examples.zh: 这支队伍的自律让对手的鲁莽行为显得更丢脸。

extraExplanation: 词形提示：out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outrun）。outshame 的意思不是“把某人羞辱一顿”这么直接的攻击，更常见的是“以更高的品格/更好的行为让对方无地自容”。
使用场景：这个词在日常口语里不算高频，更常见于较正式、写作或文学语境，用来强调强烈的道德对比（virtue vs. shame）。

summary.en: “Outshames” means “surpasses in a way that causes shame,” often by making someone look worse through comparison.
summary.zh: “Outshames”意为“胜过到让对方羞愧”，常指通过对比使对方显得不如人。

definition.en: to make someone or something seem less worthy or less impressive by comparison; to surpass in a way that causes shame or embarrassment
definition.zh: （通过对比）使某人/某物显得不如人，从而感到羞愧；在某方面胜过到让对方难堪

examples.en: Her kindness outshames his harsh words.
examples.zh: 她的善意让他的刻薄话语相形见绌。

examples.en: Their calm professionalism outshames the rude complaints online.
examples.zh: 他们冷静专业的态度让网上那些粗鲁的抱怨显得很丢脸。

definition.en: to shame someone by being morally better or behaving more honorably
definition.zh: 以更高尚/更有荣誉感的行为使某人感到羞愧

examples.en: He admits that her honesty outshames him.
examples.zh: 他承认她的诚实让他感到惭愧。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。所以 outshame 的核心意思是“在‘让人羞愧’这件事上胜过”，常带有强烈的对比感：不是直接骂人，而是用更好的表现让对方自惭形秽。
outshame / outshames 常见于文学或较正式的写作中，比日常口语更常用 outshine（使相形见绌）或 make someone feel ashamed（让某人羞愧）。

summary.en: Outshaming means shaming someone more than others do, or competing to be the harshest in blaming or humiliating.
summary.zh: Outshaming 指“比别人更强烈地羞辱/指责某人”，也可指在指责羞辱上互相攀比、看谁更狠。

definition.en: the act of shaming someone more than another person does; trying to “win” at shaming
definition.zh: （比别人）更强烈地羞辱/指责某人的行为；想在“羞辱”上胜过别人

examples.en: Online arguments can turn into outshaming, where people compete to sound the most morally strict.
examples.zh: 网络争论有时会变成 outshaming，大家比赛看谁的道德立场更“严格”。

examples.en: Instead of helping, the comments became pure outshaming.
examples.zh: 这些评论没有帮助到人，反而变成了纯粹的“羞辱竞赛”。

definition.en: shaming someone more than someone else does; making someone feel even more ashamed (often in public)
definition.zh: 比别人更强烈地羞辱某人；让某人感到更羞愧（常指公开场合）

examples.en: He tried to defend her, but the crowd kept outshaming her with harsher insults.
examples.zh: 他想为她辩护，但人群用更刻薄的辱骂不断 outshaming 她。

examples.en: Don’t focus on outshaming others—focus on solving the problem.
examples.zh: 别把重点放在 outshaming 别人上，把重点放在解决问题。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过/胜过”（如 outdo, outrun）。因此 outshame 的核心就是“在让人难堪/羞愧这件事上超过别人”。
outshaming 在日常口语中不算特别常见，但在社交媒体语境（公开指责、群体围攻、道德优越感竞争）里更容易看到。很多时候带有负面评价，暗示“只顾羞辱、不顾建设性”。

summary.en: Outshape means to surpass someone in physical shape or to design/shape something better than another version.
summary.zh: outshape 指在身材体能上胜过别人，或在造型/设计上优于另一个版本。

definition.en: to be in better physical condition or have a better-looking body shape than someone else
definition.zh: 在体能或身材上胜过（某人）；比……更健美/更有型

examples.en: After months of training, she could outshape most people in her class.
examples.zh: 经过几个月训练，她的身材和体能已经能胜过班里大多数人。

examples.en: He’s trying to outshape his friends before summer.
examples.zh: 他想在夏天前练得比朋友们更有型。

definition.en: to shape or design something better than another person or version
definition.zh: 在造型/设计/塑造上优于（另一人或另一个版本）

examples.en: The new prototype outshapes the old one by fitting the hand more comfortably.
examples.zh: 新原型在造型上优于旧款，因为握起来更舒服。

examples.en: Small changes can outshape a competitor’s product when comfort matters.
examples.zh: 在强调舒适度的情况下，小改动就可能让你的产品在造型上胜过竞争对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。因此 outshape 直观理解就是“在 shape（身材/形状/造型）上胜过”。
outshape 不是特别常见的日常词；谈“身材/体能”时更常用 be in better shape than… / be fitter than…；谈“设计更好”时更常用 outdesign / outperform（在表现上胜过）。

summary.en: Outshaped means “was in better shape than” or “surpassed in form,” but it’s uncommon in everyday English.
summary.zh: outshaped 表示“在体型/状态或外形上胜过”，但在日常英语中不太常用。

definition.en: (Past tense/past participle of outshape) to be in a better shape than someone or something; to surpass in physical condition or form.
definition.zh: （outshape 的过去式/过去分词）比某人或某物更有体型/状态；在外形或体能上胜过。

examples.en: After months of training, she outshaped most of her teammates.
examples.zh: 经过几个月训练后，她的体能和体型胜过了大多数队友。

examples.en: The new design outshaped the old model, with cleaner lines and a slimmer profile.
examples.zh: 新设计在外形上胜过旧款：线条更干净，轮廓更利落。

definition.en: to shape something better than someone else does (less common).
definition.zh: 把某物塑造得比别人更好（较少见）。

examples.en: With more time and better tools, the sculptor outshaped his earlier work.
examples.zh: 因为有更多时间和更好的工具，这位雕塑家把作品塑造得比自己早期的作品更出色。

extraExplanation: “outshape/outshaped”在现代英语里不算常见，更常见的表达是：outperform（表现更好）、be in better shape（状态更好）、have a better physique（体格更好）、be better shaped（外形更匀称）。
当你想表达“体能/健康状态更好”时，用“be in better shape”最自然；当你想表达“外形线条更好看”时，用“better-shaped / more streamlined”更地道。

summary.en: Outshaping means surpassing others in shaping or forming something (or, less commonly, the process of improving shape, especially body shape).
summary.zh: Outshaping 指在塑造/成形方面胜过他人；较少见时也可指塑形（尤指身材塑形）的过程。

definition.en: (present participle of **outshape**) shaping something better, more effectively, or more attractively than someone or something else; surpassing in how you shape or form something.
definition.zh: （**outshape** 的现在分词）在“塑造/成形”方面比别人或别的事物做得更好；在造型、塑形上胜过。

examples.en: The new designer is **outshaping** the older team with cleaner, simpler lines.
examples.zh: 这位新设计师用更干净、更简洁的线条，在造型上胜过了老团队。

examples.en: With better tools, the workshop started **outshaping** its competitors’ products.
examples.zh: 有了更好的工具后，这家工坊开始在产品成形质量上超过竞争对手。

definition.en: (less common, often in marketing/fitness) the act or process of improving shape—especially body shape—or presenting a more “shaped” look than others.
definition.zh: （较少见，常见于营销/健身语境）塑形的过程；尤指身材塑形，或在外形上显得比别人更“有型”。

examples.en: The program focuses on strength and mobility, not just **outshaping** other people.
examples.zh: 这个训练计划强调力量和灵活性，而不只是比别人更“有型”。

examples.en: Their ads promise quick **outshaping**, but results usually take time.
examples.zh: 他们的广告承诺快速塑形，但效果通常需要时间。

extraExplanation: “outshaping”不是特别常见的标准词汇，更常见的表达通常是 **outdo / outperform**（在某方面胜过）、**shape better**（塑造得更好）、或在健身语境用 **get in shape / tone up**（塑形/紧致）。
作为动词 **outshape** 带有“out-（超过）+ shape（塑造）”的构词逻辑，但在正式写作中可能显得生硬；如果想更自然，可以根据语境改用更常用的动词。

summary.en: Outsharp means to surpass in sharpness—either literally (a sharper edge/image) or figuratively (a sharper mind or wit). It’s relatively rare in everyday English.
summary.zh: outsharp 指“在锋利度/清晰度/敏锐度上胜过”。既可字面用于刀刃、画面清晰度，也可引申用于头脑或机智；日常英语中较少见。

definition.en: to be sharper than; to surpass someone or something in sharpness, clarity, or quickness (of mind, wit, etc.)
definition.zh: 比……更锋利/更清晰；在敏锐度、清晰度或机敏（如思维、机智）上胜过……

examples.en: This new blade seems to outsharp the old one after just a few passes on the stone.
examples.zh: 这把新刀在磨刀石上磨了几下后，似乎就比旧刀更锋利。

examples.en: In debate, she often outsharps her opponents with quicker answers and clearer logic.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，她常凭更快的回应和更清晰的逻辑胜过对手。

definition.en: sharper than another (rare; often written with a hyphen as out-sharp)
definition.zh: 比另一个更锋利/更清晰的（较少见；常写作 out-sharp）

examples.en: The out-sharp edge cut the paper cleanly.
examples.zh: 那更锋利的刀刃把纸利落地割开了。

extraExplanation: “outsharp”不是日常高频词，更常见的表达是“sharper than… / more sharp / outdo… in sharpness”。在写作中也常见连字符形式“out-sharp”，用来强调“在某方面更‘sharp’”。
“sharp”除了“锋利、清晰”之外，还常指“头脑敏锐、反应快、言辞犀利”。因此 outsharp 既可用于刀刃/图像清晰度，也可用于人的思维与口才。

summary.en: Outsharpen means to be sharper than something else or to sharpen something so it becomes sharper than another.
summary.zh: Outsharpen 指“比……更锋利/更清晰”，也可指“把……磨得比……更锋利”。

definition.en: to become sharper than something else; to gain an advantage in sharpness, clarity, or precision
definition.zh: 比……更锋利；在清晰度或精准度上胜过……

examples.en: Over time, a well-maintained knife can outsharpen cheaper blades.
examples.zh: 随着时间推移，保养得当的刀具可以比更便宜的刀片更锋利。

examples.en: In a close competition, she tried to outsharpen her rivals’ arguments with clearer evidence.
examples.zh: 在激烈的竞争中，她试图用更清晰的证据让自己的论点胜过对手。

definition.en: to make something sharper than another thing; to sharpen so that it surpasses in sharpness
definition.zh: 把……磨得比……更锋利；将……锐化到超过……的程度

examples.en: A professional sharpener can outsharpen most home tools.
examples.zh: 专业磨刀师能把刀磨得比大多数家用工具更锋利。

examples.en: He used a finer stone to outsharpen the factory edge.
examples.zh: 他用更细的磨石把出厂刀刃磨得更锋利。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outsmart, outrun）。因此 outsharpen 直观上就是“在锋利度/清晰度上超过”。这个词不算高频，更常见的表达是 “be sharper than … / sharpen … more than … / outperform … in clarity”。

summary.en: Outsheathe means to draw a weapon from its sheath, or figuratively to reveal power or threat.
summary.zh: Outsheathe 指把武器从鞘中抽出（出鞘），也可比喻显露力量或威胁。

definition.en: to pull a sword or similar weapon out of its sheath; to unsheathe (often used in a literary or dramatic style)
definition.zh: （把剑等武器）从剑鞘中抽出；出鞘（常见于文学或较戏剧化的表达）

examples.en: The knight outsheathed his sword and stepped forward.
examples.zh: 骑士抽出长剑，向前一步。

examples.en: In the story, the hero outsheathes the blade only when peace has truly failed.
examples.zh: 在故事里，英雄只有在和平确实无望时才会让刀出鞘。

definition.en: (figurative) to bring out or display something forceful, such as anger, power, or a threat
definition.zh: （比喻）亮出/显露强硬的一面，如愤怒、力量或威胁

examples.en: The calm leader finally outsheathed his authority during the crisis.
examples.zh: 在危机中，那位一向冷静的领袖终于亮出了权威。

examples.en: Her words were polite, but the message outsheathed a clear warning.
examples.zh: 她的话很客气，但其中隐含着明确的警告。

extraExplanation: “outsheathe”较少见，更多出现在文学、史诗、奇幻题材或仿古风格中；日常英语里更常用“unsheathe”。
构词上是 out-（向外）+ sheathe（把……装入鞘/剑鞘）；注意“sheathe”本身是“入鞘”，而“unsheathe/outsheathe”是“出鞘”。

summary.en: Outshift means to shift into a higher gear, often faster or more strategically than someone else, especially in racing.
summary.zh: Outshift 指升挡（换到更高挡位），常用于赛车语境，含“比对手更快/更巧妙升挡”的意思。

definition.en: to shift a vehicle’s transmission into a higher gear (or through gears), often earlier or more effectively than someone else, especially in racing
definition.zh: （尤指赛车中）换到更高挡位；（常指比对手更早或更有效地）升挡

examples.en: He tried to outshift the other driver on the straight.
examples.zh: 他想在直道上比另一位车手更快升挡。

examples.en: If you outshift too early, the engine may lose power.
examples.zh: 如果你升挡太早，引擎可能会没力。

definition.en: to shift to a higher gear (in a vehicle)
definition.zh: （车辆）升挡、换到更高挡

examples.en: Outshift at around 3,000 RPM for smoother driving.
examples.zh: 大约在每分钟 3,000 转时升挡，驾驶会更顺。

extraExplanation: “Out-”常带有“超过/胜过”的意思（如 outsmart, outrun），所以 outshift 在赛车语境里常隐含“用更好的升挡时机或更快的换挡动作压过对手”。
在日常英语中，更多人会说 “shift up” 或 “upshift”。“Outshift”更偏竞技、技术讨论或赛车评论。

summary.en: “Outshifts” means “surpasses by shifting gears better,” especially in racing; it can also mean “outperforms by changing pace or strategy.”
summary.zh: “outshifts”指（尤指赛车中）通过更好的换挡超越对手；也可引申为通过调整节奏或策略而胜过别人。

definition.en: to shift a vehicle into a higher gear than another driver, especially in racing, so you accelerate past them
definition.zh: （尤指赛车中）比对手更早/更高挡位地换挡，从而加速超越对方

examples.en: He outshifted the car behind him coming out of the corner.
examples.zh: 他在出弯时换到更高挡位，把后车甩开了。

examples.en: If you outshift too early, you may lose power.
examples.zh: 如果换挡过早，可能会动力不足。

definition.en: (figurative) to outperform someone by changing pace, method, or timing more effectively
definition.zh: （引申）通过更有效的节奏、方法或时机调整而胜过别人

examples.en: The team outshifted its rivals by changing strategy mid-game.
examples.zh: 这支队伍在比赛中途改变策略，从而压过了对手。

examples.en: She outshifted everyone at work by learning new tools faster.
examples.zh: 她更快学会新工具，在工作中甩开了所有人。

extraExplanation: “outshift”常见于汽车/摩托运动语境，核心是“换挡时机更优或挡位更高”，从而获得更好的加速与速度。日常写作里也可借用作比喻，但不如“outperform / outpace”常用。

summary.en: Outshine means to surpass others in excellence or to shine more brightly than something else.
summary.zh: Outshine 指在表现上胜过他人，或在光亮上比其他事物更明亮。

definition.en: to be more impressive, successful, or attractive than someone or something else; to surpass
definition.zh: 比……更出色；胜过；使相形见绌

examples.en: Her performance outshone everyone else’s in the competition.
examples.zh: 她在比赛中的表现胜过了所有人。

examples.en: The new model outshines the old one in both speed and battery life.
examples.zh: 新款在速度和续航方面都胜过旧款。

examples.en: He didn’t mean to outshine his teammate; he just did his best.
examples.zh: 他并不是想抢队友风头；他只是尽力而为。

definition.en: to shine more brightly than another light; to be brighter
definition.zh: 比……更明亮；光芒盖过

examples.en: Tonight, the moon outshines the stars.
examples.zh: 今晚月亮的光芒盖过了星星。

examples.en: The streetlights outshone the candles in the window.
examples.zh: 路灯的亮度超过了窗边的蜡烛。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过/胜过”（如 outdo, outperform）。因此 outshine 字面意思是“比……更闪耀”，既可指真实的光更亮，也常用于比喻“更优秀/更吸引人”。
在职场或团队语境里，outshine 有时会带出“抢风头”的含义，语气可能中性或略带负面；想表达更中性的“表现更好”，也可以用 do better / surpass / excel。

summary.en: “Outshined” means “surpassed” or “was more impressive/brighter than,” and it’s also the past form of “outshine.”
summary.zh: “outshined”表示“胜过/更出色/更耀眼”，也是 outshine 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: to be brighter or more impressive than someone or something; to surpass
definition.zh: 比……更出色；胜过；使相形见绌

examples.en: Her presentation outshined the others because it was clear and well organized.
examples.zh: 她的演讲因为清晰又有条理而比其他人的更出色。

examples.en: The small café outshined bigger restaurants with its warm service and great coffee.
examples.zh: 这家小咖啡馆用贴心服务和好咖啡胜过了更大的餐厅。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “outshine”
definition.zh: “outshine”的过去式/过去分词：胜过；比……更耀眼

examples.en: He outshined his teammates during the final game.
examples.zh: 他在决赛中表现得比队友更出色。

examples.en: By the end of the year, her achievements had outshined last year’s results.
examples.zh: 到年底时，她的成就已经超过了去年的成绩。

extraExplanation: “outshined”来自动词 outshine（out- 表示“超过/胜过” + shine “发光/出彩”）。既可指字面上的“更亮”，也常用于比喻：在表现、才华、成就上“更抢眼”。
拼写提示：outshine 的过去式既可写作 outshone（更常见、偏正式），也可写作 outshined（较常见于美式英语、口语和一般写作中）；两者意思相同。

summary.en: Outshiner means a person or thing that clearly outshines others.
summary.zh: Outshiner 指明显胜过他人、最出色或最耀眼的人或事物。

definition.en: a person or thing that outshines others; someone or something that is noticeably better, brighter, or more impressive than the rest
definition.zh: 胜过他人的人或事物；比别人更出色、更耀眼、更令人印象深刻的存在

examples.en: In a class full of talented students, Maya was the outshiner in public speaking.
examples.zh: 在一群都很有才华的学生中，玛雅在演讲方面最出众。

examples.en: That new phone’s camera is an outshiner—its photos look sharp even at night.
examples.zh: 那款新手机的相机特别出彩——即使在夜里拍出来也很清晰。

examples.en: The quiet short story turned out to be the outshiner of the whole collection.
examples.zh: 那篇安静的短篇小说反而成了整本作品集中最亮眼的一篇。

extraExplanation: “outshiner”是由 out-（胜过、超过）+ shine（发光；出众）+ -er（表示“人/物”）构成，字面意思就是“胜过他人而发光的人/物”。
这个词在日常口语中不算最常见，更常用的是动词“outshine”（胜过；比……更出色）或表达方式 like “the standout / the star / the highlight”。

summary.en: “Outshines” means “surpasses” or “shines brighter than,” either figuratively or literally.
summary.zh: “outshines”表示“胜过／更出色”，也可指“更明亮、更耀眼”（字面或比喻）。

definition.en: to be better, more impressive, or more noticeable than someone or something else; to surpass
definition.zh: 胜过；比……更出色／更引人注目；超越

examples.en: Her performance outshines everyone else in the class.
examples.zh: 她的表现胜过班上所有人。

examples.en: The new phone’s camera outshines the older model.
examples.zh: 这款新手机的相机比旧型号更出色。

definition.en: (literal) to shine more brightly than something else
definition.zh: （字面）比……更明亮；更耀眼

examples.en: On a clear night, the moon outshines most of the stars.
examples.zh: 在晴朗的夜晚，月亮比大多数星星更明亮。

examples.en: The stage lights outshine the decorations behind the actors.
examples.zh: 舞台灯光比演员身后的装饰更耀眼。

extraExplanation: “outshines”是动词“outshine”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outshines）。常见过去式是“outshone”，但在现代英语中“outshined”也有人用，尤其在美式英语里。

summary.en: Outshining means surpassing others in quality or attention, or shining more brightly in a literal sense.
summary.zh: outshining 指在表现或引人注目方面胜过他人，也可指字面上更明亮、更耀眼。

definition.en: to surpass others; to be much better, more impressive, or more noticeable than someone or something else
definition.zh: 胜过；更出色；比……更引人注目

examples.en: She was outshining everyone in the class with her clear answers.
examples.zh: 她回答得很清楚，明显比班里其他人更出色。

examples.en: The new product is outshining older models in both speed and battery life.
examples.zh: 这款新产品在速度和续航上都胜过旧型号。

definition.en: to shine more brightly than something else (literal meaning)
definition.zh: （字面）比……更明亮；更耀眼

examples.en: Tonight the moon is outshining the stars.
examples.zh: 今晚月亮比星星更亮。

examples.en: In the clear sky, the lighthouse was outshining every nearby light.
examples.zh: 在晴朗的天空下，灯塔的光比附近所有灯都更耀眼。

extraExplanation: “outshining”是动词 outshine 的现在分词/动名词形式，可用于进行时（is/was outshining）或作名词性用法（Outshining others takes practice）。
构词上是 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ shine（发光），因此既可用于“更优秀/更显眼”的比喻义，也可用于“更亮”的字面义。

summary.en: “Outshone” means “was more impressive or brighter than others,” and it is the past form of “outshine.”
summary.zh: “Outshone”表示“胜过/更出色（或更明亮）”，是“outshine”的过去式和过去分词。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “outshine”: to be more impressive, successful, or noticeable than someone or something else.
definition.zh: “outshine”的过去式和过去分词：比……更出色、更成功或更引人注目；使……相形见绌。

examples.en: She outshone the other candidates in the interview with clear answers and confidence.
examples.zh: 她在面试中以清晰的回答和自信表现胜过其他候选人。

examples.en: The dessert was good, but the fresh fruit outshone everything else on the table.
examples.zh: 甜点不错，但新鲜水果比桌上其他东西都更出彩。

examples.en: In the final scene, his performance outshone even the lead actor’s.
examples.zh: 在最后一幕里，他的表演甚至盖过了主演。

definition.en: to shine more brightly than something else (literal meaning).
definition.zh: （字面义）比……更明亮地发光。

examples.en: On a clear night, the full moon outshone the stars.
examples.zh: 在晴朗的夜晚，满月的光辉盖过了群星。

examples.en: The new headlights outshone the old ones on dark roads.
examples.zh: 在黑暗的道路上，新车灯比旧车灯更亮。

extraExplanation: “outshine”是不规则动词：outshine – outshone – outshone。常见搭配有：outshone everyone/others（胜过所有人/其他人）、outshone in + 场合（在……中表现最突出）。
这个词既可用于积极的赞美（表现突出），也可能带有比较意味：有时会让被比较的人显得“被压过风头”。语境友善时更自然。

summary.en: Outshoot means to shoot better or more than someone else, or (less commonly) to shoot past a target.
summary.zh: outshoot 指射得比别人更准或更多；也可指射过头（超出目标）。

definition.en: To shoot better or more accurately than someone else, especially in a competition.
definition.zh: （尤指比赛中）射得比别人更准；枪法更胜一筹。

examples.en: She outshot her rivals in the final round and won the gold medal.
examples.zh: 她在决赛轮枪法胜过对手，赢得了金牌。

examples.en: Our team was outshot from long range, so we lost the match.
examples.zh: 对手远射更强，我们因此输了比赛。

definition.en: To shoot more bullets/arrows (or take more shots) than someone else; to shoot more often.
definition.zh: 射击次数比别人多；开枪（或射箭、投篮）更多。

examples.en: They tried to outshoot the other side, but they ran out of ammunition.
examples.zh: 他们想用更密集的火力压过对方，但弹药用光了。

examples.en: In the second half, we outshot them 18 to 10.
examples.zh: 下半场我们出手（射门/投篮）18次，对方10次。

definition.en: To shoot past a target or shoot farther than intended; to overshoot.
definition.zh: 射过头；（距离或方向）超出目标。

examples.en: Aim lower—you're outshooting the target.
examples.zh: 瞄低一点——你射过头了。

examples.en: He outshot the mark by several yards.
examples.zh: 他射得超过目标好几码。

extraExplanation: “out-” 这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outnumber, outrun）。所以 outshoot 最常见的意思是“在射击上胜过别人”。
在体育报道里，outshoot 常用来统计“射门/出手次数更多”（如 outshot them 18–10）。在这种用法中，过去式/过去分词常见为 outshot。

summary.en: Outshooting means surpassing others in shooting ability (accuracy, distance, or score), and less commonly, growing shoots faster than something else.
summary.zh: outshooting 指在射击能力上超过他人（更准、更远或得分更高）；较少见时也可指植物长新枝更快、超过别的植物。

definition.en: present participle/gerund of outshoot: to shoot better, more accurately, or farther than someone else (often in sports or hunting).
definition.zh: outshoot 的现在分词/动名词：在射击上比别人更强（更准、更远或得分更高），常用于运动或狩猎语境。

examples.en: She was outshooting everyone on the team by the end of the season.
examples.zh: 赛季末她的射击水平已经超过了队里的所有人。

examples.en: He trained every day and kept outshooting his rivals in competition.
examples.zh: 他每天训练，在比赛中一直压过对手。

definition.en: (less common) growing or extending shoots faster than another plant; surpassing in new growth.
definition.zh: （较少见）在植物生长中，长出新枝/新芽更快，从而超过其他植物。

examples.en: In spring, the vines were outshooting the shrubs nearby.
examples.zh: 春天里，这些藤蔓长得比旁边的灌木更快。

extraExplanation: “out-” 是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。因此 outshoot = out(超过)+shoot(射击/发射)。在日常英语中更常见的是 outshoot（动词原形）或 outshot（过去式），outshooting 多用于进行时或作动名词。

summary.en: “Outshoots” means branches or developments that grow out of a main source; it can also mean “develops/branches out” as a verb.
summary.zh: “outshoots”指从主要来源分出的“分支/衍生物”；作动词可表示“由……发展/分化出来”。

definition.en: (plural noun) side branches or offshoots—things that grow or develop from a main stem, source, or organization.
definition.zh: （名词复数）分支；旁枝；衍生出来的事物——从主要根源、主体或组织发展出来的部分。

examples.en: The research project has several outshoots, including a new app and a training course.
examples.zh: 这个研究项目有几个衍生成果，包括一个新应用和一门培训课程。

examples.en: Small towns can be outshoots of a nearby big city’s economy.
examples.zh: 小城镇可能是附近大城市经济的延伸分支。

definition.en: (third-person singular verb) grows or branches out from something; develops as a result of something else.
definition.zh: （动词第三人称单数）从……分出/长出；由……发展/衍生而来。

examples.en: A new debate outshoots from the original question.
examples.zh: 一个新的争论点从最初的问题中衍生出来。

examples.en: Her interest in design outshoots from her love of drawing.
examples.zh: 她对设计的兴趣源自她对绘画的热爱。

extraExplanation: “outshoot”常用于比喻：像树枝从主干“长出去”一样，表示想法、项目、组织或影响力从某个核心延伸、分化。
它与“offshoot”含义接近，但“offshoot”在现代英语中更常见、更口语化；“outshoot”稍显书面、偏描述“向外分枝/延伸”的画面感。

summary.en: Outshot most commonly means the final outcome or result (often: “the outshot”). It can also be a rare past form of “outshoot.”
summary.zh: Outshot 最常用来表示“最终结果/结局”（常见于 the outshot）。也可作罕见用法，表示 outshoot 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: The final result or outcome of a situation (often used in the phrase “the outshot”).
definition.zh: （事情的）最终结果，结局（常用于短语“the outshot”）。

examples.en: The outshot of the negotiations was a new agreement.
examples.zh: 谈判的最终结果是达成了一项新协议。

examples.en: I don’t know what the outshot will be, but we’ll find out soon.
examples.zh: 我不知道最终会是什么结果，但很快就会知道。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “outshoot” (to shoot better than someone else); rare.
definition.zh: “outshoot”的过去式和过去分词：射得比……更准/更远；较少见。

examples.en: She outshot everyone on the team during practice.
examples.zh: 在训练中，她的射击成绩超过了队里所有人。

extraExplanation: “outshot”作名词表示“结果/结局”时，语气偏书面、略带旧式（常见于19世纪及更早的文学或正式写作）。现代口语里更常说 outcome / result。
固定搭配：the outshot of (something) = （某事的）最终结果。

summary.en: Outshoulder means to push past or outdo someone using your shoulder or physical strength in close contact.
summary.zh: outshoulder 指在贴身对抗中用肩膀或身体力量挤过、压过对方，也可引申为胜过对手。

definition.en: to surpass, outdo, or push past someone by using your shoulder (or by having stronger shoulders), especially in close physical competition
definition.zh: 用肩膀（或凭更强的肩部力量）在近身对抗中挤过、压过对方；引申为在竞争中胜过、压倒

examples.en: In the final seconds, she outshouldered her opponent and won the ball.
examples.zh: 最后几秒，她用肩膀挤过对手，抢到了球。

examples.en: The veteran runner outshouldered the younger athlete at the corner.
examples.zh: 老将跑到拐角处时用身体（肩膀）压过了年轻选手。

examples.en: He tried to outshoulder his way through the crowd to the exit.
examples.zh: 他试图用肩膀在人群中硬挤出一条路到出口。

extraExplanation: “out- + shoulder”属于英语里常见的构词方式：out- 表示“超过/胜过”。因此 outshoulder 字面就是“在肩膀上胜过别人”，多用于描写贴身争抢、身体对抗（如足球、篮球、冰球）或在人群中挤过别人。
这个词相对少见，更常见的表达有：outmuscle（凭力量压过）、shoulder past（用肩膀挤过去）、edge past（勉强超过）。

summary.en: Outshout means to shout louder than someone or to overwhelm them by shouting more strongly.
summary.zh: Outshout 指“比别人喊得更大声”，也可指“用更强势的喊叫压过/压制对方”。

definition.en: to shout louder than someone else so that you can be heard over them
definition.zh: 比别人喊得更大声；用更大的喊声压过对方

examples.en: The fans tried to outshout each other during the game.
examples.zh: 比赛时，球迷们试着互相用更大的喊声压过对方。

examples.en: I couldn’t outshout the music, so I texted her instead.
examples.zh: 音乐太吵我喊不过它，所以我改用发短信。

definition.en: to defeat or silence someone by shouting more forcefully
definition.zh: 用更强势的喊叫压制/驳倒对方（常带负面语气）

examples.en: He kept trying to outshout anyone who disagreed with him.
examples.zh: 他总想用更大声来压过任何不同意他的人。

examples.en: In a heated meeting, don’t try to outshout your coworkers—listen first.
examples.zh: 在激烈的会议上，不要试图用更大声压过同事——先听再说。

extraExplanation: out- 是常见前缀，表示“比……更……、胜过……”。因此 outshout 字面意思就是“喊得比别人更大声”。类似构词：outperform（表现胜过）、outnumber（数量超过）、outsmart（更聪明、智胜）。
语用上，outshout 常暗示争吵或喧闹环境中的“抢声音/压人”，在礼貌沟通里通常不推荐，可换成 speak up（提高音量）、raise your voice（提高嗓门，可能带负面）、be heard（让别人听见）。

summary.en: “Outshouted” means someone shouted louder than others, often to be heard or to drown someone out.
summary.zh: “outshouted”表示“喊得比别人更大声”，常用于嘈杂环境或用喊声压过别人。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “outshout”: to shout louder than someone else.
definition.zh: “outshout”的过去式和过去分词：比别人喊得更大声。

examples.en: In the noisy bar, he outshouted everyone to get the bartender’s attention.
examples.zh: 在吵闹的酒吧里，他用更大的声音盖过所有人来引起酒保注意。

examples.en: The crowd outshouted the announcer during the final seconds of the game.
examples.zh: 比赛最后几秒，观众的喊声盖过了解说员。

definition.en: to overwhelm or silence someone by shouting (so their voice cannot be heard).
definition.zh: 用喊叫压制（或“喊过”）别人，使对方的声音听不见。

examples.en: She tried to explain, but he kept interrupting and outshouted her.
examples.zh: 她想解释，但他不断打断并用更大的声音压住她。

examples.en: During the argument, calmer voices were outshouted by a few angry people.
examples.zh: 争吵中，较冷静的声音被少数愤怒的人用喊声压了下去。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“在某方面超过/胜过”。所以 outshout = shout louder than（喊得比……更大声）。类似的词还有 outwork（比……更努力工作）、outperform（表现超过）、outnumber（数量超过）。
outshout 常带有“对抗、争执、喧闹场景”的语感；如果只是“提高音量”，更中性常用 speak louder / raise your voice。

summary.en: Outshouting means shouting louder than others, often to be heard or to overpower someone in a dispute.
summary.zh: Outshouting 指比别人喊得更大声，常用于为了让人听见或在争论中压过对方。

definition.en: (present participle of outshout) shouting louder than someone else, often to be heard or to win an argument.
definition.zh: （outshout 的现在分词）比别人喊得更大声，常为让人听见或在争论中压过对方。

examples.en: In the crowded market, vendors were outshouting each other to attract customers.
examples.zh: 在拥挤的市场里，小贩们互相喊得更大声来吸引顾客。

examples.en: He tried outshouting her, but she stayed calm and kept speaking clearly.
examples.zh: 他试图用更大声压过她，但她很冷静，仍然清晰地说话。

definition.en: the act of shouting louder than others (used as a noun/gerund).
definition.zh: （作名词/动名词）用更大声的喊叫压过别人这一行为。

examples.en: Outshouting isn’t a good communication strategy in a meeting.
examples.zh: 在会议里，靠大喊压过别人并不是好的沟通方式。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（例如 outsmart=比……更聪明，outwork=比……更努力）。因此 outshout 的核心意思就是“在音量上胜过”。
在英语语境中，描述争吵时常带一点负面评价：outshout 往往暗示用音量取胜，而不是用理由取胜。

summary.en: “Outshouts” means “shouts louder than someone/something else” or “covers another sound by shouting.”
summary.zh: “outshouts” 表示“比别人喊得更大声”或“用喊声盖过其他声音”。

definition.en: to shout louder than someone else; to win by being louder
definition.zh: 比别人喊得更大声；用更大的声音压过对方

examples.en: In the noisy bar, she outshouts everyone to get the server’s attention.
examples.zh: 在嘈杂的酒吧里，她用更大的声音压过所有人来引起服务员注意。

examples.en: He tries to outshout his opponent instead of listening.
examples.zh: 他试图用更大的声音压过对手，而不是去倾听。

definition.en: to drown out another sound by shouting; to make it hard to hear something else
definition.zh: 用喊声盖过其他声音；让别的声音听不清

examples.en: The crowd outshouts the announcer, so we miss the message.
examples.zh: 人群的喊声盖过了播报员，我们没听清消息。

examples.en: Their cheering outshouts the music for a moment.
examples.zh: 他们的欢呼声一度盖过了音乐。

extraExplanation: “out-” 这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（在数量、程度或能力上），比如 outnumber（数量超过）、outperform（表现胜过）。因此 outshout 就是“在喊叫这件事上胜过对方”。
“outshouts” 是第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it outshouts）。原形是 outshout；过去式/过去分词常用 outshouted。

summary.en: Outshove means to shove more strongly or farther than others, often to push past them in a crowd.
summary.zh: outshove 指在推搡中比别人更用力/更远，常指为了挤过去而把人推开。

definition.en: to push or shove more strongly or farther than someone/something else; to shove past in a way that defeats another person’s shove.
definition.zh: （在推搡中）比……推得更用力/更远；把……推开并挤过去（在推搡上胜过对方）。

examples.en: In the crowd, he tried to outshove everyone to reach the front.
examples.zh: 在人群里，他想推开所有人挤到最前面。

examples.en: The bigger player outshoved his opponent under the basket.
examples.zh: 那个更壮的球员在篮下把对手顶开了。

examples.en: They outshoved each other at the gate until security stepped in.
examples.zh: 他们在门口互相推搡，直到保安介入。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过/胜过”。所以 outshove 就是“在 shove（推、推搡）这件事上超过对方”。类似构词还有 outpush（推得更过分/更用力）、outbid（出价更高）、outnumber（数量超过）。
这个词在日常英语中不常见，更常用的表达是 “push past,” “shove past,” “push your way through,” 或 “outmuscle someone”（在身体对抗上压制）。

summary.en: “Outshoved” means “pushed/shoved more strongly or more successfully than others.”
summary.zh: “outshoved”表示“推挤得比别人更用力/更成功”。

definition.en: (Past tense/past participle of “outshove”) pushed harder, farther, or more effectively than someone else; surpassed in shoving or pushing.
definition.zh: （outshove 的过去式/过去分词）比别人推得更用力、更远或更有效；在推搡/推挤方面胜过对方。

examples.en: In the crowd, he outshoved the others and reached the door first.
examples.zh: 在人群里，他比别人更用力地推挤，最先挤到门口。

examples.en: She outshoved her opponent in the scrum and won the ball.
examples.zh: 在争抢中她把对手推开得更厉害，抢到了球。

definition.en: (Less common) pushed someone aside or out of a place by using more force than another person did.
definition.zh: （较少见）用更大的力气把某人挤开或挤出某个位置，力度超过他人。

examples.en: He outshoved a man who was blocking the narrow aisle.
examples.zh: 他把挡在狭窄过道上的那个人更用力地挤开。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“比……更、胜过……”。因此 outshove 直译就是“推得比……更厉害”。这个词在日常口语里不算常见，更常用的表达有 push past、shove past、push someone aside、outpush 等。

summary.en: Outshoving means pushing more forcefully than others or pushing something out by shoving; it’s an uncommon word.
summary.zh: Outshoving 指比别人更用力地推挤，或用推挤把东西推出来；这个词不常用。

definition.en: the act of pushing more forcefully than someone else, or trying to push past others (present participle/gerund of “outshove”)
definition.zh: 比别人更用力地推挤；（为抢先）推开别人往前挤（“outshove”的现在分词/动名词）

examples.en: In the crowded hallway, outshoving only made things slower and more stressful.
examples.zh: 在拥挤的走廊里，用力推挤只会让事情更慢、更紧张。

examples.en: He was outshoving everyone to get to the front of the line.
examples.zh: 他为了挤到队伍前面，一直在推开别人往前挤。

definition.en: pushing something out of a place by shoving
definition.zh: 用推挤把某物从某处挤出去／推开

examples.en: Outshoving the stuck drawer finally opened it.
examples.zh: 用力把卡住的抽屉往外推，终于把它打开了。

examples.en: They tried outshoving the chair from under the table with their foot.
examples.zh: 他们试着用脚把椅子从桌子底下推出来。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“比……更、超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outshove 字面意思就是“推得比别人更厉害”。
“outshove/outshoving”在现代英语里不算常用；日常更常说 shove past（挤过去）、push past（推挤着过去）、elbow one’s way（用胳膊肘挤出一条路）或 push someone aside（把人推到一边）。

summary.en: Outshow means to draw more attention by putting on a more impressive show than others.
summary.zh: Outshow 指用更抢眼的展示或表现吸引更多注意力，从而胜过他人、抢风头。

definition.en: to attract more attention than someone or something else by putting on a better or more impressive show; to outshine
definition.zh: 以更精彩、更抢眼的表现吸引更多注意力；抢风头；胜过他人（的展示）

examples.en: She didn’t mean to outshow anyone, but her performance stole the scene.
examples.zh: 她并不是想抢谁的风头，但她的表演确实成了全场焦点。

examples.en: The small brand tried to outshow bigger competitors with a bold ad campaign.
examples.zh: 这家小品牌试图用大胆的广告活动来胜过更大的竞争对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo 胜过，outshine 更耀眼）。因此 outshow 直观上就是“在展示/表现上超过别人”。
这个词相对不算高频；日常表达里更常见的是 outshine、outdo，或用 steal the show（抢尽风头）来表达类似意思。

summary.en: “Outshowed” means “showed more than others” or “outshined,” and it’s the past form of “outshow.”
summary.zh: “outshowed”表示“在表现或吸引注意方面胜过、盖过风头”，是“outshow”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “outshow”: to attract more attention than someone or something else; to appear better, stronger, or more impressive in comparison.
definition.zh: “outshow”的过去式和过去分词：比别人或别的事物更吸引注意；在比较中显得更出色、更强或更令人印象深刻。

examples.en: At the talent show, her calm confidence outshowed many more experienced performers.
examples.zh: 在才艺表演中，她沉稳的自信让许多更有经验的表演者都显得逊色。

examples.en: The smaller team outshowed the bigger one with smarter strategy and tighter teamwork.
examples.zh: 这支更小的队伍靠更聪明的策略和更紧密的配合，让更大的队伍都相形见绌。

extraExplanation: “outshow”是由前缀 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ show 组成，意思是“在表现/吸引眼球方面胜过”。在现代英语里不算常见；更常用的表达通常是 outshine（更耀眼/更出色）、outdo（做得更好）或 steal the show（抢尽风头）。
形式上，“outshow”的过去式常写作 outshowed（规则变化）。但在一些用法里也可能见到 outshown 作为过去分词（类似 show → showed/shown）。不同写法取决于语域与作者习惯；学习和写作中用更常见的 outshone/outdid 往往更自然。

summary.en: Outshower means to surpass someone by showering more praise, gifts, or attention (rare; often literary).
summary.zh: Outshower 指在“倾注式给予”（如赞美、礼物、关注）方面胜过别人（较少见，偏文学/修辞用法）。

definition.en: to give or cover someone or something with more gifts, praise, attention, etc. than another person does; to surpass in “showering”
definition.zh: 比别人给予更多（礼物、赞美、关注等）；在“倾注式给予”方面胜过

examples.en: They tried to outshower each other with compliments at the ceremony.
examples.zh: 在典礼上，他们互相比着用赞美“倾注”对方。

examples.en: The company outshowered its competitors with bonuses to keep staff from leaving.
examples.zh: 这家公司用更丰厚的奖金胜过竞争对手，以留住员工。

definition.en: to shower more heavily than something else (used more literally, but rare)
definition.zh: （更字面、较少见）比别处下更大的阵雨；降雨更猛烈

examples.en: In the mountains, one valley can outshower the next during summer storms.
examples.zh: 在山区，夏季雷阵雨时，一个山谷的雨势可能比隔壁山谷更大。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“在某方面胜过/超过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outsmart 更聪明地胜过）。因此 outshower 多用于比喻：在送礼、赞美、关怀等方面“比别人更会倾注”。
这个词在现代日常英语中非常少见，写作时更常用更自然的表达：outdo someone in giving praise/gifts，shower someone with praise/gifts more than others do。

summary.en: “Outshown” means “having outshown”—being more impressive or attention-getting than something else.
summary.zh: “outshown”表示“更出彩/更吸睛而胜过对方”，是 outshow 的过去分词。

definition.en: Past participle of “outshow”: to attract more attention than someone or something else; to be more impressive or noticeable.
definition.zh: “outshow”的过去分词：比某人或某物更吸引注意；更出彩、更显眼。

examples.en: Her simple speech outshown the more expensive presentation.
examples.zh: 她朴实的演讲反而比更昂贵的展示更出彩。

examples.en: The newcomer was outshown by the veteran’s calm confidence.
examples.zh: 新人被老手沉稳的自信比下去了。

extraExplanation: “outshown”来自动词 outshow（out- + show），意思是“在表现/吸睛程度上胜过”。英语里更常见的表达是 outshine（outshone/outshone）或 overshadow（使……相形见绌）；outshow 相对少用，但在口语或写作中仍能见到。
拼写提示：outshow 的过去式/过去分词有两种常见形式：outshowed / outshowed（规则变化）以及 outshown（不规则/类不规则用法）。不同作者与语域可能偏好不同形式；如果你不确定，用更常见的 outshone（来自 outshine）通常更自然。

summary.en: Outshriek means to shriek louder than someone or something else.
summary.zh: Outshriek 指尖叫得比别人/别的声音更大、更尖，从而把对方压过去。

definition.en: to shriek louder than someone or something else; to surpass in shrieking volume or intensity
definition.zh: 比……叫得更尖、更大声；以尖叫声压过（别人/别的声音）

examples.en: The crowd outshrieked the band when the singer came on stage.
examples.zh: 主唱一上台，观众的尖叫声就盖过了乐队的声音。

examples.en: A single siren can outshriek traffic noise at night.
examples.zh: 夜里，一辆警笛声就能压过车流噪音。

definition.en: to shriek louder than before; to give an especially loud shriek (less common)
definition.zh: （不及物，较少见）叫得更尖更大声；发出特别响的尖叫

examples.en: As the roller coaster dropped, some riders outshrieked and then laughed.
examples.zh: 过山车俯冲时，有些乘客叫得更大声，随后又笑了起来。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“比……更、胜过……”。类似用法还有 outsing（唱得比……好/响）、outshout（喊得比……大声）、outdo（做得比……更好）。因此 outshriek 多用于强调“声音上的压过/盖过”。

summary.en: Outshrill means to be more shrill than something else—to surpass it in high-pitched, piercing sound.
summary.zh: outshrill 指（声音）比别的更尖锐刺耳，在尖厉程度上“胜过”。

definition.en: to be louder and more high-pitched (more shrill) than someone or something; to surpass in shrillness
definition.zh: （声音）比……更尖锐、更刺耳；在尖厉程度上胜过……

examples.en: The alarm outshrilled every other sound in the hallway.
examples.zh: 警报声比走廊里的其他声音都更尖锐刺耳。

examples.en: In the argument, his voice outshrilled hers and everyone stopped talking.
examples.zh: 争吵中，他的声音比她更尖更刺耳，大家都停下来说话了。

examples.en: The violin can outshrill a flute when played very high and loudly.
examples.zh: 小提琴在拉得很高、很响时，尖锐程度可能超过长笛。

extraExplanation: “outshrill”由前缀 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ shrill（尖锐刺耳的）构成，意思是“在尖锐刺耳方面胜过”。这个词较少见，更常用的表达包括 “be more shrill than…” 或 “be shriller than…”。

summary.en: An archaic verb meaning “to shut out; to exclude.”
summary.zh: 一个较少见的古义动词，意思是“把……关在外面；排斥”。

definition.en: (Archaic) to shut out; to exclude or keep someone or something outside a place or group.
definition.zh: （古义/文学用法）把……关在外面；排斥，使……不得进入。

examples.en: The villagers outshut the stranger from their meeting hall.
examples.zh: 村民把陌生人关在会堂外，不让他进入。

examples.en: She felt outshut from the conversation because she didn’t know the topic.
examples.zh: 因为不了解话题，她觉得自己被排除在谈话之外。

extraExplanation: “outshut”在现代英语里很少见，带有较强的古风或文学色彩；日常更常用“shut out”“exclude”“bar (someone) from”。
词形上可理解为“out-（在外）+ shut（关）”，强调“关到外面去”的动作或结果。

summary.en: “Outside” means the outer part of something, or a place that is not inside; it can also mean external to a group, and in some contexts it means “at most.”
summary.zh: “Outside”可表示“外部/外面”（名词、形容词、副词），也可表示“外部的、局外的”，在某些语境下还可表示“最多、不超过”。

definition.en: the outer side or surface of something; the part that is not inside
definition.zh: 外侧；外表面；不在里面的部分

examples.en: The outside of the box is wet, but the inside is dry.
examples.zh: 盒子的外面是湿的，但里面是干的。

examples.en: Please write your name on the outside of the envelope.
examples.zh: 请把你的名字写在信封外面。

definition.en: not inside a building or enclosed place; outdoors
definition.zh: 在外面；不在室内的；户外的

examples.en: It’s cold outside today.
examples.zh: 今天外面很冷。

examples.en: Let’s eat outside if the weather is nice.
examples.zh: 如果天气好，我们就在外面吃吧。

definition.en: located on or relating to the outer area; not inside
definition.zh: 外部的；在外面的；外侧的

examples.en: Use the outside pocket for keys.
examples.zh: 用外侧口袋放钥匙。

examples.en: The outside door is locked.
examples.zh: 外面的门锁着。

definition.en: not part of a group, organization, or situation; external
definition.zh: 外部的；局外的；不属于某团体/情况的

examples.en: They brought in outside experts to help.
examples.zh: 他们请了外部专家来帮忙。

examples.en: I’m an outside observer, so I may see things differently.
examples.zh: 我是局外观察者，所以可能看法不同。

definition.en: the maximum or most extreme possible amount (often in comparisons)
definition.zh: 最大限度；极限（常用于比较）

examples.en: We’ll be there in ten minutes, outside twenty at the most.
examples.zh: 我们十分钟就到，最多不超过二十分钟。

extraExplanation: “outside”既可以表示“在外面/外部”（地点与空间），也常用于比喻意义表示“外部的、局外的”（不属于某群体或核心圈）。例如 outside help（外援）、outside opinion（外部意见）。
常见搭配：outside of + 名词（在……外面；除了……之外）。口语里 outside of 也常用来表示“除了”，如 Outside of work, I don’t travel much（除了工作以外，我不怎么旅行）。正式写作中可用 except for / apart from 替换更清晰。

summary.en: “Outsided” is rare in modern English; it can mean “excluded/kept outside,” but most learners usually want “outside” or “left out/excluded.”
summary.zh: “outsided”在现代英语中很罕见；可表示“被排除在外”，但多数情况下更应使用“outside”或“left out/excluded”等更地道的表达。

definition.en: (Rare) excluded or kept on the outside; not included in a group or decision.
definition.zh: （罕见）被排除在外的；被置于外部的；不被纳入群体或决策之中的。

examples.en: He felt outsided at work when important meetings happened without him.
examples.zh: 当重要会议没有叫上他时，他在工作中感觉自己被排除在外。

examples.en: New students can easily become outsided if no one invites them to join activities.
examples.zh: 如果没人邀请新同学参加活动，他们很容易变成被边缘化的人。

definition.en: (Very rare) past tense/past participle of a rare verb “to outside,” meaning to put something outside or to shut someone out.
definition.zh: （非常罕见）作为罕见动词“to outside”的过去式/过去分词，意为“把……放到外面”或“把某人拒之门外/排除在外”。

examples.en: The tools were outsided to keep the workshop clear. (unnatural; usually: “put outside”)
examples.zh: 工具被搬到外面，以便让车间保持整洁。（不自然；更常说 put outside）

examples.en: She was outsided from the discussion. (unnatural; usually: “left out” / “excluded”)
examples.zh: 她被排除在讨论之外。（不自然；更常说 left out / excluded）

extraExplanation: “outsided”在现代英语里非常少见，很多时候是把更常用的“outside”误写成了“outsided”。如果你想表达“在外面/外部”，用 outside（prep./adv./adj./n.）更自然：e.g., outside the house（在房子外面）, go outside（到外面去）, an outside chance（不大的可能性）。
如果你想表达“被排除在外/被冷落”，英语里更地道的说法是：left out, excluded, shut out, sidelined。

summary.en: Outsidedness means the state or feeling of being an outsider—alienated or not fully included.
summary.zh: Outsidedness 指“局外人”的状态或感受——疏离、未被完全接纳的局外感。

definition.en: the state or feeling of being an outsider (not fully included in a group, place, or culture); social or emotional alienation
definition.zh: “局外人”状态；局外感（在群体、环境或文化中不被完全接纳的感觉）；疏离感

examples.en: As an international student, she sometimes felt a painful outsidedness during holidays.
examples.zh: 作为一名国际学生，她在节假日里有时会感到一种刺痛的局外感。

examples.en: His novel explores outsidedness and the quiet longing to belong.
examples.zh: 他的小说探讨了局外感，以及那种安静却强烈的归属渴望。

examples.en: The policy unintentionally increased outsidedness among immigrant communities.
examples.zh: 这项政策无意中加剧了移民社群的局外感。

extraExplanation: “outsidedness”并不是最常见的日常用词，更常见的表达是“feeling like an outsider / outsider status / alienation / social exclusion”。它通常出现在文学、社会学、文化研究或更偏思辨的写作中，用来强调一种持续的、结构性的“被排除在外”的体验。
构词上是 outside（外部）+ -ness（名词后缀，表示“……的状态/性质”）。因此它带有抽象名词的语气，读起来比“being outside”更正式、更像概念。
使用小提示：当你想强调“身份或处境上的局外（例如阶层、族裔、文化差异）”时用它很贴切；如果只是“没被邀请/没参与某次活动”，用更简单的表达更自然。

summary.en: Outsideness means the state of being outside or, more commonly, the feeling of not belonging—being an outsider.
summary.zh: outsideness 指“在外”的状态，更常指“不归属感/局外感”，也就是像局外人一样不属于某个群体。

definition.en: The state or quality of being outside, especially of not belonging to a group or community.
definition.zh: 在外（部）的状态或性质；尤指不属于某个群体、圈子或社群的“局外感”。

examples.en: Moving to a new school gave her a strong sense of outsideness at first.
examples.zh: 转到新学校一开始让她强烈感到自己像个局外人。

examples.en: His accent made his outsideness more noticeable in the small town.
examples.zh: 在那个小镇里，他的口音让他的“外来者”身份更显眼。

examples.en: The book explores the outsideness many immigrants feel between two cultures.
examples.zh: 这本书探讨了许多移民在两种文化之间感到的“在外感/不归属感”。

definition.en: The outward or external side of something; external appearance (less common).
definition.zh: 某物的外部或外侧；外在表象（较不常用）。

examples.en: The outsideness of the building looks old, but the inside has been renovated.
examples.zh: 这栋楼外观看起来很旧，但内部已经翻新了。

extraExplanation: “outsideness”不是特别常见的日常词，更常见的表达是“feeling like an outsider（像局外人一样的感觉）”“a sense of not belonging（不归属感）”。它常出现在文学、社会学或心理描写里，用来强调一种持续的“被排除在外”的体验。
构词上是 outside + -ness（表示“……的状态/性质”），类似于 “darkness（黑暗）”“kindness（善良）”。因此它往往表达一种抽象状态，而不仅仅是“在外面”的空间位置。

summary.en: An outsider is someone not in a group, or someone not expected to win.
summary.zh: outsider 指不属于某个群体的“局外人/外人”，也可指比赛或竞争中“不被看好的人”。

definition.en: A person who is not part of a particular group, community, or organization; someone who is not accepted as a member.
definition.zh: 局外人；外人：不属于某个群体、社区或组织的人；不被视为成员的人。

examples.en: As an outsider, it was hard for him to understand the team’s jokes.
examples.zh: 作为局外人，他很难理解团队里的玩笑。

examples.en: She always felt like an outsider at school because she had just moved there.
examples.zh: 因为刚搬到那里，她在学校总觉得自己像个局外人。

examples.en: Outsiders are not allowed to attend the private meeting.
examples.zh: 外人不允许参加这次私下会议。

definition.en: Someone who is not expected to win or succeed, especially in sports, politics, or competitions.
definition.zh: （尤指比赛、体育或政治中的）非热门者；被看低的一方：通常不被看好会获胜的人。

examples.en: The outsider surprised everyone by winning the tournament.
examples.zh: 这位非热门选手赢得了锦标赛，让所有人都很惊讶。

examples.en: In the election, he started as an outsider with little support.
examples.zh: 在选举中，他起初是个不被看好的候选人，支持者很少。

extraExplanation: “outsider”常带有情感色彩：可以只是中性的“非成员”，也可以表达“被排斥、格格不入”的感觉。
文学与文化中，“outsider”常用来塑造“边缘人物/局外人视角”，通过一个不属于主流的人来观察社会规则与不公；例如“an outsider’s perspective（局外人的视角）”。

summary.en: “Outsiders” means people not part of a group; it can also mean excluded people or underdogs in competition.
summary.zh: “outsiders”指不属于某个群体的人；也可指被排斥者，或比赛中不被看好的一方（冷门）。

definition.en: people who are not part of a particular group, community, or organization
definition.zh: 局外人；圈外人（不属于某个群体、社区或组织的人）

examples.en: As outsiders, we didn’t understand the office jokes yet.
examples.zh: 作为局外人，我们还不懂办公室里的那些玩笑。

examples.en: The committee asked outsiders to give an independent opinion.
examples.zh: 委员会请圈外人士提供独立意见。

definition.en: people who are not accepted as belonging to a social group and may feel excluded
definition.zh: 不被接纳的人；被排斥者（在社交群体中感到被拒之门外的人）

examples.en: In a new school, it’s easy to feel like outsiders at first.
examples.zh: 在新学校里，一开始很容易感觉自己是被排斥的人。

examples.en: The story is about outsiders trying to find a place to belong.
examples.zh: 这个故事讲的是被排斥的人努力寻找归属感。

definition.en: people or teams not expected to win in a competition
definition.zh: 冷门选手；不被看好的一方（比赛中不被认为会赢的人或队伍）

examples.en: The outsiders shocked everyone by winning the championship.
examples.zh: 这支不被看好的队伍夺冠，震惊了所有人。

examples.en: Fans love a story where outsiders beat the favorites.
examples.zh: 粉丝们喜欢“冷门击败热门”的故事。

extraExplanation: “outsider”既可以是中性词（只是“非成员”），也可能带有情绪色彩（“被排斥的人”）。语气取决于上下文：例如“independent outsiders”更中性；“feel like an outsider”更偏孤立、疏离。
《The Outsiders》（S. E. Hinton, 1967）是美国很有名的青少年小说（后也被改编成电影），讲不同社会阶层的青少年群体冲突与归属感。很多英语学习者会在阅读课或流行文化中遇到这个标题。

summary.en: “Outsides” means the outer surfaces or external parts of something.
summary.zh: “outsides”指某物的外表面或外部部分（名词复数）。

definition.en: the exterior surfaces or outer parts of something; the parts you can see from the outside
definition.zh: （某物的）外表面；外部；外侧部分

examples.en: The box was wet, but the outsides of the books were still clean.
examples.zh: 盒子湿了，但书的外表面还是干净的。

examples.en: Wipe the outsides of the bottles before you put them in the fridge.
examples.zh: 把瓶子外面擦干净再放进冰箱。

examples.en: The outsides of the cookies were crispy, but the centers were soft.
examples.zh: 饼干外面很酥脆，但里面很柔软。

extraExplanation: “outsides”通常是名词复数，用来强调“外部的各个表面/外侧部分”，尤其当一个东西有多面、或在比较“外面 vs. 里面”时很常见。
在日常表达里，更常见的单数形式是“outside”（例如：the outside of the house 房子的外部）。用“outsides”时，多半是在说“外面这些部分”（如瓶身外侧、饼干外层等）。

summary.en: “Outfit” means a set of clothes, a team/organization, or (as a verb) to equip or provide with clothing/equipment.
summary.zh: “outfit”可指一套衣服/穿搭、一个团队/组织，也可作动词表示配备（衣物或装备）。

definition.en: (Most likely you meant) a set of clothes worn together; an outfit.
definition.zh: （你可能想写的是）一套搭配好的衣服；（一身）穿搭。

examples.en: She wore a simple outfit to the interview.
examples.zh: 她穿了一身简单的穿搭去面试。

examples.en: That outfit looks great with your shoes.
examples.zh: 那套穿搭和你的鞋子很配。

definition.en: A group, team, or organization (often working together for a purpose).
definition.zh: （常指一起工作的）一伙人；团队；组织。

examples.en: A small film outfit came to town to shoot a scene.
examples.zh: 一个小型电影团队来到镇上拍摄一场戏。

examples.en: He works for a tech outfit in Seattle.
examples.zh: 他在西雅图的一家科技公司（团队）工作。

definition.en: To provide someone or something with clothes or equipment; to equip.
definition.zh: 给（某人/某物）配备衣物或装备；使具备所需设备。

examples.en: The company outfitted the staff with new uniforms.
examples.zh: 公司给员工配发了新制服。

examples.en: They outfitted the boat for a long trip.
examples.zh: 他们为长途旅行给船配齐了装备。

extraExplanation: “outsift”不是常见英文单词，最接近、最常用的可能是“outfit”。如果你原本想表达“把……筛出来（sift out）”，更自然的写法通常是“sift out … / sift … out”。

summary.en: “Outsigh” is likely a misspelling of “outweigh,” meaning to be greater in importance/value or heavier in weight.
summary.zh: “outsigh” 很可能是 “outweigh” 的拼写错误，意思是（重要性/价值上）胜过，或（重量上）更重。

definition.en: (Commonly spelled “outweigh”) To be more important, greater, or more valuable than something else.
definition.zh: （常拼作 outweight）比……更重要/更大/更有价值；胜过……

examples.en: The benefits of exercise outweigh the risks for most people.
examples.zh: 对大多数人来说，运动的益处大于风险。

examples.en: In this job, experience can outweigh formal education.
examples.zh: 在这份工作中，经验可能比正规学历更重要。

definition.en: To weigh more than something else (in physical weight).
definition.zh: （重量上）比……更重。

examples.en: This suitcase outweighs the airline’s limit.
examples.zh: 这个行李箱超过了航空公司的重量限制。

examples.en: On average, males outweigh females in this species.
examples.zh: 平均而言，这个物种的雄性比雌性更重。

extraExplanation: “outsigh” 不是常见英语单词，很可能是拼写错误。最接近、最常用的词是 **outweigh**（超过、胜过）。
记忆法：out-（超过）+ weigh（称重/衡量）→ “在重量或重要性上超过”。
常见搭配：outweigh the costs/risks（利大于弊/风险）、far outweigh（远远超过）。

summary.en: “Outsight” is rare/nonstandard; usually use “view/sight,” or you may mean “insight” or “oversight.”
summary.zh: “outsight”很少见且不太规范；通常用“view/sight”，也可能是想写“insight（洞见）”或“oversight（疏忽/监督）”。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) the ability or act of seeing outward; an external view or what is seen outside.
definition.zh: （罕见/不规范用法）向外看的能力或行为；外部的景象、外面的视野。

examples.en: From the window, she had a wide outsight of the valley.
examples.zh: 从窗户望出去，她看到了山谷开阔的外部景象。

examples.en: In most modern writing, people would say “a view” or “sight,” not “outsight.”
examples.zh: 在现代英语里，人们通常会说“a view”或“sight”，而不会用“outsight”。

definition.en: Often a misspelling of “insight” (deep understanding) or confusion with “oversight” (a mistake / supervision).
definition.zh: 常见于把“insight（洞见、深刻理解）”拼错，或与“oversight（疏忽/监督）”混淆。

examples.en: If you mean “deep understanding,” the correct word is “insight.”
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“深刻理解”，正确的词是“insight”。

examples.en: If you mean “a mistake you didn’t notice,” the word is “oversight.”
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“没注意到的错误/疏忽”，用“oversight”。

extraExplanation: “Outsight”不是常用标准词，在词典中也不常见。写作或考试中建议避免使用，改用更自然的表达：a view（景色/视野）、sight（景象/看到的东西）、out of sight（看不见；口语中也可表示“非常棒”）。
如果你想说“洞察力/见解”，用 insight；想说“疏忽”或“监管”，用 oversight。可以告诉我你的句子，我帮你选最贴切的词。

summary.en: “outsights” is not a standard English word; it’s usually a typo for “insights” or related to “outside.”
summary.zh: “outsights” 不是标准英文词；通常是把 “insights” 写错，或与 “outside（外部）” 的意思混淆。

definition.en: A rare or nonstandard word; usually a misspelling. People often mean “insights” (deep understanding) or “outside” (the exterior).
definition.zh: 罕见或非标准用法；通常是拼写错误。人们多半想写的是 “insights”（洞见/深刻理解）或 “outside”（外面/外部）。

examples.en: I think you meant “insights,” not “outsights.”
examples.zh: 我觉得你想写的是 “insights”，不是 “outsights”。

examples.en: Could you share your insights from the meeting?
examples.zh: 你能分享一下你从会议中得到的洞见吗？

extraExplanation: “outsight(s)” 在现代英语里几乎不用，不是常见词。更常见的相关词是：
1) insights：表示“洞见、见解”，常用于学习、分析、报告、会议总结等语境（如: key insights）。
2) outside：表示“外面/外部”，也可作形容词（outside view 外部视角）。
如果你告诉我你想表达的中文意思（比如“外部视角”还是“洞见”），我可以帮你选最自然的英文说法并给更多例句。

summary.en: “outsin” is a rare verb meaning to outdo someone in sin or wrongdoing.
summary.zh: “outsin”是一个罕见动词，意思是“在罪过/作恶方面胜过别人”。

definition.en: (Rare) To be more sinful than someone else; to surpass or outdo (someone) in wrongdoing.
definition.zh: （罕见）比别人更“罪孽深重”；在作恶方面胜过或超过（某人）。

examples.en: He liked to brag that no one could outsin him, but it only showed his insecurity.
examples.zh: 他爱吹嘘没人能比他更会作恶，但这只暴露了他的不安。

examples.en: The novel suggests that comparing who can outsin whom misses the point of moral growth.
examples.zh: 小说暗示：比较谁更会作恶，反而偏离了道德成长的重点。

extraExplanation: “outsin”不是常用英语词，日常交流里很少见；更常见的表达是：be worse than someone / be more sinful than someone / outdo someone in wrongdoing。
如果你想表达“比……更出色”，可能是拼错了 outshine（胜过，胜于）。如果你想表达“在外面（outs）”，那可能是 outs（出局次数，棒球用语）或 outside（在外面）。

summary.en: Outsing means to sing better than someone else or to sing more loudly than them.
summary.zh: Outsing 指唱得比别人更好，或唱得比别人更大声（盖过对方）。

definition.en: to sing better than someone else, especially in a contest or comparison
definition.zh: （尤指在比赛或比较中）唱得比别人更好、胜过别人

examples.en: She outsinged everyone in the school talent show.
examples.zh: 她在学校才艺表演中唱得比所有人都好。

examples.en: It’s hard to outsing a trained opera singer.
examples.zh: 要唱赢受过训练的歌剧演员很难。

definition.en: to sing more loudly than someone else; to drown out another voice by singing
definition.zh: 唱得比别人更大声；用歌声盖过别人的声音

examples.en: The fans tried to outsing each other in the stands.
examples.zh: 看台上的球迷们试着彼此比谁唱得更大声。

examples.en: He couldn’t outsing the choir, so he stopped shouting the melody.
examples.zh: 他无法用歌声盖过合唱团，于是就不再大声喊旋律了。

extraExplanation: “outsing”由前缀 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ sing 组成，常用于“outsing someone”。它强调比较结果：唱得更好或更响。过去式和过去分词常见为 outsinged，也可能见到 out-sang / out-sung（更文学或更不规则动词的写法）。

summary.en: “Outsinging” means singing better or more powerfully than others, or the act of doing so.
summary.zh: “outsinging”指唱得比别人更好/更有力；也可指这种“唱过别人”的行为。

definition.en: singing better, more loudly, or more impressively than someone else (present participle of “outsing”).
definition.zh: （outsing 的现在分词）比别人唱得更好、更响亮或更有感染力。

examples.en: She was outsinging everyone in the choir rehearsal.
examples.zh: 在合唱团排练中，她唱得比所有人都更出色。

examples.en: He kept outsinging his rivals in every round of the contest.
examples.zh: 在比赛的每一轮里，他都一直唱得比对手更强。

definition.en: the act or situation of singing better or louder than others (used as a gerund).
definition.zh: （作动名词）指“唱得压过别人/胜过别人”的行为或情况。

examples.en: Her outsinging of the lead singer surprised the audience.
examples.zh: 她唱得压过主唱，让观众很惊讶。

examples.en: There’s a fine line between confident singing and outsinging the whole group.
examples.zh: 自信地唱和把整组人都唱下去之间只有一线之隔。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo 超越、outperform 表现更好）。所以 outsing 的核心意思就是“唱得比……更好/更响”。
在合唱或团队场合，outsinging 有时会带一点社交语气：既可能是夸赞实力强，也可能暗示“抢风头”。要看具体语境和语气。

summary.en: “outsings” means “sings better/louder than” or “surpasses,” and it’s the third-person singular form of “outsing.”
summary.zh: “outsings”表示“在唱歌方面胜过/唱得更好或更响”，也可引申为“超过”；它是“outsing”的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: to sing better or louder than someone else; to outdo in singing
definition.zh: （在唱歌方面）比别人唱得更好或更响；在歌唱上胜过

examples.en: In the choir, she often outsings the other students with her strong voice.
examples.zh: 在合唱团里，她嗓音很强，经常在歌唱上胜过其他同学。

examples.en: He tried to outsings his friend at karaoke, but he forgot the lyrics.
examples.zh: 他想在卡拉OK里唱得比朋友更厉害，但他忘词了。

definition.en: (figurative) to surpass or overshadow someone or something in a noticeable way
definition.zh: （比喻）明显超过；使……相形见绌

examples.en: Her confidence outsings everyone else’s doubts in the room.
examples.zh: 她的自信让屋里其他人的怀疑都相形见绌。

examples.en: The small team’s results outsings the big company’s promises.
examples.zh: 这个小团队的成果比大公司的承诺更有说服力。

extraExplanation: “outsings”是动词“outsing”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outsings）。
前缀“out-”常表示“胜过、超过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outshine 更出色/更耀眼），理解这个前缀能帮助你猜测很多新词的意思。

summary.en: “Outsinned” means “sinned more than others,” and it’s a rare, formal word often used in religious or moral contexts.
summary.zh: “outsinned”意为“比别人犯更多的罪/更严重的过错”，较少见，多用于宗教或道德语境。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of outsin) to have sinned more than someone else; to surpass others in wrongdoing.
definition.zh: （outsin 的过去式/过去分词）比别人犯更多的罪；在作恶方面超过他人。

examples.en: He felt he had outsinned everyone in his family and didn’t deserve forgiveness.
examples.zh: 他觉得自己比家里任何人犯的罪都多，不配得到原谅。

examples.en: In the sermon, the preacher said no one had outsinned the reach of mercy.
examples.zh: 在布道中，牧师说没有人会因为“罪太多”而超出怜悯所能触及的范围。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“在……方面超过/胜过”（如 outnumber 数量超过，outwork 工作更卖力）。因此 outsin 就是“在罪恶/过错上超过别人”。
outsin/outsinned 属于较少见、带一点书面或宗教语境的用法；日常英语里更常说：sin more than someone / be worse than someone / do more wrong.
它常见于讲道、宗教写作或带有道德批评色彩的句子中，语气可能较重，使用时注意场合。

summary.en: “Outsinning” means sinning more than others (a rare, often humorous or moral/religious word).
summary.zh: “outsinning”指“比别人更犯错/更作恶”，属于较少见、常带讽刺或宗教色彩的用词。

definition.en: (present participle/gerund of outsin) to sin more than someone else; to surpass others in wrongdoing.
definition.zh: （outsin 的现在分词/动名词）比别人犯更多的罪；在作恶或不道德行为上超过他人。

examples.en: He joked that he was always outsinning his friends, though he didn’t mean it seriously.
examples.zh: 他开玩笑说自己总是比朋友更“爱作恶”，但并不是认真的。

examples.en: The novel portrays a corrupt court where nobles compete by outsinning one another.
examples.zh: 小说描写了一个腐败的宫廷，贵族们彼此攀比，看谁更作恶。

extraExplanation: “outsin”这个动词非常少见，多用于幽默、讽刺或宗教语境里，表达“在罪过上胜过/超过别人”。日常英语里更常见的说法是：sin more than someone、be more sinful than…、do worse things than…。
学习时也要注意不要和更常见的“outshining（胜过、比……更出色）”混淆：outsinning 是“更坏”，outshining 是“更好/更亮眼”。

summary.en: “outsins” is not a recognized standard English word; it’s likely a misspelling (often of “outshines”) or a two-word phrase in context.
summary.zh: “outsins”不是常见的标准英语词，通常是拼写错误（常见是“outshines”）或需要按语境拆成两个词的短语。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling or typing error (for example, “outshines” or “out sins”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词，可能是拼写/输入错误（例如想写“outshines”或“out sins”）。

examples.en: I can’t find “outsins” in a dictionary—did you mean “outshines”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“outsins”，你是不是想写“outshines”？

examples.en: If you meant “out sins,” it would usually be written as two words in a sentence.
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“out sins”，通常会在句子里写成两个单词。

extraExplanation:
你可能想查的是：
1) outshines（动词 outshine 的第三人称单数）：意思是“比……更出色/更耀眼”。
2) out sings（outsing 的第三人称单数）：意思是“唱得比……好”。
3) out sins（短语，两词）：字面可理解为“犯下比……更多/更严重的罪”。
把你看到它的原句贴出来（前后各一行）我可以帮你准确判断是哪一个。

summary.en: Outsit means to sit longer than someone else, often to outlast them in a situation.
summary.zh: Outsit 指比别人坐得更久，常用于“耗时间/比耐力”的语境。

definition.en: to remain seated longer than someone else; to outlast others in a sitting contest or by waiting while seated
definition.zh: 比别人坐得更久；（比赛或较劲中）靠久坐来耗过/熬过对方

examples.en: He tried to outsit his friends in the long meeting.
examples.zh: 他想在那场漫长的会议里比朋友们坐得更久。

examples.en: They had a bet to see who could outsit the others without standing up.
examples.zh: 他们打赌看谁能不站起来、比其他人坐得更久。

examples.en: If you just stay calm, you can outsit the pressure until it passes.
examples.zh: 只要你保持冷静，就能“坐得住”，把压力熬过去。

extraExplanation: “outsit”由 out-（超过、胜过）+ sit 组成，常见于较口语或描述“耐力/耗时间”的场景，比如久坐比赛、熬会议、在酒吧或牌局里“谁坐得更久”。有时也可引申为“沉得住气、坚持等待”。

summary.en: “outsits” is the third-person singular of the rare verb “outsit,” meaning to sit longer than someone else or outlast them by staying seated.
summary.zh: “outsits”是罕见动词“outsit”的第三人称单数，意思是“比别人坐得更久/坚持到对方先离开”。

definition.en: (Rare) to sit longer than someone else, especially to endure something (like a meeting, performance, or wait) until the other person leaves first.
definition.zh: （罕见）比别人坐得更久；尤指在会议、演出或等待等情况下坚持到对方先离开。

examples.en: She outsits everyone in long meetings and stays until the end.
examples.zh: 她在冗长的会议里总能比所有人坐得更久，一直待到最后。

examples.en: He tried to outsit his opponent during the marathon chess match.
examples.zh: 在马拉松式的国际象棋对局中，他试图比对手坚持得更久。

extraExplanation: “outsits”通常是动词“outsit”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outsits）。这个词在现代英语里很少见，更常用的表达是：stay longer than…, outlast…, sit through…（坚持坐完/熬过）。
如果你本来想查的是“outfits”（服装；装配），请告诉我上下文句子，我可以帮你确认拼写与正确词义。

summary.en: Outsitting means sitting longer than others, often to win by patience or endurance.
summary.zh: outsitting 指比别人坐得更久，常靠耐心或耐力“熬到最后”而取胜。

definition.en: (present participle/gerund of outsit) staying seated longer than someone else, often to win by endurance or patience.
definition.zh: （outsit 的现在分词/动名词）比别人坐得更久，常指靠耐力或耐心“熬”到最后而获胜。

examples.en: In the meeting, she won by outsitting everyone and waiting until the decision was made.
examples.zh: 在会议上，她靠比所有人都坐得更久，等到最后做出决定而赢了。

examples.en: He kept quiet, outsitting the other bidders until the price dropped.
examples.zh: 他一直不出声，靠“熬坐”到其他竞标者都退出，直到价格降下来。

definition.en: remaining seated for a long time (sometimes with a sense of stubbornness or waiting something out).
definition.zh: 长时间坐着不动（有时带有固执、耗时间或“等对方撑不住”的意味）。

examples.en: After lunch, they spent the afternoon outsitting the heat indoors.
examples.zh: 午饭后，他们整个下午都在室内久坐，熬过外面的酷热。

examples.en: I’m outsitting the traffic and leaving later.
examples.zh: 我打算先不走，坐着等一等，避开堵车再出发。

extraExplanation: “outsit”是由 out-（超过、胜过）+ sit（坐）构成，语气常带“比谁更能熬/更有耐心”的竞争感。常见于牌桌、谈判、拍卖、会议等场景：不是靠更快行动，而是靠更久等待来占上风。

summary.en: Outsize means unusually large, or (as a verb) to be larger than something else.
summary.zh: outsize 指“特大、格外巨大”；作动词时指“比……更大”。

definition.en: (of something) to be larger than another thing in size, amount, or number.
definition.zh: （某物）在尺寸、数量或程度上比另一物更大。

examples.en: The living room outsizes the bedroom by almost 100 square feet.
examples.zh: 客厅比卧室大将近100平方英尺。

examples.en: In this market, demand outsizes supply.
examples.zh: 在这个市场里，需求大于供给。

definition.en: larger than usual; bigger than a standard size.
definition.zh: 比通常更大的；超出标准尺寸的。

examples.en: He wore an outsize coat that looked a bit too big on him.
examples.zh: 他穿了一件特大号外套，看起来有点宽大。

examples.en: The project had an outsize influence on the company’s future.
examples.zh: 这个项目对公司的未来产生了格外巨大的影响。

extraExplanation: “Outsize”既可作动词（outsize = be larger than），也可作形容词（outsize = unusually large）。在日常口语中，形容词用法更常见，尤其在搭配“outsize influence/role/impact（巨大的影响/作用）”时，常带有“远超一般程度”的含义。
与“oversize”相比：两者都可表示“过大/特大”。“Oversize”在服装尺码、包装、行李等具体“尺寸超标”的语境更常见；“outsize”更常用来强调“格外巨大（尤其是抽象影响力）”。

summary.en: Outsized means disproportionately large, especially in influence or impact.
summary.zh: outsized 表示“过大、超出常规且不成比例的”，常形容影响力或作用特别大。

definition.en: Much larger than normal or than expected; disproportionately big in size, amount, or influence.
definition.zh: 比正常或预期大很多的；“过大”的、不成比例的（可指尺寸、数量或影响力）。

examples.en: The company has an outsized influence on the local economy.
examples.zh: 这家公司对当地经济有着过大的影响力。

examples.en: Her outsized confidence helped her speak up in meetings.
examples.zh: 她过强的自信帮助她在会议中敢于发言。

examples.en: An outsized backpack looked awkward on the small child.
examples.zh: 一个过大的背包背在那个小孩子身上显得很别扭。

extraExplanation: “outsized”常用来形容“影响力/作用”过大，而不一定是真正的物理尺寸大：outsized influence / role / impact 都很常见，带有“不成比例”的语感。
构词上是 out-（超过）+ sized（有某种尺寸的），语气比单纯的 “big/large” 更强调“超出常规、比例失衡”。
常见搭配：outsized impact（过大的影响）、outsized role（不成比例的重要角色）、outsized personality（个性张扬/存在感很强，语境可褒可贬）。

summary.en: Outsize means “unusually large,” and as a verb it means “to be larger than something else.”
summary.zh: outsize 表示“异常大、特大号”；作动词表示“比……更大（在尺寸上超过）”。

definition.en: (verb) To be larger than something else; to exceed something in size.
definition.zh: （动词）比……更大；在尺寸上超过……。

examples.en: The new stadium outsizes the old one by thousands of seats.
examples.zh: 新体育场比旧体育场多出数千个座位，规模更大。

examples.en: In some markets, one company outsizes its rivals and can set lower prices.
examples.zh: 在一些市场里，一家公司规模远超竞争对手，因此可以定更低的价格。

definition.en: (adjective) Unusually large; bigger than what is typical or expected.
definition.zh: （形容词）异常大的；大得超出常见或预期的。

examples.en: He wore an outsize coat that looked too big on him.
examples.zh: 他穿着一件超大号的外套，看起来不太合身。

examples.en: The project became an outsize success after the video went viral.
examples.zh: 视频走红后，这个项目获得了超乎寻常的成功。

definition.en: (noun) An unusually large size, especially in clothing.
definition.zh: （名词）（尤指服装的）特大号；超大尺寸。

examples.en: Do you carry outsizes in this jacket?
examples.zh: 这款夹克你们有特大号吗？

examples.en: The shop has a small section for outsizes.
examples.zh: 这家店有一小块区域卖特大号。

extraExplanation: “outsizes”通常是动词“outsize”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outsizes）。例如：This building outsizes that one.
在服装语境中，英式英语里“outsize(s)”更常见；美式英语里更常说“plus-size / big and tall / oversized”（根据具体语境不同）。

summary.en: Outskate means to skate better or faster than someone else, especially in hockey or speed skating.
summary.zh: Outskate 指在滑冰方面（尤其是冰球或速度滑冰）滑得比别人更好或更快，从而胜过对方。

definition.en: to skate better or faster than someone else; to beat someone in skating by having more skill, speed, or stamina
definition.zh: 在滑冰方面胜过（某人）；滑得更快/更好，从而在滑冰中击败（某人）

examples.en: She outskated everyone in the final lap and won the race.
examples.zh: 她在最后一圈滑得比所有人都快，赢得了比赛。

examples.en: He outskated his opponent with sharper turns and better balance.
examples.zh: 他用更利落的转弯和更好的平衡能力在滑冰上胜过了对手。

examples.en: Our team was outskated in the first period, so we had to play smarter.
examples.zh: 我们队在第一节被对手滑得更快，所以我们必须打得更聪明。

definition.en: to skate beyond a certain point or area; to skate past something (less common)
definition.zh: 滑过某个界限/区域；滑过（某处）（较少见）

examples.en: Be careful not to outskate the marked boundary on the ice.
examples.zh: 小心别滑出冰面上标出的边界。

examples.en: They outskated the safe area and were told to return.
examples.zh: 他们滑出了安全区域，被要求返回。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“比……更……/超过……”。所以 outskate = skate 得比别人更好/更快。类似的词还有 outplay（在比赛中胜过）、outperform（表现更好）、outsmart（更机智）。

summary.en: Outskill means to surpass someone in skill, and in business contexts it can also mean to raise people’s skills to a higher level.
summary.zh: Outskill 指“在技能上胜过他人”，在职场语境中也可指“把技能提升到更高水平”。

definition.en: to be more skilled than someone else; to surpass someone in ability
definition.zh: 比别人更有技能；在能力上胜过（某人）

examples.en: She outskills most players her age.
examples.zh: 她的水平超过了大多数同龄选手。

examples.en: In negotiations, he often outskilled his opponents.
examples.zh: 在谈判中，他常常在技巧上胜过对手。

definition.en: to train people so they gain higher-level skills (especially for a new job or changing industry)
definition.zh: 提升技能；使具备更高层次技能（尤用于就业或行业转型）

examples.en: The company is outskilling its staff to use AI tools effectively.
examples.zh: 公司正在提升员工技能，以便有效使用 AI 工具。

examples.en: Governments are investing in programs to outskill workers for green jobs.
examples.zh: 政府正在投资相关项目，提升劳动者技能以适应绿色岗位。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart、outperform）。因此 outskill 在结构上就是“在技能上胜过”。
在职场语境里，outskill 有时被用作企业用语，表示“把员工技能提升到更高水平”。这和更常见的 upskill（提升技能）很接近，但 outskill 更强调“达到更高、领先的水平”。

summary.en: Outskip means to surpass someone by skipping (literally), and sometimes to outdo or go beyond (figuratively).
summary.zh: Outskip 指在跳跃/蹦跳时超过别人；也可比喻为超越、胜过。

definition.en: to skip farther or faster than someone or something; to surpass in skipping
definition.zh: （在跳跃或蹦跳时）跳得更远/更快；在跳跃方面胜过

examples.en: In the playground game, Mia outskipped everyone by a full step.
examples.zh: 在操场游戏里，米娅每一步都比别人跳得更远。

examples.en: The young deer outskipped the older ones and reached the stream first.
examples.zh: 小鹿比年长的鹿跳得更快，先到了溪边。

definition.en: (figurative) to surpass or go beyond; to outdo
definition.zh: （比喻）超越；胜过；做得更好

examples.en: Her new novel outskipped her earlier work in both style and confidence.
examples.zh: 她的新小说在文风和自信度上都超越了早期作品。

examples.en: The team hopes to outskip last year’s results with a stronger season.
examples.zh: 球队希望用更强的赛季表现超越去年的成绩。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力、outsmart 更聪明地胜过）。因此 outskip 字面就是“跳得比……更厉害”。
outskip 比较少见，更常见的表达是 “outjump”（跳得更高/更远）或 “skip past”（跳过/略过）。在写作里用 outskip 会显得更生动、带一点口语或文学色彩。

summary.en: “Outskipped” means “skipped past or surpassed,” literally by skipping or figuratively by exceeding.
summary.zh: “Outskipped”表示“（通过跳跃）超过/甩开”，也可比喻为“胜过、超出”。

definition.en: (Past tense/past participle of **outskip**) to skip faster, farther, or more lightly than someone else; to outpace someone by skipping.
definition.zh: （**outskip** 的过去式/过去分词）跳跃得比别人更快、更远或更轻快；通过蹦跳超过（别人）。

examples.en: The child outskipped everyone in the playground race.
examples.zh: 那个孩子在操场比赛中蹦跳着超过了所有人。

examples.en: She outskipped her brother and reached the gate first.
examples.zh: 她比哥哥跳得更快，先到达了大门。

definition.en: (Figurative) to surpass or do better than someone/something.
definition.zh: （比喻）胜过；超过（某人/某事）。

examples.en: His confidence outskipped his experience.
examples.zh: 他的自信超过了他的经验。

examples.en: The project’s demands outskipped our resources.
examples.zh: 项目的需求超过了我们的资源。

extraExplanation: “outskipped”比较少见，日常英语更常用 outpace / outrun / surpass 来表达“超过”。不过在描写动作（尤其是孩子、轻快步伐、童话或诗意叙述）时，用 outskip 会更形象。
前缀 out- 常表示“比……更、超过……”，如 outsmart（智胜）、outgrow（长得比……快/大）、outnumber（数量超过）。

summary.en: Outskipping means surpassing someone by skipping faster/farther, or (figuratively) outpacing them.
summary.zh: outskipping 指在跳跃上胜过他人，也可比喻为在进度或表现上超越对方。

definition.en: to skip faster, farther, or more times than someone or something; to surpass in skipping
definition.zh: 在跳跃（蹦跳、跳绳等）方面比……更快、更远或次数更多；在跳跃上胜过

examples.en: She kept outskipping the other children in the playground race.
examples.zh: 在操场比赛中，她一直比其他孩子跳得更快、更厉害。

examples.en: With long legs, the deer was outskipping the dogs across the field.
examples.zh: 那只鹿腿很长，在田野上跳跃奔跑时把狗甩在了后面。

definition.en: (figurative) to outpace or outperform someone; to move ahead more quickly
definition.zh: （比喻）超过、胜过；更快地领先

examples.en: In the first quarter, the startup was outskipping its competitors in user growth.
examples.zh: 在第一季度，这家初创公司在用户增长方面超过了竞争对手。

examples.en: Don’t rush—steady effort can beat outskipping at the start.
examples.zh: 别急——稳定的努力往往能胜过一开始就冲得太猛。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outskip 字面就是“跳得比……更厉害”，也很自然地引申为“在进度/表现上领先”。
“outskipping”是动词 outskip 的现在分词/动名词形式，可用于进行时（was outskipping）或作名词用法（Outskipping others takes practice）。

summary.en: Outskirmish means to defeat or outperform an opponent in a small, brief clash.
summary.zh: outskirmish 指在小规模、短暂的冲突中击败或胜过对手。

definition.en: to defeat or do better than an opponent in a skirmish (a small, short fight or clash)
definition.zh: 在小规模冲突（遭遇战）中击败或胜过对手

examples.en: The patrol outskirmished the raiders and forced them to retreat.
examples.zh: 巡逻队在遭遇战中击退了袭击者，迫使他们撤退。

examples.en: They hoped to outskirmish their rivals through faster scouting and smarter tactics.
examples.zh: 他们希望通过更快的侦察和更聪明的战术，在小规模交锋中胜过对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork, outsmart）。因此 outskirmish 的核心意思就是“在小规模交战中胜过对方”。
skirmish 指短暂、规模较小的冲突（军事、政治或口头争执都可用），因此 outskirmish 多见于较正式或描写性语境，而日常口语更常说 “beat/defeat them in a skirmish”。

summary.en: Someone who outdoes an opponent in skirmishing—small, quick conflicts, literal or figurative.
summary.zh: 在遭遇战/小冲突（也可引申为小争执）中胜过对手的人。

definition.en: a person, group, or unit that defeats or surpasses another in light, scattered fighting (skirmishing), usually by being more agile, tactical, or persistent
definition.zh: 在小规模、零散的交战（遭遇战/小冲突）中胜过对手的人、团体或部队；常指更灵活、更善于战术或更持久的一方

examples.en: The scouts became the outskirmishers, forcing the enemy to retreat before the main battle began.
examples.zh: 侦察兵成了“更擅长遭遇战的一方”，在主战开始前就迫使敌军后撤。

examples.en: In the debate, she was the outskirmisher—quick with questions and hard to pin down.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，她像“更会打游击的人”——提问迅速，让人难以抓住破绽。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“胜过、超过”（如 outsmart 胜过对方的聪明、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outskirmisher 可理解为“在 skirmish（小冲突/遭遇战）中胜过对方的人”。
skirmish 原本多用于军事语境，指主战前后的零星交火；现代也常被引申为“口角、争执、短暂交锋”。所以 outskirmisher 也可比喻“在小规模争辩中占上风的人”。
这个词比较少见，更常见的表达是 outskirmish（动词：在遭遇战中胜过）或 skirmisher（散兵/游兵）。

summary.en: Outskirts means the outer edge of a town or city, most often used as “the outskirts of + place.”
summary.zh: Outskirts 指城市或城镇的外围/边缘地带，最常见用法是 “the outskirts of + 地点”。

definition.en: the outer area of a city or town; the edge of a place (often residential or less central)
definition.zh: （城市或城镇的）郊区；边缘地带（通常离市中心较远）

examples.en: They bought a small house on the outskirts of Chicago.
examples.zh: 他们在芝加哥的郊区买了一栋小房子。

examples.en: A new shopping center is being built on the outskirts of the city.
examples.zh: 一座新的购物中心正在城市边缘地带修建。

extraExplanation: 更常见的形式是复数：the outskirts of + 地点，表示“某地的郊外/边缘”。单数 outskirt 较少单独使用；学习时建议掌握固定搭配 the outskirts。
相关区别：suburb（郊区，常指有明确居民区、相对独立的社区）更中性；outskirts 更强调“边缘、外围”的位置感，不一定是规划好的“郊区社区”。

summary.en: Outskirter means a person who lives on the outskirts of a city or town.
summary.zh: outskirter 指住在城市或城镇郊区（边缘地带）的人。

definition.en: A person who lives on or comes from the outskirts (outer areas) of a town or city.
definition.zh: 住在城镇或城市郊区（边缘地带）的人；来自郊区的人。

examples.en: As an outskirter, she rarely goes downtown except for work.
examples.zh: 作为一个住在郊区的人，她除了上班很少去市中心。

examples.en: The outskirters felt the new subway line would finally connect them to the city.
examples.zh: 郊区居民觉得新地铁线路终于能把他们和城市连起来。

extraExplanation: “outskirter”并不是非常常见的标准词汇，更常见的说法是“a person who lives on the outskirts”“suburban resident（郊区居民）”或在英式英语里用“outsider（局外人）”但含义不同。“outskirter”由“outskirts（郊区/边缘地带）+ -er（……的人）”构成，属于按规则造出来、但实际使用频率较低的词。

summary.en: “Outskirts” means the outer areas of a city or the outer edge of something.
summary.zh: “outskirts”指城市的郊区/边缘地带，也可指某事物的外围或边缘。

definition.en: the outer areas of a town or city, away from the center
definition.zh: （城镇或城市的）郊区；边缘地带

examples.en: They live on the outskirts of Chicago, where it’s quieter.
examples.zh: 他们住在芝加哥的郊区，那儿更安静。

examples.en: A small factory sits on the outskirts of town.
examples.zh: 镇子边缘有一家小工厂。

definition.en: the outer edge or less important part of something (often used with “of”)
definition.zh: （事物的）边缘；外围（常与 of 连用）

examples.en: He stayed on the outskirts of the conversation and didn’t say much.
examples.zh: 他一直在谈话的边缘，没怎么说话。

examples.en: The village lies on the outskirts of the forest.
examples.zh: 那个村庄位于森林边缘。

extraExplanation: “Outskirts”通常以复数形式出现（the outskirts），即使指的是一个地区。它来自“out-（外）+ skirt（边缘/下摆）”，把城市想象成有“边缘/衣摆”的整体，因此用来形容“外圈”。
常见搭配：on the outskirts of + 地名/地点（在……郊区/边缘）；live on the outskirts（住在郊区）；industrial outskirts（工业区边缘）。

summary.en: Outlander means a foreigner or outsider; it’s also the name of the series “Outlander.”
summary.zh: Outlander 指外地人/外国人/外来者；也可指《Outlander》这部作品。

definition.en: a person who comes from another country or place; a foreigner or outsider
definition.zh: 外地人；外国人；外来者

examples.en: In the village, he was treated like an outlander at first.
examples.zh: 在那个村子里，一开始他被当作外来人对待。

examples.en: The story follows an outlander trying to understand local customs.
examples.zh: 故事讲的是一位外来者努力理解当地风俗。

examples.en: As an outlander, she asked politely before taking photos.
examples.zh: 作为外来者，她在拍照前会礼貌地询问。

definition.en: (often capitalized) a person who is far from home; also the title/term associated with the novel/TV series “Outlander”
definition.zh: （常大写）远离家乡的人；也指小说/电视剧《Outlander》的名称或相关用语

examples.en: I started watching Outlander last week.
examples.zh: 我上周开始看《Outlander》。

examples.en: Fans call Claire an outlander because she doesn’t belong to that time and place.
examples.zh: 粉丝称克莱尔为“outlander”，因为她不属于那个时空。

extraExplanation: “outslander”并不是常见英语单词。你可能想写的是 **outlander**（外地人/外国人），或是在指影视作品 **Outlander**。如果你能告诉我你看到它的句子/上下文，我也可以帮你确认。

summary.en: Outslang means to use more slang than someone else, or to speak in an especially slangy way.
summary.zh: Outslang 指在俚语使用上超过别人，或用非常“俚语化/潮语化”的方式说话。
