definition.en: to use more slang than someone else, or to beat them at speaking in a very slangy, trendy way
definition.zh: （在说话时）用比别人更多的俚语；在使用潮语/俚语方面“胜过”别人

examples.en: He tried to impress the teens, but they outslanged him instantly.
examples.zh: 他想给青少年留下好印象，但对方立刻在俚语上“碾压”了他。

examples.en: I can’t outslang my younger cousins—they’re always ahead of the trends.
examples.zh: 我没法在俚语上赢过我的表弟表妹们——他们总是走在潮流前面。

definition.en: to describe something using a lot of slang (often for humor or style)
definition.zh: 用大量俚语来描述某事（常为幽默或风格化表达）

examples.en: The narrator outslangs the whole story, making it feel casual and street-smart.
examples.zh: 叙述者全程用很多俚语来讲故事，让整体感觉更随意、更“街头”。

extraExplanation: “out-”在英语里常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart 胜过某人更聪明地应对；outperform 表现更好）。因此 outslang 是由 out- + slang 构成的口语化造词，多见于非正式语境、网络或幽默表达。
这个词不算标准高频词，更常见的说法是：use more slang than someone / be more slangy / talk more street than someone。

summary.en: “Outsleep” means to sleep longer than someone else, and it can also mean to oversleep (often as “outsleep oneself”).
summary.zh: “Outsleep”表示“比别人睡得更久”，也可表示“睡过头”（常见为“outsleep oneself”）。

definition.en: to sleep longer than someone else (often so you wake up later than them).
definition.zh: 比别人睡得更久（常指醒得比对方晚）。

examples.en: On weekends, I usually outsleep my brother by an hour.
examples.zh: 周末我通常比我弟弟多睡一小时。

examples.en: She outslept everyone on the trip and missed breakfast.
examples.zh: 旅行时她比所有人都睡得久，结果错过了早餐。

definition.en: to sleep too long; to oversleep (often used as “outsleep oneself,” especially in older or formal English).
definition.zh: 睡过头；睡得太久（常见用法为“outsleep oneself”，偏较旧或较正式）。

examples.en: He outslept himself and arrived late to class.
examples.zh: 他睡过头，上课迟到了。

examples.en: I must not outsleep tomorrow—my flight is early.
examples.zh: 我明天可不能睡过头——我的航班很早。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过/胜过”，如 outwork（比别人更努力工作）、outlive（比……活得更久）。因此 outsleep 的核心就是“在睡这件事上超过别人”。
日常口语里表达“睡过头”更常用 oversleep（I overslept.）。outsleep 表达“比别人睡得更久”更自然；表示“睡过头”时多见于较旧/较正式的用法（outsleep oneself）。

summary.en: “Outsleeping” means sleeping longer than others or still being asleep when others wake up.
summary.zh: “outsleeping”表示比别人睡得更久，或别人醒来时你还在睡。

definition.en: sleep longer than someone else; remain asleep while others wake up.
definition.zh: 比别人睡得更久；别人醒来时你还在睡。

examples.en: On weekends, I’m usually outsleeping my roommates.
examples.zh: 周末我通常比室友睡得更久。

examples.en: She was still outsleeping everyone when the breakfast dishes were already on the table.
examples.zh: 早餐餐具都摆上桌了，她还在睡，比大家都睡得更久。

definition.en: (describing an action) being in the process of sleeping longer than others.
definition.zh: （作描述）正在比别人睡得更久、还没醒来。

examples.en: I missed the early meeting because I was outsleeping my alarm.
examples.zh: 我错过了早会，因为我睡过头了，连闹钟都没听到。

examples.en: The kids were outsleeping the adults after the long hike.
examples.zh: 长途徒步后，孩子们睡得比大人更久。

extraExplanation: “outsleep”由前缀 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ sleep 组成，常见于轻松口吻或非正式表达，意思是“比别人睡更久”。
口语中更常用的说法是 “sleep in”（睡懒觉）或 “oversleep”（睡过头）。其中 oversleep 强调“睡过头导致迟到/误事”，而 outsleep 更强调“比别人睡得久”。

summary.en: “outsleeps” means “sleeps longer than others” or “sleeps past something and misses it.”
summary.zh: “outsleeps”指“比别人睡得更久”，也可指“睡过头错过某事”。

definition.en: to sleep longer than someone else; to still be asleep after others wake up
definition.zh: 比别人睡得更久；别人醒来时仍在睡

examples.en: On weekends, he outsleeps everyone in the house.
examples.zh: 周末他比家里所有人都睡得更久。

examples.en: She usually outsleeps her alarm and wakes up late.
examples.zh: 她通常会睡过闹钟，结果起晚了。

definition.en: to sleep through a time period and miss something (like an event or deadline)
definition.zh: 睡过头而错过（活动、约定或期限）

examples.en: He outsleeps the morning meeting if he stays up too late.
examples.zh: 如果他熬夜太晚，早上的会议就会睡过头错过。

examples.en: I’m worried I’ll outsleep my flight if I don’t set a second alarm.
examples.zh: 我担心如果不设第二个闹钟，会睡过头错过航班。

extraExplanation: “outsleeps”是动词“outsleep”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outsleeps）。常见结构：outsleep + someone（比某人睡得久），outsleep + alarm/meeting/flight（睡过头错过…）。
前缀“out-”常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outgrow 长得超过/不再适用）。

summary.en: “Outslept” means you slept longer than others or slept past an alarm/time and missed it.
summary.zh: “outslept”表示你比别人睡得更久，或睡过头错过闹钟/时间。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “outsleep”: to sleep longer than someone else.
definition.zh: “outsleep”的过去式和过去分词：比别人睡得更久。

examples.en: On the trip, I outslept everyone and missed breakfast.
examples.zh: 旅行时，我比大家都睡得久，结果错过了早餐。

examples.en: He bragged that he outslept his roommates all weekend.
examples.zh: 他夸口说整个周末他都比室友睡得久。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “outsleep”: to sleep past a time or event (often accidentally), so you miss it.
definition.zh: “outsleep”的过去式和过去分词：睡过头，导致错过某个时间或事情（常为无意）。

examples.en: I outslept my alarm and was late for class.
examples.zh: 我睡过头没听到闹钟，上课迟到了。

examples.en: She outslept the early train, so she took a later one.
examples.zh: 她睡过头错过了早班火车，只好改坐下一班。

extraExplanation: “outslept”是动词“outsleep”的过去式/过去分词，常见搭配：outsleep someone（比某人睡得久）；outsleep one’s alarm / outsleep the time（睡过头）。
近义表达（更口语）：sleep in（睡懒觉/起晚了），oversleep（睡过头）。注意：sleep in 不一定错过事情；oversleep/outsleep one’s alarm 更强调“因此迟到/错过”。

summary.en: “Outslick” means to beat someone by being slick or smooth (often in a cunning way), and less commonly to make something slicker than another thing.
summary.zh: “Outslick”指在圆滑/话术/耍滑头方面胜过别人（常含狡黠意味）；较少见时也可指让某物比另一物更光滑。

definition.en: to outdo someone in being slick, smooth, or skillful at getting what you want (often implying cunning or showy charm)
definition.zh: 在“圆滑/油嘴滑舌/做事很溜”方面胜过别人（常含“耍小聪明或靠花言巧语取胜”的意味）

examples.en: He tried to outslick the other salesman with fast talk and big promises.
examples.zh: 他想用油嘴滑舌和夸张的承诺在销售上压过另一位销售员。

examples.en: Don’t try to outslick the negotiator—she notices every trick.
examples.zh: 别想在谈判代表面前耍滑头——她什么小把戏都看得出来。

definition.en: to make something slicker or smoother than something else (less common)
definition.zh: 使某物比另一物更光滑/更顺滑（较少见）

examples.en: The new coating outslicks the old one, so the parts move more easily.
examples.zh: 新涂层比旧涂层更顺滑，所以零件运动更容易。

extraExplanation: “outslick”由前缀 out-（胜过、超过）+ slick（圆滑的；光滑的）构成，属于较少见、偏口语/修辞的动词。更常见的表达是 outsmart（智取）、outmaneuver（策略上胜过）、outtalk（靠嘴赢）。
语气上常带一点负面或不信任：强调“靠圆滑、花招、话术取胜”，而不一定是靠实力或诚意。

summary.en: “Outslid” means “slid better/farther than others,” and it’s the past form of the rare verb “outslide.”
summary.zh: “outslid”表示“滑得比别人更好/更远”，是较少见动词“outslide”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “outslide”: to slide farther, faster, or more successfully than someone or something else.
definition.zh: “outslide”的过去式和过去分词：比别人或别的东西滑得更远、更快或更顺利；在滑行方面胜过。

examples.en: On the ice, she outslid everyone in the race.
examples.zh: 在冰面上，她在比赛中滑得比所有人都好。

examples.en: The sled outslid the others because its runners were smoother.
examples.zh: 因为雪橇的滑板更光滑，它比其他雪橇滑得更远。

definition.en: figurative: to avoid or escape something by moving away smoothly or quickly.
definition.zh: （比喻）巧妙地躲开、避开某事；像“滑走”一样迅速脱身。

examples.en: With a calm answer, he outslid the most awkward question.
examples.zh: 他用冷静的回答巧妙地避开了最尴尬的问题。

extraExplanation: “outslid”来自 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ slide（滑行）。因为 slide 的不规则变化是 slide–slid–slid，所以 outslide 的过去式/过去分词也是 outslid。
这个词在日常英语中比较少见；更常用的表达是 “slid past,” “slid farther than,” 或在比喻义中用 “evaded / avoided.”

summary.en: Outslide means to slide past/out of something, or to slide better/farther than others.
summary.zh: Outslide 指“滑过/滑出”，也可指“在滑行上胜过别人（滑得更好/更远）”。

definition.en: to slide past or beyond something; to move out by sliding
definition.zh: 滑过某物；用滑动的方式滑到外面/越过

examples.en: The child outslid the shallow water and reached the deeper part of the pool.
examples.zh: 孩子滑过浅水区，到了泳池更深的地方。

examples.en: The sled outslid the track and ended up in the snow.
examples.zh: 雪橇滑出了滑道，最后停在雪地里。

definition.en: to slide better or farther than someone or something (to outperform in sliding)
definition.zh: 在滑行方面胜过（某人/某物）；滑得更好/更远

examples.en: Her skates outslid everyone else’s on the smooth ice.
examples.zh: 在光滑的冰面上，她的冰鞋比所有人都滑得更出色。

examples.en: The new wax helped the board outslide last year’s model.
examples.zh: 新的蜡让这块板比去年的型号滑得更快更远。

extraExplanation: “outslide”比较少见，更常见的表达是“slide past / slide out / outdo someone in sliding”。但它符合英语里“out- + 动词”的构词规律，表示“超过、胜过、比……更……”。
发音上重音通常落在“slide”部分：out-SLIDE。

summary.en: Outsling means to outdo someone in throwing or hurling—literally (throwing farther/better) or figuratively (surpassing in rapid ‘slinging’ of words or claims).
summary.zh: Outsling 指在投掷上胜过他人——可指字面上的投得更远/更准，也可作比喻，指在“甩出言辞或说法”等方面压过对方。

definition.en: to throw or hurl something farther or more effectively than someone else (often with a sling, or by a swinging throw)
definition.zh: （常指用投石索或甩投的方式）比别人投得更远或更准；胜过别人地投掷

examples.en: With practice, she could outsling most of the older kids at the target range.
examples.zh: 经过练习，她在靶场上投掷的水平能胜过大多数大孩子。

examples.en: The new design let the catapult outsling the older model by several meters.
examples.zh: 新设计让投石机比旧型号能投得更远，足足多出好几米。

definition.en: to surpass someone in a skill that involves slinging or rapid throwing (figurative)
definition.zh: （比喻）在“甩出/抛出”某种东西的能力上胜过别人（如快速抛出、投放等）

examples.en: In the debate, she outslinged her opponent with sharper one-liners.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，她用更犀利的妙语连珠压过了对手。

examples.en: He tried to outsling everyone with flashy claims, but the facts didn’t support him.
examples.zh: 他想用夸张的说法压过所有人，但事实并不支持他。

extraExplanation: “outsling”由前缀 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ sling（甩投、投掷）构成，属于比较口语/文学化的构词，用来强调“投得比别人更远/更强”。
sling 最初与投石索（sling）有关：用皮带或绳带甩动石块并抛出，因此 outsling 在带有“投射距离/力度”的语境里更自然。

summary.en: “Outslink” is a rare/nonstandard verb, usually in SEO, meaning to surpass another site by having more/stronger links, or to link out to another site.
summary.zh: “outslink”是少见/非标准动词，多见于SEO语境，通常指在外链/反向链接上超过别的网站，或指向外部网站进行链接。

definition.en: (Nonstandard/rare) To beat or surpass another website or page by having more or stronger links (especially backlinks).
definition.zh: （非标准/少见用法）在链接数量或质量上（尤其是外链/反向链接）超过另一个网站或页面。

examples.en: Their blog started to outslink competitors after several major sites referenced it.
examples.zh: 在几个大型网站引用他们之后，他们的博客开始在外链上超过竞争对手。

examples.en: To outslink a rival, focus on earning trustworthy backlinks, not spammy ones.
examples.zh: 要在外链上超过对手，应专注获取可信的反向链接，而不是垃圾链接。

definition.en: (Sometimes used) To link to something on another website; to create an outbound link.
definition.zh: （有时会这样用）链接到其他网站的内容；创建一个站外链接。

examples.en: The article outslinks to the original study for readers who want details.
examples.zh: 这篇文章链接到原始研究，方便想看细节的读者。

extraExplanation:
“outslink”不是常见标准词，更常见的相关词是：
- outlink（动词/名词）：在网页上“外链”到别的网站；或“外链/站外链接”本身。
- backlink：其他网站指向你的网站的链接（反向链接）。
如果你是在SEO语境里看到“outslink”，通常是非正式说法，意思接近“在外链/反向链接上胜过对手”。
如果你能提供原句（你在哪里看到这个词），我可以判断它是不是拼写错误（例如 outlink / outshine / outstrip）以及更准确的意思。

summary.en: Outslip means to slip out/escape quietly, or (rarely) to slip ahead of others.
summary.zh: outslip 指悄悄溜走/逃开；也可（较少见）指轻巧地超过别人。

definition.en: to slip out or escape quietly and quickly (often without being noticed)
definition.zh: 悄悄溜走；不被注意地逃开

examples.en: She outslipped the crowd and left before anyone noticed.
examples.zh: 她悄悄从人群中溜走，在没人注意前就离开了。

examples.en: The cat outslipped through the open window.
examples.zh: 那只猫从开着的窗户悄悄溜了出去。

definition.en: to move past someone by slipping ahead; to outpace in a quick, smooth way (rare)
definition.zh: （迅速、轻巧地）溜到前面；超过（较少见）

examples.en: In the final seconds, he outslipped two runners to take the lead.
examples.zh: 最后几秒，他轻巧地超过两名选手，取得领先。

extraExplanation: “out-”常表示“超过”或“向外、脱离”，而“slip”是“滑动/溜走”。“outslip”在现代英语里不算常用，更常见的说法是“slip out”“sneak out”“get away”。在文学或较旧的文字中，你可能会见到它用来强调“悄无声息、动作轻快地脱身”。

summary.en: “Outsmart” means to beat someone by being cleverer or more strategic.
summary.zh: “outsmart”表示用更聪明或更有策略的方式击败/胜过对方。

definition.en: to defeat someone by being cleverer, thinking faster, or planning better
definition.zh: （靠更聪明、更快的思考或更好的计划）智胜；胜过

examples.en: She outsmarted her opponents by predicting their next move.
examples.zh: 她预测到对手的下一步行动，从而智胜了他们。

examples.en: The detective outsmarted the thief with a simple trick.
examples.zh: 侦探用一个简单的计策智胜了小偷。

examples.en: I tried to outsmart the system, but it didn’t work.
examples.zh: 我试着钻系统的空子，但没有成功。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（比如 outwork 比别人更努力地工作，outnumber 在数量上超过）。因此 outsmart 字面意思就是“在聪明/机智方面胜过”。
outsmart 常用于强调“策略、机智上的胜利”，语气可以是中性的（善意地比对方更会想办法），也可能带一点“耍手段、钻空子”的意味，需看语境。

summary.en: “Outsmarted” means someone was beaten or tricked because another person was smarter or more strategic.
summary.zh: “outsmarted”表示“被人用更聪明/更有策略的方式击败或骗过”，即“被智胜”。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “outsmart”: to defeat or gain an advantage over someone by being more clever, strategic, or quick-thinking.
definition.zh: “outsmart”的过去式/过去分词：用更聪明、更有策略或更机敏的方式战胜某人；智胜某人。

examples.en: She outsmarted her opponent by changing her plan at the last minute.
examples.zh: 她在最后一刻改变计划，智胜了对手。

examples.en: The detective outsmarted the thief and recovered the stolen necklace.
examples.zh: 侦探智胜了小偷，找回了被盗的项链。

examples.en: I thought I could outsmart the system, but it didn’t work.
examples.zh: 我以为我能“钻空子”骗过系统，但没有成功。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 人数超过，outperform 表现更好）。outsmart 强调“在聪明/策略上胜过”。
日常语境中，outsmart 有时也带一点“耍小聪明、钻空子”的意味，是否偏负面取决于语境。

summary.en: Outsmarting means defeating someone by being cleverer or using a smarter strategy; it can also mean the act of doing so.
summary.zh: outsmarting 指用更聪明或更高明的策略智胜对方；也可指这种“智胜”的行为/过程。

definition.en: present participle of outsmart: defeating someone or gaining an advantage by being cleverer, thinking faster, or using a smart strategy (sometimes by tricking them).
definition.zh: outsmart 的现在分词：用更聪明、更快的思考或巧妙策略战胜对方、占上风（有时带点“耍聪明/骗过”的意味）。

examples.en: She’s outsmarting her competitors with better data and faster decisions.
examples.zh: 她用更好的数据和更快的决策正在智胜竞争对手。

examples.en: The detective kept outsmarting the thief at every turn.
examples.zh: 侦探在每个关键点上都不断智胜小偷。

examples.en: He tried outsmarting the system, but the rules were updated.
examples.zh: 他试图钻系统的空子，但规则更新了。

definition.en: the act or process of outsmarting someone (used like a noun/gerund).
definition.zh: 智胜他人的行为或过程（作动名词用）。

examples.en: Outsmarting your rivals isn’t just about IQ—it’s about preparation.
examples.zh: 智胜对手不只是智商问题，更是准备是否充分。

examples.en: His outsmarting of the guard relied on patience and timing.
examples.zh: 他能骗过守卫，靠的是耐心和时机。

extraExplanation: “out-”在英语里常表示“超过/胜过”（如 outperform 表现胜过，outnumber 数量超过）。outsmarting 强调在“聪明/策略”层面胜过别人。
语气上不一定是负面的：在比赛、谈判、解谜里可中性或褒义；但在“outsmarting the system（钻空子）”这类搭配里，常带有不太正当或投机取巧的暗示。

summary.en: “outsmarts” means to win against someone by being more clever or better prepared.
summary.zh: “outsmarts”指用更聪明或更周全的方式战胜对方、智胜。

definition.en: to defeat or get an advantage over someone by being more clever, planning better, or thinking faster
definition.zh: 用更聪明的办法、更好的计划或更快的反应战胜（某人）；智胜

examples.en: She outsmarts her opponents by staying calm and thinking ahead.
examples.zh: 她通过保持冷静、提前思考来智胜对手。

examples.en: The detective outsmarts the suspect with a simple but clever question.
examples.zh: 侦探用一个简单却巧妙的问题智胜嫌疑人。

examples.en: Our team outsmarts the competition by understanding what customers really need.
examples.zh: 我们团队通过真正理解客户需求来胜过竞争对手。

extraExplanation: “outsmarts”是动词“outsmart”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outsmarts）。结构来自前缀 out-（超过、胜过）+ smart（聪明的），常带有“靠计谋/头脑取胜”的感觉。

summary.en: Outsmell means to smell stronger than something else or to have a better sense of smell than someone/something.
summary.zh: outsmell 指气味更浓、盖过别的味道，或嗅觉更灵敏、能比别人/别的动物更容易嗅出气味。

definition.en: to have a stronger smell than something else; to smell more strongly
definition.zh: （气味）比……更浓；更有味道

examples.en: The garlic outsmelled everything else in the kitchen.
examples.zh: 大蒜的味道盖过了厨房里其他所有味道。

examples.en: This cheese can outsmell the whole fridge if you don’t wrap it well.
examples.zh: 这种奶酪如果不包好，味道能把整个冰箱都熏到。

definition.en: to be better at smelling or detecting smells than someone or something
definition.zh: 比……更擅长闻到/嗅出气味；嗅觉更灵敏

examples.en: A trained dog can outsmell humans by a huge margin.
examples.zh: 受过训练的狗在嗅觉上能远远胜过人类。

examples.en: The fox tried to hide, but the hounds outsmelled it quickly.
examples.zh: 狐狸想躲起来，但猎犬很快就嗅出了它的踪迹。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。类似结构还有 outwork（比……更努力/干得更多）、outnumber（数量超过）、outperform（表现胜过）。

summary.en: Outsmile means to smile more brightly or confidently than someone else—often to show positivity or win attention.
summary.zh: Outsmile 指“笑得比别人更灿烂/更自信”，常用来强调积极、吸引注意或在气势上胜过他人。

definition.en: to smile more brightly, more confidently, or for longer than someone else; to surpass someone in smiling
definition.zh: 比别人笑得更灿烂/更自信/更久；在微笑上胜过某人

examples.en: Even under pressure, she managed to outsmile everyone in the room.
examples.zh: 即使在压力下，她仍然能笑得比房间里所有人都更灿烂。

examples.en: He tried to outsmile his opponent for the cameras.
examples.zh: 为了镜头，他试图用更自信的微笑压过对手。

examples.en: We can’t outsmile the problem—we have to solve it.
examples.zh: 我们不能靠笑容掩盖问题——必须把问题解决。

extraExplanation: “outsmile”是由前缀“out-”（表示“胜过、超过”）+“smile”构成的合成动词，意思类似于“outshine（胜过、比……更出色）”。它在日常口语中不算特别常见，但在写作、新闻标题或强调对比时很形象。
常见搭配：outsmile someone / outsmile the crowd。也可以用于比喻：表示“用笑容掩盖或压过某种情绪/困境”（如例句3）。

summary.en: Outsmiled means “smiled more/better than someone,” or figuratively “stayed cheerful in spite of difficulty.”
summary.zh: Outsmiled 意为“笑得比别人更灿烂/更讨喜”，也可比喻“在困难中仍保持微笑与乐观”。

definition.en: (past tense of outsmile) To smile more brightly, confidently, or pleasantly than someone else; to surpass someone by smiling.
definition.zh: （outsmile 的过去式）笑得比别人更灿烂、更自信或更讨喜；用微笑胜过对方。

examples.en: Even when he was nervous, he outsmiled everyone in the room.
examples.zh: 即使他很紧张，他还是笑得比房间里的所有人都更灿烂。

examples.en: She outsmiled her rival during the interview and seemed more relaxed.
examples.zh: 面试时她笑得比竞争对手更自然，看起来也更放松。

definition.en: To remain cheerful or friendly despite a difficult situation; to “smile through” something and appear stronger than it (figurative).
definition.zh: 在困难处境中仍保持乐观或友好；用微笑“扛过去”，表现得比困境更强（比喻）。

examples.en: After the bad news, he outsmiled the moment and thanked everyone for their support.
examples.zh: 听到坏消息后，他还是带着微笑面对当下，并感谢大家的支持。

examples.en: They outsmiled the stress of the long trip and kept encouraging each other.
examples.zh: 他们用微笑化解长途旅行的压力，互相鼓励。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 工作得比…更努力，outperform 表现优于…）。因此 outsmile 字面意思就是“笑得比…更好/更多”。
“outsmiled”多见于叙述或描写性语境（小说、采访报道等），强调一种无声的竞争或气场压过对方；口语里也常用更简单的表达，如 smiled more than / had the bigger smile。

summary.en: Outsmile means to surpass someone by smiling more brightly or confidently.
summary.zh: Outsmile 指用更灿烂或更自信的微笑胜过对方。

definition.en: to smile more brightly, confidently, or convincingly than someone else; to defeat or surpass someone by smiling
definition.zh: （在微笑上）比别人更灿烂、更自信或更有说服力；用微笑压过对方

examples.en: Even when he was criticized, he outsmiled everyone and stayed calm.
examples.zh: 即使被批评，他也用更自信的微笑压过所有人，保持冷静。

examples.en: She tried to outsmile her nerves before the interview.
examples.zh: 面试前，她努力用微笑压住紧张。

definition.en: (of a smile) to appear or be more noticeable than another expression, often in writing or description
definition.zh: （描写中）某个微笑“胜过/盖过”另一种表情，更明显地显现出来

examples.en: A small grin outsmiled his irritation as he read the message.
examples.zh: 他看短信时，一丝笑意盖过了他的烦躁。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 工作更努力、outsmart 更聪明地胜过）。因此 outsmile 直观意思就是“在微笑这件事上胜过别人”。
你输入的 outsmiles 通常是第三人称单数（He/She outsmiles…）或名词复数形式的误用；词典形式一般写作 outsmile。

summary.en: Outsmiling means smiling more than someone else, often to outdo them or seem more positive.
summary.zh: Outsmiling 指“比别人笑得更多/更灿烂”，常用于比较或表示想用更积极的态度胜过对方。

definition.en: (present participle of outsmile) Smiling more than someone else, often to appear friendlier, calmer, or more confident than them.
definition.zh: （outsmile 的现在分词）比别人笑得更多，常指为了显得更友好、更镇定或更自信。

examples.en: She kept outsmiling her competitors during the interview.
examples.zh: 在面试中，她一直比竞争者笑得更灿烂。

examples.en: He tried to win the argument by outsmiling everyone in the room.
examples.zh: 他试图用比在场所有人都更会笑的方式来赢得争论。

definition.en: (adjectival use) Showing the act of smiling more than others; wearing a noticeably brighter smile.
definition.zh: （作形容词用）呈现出“比别人更会笑/笑得更灿烂”的状态；笑容格外明显。

examples.en: In the photo, the outsmiling child stands in the center.
examples.zh: 照片里，那个笑得最灿烂的孩子站在中间。

examples.en: Her outsmiling confidence made people relax.
examples.zh: 她那种“笑得更自信”的气场让大家放松下来。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outperform 表现更好）。因此 outsmile 直译就是“笑得比别人更厉害/更灿烂”。
outsmile/outsmiling 不算特别常见，更多出现在叙述、描写或比较语境里；日常口语里也可以用 smile more than 或 have the biggest smile 来表达相近意思。

summary.en: Outsmoke means to surpass someone or something by smoking more or producing more smoke; it can also mean to beat someone at smoking food (barbecue).
summary.zh: Outsmoke 指在吸烟量或冒烟程度上超过别人/别的东西；在烧烤语境中也可指熏制食物的效果更胜一筹。

definition.en: to smoke more (cigarettes, etc.) than someone else; to surpass someone in how much they smoke
definition.zh: （在吸烟量上）比别人抽得更多；在吸烟方面胜过别人

examples.en: He can outsmoke almost anyone at the party.
examples.zh: 在派对上，他几乎能在吸烟量上胜过任何人。

examples.en: She joked that her old friends could outsmoke her back in college.
examples.zh: 她开玩笑说，她大学时的老朋友抽烟量能比她大。

definition.en: to produce more smoke than something else (e.g., a fire or engine); to smoke more heavily
definition.zh: 冒出比另一物更多的烟；烟更大（如火、引擎等）

examples.en: This old grill outsmokes my newer one.
examples.zh: 这台旧烤炉冒烟比我那台新的更大。

examples.en: The truck outsmoked the cars around it as it climbed the hill.
examples.zh: 卡车上坡时冒烟比周围的车更严重。

definition.en: (barbecue/cooking) to smoke food better than someone else; to beat someone in smoked flavor or results
definition.zh: （烧烤/烹饪）在熏制食物的味道或效果上胜过别人

examples.en: He’s proud that he can outsmoke his neighbors at weekend cookouts.
examples.zh: 他很得意，说自己周末烧烤时熏制水平能胜过邻居。

examples.en: They tried to outsmoke each other with different wood chips.
examples.zh: 他们用不同的木屑互相比拼谁熏出来更好。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 工作更努力、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outsmoke 直观意思就是“在冒烟/吸烟这件事上超过”。
这个词在日常口语里不算高频；写作时如果想更自然，也可以用“smoke more than … / produce more smoke than …”。

summary.en: Outsmoked means “smoked more than others” or, in barbecue talk, “produced better smoke flavor than a rival.”
summary.zh: outsmoked 表示“抽得比别人更多”，也可用于烧烤语境指“烟熏风味更胜一筹”。

definition.en: (past tense/participle of outsmoke) to smoke more than someone else; to be the heavier smoker in comparison.
definition.zh: （outsmoke 的过去式/过去分词）比别人抽得更多；在抽烟量上胜过别人。

examples.en: At the party, he outsmoked everyone and left the room smelling like cigarettes.
examples.zh: 在聚会上，他抽得比所有人都多，离开时整个人都有烟味。

examples.en: She used to outsmoke her friends in college, but she quit later.
examples.zh: 她大学时曾经比朋友们抽得都多，但后来戒了。

definition.en: (informal, especially in barbecue/cooking) to produce better smoke flavor than another cook or smoker; to “smoke better” than a rival.
definition.zh: （非正式，尤指烧烤/烹饪）在熏制风味上胜过别人；熏得更香、更到位。

examples.en: Their brisket was good, but the next team outsmoked them with richer smoke flavor.
examples.zh: 他们的牛胸肉不错，但下一队的烟熏风味更浓郁，把他们比下去了。

examples.en: We outsmoked the competition by using oak and keeping the temperature steady.
examples.zh: 我们用橡木并保持温度稳定，在比赛里熏得更出色。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力，outplay 技术更胜一筹）。所以 outsmoke 字面意思就是“在抽烟/熏制上超过对方”。
在烧烤语境里，outsmoked 通常不是字面“抽烟”，而是指“烟熏效果、风味更好”。具体含义要看上下文。

summary.en: “Outsmokes” means “smokes more than” or “produces more smoke than”; it can also be used in cooking (smoking food) or figuratively.
summary.zh: “outsmokes”意为“比……抽得更多/冒烟更多”，也可用于熏制食物或作比喻表达“噱头大于实质”。

definition.en: to smoke more (cigarettes, etc.) than someone else; to be a heavier smoker than
definition.zh: （在吸烟数量上）比别人抽得更多；烟瘾更大

examples.en: He outsmokes everyone in his office.
examples.zh: 他在办公室里比所有人都抽得多。

examples.en: If you’re trying to quit, avoid friends who outsmoke you.
examples.zh: 如果你在戒烟，尽量避开那些比你抽得更多的朋友。

definition.en: to produce more smoke than something else (literal or figurative)
definition.zh: （烟雾量）比另一个东西更大；（比喻）在“制造烟雾/噱头”上压过对方

examples.en: That old truck outsmokes the newer one when it starts.
examples.zh: 那辆旧卡车启动时冒的烟比新车还多。

examples.en: The flashy ad campaign outsmokes the product’s real quality.
examples.zh: 那场花哨的广告宣传噱头大于产品的真实品质。（比喻）

definition.en: (in barbecue/cooking) to smoke food longer or more intensely than another cook or recipe
definition.zh: （烧烤/烹饪）在熏制食物时比另一种做法熏得更久或更重

examples.en: Their brisket outsmokes ours by an hour.
examples.zh: 他们的牛胸肉比我们多熏了一个小时。

examples.en: This recipe outsmokes the last one, so the flavor is stronger.
examples.zh: 这个食谱比上一个熏得更重，所以味道更浓。

extraExplanation: “outsmokes”是动词“outsmoke”的第三人称单数现在时：he/she/it outsmokes。过去式/过去分词是“outsmoked”。
“out-”常表示“超过/胜过”（如 outwork, outplay）。因此 outsmoke 常用于比较：outsmoke someone/something。
口语里也会用作比喻，表示“噱头/障眼法超过实质”，但要注意语境，避免误解为鼓励吸烟。

summary.en: “Outsmoking” means surpassing others in smoking (or producing more smoke), and it can be used as a gerund/noun or as the -ing form of “outsmoke.”
summary.zh: “outsmoking”表示在吸烟量上超过别人，或（某物）冒出更多烟；既可作动名词，也可作 outsmoke 的 -ing 形式。

definition.en: the act of smoking more than someone else, or surpassing others in how much one smokes
definition.zh: （在吸烟量上）比别人吸得更多；在“吸烟”这件事上胜过他人

examples.en: He was outsmoking everyone at the party, which made the room smell awful.
examples.zh: 他在聚会上烟抽得比所有人都多，结果房间闻起来很难闻。

examples.en: Outsmoking your friends isn’t something to be proud of.
examples.zh: 比朋友抽得更多并不值得骄傲。

definition.en: present participle of “outsmoke”: smoking more than someone else, or producing more smoke than something else
definition.zh: “outsmoke”的现在分词：比别人抽得更多；或（某物）冒出更多烟

examples.en: He kept outsmoking his coworkers during breaks.
examples.zh: 他在休息时间总是比同事抽得更多。

examples.en: That old grill is outsmoking the new one.
examples.zh: 那台旧烤炉冒的烟比新烤炉还多。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（像 outdo 超过、outperform 表现更好）。所以 outsmoke 就是“在吸烟/冒烟方面超过”。
在日常英语里，outsmoke 用来形容“抽得更多”并不常见，也可能带有负面评价；在非吸烟语境中，更常见的是指“某物冒烟更多”（比如机器、烤炉、火堆）。

summary.en: Outsnatch means to snatch something away or take it before someone else can.
summary.zh: Outsnatch 指突然夺走某物，或抢在别人之前拿走。

definition.en: to seize or take something away from someone suddenly, often by being faster than them; to snatch before another person can.
definition.zh: （比别人更快地）突然夺走/抢走某物；抢在别人之前拿走。

examples.en: He outsnatched the ball from the defender and scored.
examples.zh: 他从防守队员手里把球抢了过来并进球。

examples.en: She outsnatched the last ticket just before I reached the counter.
examples.zh: 我刚走到柜台前，她就抢先拿走了最后一张票。

extraExplanation: “out-”作前缀常表示“胜过、超过、比……更快/更好”，如 outplay（胜过对手）、outsmart（智胜）、outrun（跑得更快）。因此 outsnatch 强调“抢得更快、抢先夺走”。
该词在现代日常英语中比较少见，更常用的表达是 snatch away / grab (something) from someone / snatch (something) from someone。

summary.en: “Outsnore” means to snore louder than someone else, often in a joking way.
summary.zh: “outsnore”指（常带玩笑）打鼾比别人更响、更厉害。

definition.en: to snore louder or more strongly than someone else (often used humorously)
definition.zh: （常带幽默意味）比别人打鼾更响/更厉害

examples.en: He didn’t just snore—he outsnored everyone in the cabin.
examples.zh: 他不只是打鼾——在小木屋里他比任何人都鼾声更响。

examples.en: I can’t share a room with him; he out-snores a chainsaw.
examples.zh: 我没法和他同住一间房；他打鼾的声音比电锯还夸张。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（例如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outshine 更出众）。因此 outsnore 就是“在打鼾这件事上胜过别人”。
该词在日常口语和幽默表达中更常见，正式写作里不太常用；也常写作 out-snore（加连字符）以强调构词结构。

summary.en: “Outsnored” means someone snored louder or longer than others (past tense).
summary.zh: “outsnored”表示过去“比别人打鼾更响或更久”。

definition.en: (past tense of outsnore) to snore more loudly or for longer than someone else; to “outdo” another person in snoring.
definition.zh: （outsnore 的过去式）比别人打鼾更响或更久；在打鼾方面“胜过”别人。

examples.en: He outsnored everyone in the cabin, so no one slept well.
examples.zh: 他在小木屋里打鼾声最大，结果大家都没睡好。

examples.en: I didn’t think anyone could outsnore my dad, but my uncle did.
examples.zh: 我原以为没人能比我爸打鼾更厉害，但我叔叔做到了。

extraExplanation: “outsnore”由前缀 out-（超过、胜过）+ snore（打鼾）构成，语气通常带点幽默或夸张，用来轻松地比较谁的鼾声更夸张。
更常见的日常说法是：snore louder than / snore more than；“outsnore”更像一种俏皮的用词。

summary.en: “outsnores” means “snores louder than someone else,” usually in a humorous way.
summary.zh: “outsnores”表示“打鼾声比别人更大”，通常带幽默、夸张语气。

definition.en: to snore more loudly than someone else (often used humorously)
definition.zh: （常带幽默）打鼾声比别人更大；把别人“鼾”下去

examples.en: He always outsnores everyone in the room.
examples.zh: 他总是比房间里的所有人打鼾更响。

examples.en: I can’t sleep because my roommate outsnores a lawnmower.
examples.zh: 我睡不着，因为我室友的鼾声比割草机还响。

extraExplanation: “outsnores”是动词“outsnore”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outsnores）。结构是 out-（超过、胜过）+ snore（打鼾）。多用于口语或夸张的玩笑说法，并不是非常正式的词。

summary.en: Outsnoring means snoring louder than others (often humorously).
summary.zh: outsnoring 指（常带玩笑地）打呼噜比别人更响、盖过别的声音。

definition.en: snoring louder than someone else; competing in snoring and being the louder one
definition.zh: （比别人）打呼噜更响；在“打呼噜比赛”中声音更大

examples.en: He was outsnoring everyone in the cabin.
examples.zh: 他在小木屋里打呼噜比所有人都响。

examples.en: I couldn’t sleep because my roommate was outsnoring the TV.
examples.zh: 我睡不着，因为室友打呼噜的声音比电视还大。

definition.en: (of a sound) overpowering another sound because of very loud snoring
definition.zh: （指声音）因呼噜声太大而盖过另一种声音

examples.en: His outsnoring kept drowning out the music.
examples.zh: 他那震天的呼噜声一直把音乐声盖过去。

extraExplanation: “outsnoring”来自动词“outsnore”（out- + snore）。前缀 out- 常表示“比……更……、胜过……”，例如 outwork（比别人更努力工作）、outshine（更出色）。
这个词偏口语、带幽默感，多用于夸张地描述呼噜声很大；正式写作里更常见的说法是 “snore louder than … / snore very loudly”。

summary.en: Outsoar means to fly higher than something else, or figuratively to surpass or exceed it.
summary.zh: Outsoar 指飞得比别的更高；也可比喻为超越、超过。

definition.en: To fly higher than another bird or aircraft; to rise above in flight.
definition.zh: （在飞行中）飞得比……更高；飞到……之上。

examples.en: The eagle outsoared the smaller hawks and disappeared into the clouds.
examples.zh: 那只鹰飞得比那些较小的鹰更高，最后消失在云层里。

examples.en: In the strong updraft, the glider outsoared the other planes.
examples.zh: 在强上升气流中，那架滑翔机飞得比其他飞机更高。

definition.en: To surpass or exceed someone or something, especially in imagination, achievement, or success.
definition.zh: （比喻）超越；胜过（尤指在想象力、成就或成功方面）。

examples.en: Her ambition outsoared her experience, but she kept learning fast.
examples.zh: 她的抱负超过了她的经验，但她学习得很快。

examples.en: The new product outsoared expectations in its first month.
examples.zh: 这款新产品在第一个月就远超预期。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“比……更……/超过……”。因此 outsoar 字面意思是“飞得比……更高”，也常被用作比喻，表示“（在成就、想象等方面）超越”。
这个词相对不常见；在日常写作中，更常用的表达包括 “surpass / exceed / go beyond”。在文学或演讲中用 outsoar 会更有画面感和抒情效果。

summary.en: Outsoared means “surpassed,” especially by flying higher, or figuratively by greatly exceeding.
summary.zh: Outsoared 意为“超越”，既可指飞得更高（更远），也常作比喻指远远超过。

definition.en: to fly higher or farther than someone or something else
definition.zh: 飞得比……更高（或更远）；高飞超越

examples.en: The eagle outsoared the other birds within minutes.
examples.zh: 那只鹰几分钟内就飞得比其他鸟都高。

examples.en: Their kite outsoared ours in the strong wind.
examples.zh: 在大风中，他们的风筝飞得比我们的更高。

definition.en: to surpass someone or something by a lot (often used figuratively, not literally about flying)
definition.zh: （常用于比喻）远远超过；胜过

examples.en: Her confidence outsoared her experience at first.
examples.zh: 起初，她的自信远远超过了她的经验。

examples.en: In the final quarter, the team outsoared expectations.
examples.zh: 在最后一节，这支队伍的表现远超预期。

extraExplanation: “outsoared”是动词“outsoar”的过去式/过去分词。前缀“out-”常表示“比……更、超过”（如outperform超过、outnumber数量超过）。
“soar”本义是“高飞、翱翔”，因此“outsoar”既可字面指“飞得更高”，也常用作更有文学色彩的比喻，表示“志向/成就/表现远超”。

summary.en: Outsoaring means going higher than others—literally in flight or metaphorically in achievement or ambition.
summary.zh: Outsoaring 指“飞得更高/超越”，既可指真实飞行高度，也常比喻成就或志向更高。

definition.en: rising or flying higher than someone or something else; surpassing others in height or achievement (often used metaphorically).
definition.zh: 飞得比别人/别的东西更高；（常作比喻）在成就、表现等方面超越、胜过。

examples.en: The eagle was outsoaring the smaller birds above the cliffs.
examples.zh: 那只鹰在悬崖上空飞得比那些小鸟更高。

examples.en: Her confidence was outsoaring her doubts after weeks of practice.
examples.zh: 经过几周练习，她的自信已经压过了疑虑。

definition.en: having the quality of soaring above others; exceptionally high or ambitious.
definition.zh: （形容）高远的；卓越的；雄心勃勃的。

examples.en: The speech ended with an outsoaring vision of a fairer future.
examples.zh: 演讲以一个更公平未来的高远愿景作结。

examples.en: They admired his outsoaring ambition, even if it seemed unrealistic.
examples.zh: 他们欣赏他卓越的雄心，即使这看起来不太现实。

extraExplanation: “outsoaring”来自动词“outsoar”（out- 表示“超过/胜过” + soar “翱翔、飞升”）。在文学或演讲中常用作比喻，表达“志向/成就/情绪上升并超越限制”，语气较抒情、正式。
日常口语里更常说“surpass/overcome/excel”来表达“超越”，而“outsoar/outsoaring”更有画面感，常与“eagle/sky/heights/vision/ambition”等词搭配。

summary.en: Outsoars means rises or flies higher than, or figuratively surpasses.
summary.zh: Outsoars 表示“飞得更高/升得更高”，也可比喻“超越、胜过”。

definition.en: to fly or rise higher than someone or something else; to surpass in soaring (often used literally for birds or figuratively for achievement)
definition.zh: 飞得或升得比别人/别物更高；（常用于鸟类）高飞超过；（比喻）超越、胜过

examples.en: The eagle outsoars the smaller birds, circling far above the valley.
examples.zh: 鹰高飞在更小的鸟之上，在山谷上空盘旋。

examples.en: Her ambition outsoars her fear, so she keeps trying even after setbacks.
examples.zh: 她的雄心超越了恐惧，所以即使受挫也继续努力。

examples.en: In the final chapter, the hero’s hope outsoars despair.
examples.zh: 在最后一章里，主角的希望战胜了绝望。

extraExplanation: “outsoars”是动词“outsoar”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outsoars）。词缀out-常表示“超过、胜过”（如outshine胜过、outperform表现优于）。
除了字面“飞得更高”，它很常见的用法是比喻性的：用来形容理想、希望、才华、成就等“高过/胜过”某种限制或对手，带有文学色彩。

summary.en: “Outsold” means “sold more than,” used to compare sales between two things.
summary.zh: “Outsold”表示“销量超过/卖得更多”，用于比较两个对象的销售表现。

definition.en: sold more than another product, person, or company (past tense/past participle of “outsell”)
definition.zh: 比另一种产品、个人或公司卖得更多（outsell 的过去式/过去分词）

examples.en: The new phone outsold last year’s model in just two weeks.
examples.zh: 这款新手机在短短两周内就比去年的型号卖得更多。

examples.en: Her first novel outsold many bestsellers and surprised the publisher.
examples.zh: 她的第一部小说销量超过了许多畅销书，让出版社很意外。

extraExplanation: “outsold”来自动词“outsell”（out- 表示“超过/胜过” + sell “卖”）。常用于商业、市场、出版等语境，比较两个对象的销量。
语法提示：常见结构是 A outsold B（A 的销量超过 B）。也可以用被动：B was outsold by A（B 被 A 在销量上超过）。
注意它强调“销量（数量/业绩）上的超过”，不是一般意义上的“更受欢迎”（那更常用 “was more popular than”）。

summary.en: An outsole is the outer bottom layer of a shoe that contacts the ground.
summary.zh: outsole 指鞋子最下面、接触地面的外底。

definition.en: the outer bottom part of a shoe or boot that touches the ground
definition.zh: 鞋底外侧（鞋子最下面、接触地面的那一层）

examples.en: These hiking boots have a thick rubber outsole for better grip.
examples.zh: 这双登山靴有厚厚的橡胶外底，抓地力更好。

examples.en: The outsole is worn down, so it’s time to replace the shoes.
examples.zh: 外底磨平了，所以该换鞋了。

extraExplanation: 在制鞋里，常见结构是：insole（鞋垫/内底，脚踩着的部分）+ midsole（中底，常负责缓震，如跑鞋的泡棉层）+ outsole（外底，负责耐磨与抓地，常用橡胶）。
运动鞋广告里常会强调 outsole 的“traction（抓地力）”“durability（耐磨性）”，以及纹路（tread pattern）对防滑的影响。

summary.en: “Outsoler” is a rare term that may refer to a person or company that makes or supplies shoe outsoles.
summary.zh: “outsoler”很少见，通常可理解为制作或供应鞋子外底的人或公司。

definition.en: (Rare; industry jargon) A person, worker, or business involved in making, supplying, or attaching an outsole (the bottom part of a shoe).
definition.zh: （少见；行业用语）与鞋底外底（outsole，鞋子最底部）制作、供应或粘合/缝合有关的人、工人或企业。

examples.en: The factory hired an outsoler to speed up the shoe-assembly line.
examples.zh: 工厂雇了一名负责外底工序的工人，以加快制鞋流水线。

examples.en: We changed outsolers because the new supplier offered more durable rubber outsoles.
examples.zh: 我们更换了外底供应商，因为新供应商提供更耐磨的橡胶外底。

extraExplanation: “outsoler”在通用英语里非常不常见，很多词典未收录；在鞋类制造/贸易语境中，有时会被用来指“做外底的人/外底供应商”。更常见、更标准的词是：outsole（外底）、outsole supplier（外底供应商）、shoe sole maker（鞋底制造商）。
如果你原本想表达“外包的人/公司”，常用词是 outsourcer；如果想表达“卖得比别人多”，常用词是 outseller / to outsell。

summary.en: “Outsoles” are the outer bottom parts of shoes that contact the ground.
summary.zh: “Outsoles”指鞋子与地面接触的外层鞋底（外底）。

definition.en: the outer bottom part of a shoe that touches the ground (plural of “outsole”)
definition.zh: 鞋底外底；鞋子的最外层底部（复数，outsole 的复数）

examples.en: These hiking boots have thick outsoles for better grip on rocks.
examples.zh: 这双登山靴的外底很厚，在岩石上抓地力更好。

examples.en: My sneakers’ outsoles are worn down, so they feel slippery in the rain.
examples.zh: 我运动鞋的外底磨平了，所以雨天走路会觉得很滑。

extraExplanation: 在鞋类结构里，常见部位有：outsole（外底，接触地面）/ midsole（中底，负责缓震）/ insole（鞋垫或内底，脚踩的那层）。
outsoles 常见材料有橡胶（rubber）、EVA、聚氨酯（PU）等；描述外底性能时常用 grip（抓地力）、traction（防滑牵引力）、durability（耐磨性）。

summary.en: “outsonet” is not a standard English word; it’s probably a misspelling (often “sonnet” or “outset”).
summary.zh: “outsonet”不是标准英语单词，通常是拼写错误（常见为“sonnet”或“outset”）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling or typing error (common intended words: “sonnet” or “outset”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词，可能是拼写/输入错误（常见可能想表达的词：sonnet「十四行诗」或 outset「开始、开端」）。

examples.en: I can’t find “outsonet” in a dictionary—did you mean “sonnet”?
examples.zh: 词典里找不到“outsonet”——你是不是想写“sonnet（十四行诗）”？

examples.en: At the outset of the meeting, she explained the plan.
examples.zh: 在会议一开始（outset），她就解释了计划。

examples.en: Shakespeare wrote many famous sonnets.
examples.zh: 莎士比亚写了许多著名的十四行诗（sonnets）。

extraExplanation: “sonnet”指一种固定格式的诗（通常14行），常见于莎士比亚等文学作品中。
“outset”常用于正式表达，表示“开始、起初”，搭配很固定：at the outset of…
如果你告诉我这个词出现的句子或上下文（哪本书/哪段话），我可以更准确判断你想要的单词。

summary.en: Outsonnet means to beat someone by writing better sonnets.
summary.zh: outsonnet 指在十四行诗写作上胜过某人。

definition.en: to surpass someone by writing better sonnets than they do; to defeat in a contest of sonnet-writing
definition.zh: 在十四行诗（sonnet）写作上胜过某人；用更好的十四行诗击败对方

examples.en: She hoped to outsonnet her rivals in the school poetry contest.
examples.zh: 她希望在学校诗歌比赛中用十四行诗胜过对手。

examples.en: Critics joked that the young poet could outsonnet the classics.
examples.zh: 评论家开玩笑说，这位年轻诗人写十四行诗甚至能胜过经典诗人。

extraExplanation: “outsonnet”是由前缀 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ sonnet（十四行诗）构成的创造性动词。它非常少见，多用于幽默、文学评论或夸张表达，不是日常英语常用词。
类似构词方式的常见词有 outdo（胜过）、outshine（胜过、更出色）、outsing（唱得比……好）。在写作中用“outsonnet”会带一点俏皮、文艺的语气。

summary.en: Outsophisticate means to surpass someone in sophistication or refinement.
summary.zh: outsophisticate 指在“成熟、精致或世故”方面胜过他人。

definition.en: to be more sophisticated than someone else; to surpass another person in sophistication, refinement, or worldliness
definition.zh: 在成熟度、精致度或世故程度上胜过他人；比别人更“老练/高级”

examples.en: In big cities, teenagers sometimes try to outsophisticate each other with slang and fashion.
examples.zh: 在大城市里，青少年有时会用俚语和穿搭来互相“比谁更老练”。

examples.en: He didn’t want to outsophisticate his coworkers; he just wanted to communicate clearly.
examples.zh: 他并不想在同事面前显得更“高级”；他只是想表达清楚。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见、略带幽默感或评论意味的构词：out-（“超过”）+ sophisticate（“使更世故/更精致；老练的人”）。在正式写作中不常用，更常见的表达是“outdo someone in sophistication / be more sophisticated than someone”。
语气上可能带一点讽刺：暗示对方在“装成熟/装精致”，而说话者在描述一种“比来比去”的状态。

summary.en: “Outsophisticated” is a rare, nonstandard word meaning “more sophisticated than” or “to surpass in sophistication.”
summary.zh: “outsophisticated”较少见、偏非标准用法，表示“比……更老练/更精致”，或“在精致度上胜过”。

definition.en:
adj. (rare / nonstandard) More sophisticated than someone or something else; having greater refinement, complexity, or worldly experience.
Examples: (1) Her writing felt outsophisticated compared with his. (2) In a small town, he seemed outsophisticated for his age.
definition.zh:
adj.（少见/非标准用法）比别人或别的事物更“老练/精致/复杂”；在品味、经验或表达上更成熟。
例句：(1) 和他的相比，她的写作显得更为老练。 (2) 在小镇上，他这个年纪就显得格外成熟世故。

examples.en: Her writing felt outsophisticated compared with his.
examples.zh: 和他的相比，她的写作显得更为老练。

examples.en: In a small town, he seemed outsophisticated for his age.
examples.zh: 在小镇上，他这个年纪就显得格外成熟世故。

definition.en:
vt. (very rare) To surpass someone in sophistication; to be more refined or complex than.
Example: The new design outsophisticated the older model.
definition.zh:
vt.（非常少见）在“成熟/精致/复杂程度”上胜过（某人/某物）。
例句：新设计在精致度上超越了旧款。

examples.en: The new design outsophisticated the older model.
examples.zh: 新设计在精致度上超越了旧款。

extraExplanation: “outsophisticated”并不是常见的标准词汇，更常见、更自然的表达是：more sophisticated than… / more refined than… / more polished than… / outclass (someone) in sophistication。
前缀 out- 常用来表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart, outgrow, outshine）。因此它在语义上容易理解，但在正式写作中建议用更常见的替代表达，以免读者觉得生造或别扭。

summary.en: “Outsophisticating” means surpassing others in sophistication or clever worldliness (often with a slightly critical tone).
summary.zh: “outsophisticating”指在世故、精明或“老练”程度上胜过他人，常带轻微批评或讽刺意味。

definition.en: present participle of “outsophisticate”: surpassing someone in sophistication, cleverness, or worldliness (often implying being more calculating or tricky).
definition.zh: “outsophisticate”的现在分词：在老练、精明或世故程度上胜过他人（常带“更会算计/更狡猾”的含义）。

examples.en: In negotiations, the larger firm kept outsophisticating the smaller one with complex legal language.
examples.zh: 在谈判中，大公司用复杂的法律术语不断在“老练程度”上压过小公司。

examples.en: She worried that everyone was outsophisticating her, so she stayed quiet at the dinner table.
examples.zh: 她担心大家都比她更世故、更精明，于是在餐桌上保持沉默。

definition.en: making something appear simple or naïve by being more sophisticated in comparison.
definition.zh: （通过更“高级/老练”的表现）使某人或某物显得简单或天真。

examples.en: The new marketing campaign was outsophisticating the brand’s original, friendly style.
examples.zh: 这次新的营销活动太“高端”，反而让品牌原本亲切的风格显得朴素。

extraExplanation: 这个词很少见，属于“out-（胜过）+ sophisticate（使……世故/老练）”的构词方式，语感上常带一点讽刺或批评：不是单纯“更有品味”，而是“更会玩、更会算计”。
更常用的表达包括：outsmart（智胜）、outclass（远胜）、be more sophisticated than（比……更老练/更成熟）。

summary.en: “Outsought” is a rare/archaic form usually understood as “sought out” or the past form of “outseek.”
summary.zh: outsought 很罕见/偏古语，通常可理解为“被找出来（sought out）”，也可视为 outseek 的过去形式。

definition.en:
(rare/archaic) Past tense or past participle of **outseek**: to seek for something more actively or successfully than others; often understood as “sought out; tracked down.”
Examples: 1) “He outsought every clue he could find.” 2) “The outsought answer finally appeared.”
definition.zh:
（罕见/古语）**outseek** 的过去式或过去分词：比别人更积极或更成功地寻找；在现代语境里常被理解为“被寻到/被找出来（sought out）”。
例：1）“他竭尽所能去寻找每一条线索。” 2）“那个千寻万觅的答案终于出现了。”

examples.en: In old writing, “outsought” can mean “carefully searched for.”
examples.zh: 在较古老的写法里，outsought 可表示“费力寻得的/被搜寻到的”。

examples.en: Modern English usually prefers “sought out” instead of “outsought.”
examples.zh: 现代英语通常用 sought out，而不是 outsought。

definition.en:
(rare) **Adjective use**: eagerly or widely sought; much searched for.
Example: “an outsought remedy” (= a remedy people have long searched for).
definition.zh:
（罕见）**形容词用法**：被热切追求的；被广泛搜寻的。
例：“an outsought remedy”＝“人们久寻的疗法”。

examples.en: They finally found an outsought solution to the problem.
examples.zh: 他们终于找到了那个久寻的解决办法。

extraExplanation: “outsought” 在现代英语里非常少见，很多读者会把它当成拼写错误或不标准形式。写作中如果想表达“找出来/搜寻到”，通常用 **sought out**；如果想表达“比别人更会找”，可以用 **outsearched** 或改写句子（例如：searched more thoroughly / found more clues）。

summary.en: Outsound means to be louder than something or to overpower it with sound.
summary.zh: Outsound 指（声音）比……更响，或用声音盖过、压过对方。

definition.en: to be louder than someone or something; to drown out or overpower with sound
definition.zh: （声音）比……更响；用更大的声音盖过、压过

examples.en: The cheering crowd outsounded the announcer.
examples.zh: 欢呼的人群声音盖过了播音员。

examples.en: In the storm, the wind outsounded the rain hitting the roof.
examples.zh: 暴风雨中，风声盖过了雨点打在屋顶上的声音。

examples.en: He tried to outsound everyone in the meeting, but it only made the discussion harder.
examples.zh: 他在会议上想用更大的声音压过所有人，但这反而让讨论更困难。

extraExplanation: “outsound”由前缀 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ sound 组成，意思类似于 outshine（胜过、更出色）这类构词。
实际写作中更常见的表达是 “be louder than… / drown out… / overpower…”。“outsound”相对少见，尤其在日常口语里不太常用；有时也会写成带连字符的 out-sound。

summary.en: “Outsource” means to hire an outside party to do work or provide services instead of doing it within your own organization.
summary.zh: “outsource”指把工作或服务交给外部方完成，即“外包”。

definition.en: To have work or services done by an outside company or person instead of using your own employees or resources.
definition.zh: 把工作或服务交给外部公司或个人来做，而不是由本单位员工或资源完成；外包。

examples.en: The company decided to outsource customer support to reduce costs.
examples.zh: 公司决定把客服外包出去以降低成本。

examples.en: Many startups outsource their accounting until they can hire a full-time accountant.
examples.zh: 许多初创公司在能雇全职会计之前，会先把记账工作外包。

definition.en: To obtain goods, materials, or information from an outside supplier or source.
definition.zh: 从外部供应商或渠道获取商品、材料或信息；外部采购/寻源。

examples.en: They outsource components from several suppliers in Asia.
examples.zh: 他们从亚洲的多家供应商外采零部件。

extraExplanation: “Outsource”常用于商业语境，核心对比是“in-house（内部完成）” vs. “outsourced（外包的）”。外包的常见原因包括降低成本、获得专业能力、提高效率；但也可能带来沟通成本、质量控制、数据安全等风险。
常见搭配：outsource IT / payroll / manufacturing / customer service（外包IT/工资核算/生产/客服）；outsource to + company/country（外包给某公司/某国家）。名词形式是 outsourcing（外包）。

summary.en: “Outsourced” means work or services done by an outside company; it can also be the past form of “outsource.”
summary.zh: “outsourced”指“外包的”，也可作动词“outsource”的过去式/过去分词，表示“把工作外包出去”。

definition.en: (of work, services, or production) contracted to an outside company or person instead of being done within the organization.
definition.zh: （工作、服务或生产）外包的；交由外部公司或个人完成的（而不是由组织内部完成）。

examples.en: The company’s customer support is outsourced to a call center overseas.
examples.zh: 这家公司的客服外包给了海外的呼叫中心。

examples.en: We use an outsourced team to handle payroll and taxes.
examples.zh: 我们用外包团队来处理薪资和税务。

examples.en: Some people worry that outsourced jobs reduce local employment.
examples.zh: 有些人担心外包岗位会减少本地就业机会。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “outsource”: to pay another company or person to do work that could be done by your own employees.
definition.zh: “outsource”的过去式/过去分词：把本可由本单位员工完成的工作付费交给外部公司或个人来做；外包。

examples.en: They outsourced the website design to a small studio.
examples.zh: 他们把网站设计外包给了一家小工作室。

examples.en: Last year, the hospital outsourced its cafeteria services.
examples.zh: 去年，这家医院把食堂服务外包了。

extraExplanation: “outsourced”常见于商业与管理语境，强调把非核心或可标准化的工作（如客服、IT维护、会计、人力资源、制造代工）交给外部供应商，以节省成本、提升效率或获得专业能力。
语气上通常较中性，但在就业、数据隐私、劳动条件等话题中可能带有争议色彩；写作时可根据语境搭配更明确的词，如“cost-saving outsourcing（节省成本的外包）”“offshore outsourcing（离岸外包）”。
常见搭配：outsourced labor（外包劳动力）、outsourced services（外包服务）、outsourced production（外包生产）、outsourced team（外包团队）。

summary.en: Outsourcing means paying an outside company or person to do work your organization would otherwise do itself.
summary.zh: Outsourcing 指把原本由组织内部完成的工作交给外部公司或个人来做。

definition.en: the practice of having work done by an outside company or person instead of by your own employees (often to save money, gain expertise, or increase flexibility)
definition.zh: 外包：把工作交给外部公司或个人来做，而不是由本公司员工完成（常为节省成本、获取专业能力或提高弹性）

examples.en: The company uses outsourcing to reduce customer-service costs.
examples.zh: 这家公司通过外包来降低客服成本。

examples.en: Outsourcing can speed up development, but it may create communication problems.
examples.zh: 外包可以加快开发进度，但也可能带来沟通问题。

examples.en: After outsourcing IT support, they set clear rules for response time and data security.
examples.zh: 在把 IT 支持外包后，他们为响应时间和数据安全制定了明确规定。

extraExplanation: “Outsourcing”是商业语境中的常用词，常与成本控制、专业分工、全球化供应链相关。常见搭配：outsourcing contracts（外包合同）、outsourcing provider/vendor（外包服务商/供应商）、outsourcing strategy（外包策略）。
注意区分：outsourcing（外包，交给外部做）vs. offshoring（离岸外包/把业务转移到海外，地点变化）vs. subcontracting（转包/分包，常用于项目或工程）。
在公共讨论中，“outsourcing jobs”有时会引发对就业流失与劳动条件的争议；写作时可根据场合选择更中性或更具体的表达，如 “contracting out services”（把服务外包）或 “using external vendors”（使用外部供应商）。

summary.en: Outspan means to stop and rest during a journey, originally by unhitching oxen from a wagon (South African usage).
summary.zh: outspan 指旅途中停下休息，原义是把牛从车上解下套让它们休息（南非用法）。

definition.en: (especially in South African English) to stop traveling and rest, usually by unhitching draft animals (like oxen) from a wagon; by extension, to take a break or camp for a while.
definition.zh: （尤用于南非英语）停下行程休息，常指把（牛车等的）牲畜解下套让它们休息；引申为扎营/歇一会儿。

examples.en: After hours on the road, they decided to outspan near the river for the night.
examples.zh: 在路上走了好几个小时后，他们决定在河边扎营过夜。

examples.en: The driver outspanned the oxen so they could drink and rest.
examples.zh: 赶车人把牛解下套，让它们喝水休息。

examples.en: Let’s outspan for ten minutes and then keep going.
examples.zh: 我们歇十分钟再继续走吧。

extraExplanation: 这个词来自南非荷兰语（Afrikaans）“uitspan”，字面意思是“把牲畜从挽具/车辕上解下来”。在历史语境里常见于牛车旅行、拓荒或长途运输的描写中。现代口语里也可比喻“休息一下、暂停一下”。

summary.en: “Outspanned” means “stopped to rest,” originally by unyoking oxen or other draft animals (common in South African English).
summary.zh: “outspanned”意为“停下来休息”，原指给牛等役畜解轭休整（多见于南非英语）。

definition.en: (South African English) To unyoke draft animals (especially oxen) and let them rest; to stop traveling and make a rest camp.
definition.zh: （南非英语）给役畜（尤指牛）解轭并让其休息；（旅行途中）停下来扎营休息。

examples.en: They outspanned the oxen at midday to give them water and rest.
examples.zh: 他们在中午给牛解轭，让它们喝水休息。

examples.en: After hours on the road, we outspanned near the river.
examples.zh: 在路上走了好几个小时后，我们在河边停下来休息扎营。

definition.en: (Figurative, informal) To take a break; to rest or relax after effort.
definition.zh: （引申，口语）休息一下；在辛劳后放松。

examples.en: Once the exams were over, she finally outspanned for a weekend.
examples.zh: 考试一结束，她终于周末好好休息了一下。

extraExplanation: “outspanned”是动词“outspan”的过去式/过去分词，词源与荷兰语/南非荷兰语（Afrikaans）有关：span指“套上（牲畜）拉车/拉犁的一对畜力”，outspan原指“把牲畜从车上解下来休息”。因此它在南非语境中很常见，在其他英语地区较少见。
在旅行/狩猎/越野题材的南非文学或纪实写作里，你可能会看到outspan用来描写“停下扎营、喂水、休整”。现代更通用的表达是“stop to rest / unhitch the animals / make camp”。

summary.en: Outspanning means stopping to unhitch animals (especially oxen) and rest in Southern African English; more rarely, it can mean surpassing something in span or reach.
summary.zh: outspanning 指（南部非洲英语）卸下役畜让其休息、途中停歇；较少见的意思是“在跨度/覆盖范围上超过”。

definition.en: (Southern African English) to unhitch or unyoke draft animals (especially oxen) from a wagon and let them rest; to stop and rest during a journey.
definition.zh: （南部非洲英语）把役畜（尤指牛）从车上解开/卸下，让它们休息；（旅途中）停下来休息。

examples.en: They were outspanning the oxen by the river before continuing the trek.
examples.zh: 他们在河边把牛卸下休息，然后继续长途跋涉。

examples.en: After hours on the road, we stopped outspanning under the trees.
examples.zh: 在路上走了好几个小时后，我们在树下停下来休息。

definition.en: to exceed or surpass something in span, distance, or reach (rare).
definition.zh: 在跨度、距离或覆盖范围上超过/胜过（较少见）。

examples.en: The new bridge is outspanning the old one by nearly 200 feet.
examples.zh: 这座新桥的跨度比旧桥大了将近200英尺。

examples.en: Few structures are capable of outspanning that canyon.
examples.zh: 很少有建筑能跨越那个峡谷那么宽的距离。

extraExplanation: “outspan”在南部非洲（尤其与牛车旅行、殖民时期与农牧文化相关）较常见，对应的反义动作常写作“inspan”，指把牲畜重新套上车继续赶路。
“outspanning”是动词现在分词/动名词形式，可作谓语（They are outspanning.）或名词性用法（Outspanning took an hour.）。

summary.en: Outspans means “stops to rest,” originally by unhitching oxen from a wagon; it’s the third-person singular form of outspan.
summary.zh: outspans 表示“停下休息”，原义是把拉车的牛解套休息；它是 outspan 的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: (South African English) To stop traveling and rest, especially by unhitching oxen or other draft animals from a wagon; by extension, to take a break or camp for a while. “Outspans” is the third-person singular present form (he/she/it outspans).
definition.zh: （南非英语）停下行程休息，尤指把拉车的牛等役畜从车上解套；引申为暂时休息或扎营。“outspans”是第三人称单数现在时（他/她/它 outspans）。

examples.en: After the long climb, the driver outspans near the stream so the oxen can rest.
examples.zh: 爬完漫长的坡后，车夫在溪边停下来解套休息，让牛歇一歇。

examples.en: She outspans for a few minutes before continuing the hike.
examples.zh: 她先休息几分钟再继续徒步。

extraExplanation: “outspan”主要见于南部非洲语境（尤其南非），和旧式牛车旅行有关：span 指把牛“套上/拴上”去拉车，outspan 则是“解套”。在现代英语中较少见，但在描写南非乡野、历史旅行或文学叙事时仍会用来营造地域氛围。

summary.en: Outsparkle means to shine or stand out more than others, literally or figuratively.
summary.zh: Outsparkle 指（字面或比喻）比别人/别的事物更闪耀、更出彩。

definition.en: to be more impressive, brilliant, or attention‑grabbing than someone or something else; to shine more brightly (often in a figurative sense)
definition.zh: 比……更耀眼／更出彩；在表现、魅力或吸引力上胜过（常为比喻用法）

examples.en: Her performance outsparkled everyone else’s at the audition.
examples.zh: 她在试镜中的表现比其他所有人都更出彩。

examples.en: The diamond necklace outsparkled the simpler jewelry in the display case.
examples.zh: 那条钻石项链比展示柜里更简约的首饰更闪耀。

examples.en: You don’t need to outsparkle others—just do your best.
examples.zh: 你不必非得比别人更耀眼——尽力就好。

definition.en: to shine more brightly than something else (literal, about light or glitter)
definition.zh: （字面义）比……闪得更亮／更闪烁

examples.en: In the sun, the wet sand outsparkled the dry sand.
examples.zh: 在阳光下，湿沙比干沙更闪亮。

extraExplanation: “outsparkle”由前缀 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ sparkle（闪耀）构成，语气通常带有比较意味。日常写作中更常见的替代说法有 outshine、outdo、steal the show 等；“outsparkle”更偏口语、修辞化，用来强调“闪耀感/出彩”。

summary.en: “Outsparkled” means “was more sparkling/brilliant than,” often used for looks, energy, or performance.
summary.zh: “Outsparkled”意为“更闪耀/更出彩”，常用来形容外表、气场或表现胜过别人。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “outsparkle”: to shine, glitter, or seem more lively and impressive than someone or something else.
definition.zh: “outsparkle”的过去式/过去分词：比某人或某物更闪耀、更有活力或更吸引人。

examples.en: Her simple dress outsparkled everyone else’s because of her confidence.
examples.zh: 她的裙子很简单，但因为自信，反而比其他人的更耀眼。

examples.en: The stars outsparkled the city lights once the power went out.
examples.zh: 停电后，星光比城市灯光更璀璨。

extraExplanation: “outsparkled”来自前缀 out-（表示“胜过、超过”）+ sparkle（闪耀）。这种 out- 复合动词在英语里很常见（如 outshine, outperform），但 outsparkle 相对少见，更常用的是 outshine。
它常用于比较语境，既可指真实的“光亮”，也可比喻“风采、魅力、表现”更突出。

summary.en: Outsparkling means being more sparkling, brighter, or livelier than someone or something else; it can describe both things (like bubbly drinks) and people (like a lively personality).
summary.zh: Outsparkling 指“比……更闪耀/更起泡/更有活力”，既可形容事物（如更有气泡的饮料），也可形容人（如更有神采、更灵动）。

definition.en: more sparkling, brighter, or more lively than someone or something else (often used for drinks, gems, eyes, or a person’s personality).
definition.zh: 比……更闪耀/更起泡/更有活力（常用于饮料、宝石、眼睛或人的气质）。

examples.en: Under the stage lights, her costume was outsparkling everyone else’s.
examples.zh: 在舞台灯光下，她的服装比其他人的都更闪耀。

examples.en: This new soda is outsparkling the old one, with stronger bubbles and a sharper taste.
examples.zh: 这款新汽水比旧款更“起泡”，气泡更足，口感更清爽。

examples.en: His eyes were outsparkling with excitement when he heard the news.
examples.zh: 听到消息时，他的眼睛兴奋得更闪亮。

definition.en: the act of being more sparkling or lively than; to outshine in a sparkling way.
definition.zh: （在闪耀/活力方面）胜过、压过；以更“闪亮”的方式超过。

examples.en: The critic said the lead actor was outsparkling the rest of the cast.
examples.zh: 评论家说主角的表现“闪耀度”压过了其他演员。

examples.en: She kept outsparkling her rivals with quick jokes and confident smiles.
examples.zh: 她用机智的玩笑和自信的微笑不断压过对手的风头。

extraExplanation: “outsparkling”通常来自动词短语/构词法“out- + sparkle”，表示“在某方面超过”。更常见的写法是“out-sparkling”（带连字符）或用动词原形“to out-sparkle”。
它不是特别常见的标准词汇，更常见的替换说法有：outshine（更耀眼）、more sparkling（更起泡/更闪亮）、more vivacious（更有活力）。
在饮料语境里，“sparkling”指“含气的/有气泡的”（sparkling water 苏打水/气泡水）；在人物语境里更偏“神采奕奕、灵动”。

summary.en: “outsparspied” isn’t a standard word; it likely means “outspied” (past tense): to spy more effectively than someone else.
summary.zh: “outsparspied”不是标准词；很可能指“outspied”（过去式）：在侦察/刺探方面胜过别人。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling or a garbled form of “outspied” (past tense of “outspy”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。很可能是拼写错误或混合了多个词的形式，最可能想写的是“outspied”（“outspy”的过去式）。

examples.en: I can’t find “outsparspied” in dictionaries—did you mean “outspied”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“outsparspied”——你是不是想写“outspied”？

definition.en: (Likely intended word) outspied: discovered or watched someone secretly better than they could discover or watch you; gained an advantage in spying.
definition.zh: （可能想写的词）outspied：在暗中侦察/监视方面胜过对方；比对方更早发现、跟踪或掌握对方的信息。

examples.en: The scout outspied the enemy patrol and warned the village.
examples.zh: 侦察兵先发现了敌方巡逻队，并警告了村子。

examples.en: In the thriller, the detective outspied the criminals by following their routine.
examples.zh: 在那部惊悚小说里，侦探通过跟踪他们的规律而更快掌握了罪犯的行踪。

extraExplanation: “out-”常见用法是表示“胜过、超过”（如 outsmart 胜过、outwork 比别人更努力）。因此 outspy = 在侦察/刺探方面胜过。
如果你能提供这个词出现的原句或截图，我可以更准确判断它到底应该是哪一个词（例如 outspied / outsmarted / outpaced 等）。

summary.en: “outsparspinned” isn’t a standard word; you may mean “outspin” (past: outspun): to spin more (literally in sports) or to outmaneuver someone (figuratively).
summary.zh: “outsparspinned” 不是标准单词；你可能想写 “outspin”（过去式：outspun）：字面指在运动中让球更有旋转/更会转，或引申为用机巧方式胜过对手。

definition.en: (Commonly written as outspin) to spin something faster or more skillfully than an opponent; in sports (especially cricket/baseball), to make a ball rotate more so it moves in a trickier way.
definition.zh: （通常写作 outspin）比对手转得更快或更巧；在运动中（尤指板球/棒球）让球产生更强的旋转，使轨迹更难判断。

examples.en: The young bowler outspun the senior player with a sharper, faster-turning delivery.
examples.zh: 这位年轻的投球手用更“转”的球路压过了资深选手。

examples.en: In the final innings, her spin was so consistent that she outspun everyone on the field.
examples.zh: 在最后一局，她的旋转球稳定到几乎“转赢”了场上所有人。

definition.en: to surpass someone through clever, quick movement or maneuvering (a figurative extension of ‘spin’).
definition.zh: （引申义）用更灵活、更机巧的手段胜过某人。

examples.en: He tried to outspin the questions during the interview, but the journalist kept pressing.
examples.zh: 他在采访中试图用话术“转开”问题，但记者一直追问。

examples.en: They outspun the competition by changing strategy faster than anyone else.
examples.zh: 他们通过比任何人都更快调整策略而胜过竞争对手。

extraExplanation: “outsparspinned” 不是标准英语单词，看起来像把几个部分拼在一起的误拼。最接近的常见词是 **outspin**（动词）。
如果你想表达过去式/过去分词，标准形式通常是 **outspun**（类似 spin → spun），而不是 *outspinned*。
如果你的本意是 “out-sparred”（在拳击等对抗训练中“比对手更会对练/更会周旋”），请告诉我具体语境，我可以按你想要的词条再整理。

summary.en: “outsparspinning” isn’t a standard English word; you may mean “outspinning” (spinning faster) or “outsparring/outspar” (doing better in sparring).
summary.zh: “outsparspinning”不是标准英语单词；你可能想写“outspinning”（转得更快）或“outsparring/outspar”（对练中更占优势）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; it looks like a typo or a mashed-together form (possibly “outspar” + “spinning” or “outspinning”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；看起来像拼写错误或把多个词黏在一起（可能是“outspar”+“spinning”，或想写“outspinning”）。

examples.en: I can’t find “outsparspinning” in a dictionary—did you mean “outspinning” or “outsparring”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“outsparspinning”——你是不是想写“outspinning”或“outsparring”？

definition.en: (If you meant “outspinning”) spinning faster than someone/something; surpassing in speed of spin.
definition.zh: （如果你想写的是“outspinning”）比某人/某物转得更快；在旋转速度上超过。

examples.en: The new motor is outspinning the old one by a wide margin.
examples.zh: 新马达的转速远远超过旧马达。

examples.en: Her figure skates were outspinning everyone else’s during the routine.
examples.zh: 在那套动作中，她的花滑旋转速度比其他人都快。

definition.en: (If you meant “outsparring/outspar”) doing better than an opponent in sparring; outboxing in practice fighting.
definition.zh: （如果你想写的是“outsparring/outspar”）在对练/陪练中占上风；在拳击/格斗对练中胜过对手。

examples.en: He was outsparring more experienced fighters in the gym.
examples.zh: 他在训练馆里对练时，甚至能压过更有经验的选手。

examples.en: She outsparred her opponent with quicker footwork.
examples.zh: 她用更快的步法在对练中胜过对手。

extraExplanation:
“outsparspinning”这种拼写在英语里不常见，通常不会作为一个固定词条出现。更可能的情况是：
1）你想表达“outspinning”（转得更快）；或
2）你想表达“outsparring/outspar”（对练中更占优势）。
如果你告诉我它出现的句子/上下文（比如运动、钓鱼、机械、游戏等），我可以帮你确定最贴切的词。

summary.en: “outsparsprued” is not a recognized English word; it’s probably a typo/OCR error or a nonce form, so context is needed to interpret it.
summary.zh: “outsparsprued”不是公认的英语单词，很可能是拼写/OCR 错误或临时造词；需要上下文才能判断意思。

definition.en: Not a standard English word (likely a typo, OCR error, or a made-up/nonce form). It has no widely accepted dictionary meaning.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词（很可能是拼写错误、OCR 识别错误，或作者临时造词/怪词），没有公认的词典释义。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “outsparsprued” in dictionaries—could you share the full sentence it appears in?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“outsparsprued”，你能把它出现的完整句子发我吗？

examples.en: If you meant “outsprouted,” the sentence might describe plants growing faster than others.
examples.zh: 如果你想写的是“outsprouted”，那句子可能是在说植物比别的长得更快。

extraExplanation: 这个词看起来像由 out-（“超过/比……更……”）+ 一段不常见的拼写（sparsprued）拼在一起，但“sparsprued”本身也不像常见词根或常用词。
常见来源：①键盘误触/拼写走样；②扫描文本（OCR）把相似字母识错；③文学作品里的临时造词（nonce word），用于营造声音效果或怪诞语气。
如果你把它出现的句子、出处（书名/网页链接）或你想表达的意思告诉我，我可以：1）推断最可能的原词；2）按上下文给出准确释义与更自然的替换表达。

summary.en: “outsparspruing” is not a recognized English word; it’s likely a misspelling—please provide the sentence or confirm the intended spelling.
summary.zh: “outsparspruing”不是常见或标准英语词；很可能是拼写错误。请提供句子或确认你想查的正确拼写。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It appears to be a misspelling or a garbled form of another word (possibly “outspringing,” “outspreading,” or “outspurring”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。看起来像是拼写错误或把别的词打乱了（可能想写“outspringing / outspreading / outspurring”等）。

examples.en: I can’t find “outsparspruing” in a dictionary—could you share the sentence you saw it in?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“outsparspruing”——你能把它出现的句子发我吗？

examples.en: If you meant “outspreading,” it describes something spreading outward.
examples.zh: 如果你想写的是“outspreading”，它表示“向外扩散/展开”。

extraExplanation: 这个拼写很可能是打字时字母顺序错了，或是OCR（图片转文字）识别错误。把它放进句子里、提供上下文（前后各1句）最容易判断你真正想查的词。
你也可以检查是否想表达“向外伸展/扩散”（outspreading）、“突然冒出/迸发”（outspringing，较少见/偏文学）、或“超过、胜过”（outstrip / outdo 一类）。

summary.en: “outsparspying” is not a standard English word; it likely refers to either out-spar (do better in sparring) or out-spy (gain more information by spying).
summary.zh: “outsparspying”不是规范英语词；更可能指 out-spar（对练中胜过）或 out-spy（侦察/情报上胜过）。

definition.en: (Nonstandard/likely typo) Not a recognized single word in modern English. It looks like a blend of two verbs: out-spar and out-spy.
definition.zh: （非标准/可能是拼写错误）现代英语中不被视为一个规范单词。它看起来像把两个动词 out-spar（在对练中胜过）和 out-spy（在侦察/间谍活动中胜过）拼在一起。

examples.en: I can’t find “outsparspying” in dictionaries—did you mean “outspying” or “outsparring”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“outsparspying”——你是不是想写“outspying（在侦察上胜过）”或“outsparring（在对练上胜过）”？

definition.en: to out-spar: to do better than someone in sparring or a practice fight (rare).
definition.zh: out-spar：在拳击/格斗对练或练习性对打中胜过某人（较少见用法）。

examples.en: She outsparred her partner with faster footwork.
examples.zh: 她用更快的步伐在对练中胜过了搭档。

examples.en: He didn’t win the match, but he outsparred most of the team in practice.
examples.zh: 他没赢比赛，但在训练对练中胜过了队里大多数人。

definition.en: to out-spy (outspying): to discover more information than someone else through spying, watching, or investigating (rare; often said as “outdo in intelligence gathering”).
definition.zh: out-spy（outspying）：在间谍活动、监视或调查中获取比别人更多的信息（较少见；更常说“在情报搜集中胜过/压过对方”）。

examples.en: The agency tried to outspy its rivals by improving surveillance technology.
examples.zh: 该机构试图通过提升监控技术在情报搜集上压过竞争对手。

examples.en: In the novel, the detective outspies the criminals by listening more carefully than they expect.
examples.zh: 在小说里，侦探通过比罪犯预料的更细致的倾听，在侦察上胜过他们。

extraExplanation: “outsparspying”更像是把两个结构相同的词（out- + 动词）误连在一起。英语里 out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outperform, outnumber, outsmart）。如果你告诉我你看到这个词的句子或上下文（运动/拳击？谍战/侦查？），我可以帮你确认最可能的正确拼写与意思。

summary.en: “Outspat” is the past tense of “outspit,” meaning to spit farther or more forcefully than someone else.
summary.zh: “outspat”是“outspit”的过去式，意思是吐得比别人更远或更有力。

definition.en: past tense of “outspit”: to spit farther or more forcefully than someone else (often used in contests or exaggeration).
definition.zh: “outspit”的过去式：比别人吐得更远或更有力（常见于比赛语境或夸张说法）。

examples.en: He bragged that he outspat everyone at the county fair.
examples.zh: 他吹嘘说自己在县集市上吐得比所有人都远。

examples.en: She outspat her brother by a full foot.
examples.zh: 她比弟弟多吐出整整一英尺。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“胜过、超过”（如 outwork 工作更努力、outsmart 更聪明）。因此 outspit 的意思就是“在吐这件事上胜过别人”。
这个词在现代英语里非常少见，更多时候人们会直接说 “spit farther/further than …” 或用更委婉的表达。

summary.en: Outspeak means to speak louder than others or to speak out more openly than others do.
summary.zh: outspeak 指“比别人说得更大声”或“更坦率、更直言地说出”。

definition.en: to speak louder than someone else, so that your voice is heard over theirs
definition.zh: （声音）比别人更大声，把对方的声音压过去

examples.en: In a noisy room, he tried to outspeak the crowd.
examples.zh: 在很吵的房间里，他试图用更大的声音压过人群。

examples.en: You don’t need to outspeak others to make your point.
examples.zh: 你不需要比别人更大声才能表达观点。

definition.en: to state something openly and directly (sometimes braver or more honest than others do)
definition.zh: 坦率直言地说出（常含比别人更敢说、更直接之意）

examples.en: She chose to outspeak her coworkers about unfair rules.
examples.zh: 她选择直言不讳地谈同事们不敢说的那些不公平规定。

examples.en: The article praises writers who outspeak the powerful.
examples.zh: 那篇文章称赞敢于直言批评权势的人。

extraExplanation: “outspeak”由 out-（超过、胜过）+ speak 组成，意思是“在说话上胜过别人”。日常英语里更常见的表达是 “talk over someone”（压着别人说）、“speak louder than”（比……更大声）或 “speak out”（大胆说出来）。
它不是特别高频的词，写作或正式语境中偶尔会用来强调“声音/表达上的压过或超越”。

summary.en: Outspeaker usually means an external/outdoor loudspeaker; rarely, it can mean someone who speaks out publicly.
summary.zh: Outspeaker 通常指外置/室外扬声器；较少情况下可指公开发声的人。

definition.en: A loudspeaker that is outside a device or building, used to project sound to the outside (often in announcements or security systems).
definition.zh: 外置/室外扬声器；用于把声音向外播放的喇叭（常见于广播、安防或公告系统）。

examples.en: The security guard made the announcement through the outspeaker.
examples.zh: 保安通过室外扬声器发布了通知。

examples.en: The building’s outspeaker was used for emergency warnings.
examples.zh: 这栋楼的室外扬声器用于紧急警报。

definition.en: A person who speaks out publicly or strongly expresses opinions (rare; more common: outspoken person).
definition.zh: 直言者；公开发声、强烈表达观点的人（较少见；更常用：outspoken person）。

examples.en: She became an outspeaker for workplace safety.
examples.zh: 她成为职场安全问题的公开发声者。

extraExplanation: “outspeaker”在日常英语里不算常见。表示“外置/室外扬声器”时，多见于说明书、安防/广播系统或非正式技术用语；在更标准的表达里常用“external speaker / outdoor speaker / loudspeaker”。
表示“直言者”时，英语里更自然的说法通常是“an outspoken person”或“a spokesperson/advocate”（视语境而定）。

summary.en: “Outspeaking” usually means speaking louder or more than others (the -ing form of “outspeak”); rarely, it can mean “outspoken.”
summary.zh: “outspeaking”通常指（outspeak 的 -ing 形式）说得比别人更大声或说得更多、盖过他人；较少情况下也可指“直言不讳的”。

definition.en: the act of speaking louder than someone else, or speaking more than others in a discussion (present participle/gerund of “outspeak”)
definition.zh: （动词 outspeak 的现在分词/动名词）比别人说得更大声；在讨论中说得更多、盖过他人

examples.en: In a noisy room, he kept outspeaking everyone, so it was hard to hear quieter voices.
examples.zh: 在很吵的房间里，他一直压过所有人讲话，所以很难听到较安静的人。

examples.en: Good teamwork isn’t about outspeaking others; it’s about listening and building on ideas.
examples.zh: 好的团队合作不是靠压过别人说话，而是靠倾听并在想法上继续发展。

definition.en: speaking louder than someone else; talking over others (present participle of “outspeak”)
definition.zh: （动词 outspeak 的现在分词）比别人说得更大声；在别人说话时插话、盖过对方

examples.en: She started outspeaking her colleague, and the meeting became tense.
examples.zh: 她开始盖过同事讲话，会议气氛变得紧张。

examples.en: Try not to be outspeaking people—pause and let them finish.
examples.zh: 尽量不要盖过别人说话——停一下，让对方说完。

definition.en: (rare) outspoken; expressing opinions openly and strongly
definition.zh: （较少见）直言不讳的；公开而强烈地表达观点的

examples.en: He was known for his outspeaking style, even when the topic was sensitive.
examples.zh: 他以直言不讳的风格出名，即使话题很敏感也一样。

examples.en: Her outspeaking comments surprised the audience.
examples.zh: 她直言的评论让观众感到意外。

extraExplanation: “outspeaking”在现代英语里不算常用词形；很多时候人们其实想说的是更常见的形容词“outspoken”（直言不讳的）。
动词“outspeak”更常见的用法是字面意义的“说得比别人更大声/盖过别人”，在讨论或争吵场景中常带有“抢话、压制他人”的语气。

summary.en: “Outspeaks” means “speaks more/louder/more convincingly than others,” or “expresses something more strongly than other signs.”
summary.zh: “outspeaks”表示“说得比别人更响/更多/更有说服力”，也可表示“比其他迹象更强烈地表达某种含义”。

definition.en: to speak louder, longer, or more convincingly than someone else; to outtalk someone
definition.zh: 比别人说得更响、更久或更有说服力；把对方“说过”

examples.en: In meetings, he often outspeaks quieter teammates.
examples.zh: 在会议上，他常常把比较安静的队友“说过”，让他们难以发言。

examples.en: Try not to outspeak others—make space for everyone’s ideas.
examples.zh: 尽量不要压过别人发言——给每个人的想法留出空间。

definition.en: to express something more strongly or clearly than other signs or actions; to stand out as the strongest message
definition.zh: （比其他迹象或行为）更强烈、更清楚地表达；显得最有分量

examples.en: Her silence outspeaks any excuse he could offer.
examples.zh: 她的沉默比他能给出的任何借口都更有说服力。

examples.en: In the poem, grief outspeaks reason.
examples.zh: 在这首诗里，悲伤压过了理性。

extraExplanation: “outspeaks”是动词“outspeak”的第三人称单数现在时：he/she/it outspeaks。更常见的基本形式是outspeak，过去式/过去分词常见为outspoke/outspoken。
这个词在日常口语中不算特别高频，表达“说得比别人多/更抢话”时，也可以用outtalk或talk over someone（更口语）。

summary.en: “Outsped” means “went faster than” and is the past form of “outspeed.”
summary.zh: “outsped”表示“速度超过”，是“outspeed”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “outspeed”: to go, move, or happen faster than someone or something else.
definition.zh: “outspeed”的过去式和过去分词：比某人或某物跑得/移动得更快；速度超过。

examples.en: She outsped all the other runners in the last 100 meters.
examples.zh: 在最后100米，她超过了所有其他选手的速度。

examples.en: The sports car outsped the truck easily on the highway.
examples.zh: 在高速公路上，那辆跑车轻松地比卡车更快。

examples.en: News outsped the official announcement, spreading online within minutes.
examples.zh: 消息比官方公告传播得更快，几分钟内就在网上传开了。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如：outperform 表现胜过，outnumber 数量超过）。因此 outspeed 的核心含义就是“在速度上超过”。
outspeed 是不规则变化：outspeed → outsped → outsped（不是 outspeeded）。写作或考试中常考这种过去式形式。
既可用于字面速度（跑得更快、车更快），也可用于比喻（信息/变化“传播得更快”）。

summary.en: “Outspeech” is a rare word meaning a public speech or the act of speaking out openly.
summary.zh: “outspeech”是一个较少见的词，可指公开演讲，或指公开直言表达的行为。

definition.en: (Rare) A speech or spoken statement, especially one made publicly or “out loud.”
definition.zh: （少见用法）演讲或口头陈述，尤指公开发表或大声说出的讲话。

examples.en: The mayor’s outspeech focused on public safety and jobs.
examples.zh: 市长的公开讲话重点谈了公共安全和就业。

examples.en: Her brief outspeech convinced the audience to donate.
examples.zh: 她简短的发言说服了听众捐款。

definition.en: (Rare) The act of speaking out; expressing something openly.
definition.zh: （少见用法）直言表达；公开说出（某事）的行为。

examples.en: In that community, outspeech against corruption took courage.
examples.zh: 在那个社区，公开反对腐败需要勇气。

examples.en: He practiced outspeech in meetings instead of staying silent.
examples.zh: 他练习在会议上说出自己的想法，而不是保持沉默。

extraExplanation:
“outspeech”不是现代英语里常见的标准词。很多情况下，人们更常用：
- “speech”（演讲/讲话）
- “public speech / address”（公开演讲/致辞）
- “speaking out”（公开发声）
- “outspoken”（直言不讳的，形容词）
如果你是在某篇文章、游戏、或特定软件界面里看到它，也可能是作者的造词或行业用法。你可以把原句发来，我可以帮你判断更准确的意思与更自然的表达。

summary.en: “Outspeed” means to be faster than someone or something, or to advance faster in a figurative sense.
summary.zh: “Outspeed”指在速度上超过（某人/某物），也可引申为在发展或推进速度上更快。

definition.en: to go faster than someone or something; to outrun or outpace
definition.zh: 比（某人/某物）更快；在速度上超过

examples.en: The electric car outspeeds most gas cars in quick acceleration.
examples.zh: 这辆电动车在快速加速方面比大多数燃油车更快。

examples.en: A cheetah can outspeed a human easily.
examples.zh: 猎豹可以轻松地跑得比人快。

examples.en: In the last 100 meters, she outspeeded her rival and won the race.
examples.zh: 在最后100米，她加速超过了对手，赢得了比赛。

definition.en: (figurative) to progress or develop faster than others
definition.zh: （引申）发展/进步得比别人更快

examples.en: Some startups can outspeed bigger companies by making decisions quickly.
examples.zh: 一些初创公司靠快速决策，能在发展速度上超过大型公司。

examples.en: If we outspeed our competitors in innovation, we’ll lead the market.
examples.zh: 如果我们在创新速度上超过竞争对手，就会领跑市场。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。所以 outspeed = out-（超过）+ speed（速度）。类似的词还有：outperform（表现胜过）、outnumber（数量超过）、outgrow（长得更快/超出）。
拼写小提示：过去式和过去分词常见写法是 outspeeded，也有人用 outspeed（不规则形式较少见）。在正式写作中用 outspeeded 更稳妥。

summary.en: Outspell means to spell more correctly than someone else, often in a spelling contest.
summary.zh: Outspell 指（常在拼字比赛中）拼写更正确，从而在拼写上胜过别人。

definition.en: to spell a word more accurately than someone else, especially in a spelling competition
definition.zh: （尤指在拼字比赛中）比别人拼得更准确、在拼写上胜过

examples.en: She outspelled three older students in the final round.
examples.zh: 在决赛轮，她在拼写上胜过了三名更年长的学生。

examples.en: If you stay calm, you can outspell even stronger competitors.
examples.zh: 如果你保持冷静，你甚至可以在拼写上胜过更强的对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 努力超过别人、outperform 表现更好）。所以 outspell 字面意思就是“在拼写上胜过”。
这个词最常见的语境是美国的 spelling bee（拼字比赛）。在报道或比赛解说中，经常会看到 “X outspelled Y to win the title”（X 拼得比 Y 更好，赢得冠军）。

summary.en: Outspelled means “spelled better (or longer) than someone else,” especially in a spelling bee.
summary.zh: outspelled 指“在拼写上胜过别人（或坚持更久仍拼对）”，尤其常见于拼写比赛语境。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of outspell; to spell a word or series of words better than someone else (often in a spelling contest).
definition.zh: outspell 的过去式和过去分词；（常指在拼写比赛中）比别人拼得更准确、拼得更好。

examples.en: She outspelled the older students in the final round of the spelling bee.
examples.zh: 在拼写比赛的决赛轮，她拼写表现比年长的学生还要好。

examples.en: Our team outspelled every other school and won first place.
examples.zh: 我们队的拼写水平超过了其他学校，拿了第一名。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of outspell; to continue spelling correctly for longer than others, causing them to lose.
definition.zh: outspell 的过去式和过去分词；（在淘汰赛中）比别人坚持更久仍能拼对，从而让对方被淘汰。

examples.en: He outspelled his opponent by staying calm on the hardest words.
examples.zh: 他在最难的单词上保持冷静，因此比对手坚持更久仍能拼对。

examples.en: They outspelled everyone else after a long tie-breaker.
examples.zh: 在漫长的加赛后，他们最终比所有人都更能拼对，赢了比赛。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork, outrun）。因此 outspell 字面意思就是“在拼写上胜过”。
美式英语里更常见的是 outspelled；英式英语中也可能看到 outspelt（不太常用）。
这个词最常出现在 spelling bee（拼写比赛）语境；日常写作里更常用的表达是 “spell better than” 或 “win the spelling contest” 。

summary.en: “Outspelling” means spelling better than someone else, often to win a spelling contest; it can also be the -ing form of “outspell.”
summary.zh: “outspelling”指在拼写上胜过别人（常指在拼写比赛中获胜）；也可作“outspell”的-ing形式。

definition.en: (rare) The act of spelling better than someone else, or the achievement of winning by superior spelling (often in a spelling contest).
definition.zh: （罕见）拼写胜过他人；（尤指拼写比赛中）因拼写更好而获胜。

examples.en: Her outspelling of the older students surprised everyone.
examples.zh: 她在拼写上胜过年长的学生，让所有人都很惊讶。

examples.en: The final round came down to one word, and his outspelling won him the trophy.
examples.zh: 决赛只差一个单词，他凭借更好的拼写赢得了奖杯。

definition.en: The present participle/gerund of “outspell”: to spell a word more correctly than someone else; to defeat someone in spelling.
definition.zh: “outspell”的现在分词/动名词：比别人拼写得更正确；在拼写上击败某人。

examples.en: She kept outspelling her competitors all afternoon.
examples.zh: 整个下午她一直在拼写上压过对手。

examples.en: He’s outspelling everyone in his class this year.
examples.zh: 今年他在班里拼写水平胜过所有人。

extraExplanation: “outspelling”并不是特别常见的日常词，更常见的说法是“spell better than someone”或在拼写比赛语境中说“win the spelling bee”。
在美国文化里，spelling bee（拼字比赛）很常见，因此“outspell/outspelling”多出现在比赛报道、校园语境或文学化表达中。

summary.en: Outspells means ‘spells better than someone else’ or ‘beats someone in a spelling contest.’
summary.zh: outspells 指“拼写比别人更好/在拼写比赛中胜过对手”。

definition.en: to spell a word or set of words better than someone else; to beat someone in a spelling contest
definition.zh: 在拼写上胜过某人；（在拼写比赛中）把对手拼得更好从而获胜

examples.en: She outspells most of her classmates.
examples.zh: 她的拼写能力胜过班上大多数同学。

examples.en: He outspells his opponent in the final round of the spelling bee.
examples.zh: 在拼写比赛的决赛轮，他拼写得比对手更好，赢了。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 工作更努力、outsmart 更聪明地取胜）。所以 outspell 就是“在拼写方面胜过”。
这个词常见于美国的 spelling bee（拼写比赛）语境中；日常口语里也可以更自然地说 “spell better than someone”。

summary.en: “Outspelt” means “spelled better than someone else,” especially in a spelling contest; it’s the past form of “outspell.”
summary.zh: “outspelt”意为“在拼写上胜过别人（常指拼写比赛）”，是 outspell 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of outspell: spelled a word (or words) more correctly than someone else; beat someone in a spelling contest.
definition.zh: outspell 的过去式/过去分词：在拼写上胜过别人；在拼写比赛中拼对得更多、表现更好。

examples.en: She outspelt her opponents in the final round of the spelling bee.
examples.zh: 在拼写比赛的决赛轮，她拼写得比对手更好，赢了。

examples.en: He was nervous, but he outspelt everyone with the hardest word.
examples.zh: 他很紧张，但在最难的那个词上，他比所有人拼得都对。

definition.en: (rare) spelled something better or more accurately than before; improved the spelling compared with another version.
definition.zh: （较少见）把某个词拼得比之前/另一种写法更准确；在拼写上做得更好。

examples.en: In the revised edition, the editor outspelt several names that were incorrect in the first printing.
examples.zh: 在修订版中，编辑把初版里拼错的几个名字改成了更准确的拼写。

extraExplanation: “outspelt”比较少见，更常见的是动词原形 outspell 以及第三人称单数 outspells。英语里用“out- + 动词”表示“在某方面胜过别人”（如 outwork, outsmart）。
在美式英语中，拼写比赛（spelling bee）很常见，所以 outspell/outspelt 多出现在“比赛中拼写更好、赢过对手”的语境。

summary.en: Outspend means to spend more than others (often to compete) or to spend more than planned/budgeted.
summary.zh: outspend 指花得比别人多（常用于竞争以占优势），也可指超出计划/预算而花钱。

definition.en: to spend more money than someone else, especially a competitor, to gain an advantage
definition.zh: （尤指在竞争中）花钱比别人多，以获得优势

examples.en: The bigger company can outspend its rivals on advertising.
examples.zh: 这家更大的公司可以在广告上比竞争对手花更多钱。

examples.en: They outspent other bidders to win the contract.
examples.zh: 他们出价（投入资金）高于其他竞标者，从而赢得了合同。

definition.en: to spend more money than you planned or can afford; to overspend
definition.zh: 花钱超过计划或承受能力；超支

examples.en: I outspent my budget during the holidays.
examples.zh: 假期里我的开销超过了预算。

examples.en: If you outspend every month, it’s hard to save.
examples.zh: 如果你每个月都超支，就很难存下钱。

extraExplanation: out- 是常见前缀，意思是“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过人数、outperform 表现更好）。outspend 常见于商业、市场营销和政治语境，强调“资金投入更大从而占优势”。
用法提示：outspend 后面常接比较对象（outspend + someone/company/other candidates），也常与 on 连用说明花在哪方面（outspend rivals on ads）。

summary.en: Outspending means spending more than others or more than a budget/limit; it can refer to the action itself or describe what someone is doing.
summary.zh: outspending 指花费超过他人或超过预算/限额；既可指“超支这一行为”，也可作动词形式描述“正在超支”。

definition.en: the act of spending more money than someone else, or more than a set amount (such as a budget)
definition.zh: （在支出上）花得比别人多；或超过既定额度（如预算）的支出

examples.en: The company is outspending its rivals on advertising this year.
examples.zh: 今年这家公司在广告上的花费超过了竞争对手。

examples.en: If we keep outspending our budget, we’ll have to cut costs later.
examples.zh: 如果我们继续超支预算，之后就不得不削减开支。

definition.en: present participle of outspend: to spend more money than someone else or more than you can afford
definition.zh: outspend 的现在分词：花得比别人多；或花费超过承受能力（超支）

examples.en: They are outspending other teams to attract the best players.
examples.zh: 他们花得比其他队更多，以吸引最好的球员。

examples.en: She worries she’s outspending what she earns each month.
examples.zh: 她担心自己每个月的花费超过收入。

extraExplanation: “out-” 是一个常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过人数、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outspend 直观地就是“花得更多”。
在新闻和政治语境里，outspending 常用来谈竞选资金或政府开支：outspending opponents（竞选经费超过对手）、outspending the budget（预算超支）。

summary.en: Outspends means “spends more money than someone else or more than a budget/limit.”
summary.zh: outspends表示“花钱超过别人或超过预算/限额”。

definition.en: to spend more money than someone else or than a set amount (e.g., a budget)
definition.zh: （在花钱上）超过（别人或某个限额/预算）；花得比……多

examples.en: This year, our company outspends its competitors on advertising.
examples.zh: 今年，我们公司在广告投入上超过了竞争对手。

examples.en: If the government outspends its budget, it may need to borrow more money.
examples.zh: 如果政府支出超过预算，可能就需要借更多的钱。

examples.en: She outspends her friends when it comes to travel.
examples.zh: 在旅行花费方面，她比朋友们花得更多。

extraExplanation: “outspends”是动词“outspend”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outspends）。过去式：outspent；过去分词：outspent。
注意区别：outspend强调“比别人/比某个标准花得更多”；overspend更常指“超支、花钱过度（超过自己承受能力或预算）”。例如：Don’t overspend on credit cards（别刷卡过度消费）。

summary.en: Outspent means “spent more than someone else” or “spent more than a budget/limit” (past of outspend).
summary.zh: outspent 表示“花得比别人多”或“超出预算/限额的花费”，是 outspend 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of outspend; to have spent more money than someone else or more than a limit/budget
