examples.en: The leaves outswirled across the sidewalk in the wind.
examples.zh: 树叶在风中打着旋向外散开，掠过人行道。

definition.en: to cause something to swirl outward
definition.zh: 使（某物）旋转着向外扩散

examples.en: The sudden gust outswirled dust from the dry ground.
examples.zh: 一阵突如其来的风把干地上的尘土旋着卷散开来。

extraExplanation: “outswirl”不是常见的标准词汇，更像是由 out-（表示“超过/胜过”或“向外”）+ swirl（旋转）临时组合出来的创造性用词。写作中更常见的表达有：“swirl more than… / spin faster than… / spiral outward”。
如果你在小说、诗歌或品牌文案里看到它，通常是为了强调画面感和动态：不是普通的“swirl”，而是“旋得更夸张/更外扩”。

summary.en: “Outswore” means “swore more than others” and is the past tense of “outswear.”
summary.zh: “outswore”表示“比别人更会/更常咒骂或发誓”，是“outswear”的过去式。

definition.en: past tense of “outswear”: to swear (use rude/strong language or make oaths) more than someone else; to surpass others in swearing.
definition.zh: “outswear”的过去式：比别人更常/更厉害地咒骂或发誓；在咒骂/发誓方面胜过别人。

examples.en: In the argument, he outswore everyone in the room.
examples.zh: 在那场争吵中，他骂得比屋里任何人都凶。

examples.en: The sailors outswore the soldiers, at least according to the story.
examples.zh: 至少按故事说法，水手骂起人来比士兵还厉害。

definition.en: to make stronger or more frequent vows/oaths than others (less common).
definition.zh: （较少见）发更重、更频繁的誓言/誓词，超过他人。

examples.en: He outswore his rivals that he would never give up.
examples.zh: 他发下比对手更重的誓：绝不放弃。

extraExplanation: “outswore”来自动词“outswear”（out- 表示“超过/胜过” + swear“发誓/咒骂”）。
不规则变化：swear → swore → sworn；因此 outswear → outswore → outsworn。

summary.en: Outsworn means “perjured” or “proved false by a sworn statement,” and is mainly used in older or literary English.
summary.zh: outsworn 指“发假誓、作伪证（因而不可信）”，主要见于较古或文学性的英语。

definition.en: (Archaic) Having sworn falsely; perjured; not to be trusted because of false oaths.
definition.zh: （古语）发过假誓的；作伪证的；因虚假誓言而不可信的。

examples.en: The judge dismissed the testimony as outsworn and unreliable.
examples.zh: 法官认为这份证词是伪证，不可靠，因此予以排除。

examples.en: In old stories, an outsworn witness could ruin an innocent person’s name.
examples.zh: 在古老故事里，作伪证的证人可能毁掉无辜者的名声。

extraExplanation: “outsworn”在现代英语中很少见，多见于较早的文学或法律语境，含有“因发假誓而失去可信度”的道德与法律色彩。
词形上可理解为 out-（加强/完全）+ sworn（发誓的），整体强调“誓言被推翻/被证明为假”。阅读古典作品时，常用它来描写证人、告密者或背誓之人。

summary.en: “Outswum” means someone has swum faster/farther than another person, and it can also mean having outperformed someone in a figurative way.
summary.zh: “outswum”表示（已）游得比别人更快/更远，也可比喻为在能力或策略上胜过对方。

definition.en: past participle of “outswim”: to have swum faster or farther than someone else (often used with “have/has/had”).
definition.zh: “outswim”的过去分词：游得比别人更快或更远（常与 have/has/had 连用）。

examples.en: She has outswum everyone on the team this season.
examples.zh: 这个赛季她游得比队里所有人都快。

examples.en: By the halfway mark, he had already outswum his closest rival.
examples.zh: 到半程时，他已经把最接近的对手甩在身后了。

definition.en: (figurative) to have outperformed or escaped someone by being quicker, smarter, or more effective.
definition.zh: （比喻）以更快、更聪明或更有效的方式胜过或摆脱对方。

examples.en: The small startup has outswum bigger competitors by moving faster.
examples.zh: 这家小型初创公司靠更快的行动，胜过了更大的竞争对手。

examples.en: She outswum the rumors by staying calm and focusing on her work.
examples.zh: 她保持冷静、专注工作，从而“游过”了那些流言的困扰。

extraExplanation: “outswim”是不规则动词：outswim – outswam – outswum。
“outswum”多用于完成时（have/has/had outswum），也可在被动或类似形容词的结构中出现（如：an outswum opponent 在语感上较少见，但在文学/修辞中可能出现）。

summary.en: “Outswung” means “swung outward,” and it is most often used as the past form of “outswing,” especially in cricket.
summary.zh: “outswung”表示“向外摆动/向外弯曲”，常作为“outswing”的过去式使用，尤以板球语境最常见。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “outswing”: to swing or curve outward (away from the center, or away from a batter).
definition.zh: “outswing”的过去式和过去分词：向外摆动或向外弯曲（远离中心，或在板球中指球路远离击球手）。

examples.en: The door outswung into the hallway when the wind hit it.
examples.zh: 风一吹，门就向走廊外开摆了。

examples.en: In the last over, the bowler outswung the ball to the edge of the bat.
examples.zh: 在最后一轮里，投球手让球向外弯，擦到球棒边缘。

extraExplanation: “outswing”在板球（cricket）里非常常见：out-swing指球在空中从击球手方向向外侧弯走（对右手击球手来说，通常是从身体侧往外侧）；相对的是“inswing”（向内弯）。常见说法有“outswinger”（外弯球）。

summary.en: Recorded material not used in the final film/show/audio, often released later as extras or bloopers.
summary.zh: 未被采用进最终成片/成品的录制内容，常作为花絮或NG附加发布。

definition.en: A scene, shot, or piece of recorded material that was made during filming/recording but not included in the final version (often later shown as extra or funny “blooper” material).
definition.zh: （电影/节目/录音的）删减片段、花絮：拍摄或录制时做出来但未放入最终成片的内容（常作为附加内容或搞笑“NG/穿帮”片段发布）。

examples.en: Stay after the credits to watch the outtakes.
examples.zh: 片尾字幕后别走，还有花絮可以看。

examples.en: The DVD includes interviews and outtakes from the set.
examples.zh: 这张DVD包含访谈以及片场花絮。

examples.en: Some outtakes are funnier than the final scenes.
examples.zh: 有些删减片段比正片还好笑。

extraExplanation: outtake 常见于影视与音乐行业：out-（在外、未被采用）+ take（一次拍摄/录制）。最终被选进成片的叫 takes 或 final take；没被采用的就是 outtakes。
口语里 outtakes 往往指“NG/笑场/穿帮”等轻松内容，但严格来说也可以是因为节奏、时长或叙事需要而被剪掉的正常片段。
相关表达：blooper reel（NG合集/搞笑花絮合集）、deleted scene（删减片段，通常更强调剧情片段）、behind-the-scenes（幕后花絮）。

summary.en: “Outtaken” is an uncommon form meaning “surpassed/exceeded,” and it’s also the past participle of the rare verb “outtake.”
summary.zh: “outtaken”较少见，常表示“被超过/胜过”，也是较少用的动词 outtake 的过去分词。

definition.en: (Past participle/adjective, uncommon) surpassed or exceeded; taken more than someone else.
definition.zh: （过去分词/形容词，较少见）超过；胜过；比别人“拿得更多/做得更多”。

examples.en: In the final sprint, she felt outtaken by a faster runner.
examples.zh: 在最后冲刺时，她感觉被一个更快的跑者超越了。

examples.en: The smaller team was outtaken in resources, but not in creativity.
examples.zh: 这个较小的团队在资源上处于劣势，但在创造力上并不逊色。

definition.en: Past participle form of the verb “outtake” (rare outside specific contexts).
definition.zh: 动词 outtake 的过去分词形式（在日常英语中较少见，多见于特定语境）。

examples.en: By noon, our group had outtaken the others in collected donations.
examples.zh: 到中午，我们组在募集到的捐款数上已经超过了其他组。

extraExplanation:
“outtaken”在现代日常英语里不常用。你更常会看到：
1）用更自然的动词：outdo（胜过）、surpass（超过）、overtake（追上并超过）。
2）名词 outtake（更常见）：指电影/节目里被剪掉的片段或NG镜头（deleted scenes / bloopers），例如 “watch the outtakes.”
所以如果你想表达“被超过”，通常写成 “I was overtaken/surpassed.” 会更地道。

summary.en: Outtakes are recorded scenes or clips that were made but not used in the final version, often shown later as bonus footage.
summary.zh: Outtakes 指制作中拍摄/录制了但未纳入最终成品的片段，常以花絮形式发布。

definition.en: A piece of recorded material (video, audio, photos, etc.) that was made during production but not included in the final version, often shown later as a bonus (e.g., funny mistakes, deleted moments).
definition.zh: （电影/节目/录音等制作过程中）拍摄或录制了但未被收进最终成品的素材，常作为花絮或彩蛋发布（如搞笑失误、删减片段）。

examples.en: The DVD includes bloopers and other outtakes.
examples.zh: 这张DVD包含NG镜头和其他花絮。

examples.en: After the credits, they played a montage of outtakes.
examples.zh: 片尾字幕后播放了一段花絮集锦。

examples.en: Some outtakes were later released online as bonus clips.
examples.zh: 一些未采用的片段后来作为加更视频在网上发布。

definition.en: Something removed or left out from a final text, plan, or presentation (less common than the media meaning).
definition.zh: （从最终文本、方案或展示中）被删去或未被采用的内容（不如影视语境常见）。

examples.en: The editor shared a few outtakes from earlier drafts.
examples.zh: 编辑分享了早期草稿中删掉的一些内容。

examples.en: Most of the outtakes were cut to keep the talk under ten minutes.
examples.zh: 为了把演讲控制在十分钟内，大部分内容被删掉了。

extraExplanation: “Outtake”常见于影视与录音行业：out-（外、离开）+ take（一次拍摄/录制的“镜头/段落”）。所以 outtakes 字面意思就是“被拿到外面（没用进成片）的镜头”。
学习提示：日常口语里也常用更通俗的说法，比如 bloopers（NG/搞笑失误镜头）、deleted scenes（删减片段）。不过 outtakes 的范围更广，既可以包括失误镜头，也可以是正常但被剪掉的片段。

summary.en: Outtalent means to be more talented than someone.
summary.zh: outtalent 指“比某人更有天赋/更有才能”。

definition.en: to have more talent than someone; to be more naturally skilled than another person
definition.zh: 比某人更有天赋；在天资或能力上胜过他人

examples.en: She didn’t outtalent everyone in the class, but she worked harder than anyone else.
examples.zh: 她并不是班里最有天赋的，但她比任何人都更努力。

examples.en: He felt his teammate could outtalent him, so he focused on discipline and practice.
examples.zh: 他觉得队友可能比他更有天赋，所以他把重心放在自律和训练上。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 更努力、outperform 表现更好、outshine 更出色）。因此 outtalent 直观意思就是“在天赋上胜过”。
这个词在日常英语中不算常见；更自然的说法常用 be more talented than（比……更有天赋）、outshine（更出众）或 outperform（表现更好，偏结果）。在正式写作里也更常用这些替代词。

summary.en: Outtalk means to talk more or more forcefully than someone else (often to win), or to persuade someone by talking a lot.
summary.zh: Outtalk 指在讨论中把别人压下去（说得更多/更强势以占上风），或靠不停地说把人说服。

definition.en: to talk longer or more confidently than someone else, often so that you win an argument or dominate a discussion
definition.zh: （在讨论/争论中）比别人说得更多、更久或更强势，从而压过对方、占上风

examples.en: He tried to challenge her, but she outtalked him in the meeting.
examples.zh: 他想质疑她，但在会议上她把他“说”得没话可说。

examples.en: If you keep outtalking everyone, the group may stop sharing ideas.
examples.zh: 如果你总是压着大家说，小组里的人可能就不愿意分享想法了。

definition.en: to persuade or wear someone down by talking a lot
definition.zh: 用不停地说服、纠缠式地谈话把某人说动（或说到妥协）

examples.en: The salesperson almost outtalked me into buying the upgrade.
examples.zh: 那个销售差点把我说到买升级版。

examples.en: She outtalked her parents into letting her go on the trip.
examples.zh: 她把父母说动了，最终同意她去旅行。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（例如 outdo 超越，outnumber 数量超过）。所以 outtalk 直观上就是“在说话这件事上胜过别人”。在语气上，它常暗示“话太多/太强势”或“用语言占优势”，有时带一点负面评价。

summary.en: “Outtalked” means you spoke more than someone else (often dominating the conversation) or you beat them in an argument by talking more effectively.
summary.zh: “outtalked”表示你说得比别人多（常指主导谈话），或在争论中凭口才/话语压过对方。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of outtalk: to talk longer or more than someone else, often dominating the conversation.
definition.zh: outtalk 的过去式/过去分词：比别人说得更多、更久，常常主导谈话。

examples.en: At the meeting, he outtalked everyone and left little time for questions.
examples.zh: 在会议上，他一个人说得比所有人都多，几乎没给提问留时间。

examples.en: She didn’t mean to be rude—she just gets excited and outtalks people.
examples.zh: 她并不是想无礼——只是太兴奋时就会比别人说得多。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of outtalk: to win an argument or debate by talking more effectively (or simply more persistently) than an opponent.
definition.zh: outtalk 的过去式/过去分词：在争论/辩论中靠更会说（或更能说）而压过对方、取得上风。

examples.en: The lawyer outtalked the witness and steered the jury’s attention away from the key issue.
examples.zh: 律师用言辞压过证人，把陪审团的注意力从关键问题上带走了。

examples.en: He felt outtalked in the discussion, even though he had a good point.
examples.zh: 尽管他观点不错，但在讨论中他感觉自己被对方说得压住了。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过人数、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outtalk 强调“在说话这件事上超过别人”。
语气上常带一点负面含义：可能暗示“抢话、话太多、压着别人说”。但在辩论语境也可较中性，表示“口才占优”。
常见搭配：outtalk someone / outtalk the other side；相关表达：talk over (someone)（打断并盖过对方）、dominate the conversation（主导谈话）。

summary.en: Outtalking means talking more or longer than someone else, often preventing them from speaking or gaining an advantage in a discussion.
summary.zh: outtalking 指比别人说得更多或更久，常带有让对方插不上话、在讨论中占上风的意味。

definition.en: talk more than someone else, often so that they cannot respond or so you seem to “win” the discussion
definition.zh: 比别人说得更多（常指把对方说得插不上话，或借此在讨论中占上风）

examples.en: He kept outtalking me, so I couldn’t finish my point.
examples.zh: 他一直比我说得多，搞得我都没法把观点说完。

examples.en: In meetings, she’s good at outtalking quieter coworkers.
examples.zh: 在会议上，她很擅长用更多的话压过比较安静的同事。

definition.en: (more neutral) talk longer than someone else
definition.zh: （较中性）比别人说得更久

examples.en: We started debating for fun, and he ended up outtalking everyone.
examples.zh: 我们本来只是玩玩辩论，结果他比所有人都说得久。

examples.en: They can outtalk each other for hours on the phone.
examples.zh: 他们在电话里能互相聊上好几个小时。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart 聪明过别人、outwork 比别人更努力）。所以 outtalk 就是“在说话上胜过别人”。
outtalking 是 outtalk 的现在分词/动名词形式：可用来表示正在发生的动作（He is outtalking me.），也可当名词用（Outtalking others can seem rude.）。
语气提醒：outtalking 常带一点负面含义，暗示“抢话/压制别人”。如果只是想表达“很健谈”，更常用 talkative 或 chatty。

summary.en: Outtalk(s) means to talk longer or more forcefully than someone else, often preventing them from speaking or ‘winning’ mainly by talking more.
summary.zh: outtalk(s) 指比别人说得更多、更久或更强势，常让对方插不上话；也可指靠话多在争论中“说赢”对方。

definition.en: (of a person) to talk longer, more, or more effectively than someone else, so they cannot get a chance to speak.
definition.zh: （指人）比别人说得更久、更多或更有说服力，以至于对方插不上话。

examples.en: In meetings, he often outtalks quieter coworkers.
examples.zh: 在会议上，他经常把比较安静的同事都“说”得插不上话。

examples.en: She tried to explain, but he outtalked her every time.
examples.zh: 她想解释，但他每次都用更多的话把她压过去。

definition.en: (often with an object) to defeat someone in a conversation or debate mainly by talking more, not necessarily by having better ideas.
definition.zh: （常接宾语）主要靠话多而不是观点更好，在谈话或辩论中“说赢”某人。

examples.en: He outtalked his opponent, but the audience wasn’t convinced.
examples.zh: 他靠话多把对手说下去了，但观众并不信服。

examples.en: Don’t try to outtalk her—listen and answer her points instead.
examples.zh: 别想着用话多去压她——先听，再回应她的要点。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart 比……更聪明；outwork 比……更努力）。因此 outtalk 的核心就是“在说话这件事上胜过别人”。
“outtalks”是第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outtalks）。原形是 outtalk；过去式/过去分词是 outtalked。

summary.en: “Outtask” means to surpass someone by completing more tasks or doing tasks better/faster.
summary.zh: “outtask”指在任务完成量或任务表现上超过别人（做更多、做更快或做更好）。

definition.en: to do more tasks, or complete tasks better or faster than someone else; to outperform in the amount or quality of work done
definition.zh: 在任务数量或完成质量/速度上超过（别人）；比别人做更多任务或做得更好

examples.en: She outtasked everyone on the team by finishing three reports before lunch.
examples.zh: 她在午饭前就完成了三份报告，在团队里任务完成量超过了所有人。

examples.en: If we want to win the contract, we’ll need to outtask our competitors in both speed and accuracy.
examples.zh: 如果我们想拿下合同，就得在速度和准确性上都超过竞争对手。

extraExplanation: “outtask”不是非常常见的标准词，更多见于职场/商业写作或非正式表达，用来强调“任务量”或“任务完成表现”的对比。更常用、更自然的替代词包括：outperform（表现更好）、outwork（比别人更努力/做更多工作）、outdo（胜过）、do more than（做得比……多）。

summary.en: “Outtasked” means having been given too many tasks, or more tasks than someone else.
summary.zh: “Outtasked”表示被分配了过多任务，或被分配的任务比别人更多。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of outtask) to give someone more tasks than they can reasonably handle; to overload with work.
definition.zh: （outtask 的过去式/过去分词）给某人分配多到难以合理完成的任务；使工作量超负荷。

examples.en: After the layoffs, the remaining staff felt outtasked and exhausted.
examples.zh: 裁员之后，留下的员工觉得任务超量、精疲力尽。

examples.en: She was outtasked by her manager, so she asked to reprioritize the deadlines.
examples.zh: 经理给她安排的任务过多，所以她要求重新排序截止日期的优先级。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of outtask) to assign someone more tasks than another person has (often in comparisons).
definition.zh: （outtask 的过去式/过去分词）给某人分配的任务比另一人更多（常用于比较）。

examples.en: In the group project, he was outtasked compared with everyone else.
examples.zh: 在小组项目里，相比其他人，他被分配到更多任务。

examples.en: New hires are sometimes outtasked while they are still learning the system.
examples.zh: 新员工在还没熟悉系统时，有时会被分配过多任务。

extraExplanation: “outtasked”并不是非常常见的日常词，更常见的表达有 overworked（工作过度）、overloaded（负荷过重）、swamped（忙不过来）。在写作或职场语境中，用 outtasked 往往强调“任务数量/分配”这一点，而不只是“辛苦”。
构词法提示：out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量，outperform 表现更好）。因此 outtask 可理解为“在任务上超过/压过”。

summary.en: Outtasking means assigning specific tasks to an outside provider rather than outsourcing an entire function.
summary.zh: outtasking 指把具体任务交给外部完成，而不是把整个职能整体外包。

definition.en: the practice of giving specific tasks (often small or clearly defined pieces of work) to an outside person or company, instead of outsourcing an entire department or function
definition.zh: 将某些具体任务（通常是小而清晰的工作内容）交给外部个人或公司完成；不同于把整个部门/职能整体外包

examples.en: Instead of outsourcing IT support, the company tried outtasking password resets and software updates.
examples.zh: 公司没有把整个 IT 支持外包，而是把密码重置和软件更新这些任务外派处理。

examples.en: Outtasking can reduce costs while keeping strategic decisions inside the company.
examples.zh: 外派具体任务可以降低成本，同时把战略决策留在公司内部。

definition.en: to give specific tasks to an outside provider (often for efficiency, cost, or temporary capacity)
definition.zh: 把具体任务交由外部服务商完成（常为提高效率、降低成本或弥补临时人力）

examples.en: We’re outtasking data entry for the next two months while the team is overloaded.
examples.zh: 接下来两个月团队工作量过大，我们把数据录入这项任务外派出去。

examples.en: They outtasked routine testing but kept product design in-house.
examples.zh: 他们把例行测试外派，但产品设计仍由内部完成。

extraExplanation: “outtasking”常见于商业与IT管理语境，强调“按任务切分”而不是“整体外包”。因此常与“in-house（内部）”“vendor/provider（供应商）”“routine tasks（例行任务）”“core/strategic work（核心/战略工作）”等搭配出现。
写作中如果想更自然，也可用更常见表达："outsourcing specific tasks"（把某些任务外包）或"contracting out"（把…外包出去）。

summary.en: Outtasks means surpasses others in the amount or speed of task completion.
summary.zh: outtasks 指在完成任务的数量或速度上超过他人。

definition.en: to do more tasks than someone else, or to be better/faster than someone at completing tasks
definition.zh: 比别人完成更多任务；在完成任务方面胜过（更快/更有效）

examples.en: She outtasks everyone on the team when deadlines are tight.
examples.zh: 截止日期很紧时，她完成的任务量比团队里任何人都多。

examples.en: With better planning, we can outtask our competitors this quarter.
examples.zh: 通过更好的规划，我们这个季度可以在任务完成上胜过竞争对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outperform 表现优于）。因此 outtask 也可以理解为“在做任务这件事上超过别人”。
“outtask(s)”在日常口语中不算非常常见，更常用的表达有 outwork / outdo / outperform，或说 “do more tasks than … / get more done than …”。

summary.en: Outtaste means “to taste better than” (or, less commonly, “to have a better sense of taste than”).
summary.zh: Outtaste 指“味道胜过……/更好吃”；较少见的意思是“辨味能力更强”。

definition.en: to taste better than something else; to surpass in flavor
definition.zh: （在味道上）胜过；比……更好吃

examples.en: This homemade soup outtastes the canned version by a mile.
examples.zh: 这道自制汤的味道比罐头版好太多了。

examples.en: Fresh peaches often outtaste those shipped long distances.
examples.zh: 新鲜桃子通常比长途运输来的更好吃。

definition.en: to surpass or beat someone/something in the ability to judge or appreciate flavors (less common)
definition.zh: （较少用）在品味/辨味能力上胜过；更能尝出味道差别

examples.en: Some chefs can outtaste most of us and detect tiny changes in seasoning.
examples.zh: 有些厨师的辨味能力胜过大多数人，能察觉调味的细微变化。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outshine, outnumber）。因此 outtaste 字面意思就是“在味道上胜过”。
这个词在日常英语里不算常见，更自然的说法通常是 “taste better than …” 或 “be more flavorful than …”。在写作或比较评测（食物测评）里用 outtaste 会显得更精炼、更有强调感。

summary.en: “Outtear” is a rare/nonstandard verb, usually meaning “tear out,” and it’s better written as the phrase “tear out.”
summary.zh: “outtear”是罕见/非标准用法，通常想表达“tear out（撕下/扯出）”，更建议写作短语“tear out”。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) To tear out; to pull something out by tearing.
definition.zh: （罕见/非标准用法）撕出来；用撕扯的方式把某物扯出。

examples.en: He outtore the page from the notebook in a hurry. (More standard: He tore the page out.)
examples.zh: 他匆忙把笔记本上的那一页撕了下来。（更常见：He tore the page out.）

examples.en: The wind seemed to outtear posters from the wall overnight. (More standard: tear the posters off / tear the posters down.)
examples.zh: 一夜之间风好像把墙上的海报都扯了下来。（更常见：tear the posters off / tear the posters down.）

definition.en: (Very rare) To tear more than someone/something else; to outdo in tearing.
definition.zh: （非常罕见）比……撕得更厉害；在“撕扯”这件事上胜过。

examples.en: In the argument, he tried to outtear the letter before anyone could read it. (More natural: destroy / rip up)
examples.zh: 争吵中，他想在别人读到之前把信撕得更碎。（更自然：destroy / rip up）

extraExplanation: “outtear”不是常见词，很多情况下是把短语“tear out”（撕下/扯出）误写成一个词。写作和口语里更推荐用：tear out（撕下/扯出），tear off（扯下），tear down（拆下/撕下海报等），rip out/rip up（更口语、更强调用力撕）。
如果你想表达“胜过/超过”，英语里通常用 out- + 动词（如 outdo, outpace）。但“outtear”几乎不用，因此读者可能看不懂。

summary.en: “Outtearing” is a rare, nonstandard form meaning ‘tearing more than something else.’
summary.zh: “outtearing”是罕见且不太规范的形式，大意是“比别的更撕裂/撕得更厉害”。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) Tearing more than someone or something else; ripping something more severely or more quickly than another.
definition.zh: （罕见/不规范用法）比别人或别的东西撕得更厉害、更快；把某物撕裂得更严重。

examples.en: The storm was outtearing the old banner, leaving long strips of cloth.
examples.zh: 暴风雨把那面旧旗子撕得更厉害，留下了一条条布片。

examples.en: He tried to stop the dog from outtearing the pillow.
examples.zh: 他试图阻止那只狗把枕头撕得更惨。

extraExplanation: “outtearing”不是常见的标准拼写。它更像是由 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ tearing（撕裂）临时组合出来的形式，通常会写成“out-tearing”（带连字符）以便阅读。
在正式写作里，英语更常用“tear … more badly / more quickly than …”“rip … apart”“shred”等表达来替代这个词。
如果你想表达“情绪上很撕心裂肺/令人落泪”，更自然的词是“heartbreaking”或“tear-jerking”，而不是“outtearing”。

summary.en: “Outtease” is a rare verb meaning either to tease someone more than others do, or (less commonly) to tease out information/meaning.
summary.zh: “outtease”是个少见动词，常指在逗弄/取笑上胜过别人；较少见也可指“抽丝剥茧地引出”信息或含义。

definition.en: to tease someone more than another person does; to beat someone at teasing (often playful)
definition.zh: （比别人）更会取笑/逗弄；在取笑方面胜过（多为玩笑语境）

examples.en: In our group chat, Maya can outtease anyone without being mean.
examples.zh: 在我们的群聊里，Maya 取笑起人来谁都比不过，但又不会刻薄。

examples.en: He tried to outtease his sister, but she always had a quicker comeback.
examples.zh: 他想在互相逗弄上赢过妹妹，但她总能更快回怼。

definition.en: (rare) to tease out; to draw out or bring out information or meaning gradually
definition.zh: （少见）抽丝剥茧地引出；逐步梳理出（信息/含义）

examples.en: The interviewer outteased the real story through careful questions.
examples.zh: 采访者通过细致的问题一步步引出了真实情况。

examples.en: She outteased the theme of the poem by rereading key lines.
examples.zh: 她通过反复读关键诗句，慢慢梳理出了这首诗的主题。

extraExplanation: “outtease”在现代英语里非常少见，更多时候人们会用更自然的表达：在“取笑/逗弄”意义上用“tease someone more than…”或“outdo someone in teasing”；在“引出/梳理出”意义上更常用短语动词“tease out”（如：tease out the truth / the meaning）。
拼写上也可能写作“out-tease”（带连字符），尤其在比较/对抗意味更强时。

summary.en: Outteased means “teased more than others” or “teased until someone couldn’t keep responding.” It’s an uncommon form (past tense/past participle of outtease).
summary.zh: outteased 表示“在取笑方面胜过别人”或“把某人逗/损到接不下去”。这是比较少见的形式（outtease 的过去式/过去分词）。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of outtease) To tease someone more than another person does; to outdo someone in teasing.
definition.zh: （outtease 的过去式/过去分词）比别人更会取笑（某人）；在取笑方面胜过（别人）。

examples.en: In high school, he outteased everyone, but he didn’t realize how hurtful it sounded.
examples.zh: 在高中，他在取笑人方面“胜过”所有人，但他没有意识到那听起来有多伤人。

examples.en: She tried to joke back, but she was quickly outteased and went quiet.
examples.zh: 她试着回嘴开玩笑，但很快就被“逗/损”得说不出话来。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of outtease) To tease someone so persistently that they give up or stop reacting.
definition.zh: （outtease 的过去式/过去分词）不断取笑/逗弄某人，直到对方不再反应或放弃回击。

examples.en: The comedians kept riffing until one guest felt outteased and changed the subject.
examples.zh: 喜剧演员一直开梗，直到有位嘉宾觉得自己被“逗到没法接”而转移了话题。

extraExplanation: “outteased”来自动词 outtease（比较少见）。前缀 out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 数量超过，outperform 表现超过）。所以 outtease 就是“在取笑/逗弄方面超过别人”。
注意语气：tease 有时是朋友间的善意玩笑，但也可能变成挖苦或欺负（bullying）。如果语境不友好，用 teased / mocked / ridiculed 可能更贴近意思。

summary.en: Outteasing means teasing more than others; it’s an uncommon form from “outtease.”
summary.zh: outteasing 表示“比别人更会/更过分地取笑”，源自动词 outtease，但用法较少见。

definition.en: the act of teasing someone more than another person does; trying to surpass others in teasing
definition.zh: 比别人更会/更过分地取笑（逗弄）某人；在取笑方面“胜过”他人

examples.en: The older kids kept outteasing each other to look cool.
examples.zh: 大一点的孩子为了显得酷，不断互相“比着取笑”。

examples.en: Stop outteasing your brother—it’s not funny anymore.
examples.zh: 别再变本加厉地取笑你弟弟了——已经不好笑了。

definition.en: present participle of the very uncommon verb “outtease” (to tease more than someone else)
definition.zh: 非常少见的动词 outtease 的现在分词形式（意为“在取笑方面胜过别人”）

examples.en: She was outteasing everyone in the group chat.
examples.zh: 她在群聊里最会（也最爱）拿别人开玩笑。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outshine）。因此 outtease 字面意思就是“在 teasing 上超过别人”。但 outtease / outteasing 并不是常用词，很多场合更自然的说法是: tease more than…, tease the most, or keep teasing.
如果你看到的是拼写 out teasing（分开写），那通常不是一个固定词，而是句子里的两个词：out（外面/出去）+ teasing（取笑）。例如：They’re out teasing the dog.（他们在外面逗狗。）

summary.en: “Outted” (more commonly spelled “outed”) means publicly revealing someone’s LGBTQ+ identity, often without consent; it can also mean forcing someone out.
summary.zh: “outted”（更常见拼写为“outed”）指公开揭露某人的LGBTQ+身份（常指未经同意），也可指把某人赶出去。

definition.en: (Informal) To reveal that someone is gay, bisexual, transgender, etc., especially without their consent; to publicly disclose someone’s LGBTQ+ identity.
definition.zh: （非正式）揭露某人是同性恋、双性恋、跨性别者等，尤其是在未经对方同意的情况下公开其性/性别认同。

examples.en: The reporter outed the actor without permission, which caused a lot of harm.
examples.zh: 那位记者未经允许就公开了那位演员的性取向，造成了很大伤害。

examples.en: No one should be outed at work; it can be unsafe.
examples.zh: 不应该在工作场合被人“出柜”，那可能很不安全。

examples.en: She was afraid her classmates might out her online.
examples.zh: 她担心同学会在网上把她“出柜”。

definition.en: (Less common) To remove someone from a place or activity; to force someone out.
definition.zh: （较少见）把某人赶出某地或某项活动；迫使离开。

examples.en: He was outed from the club after the argument.
examples.zh: 争吵之后，他被俱乐部赶了出去。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle form of “out” (to reveal or force out).
definition.zh: “out”（揭露/赶出）的过去式和过去分词形式。

examples.en: She outed him in a public post.
examples.zh: 她在公开帖文中把他“出柜”了。

examples.en: They were outed by an acquaintance.
examples.zh: 他们被一位熟人公开了身份。

extraExplanation: “outed”最常见的用法与LGBTQ+语境有关，通常带有负面含义，因为未经同意公开他人的性/性别认同可能带来歧视、骚扰或人身风险。更中性或正面的表达通常是“come out”（自己出柜）。
在一些新闻或社交媒体语境里也会看到“outing”（名词）表示“曝光/揭露（某人身份或秘密）”。使用时要注意语气与当事人隐私。

summary.en: “Outtell” means to tell a story better than someone else, or (more rarely) to reveal too much by talking.
summary.zh: “outtell”指在讲述上胜过别人；（较少见）也可指说得过多而泄露信息。

definition.en: to tell better than someone else; to outdo someone in telling a story or giving an account
definition.zh: （在讲述上）比别人讲得更好；在叙述故事/说明情况时胜过别人

examples.en: He can outtell anyone when it comes to funny stories.
examples.zh: 说到讲笑话，他讲得比谁都精彩。

examples.en: She tried to outtell her brother, but the audience liked his version more.
examples.zh: 她想在讲述上胜过哥哥，但听众更喜欢他的版本。

definition.en: to reveal or express more than intended; to disclose too much by telling
definition.zh: （不小心）说得过多；泄露过多信息

examples.en: In his excitement, he outtold the secret plan.
examples.zh: 他一兴奋，就把秘密计划说漏了。

examples.en: Be careful not to outtell details that should stay private.
examples.zh: 小心别把该保密的细节说太多。

extraExplanation: “outtell”非常少见，现代英语里更常用“outdo (someone) in storytelling / outshine (someone) as a storyteller”。如果你写作想更自然，通常用这些表达。
词形上是“out-（超过）+ tell（讲述）”。很多“out-”动词都表示“胜过/超过”，如“outnumber（数量超过）”“outlive（比……活得久）”。

summary.en: Outtelling means surpassing others in telling a story, or (literary) being more revealing than words.
summary.zh: Outtelling 指讲述上胜过他人；也可（文学用法）指比言语更能暴露真实情况。

definition.en: (present participle/gerund of **outtell**) surpassing someone else in telling a story or giving an account; telling something better, more fully, or more convincingly than another person.
definition.zh: （**outtell** 的现在分词/动名词）在讲述故事或叙述事情时胜过别人；讲得更好、更完整或更有说服力。

examples.en: In every meeting, he keeps **outtelling** the others with longer, more dramatic stories.
examples.zh: 每次开会，他总用更长、更戏剧化的故事把别人都比下去。

examples.en: She tried to avoid **outtelling** her teammate and instead asked questions to share the spotlight.
examples.zh: 她尽量不去“讲得比队友更抢眼”，而是通过提问把关注点分给大家。

definition.en: (literary) being more revealing or expressive than something else, especially showing true feelings more clearly than words do.
definition.zh: （文学/较少见）比其他事物更能“说明问题”；尤其指比言语更能暴露真实情绪或态度。

examples.en: His silence was **outtelling** his polite words.
examples.zh: 他的沉默比客套话更能说明他的真实想法。

examples.en: Her trembling hands were **outtelling** any denial.
examples.zh: 她颤抖的双手比任何否认都更“露馅”。

extraExplanation: “outtelling”不是高频词，更常见的表达是 **outdo someone in storytelling**（讲故事讲得比别人好）、**more telling**（更说明问题/更有力）、或 **betray**（无意中暴露）。
写作中有时会写成 **out-telling**（加连字符）来强调“胜过/压过”的对比意味。

summary.en: Outtell means to tell something better than someone else, or (especially as “outtells”) to reveal something more clearly than words do.
summary.zh: Outtell 指“讲得比别人更好”，也可指（常用 outtells）“比言语更明显地暴露/说明某事”。

definition.en: to tell (a story, fact, or message) better, more clearly, or more effectively than someone else
definition.zh: 比别人讲得更好／更清楚／更有说服力（故事、事实或信息）

examples.en: She can outtell almost anyone when it comes to funny stories.
examples.zh: 讲到有趣的故事，她几乎比任何人都讲得更精彩。

examples.en: No one could outtell him; his details and timing were perfect.
examples.zh: 没人能比他讲得更好；他的细节和节奏都恰到好处。

definition.en: to reveal or show something more strongly than words can (often in the form “outtells”)
definition.zh: 比语言更强烈地显露／说明（常用第三人称形式 outtells）

examples.en: Her nervous smile outtells her confidence.
examples.zh: 她紧张的微笑暴露了她其实没那么自信。

examples.en: The empty streets outtell the seriousness of the storm.
examples.zh: 空荡的街道更能说明暴风雨的严重程度。

extraExplanation: “outtell”比较少见，更多时候人们会用更自然的表达，如 “tell better than… / tell a better story than… / reveal / give away”。
拼写上有时会写成 “out-tell”。你输入的 “outtells” 多半是第三人称单数（he/she/it outtells）。

summary.en: Outthank means to thank someone more than others do, or to express gratitude so strongly that it feels like you can’t thank them enough.
summary.zh: Outthank 指“比别人更感谢”或“感谢到觉得怎么谢都不够”（多用于强调或修辞）。

definition.en: to thank someone more than another person does; to express greater gratitude (often by giving a bigger or more heartfelt thanks).
definition.zh: 比别人更感谢（某人）；表示更强烈的谢意（常指道谢更隆重或更真诚）。

examples.en: I can’t outthank you for what you did—you saved my job.
examples.zh: 你做的事我怎么谢都不够——你保住了我的工作。

examples.en: She tried to outthank everyone with an extra-long thank-you speech.
examples.zh: 她想用一段特别长的致谢词来“谢过”所有人。

definition.en: to thank someone so much that it feels impossible to express enough gratitude (used in a slightly playful or emphatic way).
definition.zh: 感谢到觉得“再怎么谢也不够”（语气较强调或带点俏皮）。

examples.en: We tried to outthank our hosts, but their kindness was endless.
examples.zh: 我们想把主人谢个够，但他们的热情似乎没有尽头。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outnumber）。因此 outthank 直译就是“比别人更会/更能感谢”。
outthank 在现代英语中比较少见，更多时候人们会说 “I can’t thank you enough” 或 “I really appreciate it.”；在写作或演讲里用 outthank 会显得更有修辞感、略带夸张。

summary.en: “Outthanked” (rare) means someone thanked more than others did, or was thanked more than others.
summary.zh: “outthanked”（罕见）指某人的感谢比别人更隆重/更充分，或某人受到的感谢比别人更多。

definition.en: (Rare) thanked someone more than another person did; expressed greater gratitude and made the other person’s thanks seem smaller by comparison.
definition.zh: （罕见）比另一个人更用力、更充分地感谢某人；表达更强的感激之情，从而在比较中“压过”对方的感谢。

examples.en: She outthanked everyone at the banquet, giving a long, heartfelt speech to the hosts.
examples.zh: 在宴会上，她的感谢比所有人都更隆重，给主人做了一段很走心的致谢。

examples.en: I tried to thank the volunteers, but the director outthanked me with a detailed list of names and stories.
examples.zh: 我本想感谢志愿者，但导演用一份详细的名单和故事把我的感谢“比下去”了。

definition.en: (Rare) received thanks more than someone else did; was thanked more often or more warmly (often in passive voice).
definition.zh: （罕见）比另一个人受到更多感谢；被感谢得更频繁或更热烈（常用于被动语态）。

examples.en: Among the team, the coordinator was outthanked, even though many people contributed.
examples.zh: 在团队里，协调员收到的感谢最多，尽管很多人都做出了贡献。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outshine, outrun）。因此 outthank 的字面意思就是“在感谢这件事上胜过”。
outthank / outthanked 属于非常不常见、偏口语或带幽默感的构词；正式写作里更常用 thank someone more / express greater gratitude / be more appreciative 等表达。

summary.en: Outthanking means thanking more than someone else, often jokingly or competitively.
summary.zh: Outthanking 指“比别人更夸张/更强烈地道谢”，常带玩笑或较劲的语气。

definition.en: thanking someone more than another person does; trying to show greater gratitude (often in a humorous or competitive way)
definition.zh: 比别人更用力地道谢；试图表现出更强的感激（常带幽默或“较劲”的语气）

examples.en: They kept outthanking each other after the award ceremony.
examples.zh: 颁奖典礼后，他们一直互相“比谁更会道谢”。

examples.en: Stop outthanking me—I’m already grateful!
examples.zh: 别再跟我“拼命道谢”了——我已经很感激了！

extraExplanation: “outthanking”来自动词 outthank（out- + thank）。out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outrun）。因此 outthank 直译就是“谢得比别人更多/更夸张”。
这个词不算常见，更像口语里临时造词或带喜剧效果的表达；正式写作中更常用 thank someone repeatedly / express deep gratitude / be even more grateful 等说法。

summary.en: Outthanks means thanking someone more than someone else does—often in a playful, informal way.
summary.zh: Outthanks 指“比别人更感谢”，多用于轻松、非正式语境。

definition.en: to thank someone more than another person does; to express stronger or more enthusiastic gratitude (often playful or informal)
definition.zh: 比别人更感谢；用更强烈/更热情的方式表达感谢（常为轻松、非正式用法）

examples.en: You can’t outthank my grandma—she’ll write you three cards for one favor.
examples.zh: 你不可能比我奶奶更会感谢人——你帮一个忙，她能给你写三张感谢卡。

examples.en: I tried to outthank him, but he kept saying, “No, thank you!”
examples.zh: 我想比他更客气地道谢，但他一直说“不会，是我该谢谢你！”

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outshine）。因此 outthank = “thank 得更厉害/更胜一筹”。这个词不算非常常用，更常见的表达是 “thank you so much,” “I really appreciate it,” 或 “I can’t thank you enough.”

summary.en: Outthieve means to steal more than someone else or to outdo others in dishonest taking, often in a literary or humorous tone.
summary.zh: Outthieve 指“比别人偷得更多/更会偷”，也可引申为“在不正当夺取上压过他人”，常带文学或幽默语气。

definition.en: to steal more than someone else; to surpass another person in thievery (often used humorously or in a literary style)
definition.zh: 比别人偷得更多；在偷窃方面胜过他人（常带幽默或文学色彩）

examples.en: He bragged that he could outthieve anyone in the neighborhood.
examples.zh: 他吹嘘自己能在这一带比任何人都更会偷。

examples.en: If you try to cheat the cheaters, you may end up trying to outthieve them.
examples.zh: 如果你想以骗制骗，最后可能变成想在偷骗上胜过他们。

definition.en: to take or obtain more than someone else by dishonest means; to outdo others in wrongdoing (figurative)
definition.zh: 用不正当手段夺取更多；在不法之事上压过他人（引申义）

examples.en: Some companies compete so fiercely that they seem to outthieve each other for market share.
examples.zh: 有些公司竞争激烈到仿佛在用不正当手段争夺市场份额。

examples.en: In the satire, politicians outthieve one another while claiming to serve the public.
examples.zh: 在这部讽刺作品里，政客们一边自称为民服务，一边互相“比谁更贪更黑”。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork, outsmart）。因此 outthieve 字面就是“比……更会偷”。
这个词非常少见，更多见于文学、讽刺或刻意夸张的语境；日常英语里通常会说 steal more than / outsteal（更直白但也不常用）或用比较句表达。

summary.en: “Outthieved” means “stole more than someone else” or “surpassed others in stealing,” and it’s a rare, often humorous/old-fashioned form.
summary.zh: “outthieved”表示“偷得比别人多/在偷窃上胜过别人”，很少见，常带幽默或古旧语感。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “outthieve”: to steal more than someone else, or to surpass someone in stealing (often used humorously or in old-fashioned writing).
definition.zh: “outthieve”的过去式/过去分词：偷得比别人更多，或在偷窃方面胜过别人（常带幽默或较古旧的语气）。

examples.en: He bragged that he had outthieved every rival in the city.
examples.zh: 他吹嘘自己在城里把所有对手都“偷赢”了。

examples.en: In the story, the apprentice tried to outthieve his master and got caught.
examples.zh: 故事里，学徒想在偷窃上胜过师父，结果被抓了。

extraExplanation: 这个词很少见，属于由前缀 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ thieve（偷窃）构成的动词。英语里常见的同类构词有 outsmart（智胜）、outwork（干得比……多/更努力）。
thieve 本身作为动词比 steal 更少用、更带文学/古风感；outthieve 更偏修辞或玩笑式表达，日常英语通常会说 “steal more than” 或 “be a bigger thief than …”。

summary.en: Outthieving means surpassing others in stealing—stealing more or more skillfully (rare, often humorous/literary).
summary.zh: outthieving 指在偷窃方面胜过他人——偷得更多或更“高明”（较少见，常带幽默或文学色彩）。

definition.en: stealing more than someone else, or stealing more skillfully; trying to surpass others in thieving (rare, often humorous or literary).
definition.zh: 比别人偷得更多或偷得更“高明”；试图在偷窃方面胜过他人（较少见，常带幽默或文学色彩）。

examples.en: The novel mocks corrupt officials who keep outthieving one another.
examples.zh: 小说讽刺那些腐败官员彼此“比着偷”。

examples.en: He boasted about outthieving his rivals, as if crime were a contest.
examples.zh: 他吹嘘自己比对手更会偷，好像犯罪是一场比赛。

definition.en: the act of surpassing others in stealing (used as a gerund).
definition.zh: 在偷窃方面胜过他人的行为（作动名词用）。

examples.en: Outthieving became the gang’s ugly measure of status.
examples.zh: “比谁偷得更厉害”成了帮派里丑陋的地位标准。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo 超越，outsmart 智胜）。因此 outthieve / outthieving 多用于修辞或讽刺语境，把“偷窃”说成一种可以竞争、可以‘胜出’的行为。
outthieve 本身比较罕见，更多会用常见表达替换：steal more than…, be a bigger thief than…, outdo someone in stealing。

summary.en: Outthink means to defeat someone by thinking more intelligently or strategically.
summary.zh: outthink 指用更聪明或更有策略的思考胜过他人、以智取胜。

definition.en: to think more cleverly, quickly, or strategically than someone else; to defeat someone by superior thinking
definition.zh: 比别人想得更聪明/更快/更有策略；用更高明的思考取胜

examples.en: She outthought her opponent and won the debate.
examples.zh: 她比对手更会思考，赢得了辩论。

examples.en: In chess, you try to outthink the other player.
examples.zh: 在国际象棋中，你要设法在思考上胜过对方。

examples.en: The team outthought bigger competitors by planning smarter.
examples.zh: 这个团队通过更聪明的计划，在思考上胜过了更大的竞争对手。

definition.en: the act of outthinking someone; a victory achieved through better thinking (less common)
definition.zh: 以智取胜的行为/结果；靠更好的思考获得的胜利（较少见）

examples.en: It was an outthink, not a show of strength.
examples.zh: 那是一次以智取胜，而不是靠力量。

extraExplanation: out- 是常见前缀，表示“超过/胜过”（如 outplay, outwork）。outthink 常用于竞争情境：辩论、谈判、商业策略、解谜、棋类等，强调“靠思考赢”。
常见搭配：outthink an opponent/rival/enemy（在智谋上胜过对手）；outthink the competition（在策略上胜过竞争者）。

summary.en: Outthinking means beating someone by thinking more cleverly or strategically; it can also mean the act of doing this.
summary.zh: outthinking 指用更聪明或更有策略的思考来智胜别人；也可指这种“智胜”的过程。

definition.en: thinking more cleverly, quickly, or strategically than someone else; using your mind to gain an advantage.
definition.zh: 比别人想得更聪明、更快或更有策略；用思考取得优势。

examples.en: In chess, winning often comes from outthinking your opponent rather than moving faster.
examples.zh: 在国际象棋中，获胜往往来自于在思路上胜过对手，而不是下得更快。

examples.en: She solved the problem by outthinking the system, not by breaking the rules.
examples.zh: 她是通过巧妙思考、找出系统的漏洞来解决问题的，并不是靠违规。

definition.en: the act or process of outthinking someone (used like a noun).
definition.zh: 智胜他人的思考过程（可作名词用）。

examples.en: His outthinking of stronger teams made him a respected coach.
examples.zh: 他能在思路上智胜更强的队伍，使他成为受人尊敬的教练。

examples.en: The movie celebrates brains over brawn—outthinking over fighting.
examples.zh: 这部电影赞美智胜蛮力——用脑子而不是用拳头。

extraExplanation: “outthinking”通常是动词“outthink”的现在分词/动名词形式。更常见的写法是用动词原形：outthink (someone)；例如：We need to outthink our competitors.
构词提示：out- 表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart, outrun, outwork），所以 outthink = “在思考上胜过”。

summary.en: “Outthinks” means “defeats someone by thinking better,” the third-person singular of “outthink.”
summary.zh: “outthinks”表示“在思考/策略上胜过某人”，是“outthink”的第三人称单数。

definition.en: to think more cleverly, quickly, or strategically than someone; to defeat someone by being smarter or planning better
definition.zh: 比某人想得更聪明/更快/更有策略；用更高明的思考或计划战胜对方

examples.en: The detective outthinks the criminals and solves the case.
examples.zh: 侦探比罪犯更聪明，破了案。

examples.en: In chess, she often outthinks her opponents in the endgame.
examples.zh: 在国际象棋里，她常常在残局阶段智胜对手。

examples.en: He outthinks everyone in meetings by asking the right questions.
examples.zh: 他在会议上总能问到关键问题，思路胜过别人。

extraExplanation: “outthinks”是动词“outthink”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outthinks）。常见结构：outthink + someone（outthink your rival）。
前缀“out-”常表示“胜过、超过”（如 outwork 工作更努力、outperform 表现更好、outsmart 更聪明地取胜）。

summary.en: “Outthought” means you thought more cleverly than someone (the past form of “outthink”).
summary.zh: “outthought”表示“在思考/谋划上胜过别人”，是“outthink”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of outthink) to have thought more cleverly or effectively than someone, so you could defeat them in planning or reasoning.
definition.zh: （outthink 的过去式/过去分词）想得比别人更周全或更聪明，从而在计划或推理上胜过对方。

examples.en: She outthought her opponent and won the debate.
examples.zh: 她想得比对手更周全，赢得了辩论。

examples.en: The detective outthought the criminal by predicting his next move.
examples.zh: 侦探预测了罪犯的下一步行动，从而在智谋上胜过了他。

examples.en: We were outthought in the negotiations, so we changed our strategy.
examples.zh: 我们在谈判中被对方算计得更周全，所以我们改变了策略。

extraExplanation: “outthought”常见于较正式或叙事性的英文中，口语里更常直接用动词原形“outthink”或用同义词如“outsmart”。
词形来源：out-（胜过、超过）+ think（思考）。过去式不规则：outthink → outthought（类比 think → thought）。

summary.en: Outthreaten means to threaten more strongly or more effectively than someone else.
summary.zh: outthreaten 指“用更强或更有效的威胁压过别人”。

definition.en: to threaten someone more strongly or more effectively than another person does; to make a bigger threat in order to gain advantage
definition.zh: 比别人更强烈或更有效地威胁；用更大的威胁来压过对方、取得优势

examples.en: The rival gangs tried to outthreaten each other, but it only made the conflict worse.
examples.zh: 敌对帮派试图互相“比谁更会威胁”，结果只让冲突更糟。

examples.en: Instead of negotiating, he tried to outthreaten the other side into agreeing.
examples.zh: 他没有谈判，而是想用更强硬的威胁逼对方同意。

examples.en: She refused to outthreaten anyone and chose to speak calmly.
examples.zh: 她拒绝用更大的威胁压人，而选择冷静表达。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 工作更努力，outsmart 更聪明地胜过）。因此 outthreaten 直译就是“在威胁上胜过”。这个词不算高频，更常见的表达有 “make a bigger threat / threaten more strongly / escalate threats”。

summary.en: “Outthrew” means “threw farther than (someone else)” and is the past tense of “outthrow.”
summary.zh: “outthrew”表示“投/扔得比别人更远”，是“outthrow”的过去式。

definition.en: Past tense of “outthrow”: to throw something farther than someone else (or farther than before).
definition.zh: “outthrow”的过去式：把某物扔得比别人更远（或比之前更远）。

examples.en: She outthrew everyone in the class during the distance-throw contest.
examples.zh: 在远投比赛中，她把全班同学都甩在了后面。

examples.en: With a stronger tailwind, he outthrew his personal best.
examples.zh: 借着更强的顺风，他投出了超过个人最好成绩的一投。

definition.en: (Figurative, rare) To surpass someone by acting more boldly or decisively; to outdo.
definition.zh: （比喻用法，较少见）以更大胆或更果断的行动超越某人；胜过、压过。

examples.en: In the debate, she outthrew her opponent with a surprising final argument.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，她用一个出人意料的收尾论点压过了对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork, outsmart）。因此 outthrow 的核心含义就是“扔得更远/更好”。
这是一个不规则变化动词：outthrow – outthrew – outthrown。实际写作中更常见的表达是 throw farther / throw further than。

summary.en: Outthrob means to pulse or beat more strongly or more noticeably than something else, and it’s mainly a literary/stylized verb.
summary.zh: outthrob 指“（比另一事物）跳动/搏动得更强、更明显”，多用于文学或带描写风格的表达。

definition.en: to beat or pulse more strongly or more noticeably than something else
definition.zh: （比另一事物）跳动得更强、更明显；更有节奏地搏动

examples.en: In the quiet room, his heartbeat seemed to outthrob the ticking clock.
examples.zh: 在安静的房间里，他的心跳似乎比钟表的滴答声更明显。

examples.en: The bass line outthrobbed every other instrument in the club.
examples.zh: 夜店里低音线条的震动感压过了其他所有乐器。

extraExplanation: 这是一个很少见的词，通常出现在文学或较有风格的描写中。它由前缀 out-（“胜过、超过”）+ throb（“跳动、悸动”）构成，语感上比普通的 “beat more strongly” 更有画面感。
更常用的表达包括：outpulse（较少见）、throb louder/stronger、pound harder、be more noticeable than 等。

summary.en: Outthrobbed means “throbbed more strongly or noticeably than something else.”
summary.zh: outthrobbed 表示“跳动得更强、更明显，胜过另一方”。

definition.en: Past tense of **outthrob**: to throb (beat or pulse) more strongly, loudly, or noticeably than someone or something else.
definition.zh: **outthrob** 的过去式：指（心跳、脉动、鼓点等）比另一方跳动得更强烈、更响或更明显。

examples.en: In the silent room, his heartbeat **outthrobbed** the ticking clock.
examples.zh: 在安静的房间里，他的心跳声**盖过了**钟表的滴答声。

examples.en: The bass drum **outthrobbed** the rest of the band during the finale.
examples.zh: 在终章里，大鼓的低沉鼓点**比**乐队其他声音**更强烈**。

examples.en: Her fear **outthrobbed** her calm, making her hands shake.
examples.zh: 她的恐惧感**压过了**冷静，手都开始发抖。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“胜过、超过”（如 outsmart 聪明过、outwork 比…更努力）。所以 outthrob = “跳动得比…更强”。
“outthrobbed”在日常口语中不算常见，更偏文学/描写性用法；写作时常用于把声音或情绪写得更有画面感。

summary.en: Outthrobbing means “throbbing more strongly or noticeably than something else.”
summary.zh: outthrobbing 指“（与另一事物相比）跳动/搏动得更强烈或更明显”。

definition.en: (present participle) beating or pulsing more strongly, loudly, or noticeably than something else; surpassing in throbbing.
definition.zh: （现在分词）跳动、搏动得比另一事物更强烈、更响亮或更明显；在“搏动”方面胜过。

examples.en: The pain in my tooth was outthrobbing everything else, so I couldn’t focus.
examples.zh: 牙痛的跳痛盖过了其他一切感觉，所以我无法集中注意力。

examples.en: In the quiet room, his heartbeat felt outthrobbing the ticking clock.
examples.zh: 在安静的房间里，他感觉自己的心跳声比钟表的滴答声更明显。

definition.en: (as a verb form) the act of throbbing more strongly than; to outdo in pulsing or beating.
definition.zh: （作动词形式）跳动得比……更强；在脉动或搏动上超过。

examples.en: Her anxiety outthrobbing her calm, she finally spoke up.
examples.zh: 焦虑的心跳压过了平静，她终于开口了。

examples.en: The bass was outthrobbing the melody in the small speakers.
examples.zh: 在小音箱里，低音的震动感比旋律更突出。

extraExplanation: “out-” 是英语里很常见的前缀，常表示“超过/胜过”（如 outshine 胜过、outgrow 长得比……快）。因此 outthrob / outthrobbing 主要靠构词法就能理解：throb（跳动、抽痛、震动）→ outthrob（跳得更强/更明显）。
outthrobbing 不是高频词，更常见的表达是 “throbbing more than … / throbbing louder/stronger than …”。但在文学描写或强调对比时，用 outthrobbing 会更有画面感。

summary.en: Outthrobs means “beats/throbs more strongly than,” and it’s the third-person singular form of outthrob.
summary.zh: outthrobs 表示“比……搏动/跳动得更强、更明显”，是 outthrob 的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: (third-person singular of outthrob) to beat or throb more strongly, loudly, or noticeably than something else; to surpass in throbbing.
definition.zh: （outthrob 的第三人称单数）比……跳动/搏动得更强、更响或更明显；在“搏动”程度上胜过……。

examples.en: The bass line outthrobs the melody, making the whole room vibrate.
examples.zh: 低音线条的震动感盖过了旋律，让整个房间都在发颤。

examples.en: In the silence, his heartbeat outthrobs the ticking clock.
examples.zh: 在寂静中，他的心跳声比钟表的滴答声更突出。

examples.en: The nightclub’s music outthrobs the traffic outside.
examples.zh: 夜店的音乐震得比外面的车流声还更明显。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outshine 胜过……的光彩，outperform 表现优于……）。outthrob 属于比较少见、偏文学/描写性的造词，用来强调某种规律的“搏动/震颤”在感受上压过另一种声音或节奏。

summary.en: “Outthrough” is not standard; the usual form is “out through” = to the outside by going through something.
summary.zh: “outthrough”不是标准写法；通常写作“out through”，表示“穿过某处到外面去”。

definition.en: Not a standard single English word. It is usually written as two words: “out through,” meaning “to the outside by going through (a door, window, passage, etc.).”
definition.zh: 不是标准的单个英文单词。通常写作两个词“out through”，意思是“穿过（门/窗/通道等）到外面去”。

examples.en: We went out through the back door to avoid the crowd.
examples.zh: 我们从后门出去，以避开人群。

examples.en: Light poured out through the open window.
examples.zh: 光线从开着的窗户倾泻出来。

extraExplanation: “out through”更常见的结构是：go/run/walk + out + through + 地点（the door/the gate/the tunnel）。其中 out 表示“向外”，through 表示“穿过/通过”。
如果你想表达“在……整个期间/遍及”，你可能想找的是 “throughout”（例如：throughout the year = 全年）。拼写上很容易和“out through”混淆。

summary.en: Outthrow means to surpass someone by throwing farther or better.
summary.zh: outthrow 指在投掷方面胜过别人（扔得更远或更好）。

definition.en: to throw something farther, higher, or better than someone else; to surpass in throwing
definition.zh: （在投掷上）比别人扔得更远/更高/更好；在投掷方面胜过

examples.en: She outthrew everyone in the class during the softball drill.
examples.zh: 在垒球训练中，她比班上所有人都扔得更远。

examples.en: With one clean motion, he outthrew his rival by two meters.
examples.zh: 他一个干净利落的动作，就比对手多扔了两米。

extraExplanation: “out- + throw”是很直观的构词法（out- 表示“超过、胜过”）。但“outthrow”在现代英语里不算常用，更多时候人们会说“throw farther/further than”或用“outdistance / outperform”来表达类似意思。
常见语境：体育投掷类项目（如标枪、铅球、铁饼）或日常比较谁“扔得更远”。写作时如果担心读者不熟悉，这个词可以用更常见的表达替换。

summary.en: Outthrowing means surpassing others in throwing (farther, harder, or better).
summary.zh: outthrowing 指在投掷上胜过他人（更远、更有力或更出色）。

definition.en: (Present participle of outthrow) throwing something farther, harder, or better than someone else; outperforming another person in throwing.
definition.zh: （outthrow 的现在分词）在投掷上比别人扔得更远、更有力或更出色；在“投掷能力”上胜过他人。

examples.en: She kept outthrowing the other athletes in practice.
examples.zh: 她在训练中一直比其他运动员投得更远。

examples.en: He won the contest by outthrowing everyone on the final attempt.
examples.zh: 他在最后一次尝试中投得比所有人都远，从而赢得了比赛。

examples.en: Their pitcher is outthrowing ours in warm-ups.
examples.zh: 他们的投手热身时投得比我们的更强。

definition.en: The act or skill of surpassing others in throwing (used as a noun, less common).
definition.zh: 在投掷方面超过他人的行为或能力（作名词用，较不常见）。

examples.en: His outthrowing impressed the scouts.
examples.zh: 他的投掷实力让球探们印象深刻。

examples.en: Outthrowing is important in field events like the javelin.
examples.zh: 在标枪等田赛项目中，“投得更远”很重要。

extraExplanation: “outthrowing”多见于体育或竞赛语境（如标枪、掷铁饼、棒球/垒球投球等），表示在“投得更远/更强/更准”方面胜过对手。日常口语里更常用更具体的表达，如 “throw farther than… / throw harder than… / have a stronger arm”。

summary.en: “Outthrown” most commonly means having thrown better/farther than others (past participle of outthrow); a rarer meaning is “thrown out.”
summary.zh: “outthrown”最常见指“在投掷上胜过别人”（outthrow 的过去分词）；较少见时也可指“被扔出去”。

definition.en: past participle of “outthrow”: thrown farther, harder, or better than someone/something else (often in sports or contests).
definition.zh: “outthrow”的过去分词：在投掷上比别人/别物更远、更有力或更出色（常见于体育或比赛语境）。

examples.en: She outthrown everyone in the javelin event.
examples.zh: 在标枪比赛中，她比所有人都投得更远。

examples.en: The visiting team’s pitcher was outthrown by our starter.
examples.zh: 客队投手在投球表现上被我方先发投手比下去了。

definition.en: thrown out; cast out (a rare/older-sounding use, usually replaced by “thrown out”).
definition.zh: 被扔出去；被抛出（较少见/偏旧式的用法，通常用“thrown out”替代）。

examples.en: The spoiled food was outthrown into the bin.
examples.zh: 变质的食物被扔进了垃圾桶。

extraExplanation: “outthrown”来自动词“outthrow”（out- 表示“胜过/超过” + throw“投掷”）。在现代英语里，“outthrow / outthrown”整体都比较少见；更常用的表达是“throw farther than…（比……投得更远）”或在棒球语境里说“outpitch / outpitched（在投球上压过对手）”。
如果你是在体育报道或比赛描述中看到它，通常指“在投掷距离/力度/表现上胜过对手”，而不是字面意义的“把某物扔出去”。

summary.en: “Outthrows” means “throws farther than someone else” or “surpasses a previous throwing distance.”
summary.zh: “Outthrows”表示“投得比别人更远”或“投掷距离超过之前的成绩”。

definition.en: throws something farther than another person, or throws farther than before; surpasses in throwing distance
definition.zh: （在投掷距离上）比别人投得更远；或比之前投得更远；在投掷方面胜过

examples.en: She outthrows everyone on the team in practice.
examples.zh: 在训练中，她比队里所有人都投得更远。

examples.en: He outthrows his older brother by several meters.
examples.zh: 他比哥哥多投了好几米。

examples.en: With better technique, she outthrows her personal best.
examples.zh: 凭借更好的技巧，她投得比自己的最好成绩还远。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outsmart 比别人更聪明）。因此 outthrow = throw（投掷）+ out（超过）→“投得更远/更强”。
“outthrow”在日常英语中不算特别常见，更常见的表达有 throw farther / throw further，或在体育语境中说 someone has a longer throw（某人投掷距离更远）。

summary.en: Outthrust most commonly means a projecting part that sticks out; more rarely, it can mean to thrust something outward.
summary.zh: Outthrust 最常指“突出的部分/伸出物”；较少见时也可作动词，表示“把……猛地伸出/推出”。

definition.en: a part that sticks out; a projecting extension (often used for land, rock, or a structure).
definition.zh: 突出的部分；伸出的延伸物（常用于地形、岩石或建筑结构等）。

examples.en: We rested on a rocky outthrust above the river.
examples.zh: 我们在河上方一处突出的岩石上休息。

examples.en: The castle’s outthrusts made it easier to watch the valley below.
examples.zh: 城堡伸出的结构让人更容易观察下面的山谷。

definition.en: to thrust out; to push something outward (rare/old-fashioned).
definition.zh: 把……猛地伸出/推出（较少见、偏旧式用法）。

examples.en: He outthrust his arm to stop the door from closing.
examples.zh: 他猛地伸出手臂，阻止门关上。

examples.en: The speaker outthrust a finger to emphasize the point.
examples.zh: 演讲者伸出一根手指来强调这一点。

extraExplanation: “outthrust”作名词时，多见于描写自然景观或文学性语境，意思接近“突出的岬角/岩脊/伸出部”。日常口语里更常用更具体的词，如“outcropping（露头）”“projection（突出部）”“promontory（海岬/岬角）”。
作动词时比较少见，现代英语更常说“thrust out / stick out / push out”。

summary.en: An outthruster is a small external thruster used for maneuvering or attitude control.
summary.zh: outthruster 指用于机动或姿态控制的外部小型推进器。

definition.en: a small propulsion jet (a “thruster”), often placed on the outside of a spacecraft or vehicle, used to push it slightly in a particular direction—especially for turning, stabilizing, or fine movement.
definition.zh: （通常装在航天器或载具外部的）小型推进喷口/推进器，用于在特定方向产生小推力，常用于转向、姿态稳定或精细移动。

examples.en: The pilot fired the outthrusters to rotate the ship without using the main engine.
examples.zh: 飞行员点火外侧推进器，让飞船在不使用主引擎的情况下旋转。

examples.en: One outthruster was damaged, so the spacecraft drifted slightly off its intended attitude.
examples.zh: 有一个外侧推进器受损，所以航天器的姿态略微偏离预定方向。

extraExplanation: “outthruster”不是日常英语中的常见标准词，更常见的说法是“thruster”“maneuvering thruster（机动推进器）”“reaction control thruster / RCS jet（反作用控制推进器/姿控喷口）”。它在科幻作品、游戏或非正式技术语境里更容易出现，用来强调“位于外侧/用于外向推力的小喷口”。

summary.en: “Outthrusting” means projecting outward or sticking out; it can also mean the act of thrusting outward (rare).
summary.zh: “outthrusting”指“向外突出/伸出”；也可指“向外猛推/伸出的动作”（较少见）。

definition.en: (describing something) sticking out; projecting outward.
definition.zh: （形容）伸出、突出；向外凸出。

examples.en: The outthrusting branch cast a long shadow across the path.
examples.zh: 那根突出的树枝在小路上投下了长长的影子。

examples.en: She leaned on the outthrusting rock to steady herself.
examples.zh: 她靠在那块凸出的岩石上稳住身体。

definition.en: the act or movement of thrusting outward (rare).
definition.zh: 向外猛推/伸出的动作或过程（较少见）。

examples.en: The outthrusting of the piston drives the machine forward.
examples.zh: 活塞向外推出的动作推动机器前进。

extraExplanation: “outthrusting”来自动词“outthrust”（out- 向外 + thrust 猛推/伸出），常见于描写性文字（自然景物、建筑细节、人体姿态等），语气偏文学或正式。日常口语里更常用“sticking out / protruding / jutting out”。

summary.en: Outthunder means to overpower or outdo someone or something in loudness, force, or impact.
summary.zh: outthunder 指在声音、气势或影响力上压过、胜过对方（带有“雷鸣般压倒”的形象）。

definition.en: To be louder, more powerful, or more impressive than (someone or something), as if drowning it out like thunder.
definition.zh: （在声音、气势或影响力上）盖过、压过（某人或某事）；像雷声一样把对方“压下去”。

examples.en: The lead actor’s final speech outthundered the applause in the theater.
examples.zh: 主角最后的独白气势如虹，甚至盖过了剧院里的掌声。

examples.en: Her calm facts outthundered his angry shouting.
examples.zh: 她冷静的事实陈述压过了他愤怒的吼叫。

examples.en: The new campaign outthundered its rivals on social media.
examples.zh: 这次新宣传在社交媒体上的声量和影响力压过了竞争对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart 胜过智谋、outshine 更出众）。outthunder 由 out- + thunder（雷鸣）构成，带有强烈的形象感，多用于文学、演讲评论或夸张修辞中，日常口语里相对少见。

summary.en: “Outthwack” is an informal, playful verb meaning to beat or outdo someone by hitting/striking more forcefully—or, more generally, to surpass them in a rough way.
summary.zh: “outthwack”是一个非正式、带玩笑意味的动词，意思是“在猛击/敲打上胜过别人”，也可引申为“以粗猛方式压过对手”。

definition.en: to hit, strike, or beat someone or something more effectively or more times than another person; to outdo in “thwacking” (informal, playful, and rare).
definition.zh: 比别人更厉害地猛击；在“啪/砰地打”这件事上胜过别人（非正式、带玩笑意味、较少见）。

examples.en: He bragged that he could outthwack anyone in the drum circle.
examples.zh: 他吹嘘自己在鼓圈里能把任何人都“敲得更厉害”。

examples.en: The new paddle outthwacked the old one in the water fight.
examples.zh: 在打水仗里，新桨比旧桨更能“拍出狠劲儿”。

definition.en: (by extension) to outperform or surpass someone in a rough, forceful way (often humorous).
definition.zh: （引申）以一种粗猛、带点蛮力的方式胜过别人（常带幽默）。

examples.en: Their marketing team outthwacked the competition with bold ads.
examples.zh: 他们的营销团队靠大胆广告把对手“狠狠干趴下”。

extraExplanation: “outthwack”不是常见词，多半是口语/网络语境中的临时造词（creative coinage）。结构上是前缀 out-（“超过”）+ thwack（拟声词，表示“啪/砰的一击”）。因此读者通常能靠构词法猜到意思：在“打/拍/敲”这类动作上胜过别人。
使用时要注意语气：它听起来很俏皮、夸张，不适合正式写作；更常见的表达可以用 outdo / outperform / beat / surpass，或更具体的 out-hit / outstrike。

summary.en: Outtinkle means to make a tinkling sound that is more noticeable than another sound.
summary.zh: Outtinkle 指叮当声比别的声音更明显、更清脆或更响，带有“盖过、胜过”的意思。

definition.en: to make a tinkling sound that is louder, clearer, or more noticeable than another sound; to “tinkle more” than something else
definition.zh: （声音）比另一种叮当声更响、更清脆或更引人注意；“叮当声盖过”

examples.en: The small bell outtinkled the coins in his pocket.
examples.zh: 小铃铛的声音比他口袋里的硬币叮当声更清脆响亮。

examples.en: In the quiet room, her bracelet outtinkled everything else.
examples.zh: 在安静的房间里，她手链的叮当声盖过了其他一切声音。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outshine 胜过、outnumber 数量超过）。因此 outtinkle 字面意思是“叮当得比……更厉害”。
这个词非常少见，多用于描写性、带一点文学色彩的语境；日常口语里更常说 “be louder than / drown out / ring louder than”。

summary.en: “Outtinkled” means “made a louder/clearer tinkling sound than something else,” the past form of “out-tinkle.”
summary.zh: “outtinkled”意为“叮当声比……更响/更清脆”，是动词“out-tinkle”的过去式。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “out-tinkle”: to make a clearer or louder tinkling sound than someone or something else; to surpass in tinkling.
definition.zh: “out-tinkle”的过去式/过去分词：发出比别人或别的东西更清脆或更响的叮当声；在叮当声上胜过。

examples.en: The small bell outtinkled the larger one in the quiet room.
examples.zh: 在安静的房间里，小铃铛的叮当声比大铃铛更清脆。

examples.en: Her bracelet outtinkled everyone else’s as she walked down the hallway.
examples.zh: 她走过走廊时，手链的叮当声比其他人的都更明显。

definition.en: (Less common, literary/humorous) To outdo someone in cheerful, bell-like sounds (often used playfully).
definition.zh: （较少见，偏文学/幽默）在欢快的“铃声般”声响上胜过某人（常带玩笑语气）。

examples.en: The wind chimes seemed to outtinkle and outtinkled the music on the porch.
examples.zh: 门廊上的风铃似乎把音乐的声音都“叮当”过了。

extraExplanation: “outtinkled”不是常见的标准词条形式，更常见的写法是带连字符的动词“out-tinkle”，意思是“在叮当声上胜过……”。它属于比较/竞胜用法（out- 表示“超过、胜过”，如 outshine 超过、胜过）。
这种词更常见于文学描写或幽默表达，而不常用于正式写作。日常表达里也可以用更普通的说法：“rang louder/clearer than…”（比……更响/更清脆）。

summary.en: Outtinkling is a rare, literary word meaning to tinkle more brightly or loudly than something else, or the act of doing so.
summary.zh: Outtinkling 是较罕见的文学用词，指“叮当声更清脆/更响，压过别的声音”，也可指这种“压过”的过程。

definition.en: (literary, rare) making a brighter or louder tinkling sound than someone or something else; surpassing in a light ringing sound.
definition.zh: （文学用语，罕见）发出比他人/他物更清亮或更响的叮当声；在清脆铃响声方面胜过、压过。

examples.en: In the quiet hall, her silver bracelets were outtinkling everyone else’s jewelry.
examples.zh: 在安静的大厅里，她的银手镯叮当作响，比其他人的首饰声更清脆更响。

examples.en: The small bell kept outtinkling the wind chimes outside the window.
examples.zh: 那只小铃铛的叮当声一直压过窗外风铃的声响。

definition.en: the act of surpassing another sound with a tinkling ring; the process of out-tinkling.
definition.zh: 以叮当声压过其他声音的行为/过程；“out-tinkle”的动作。

examples.en: The outtinkling of tiny ice crystals was the only music in the morning air.
examples.zh: 细小冰晶的叮当声压过一切，成了清晨空气里唯一的“音乐”。

extraExplanation: “outtinkling”多见于较有文采的描写中，常由“out-（超过）+ tinkle（叮当作响）”构成。更常见的写法是带连字符的“out-tinkling”，或直接用动词短语“tinkle louder/brighter than …”。
它不是常用词，日常英语里更自然的表达包括：“be louder than… / drown out… / outshine (in sound) … / ring more clearly than …”。

summary.en: Outtire means to wear someone out, or to outlast someone by greater endurance (a less common word).
summary.zh: Outtire 指“使筋疲力尽”，也可指“在耐力上胜过、把对方耗垮”（较少见用法）。

definition.en: to make someone (or yourself) very tired; to wear out.
definition.zh: 使（某人或自己）非常疲惫；使筋疲力尽。

examples.en: The long hike outtired the children before we reached the campsite.
examples.zh: 长途徒步在到达营地前就把孩子们累坏了。

examples.en: Try not to outtire yourself on the first day of training.
examples.zh: 训练第一天别把自己累得太狠。

definition.en: to tire more than someone else; to outlast or defeat someone by greater endurance.
definition.zh: 比别人更能撑；以更强的耐力胜过（对手）。

examples.en: In the final round, she outtired her opponent and won by persistence.
examples.zh: 在最后一轮，她靠更强的耐力把对手耗垮，凭坚持获胜。

examples.en: The strategy was to outtire the other team with constant pressure.
examples.zh: 策略是用持续施压把对方球队耗到更累。

extraExplanation: “outtire”较少见，现代英语更常用“tire out / wear out（使累坏）”，或用“outlast（比…更持久）”“outwear（比…更耐用）”来表达“胜过对方的耐力/持久度”。
这个词有时也写作带连字符的“out-tire”，在较旧的文学或正式文体中偶尔能见到。

summary.en: Outtired means extremely tired, often implying being more tired than others; it’s uncommon in modern English.
summary.zh: outtired 表示“非常累”，常含“比别人更累”的意思；在现代英语中不太常用。

definition.en: more tired than someone else; exhausted beyond another person or group
definition.zh: 比别人更累的；累过别人（更疲惫的）

examples.en: After the long hike, I was completely outtired and went straight to bed.
examples.zh: 走完那段长途徒步后，我累过头了，直接上床睡了。

examples.en: They looked outtired by the final rehearsal.
examples.zh: 到最后一次彩排时，他们看起来已经累得不行了。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of the rare verb outtire) to make someone more tired than others; to tire out completely
definition.zh: （罕见动词 outtire 的过去式/过去分词）使某人比别人更疲惫；把人累垮

examples.en: The double shift outtired him, and he could barely focus.
examples.zh: 连上两班把他累垮了，他几乎无法专注。

examples.en: Trying to do everything at once has outtired me.
examples.zh: 想一次把所有事情都做完，结果把我累坏了。

extraExplanation: “outtired”并不是现代英语里很常见、很标准的拼写；更多时候人们会说：“more tired than… / the most tired / exhausted / worn out”。
前缀 out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力，outnumber 数量超过），所以 outtired 可理解为“累得超过别人/被累倒”。在正式写作中，建议用更常见的表达以避免读者困惑。
也有人会写成带连字符的 out-tired，但仍然偏少见。

summary.en: “Outtiring” is a rare word meaning “very exhausting” or “wearing someone out.”
summary.zh: “outtiring”很少用，意思是“非常累人的 / 把人累垮的（使精疲力尽）”。

definition.en: (rare) Wearing someone out; causing someone to become very tired (present participle/adjective form of “outtire”).
definition.zh: （罕见）使人精疲力尽的；把人累垮的（outtire 的现在分词/形容词用法）。

examples.en: The long march was outtiring even for the strongest hikers.
examples.zh: 这段长途行军即使对最强壮的徒步者来说也很累人。

examples.en: They planned breaks so the work wouldn’t become outtiring.
examples.zh: 他们安排了休息，好让工作不至于把人累垮。

definition.en: (rare) To tire someone out completely; to exhaust (from the verb “outtire”).
definition.zh: （罕见）把某人彻底累垮；使精疲力尽（动词 outtire）。

examples.en: The heat outtired the runners by midday.
examples.zh: 到了中午，高温把跑者都累垮了。

examples.en: Try not to outtire yourself before the exam.
examples.zh: 考试前尽量别把自己累垮。

extraExplanation: “outtiring/outtire”在现代英语中非常少见，日常更常说：tiring / exhausting / wear someone out / tire someone out。
如果你想表达“精力充沛、从不疲倦”，常用的反义词是“untiring”（不知疲倦的）。

summary.en: Outtoil means to work harder or longer than someone else.
summary.zh: outtoil 指比别人更辛苦或更久地工作，从而胜过对方。

definition.en: to work harder or longer than someone else; to surpass someone through effort
definition.zh: 比别人更辛苦/更久地工作；以努力胜过（某人）

examples.en: She outtoiled her competitors and won the promotion.
examples.zh: 她比竞争对手更努力工作，最终获得了晋升。

examples.en: The team outtoiled their rivals in the second half.
examples.zh: 这支球队在下半场比对手更拼更卖力。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outtoil 是“toil（辛苦劳作）+ out-（超过）”的合成词。
outtoil 相对少见，更常用的表达是 outwork 或 work harder than。写作或正式语境中用 outtoil 会显得更有文学感、强调“辛劳”。

summary.en: “Outtold” means “told better than someone else” (past of outtell).
summary.zh: “outtold”表示“讲得比别人更好/更精彩”（outtell 的过去式）。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “outtell”: to tell a story, joke, or account better or more effectively than someone else; to surpass in telling.
definition.zh: “outtell”的过去式和过去分词：讲故事/讲笑话/叙述得比别人更好、更吸引人；在“讲述”方面胜过别人。

examples.en: At the reunion, she outtold everyone with a hilarious story from college.
examples.zh: 在聚会上，她讲了一个大学时期的爆笑故事，把大家都比下去了。

examples.en: No matter how many times we tried, we couldn’t outtell his version of the joke.
examples.zh: 不管我们试了多少次，都讲不过他那个版本的笑话。

extraExplanation: “outtold”非常少见，多用于较文学或玩笑式的表达。日常英语里，人们更常说：“told it better / told a better story / outdid him in storytelling”。
拼写上通常不加连字符（outtold），但在较老的文本里偶尔会看到 out-told。

summary.en: Outtongue means to defeat someone in speech—by talking better, louder, or more sharply.
summary.zh: Outtongue 指在言语上压过别人：更会说、更大声或更尖刻，从而在“嘴上”取胜。

definition.en: to speak more loudly, more skillfully, or more aggressively than someone; to outtalk
definition.zh: 在口才、声音或言语攻势上胜过某人；把某人“说服/说倒”（相当于 outtalk）

examples.en: In the debate, she outtongued her opponent with quick, clear answers.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，她用又快又清晰的回答在口才上压过了对手。

examples.en: He tried to outtongue the critics, but the facts were against him.
examples.zh: 他想用嘴上功夫压过批评者，但事实对他不利。

definition.en: to surpass someone in using sharp or abusive language; to out-argue or out-insult
definition.zh: 在尖刻或辱骂性言辞上胜过某人；用更狠的话回击（偏负面）

examples.en: They kept trying to outtongue each other, and the meeting turned ugly.
examples.zh: 他们不断试图用更狠的话压过对方，会议气氛变得很难看。

extraExplanation: “outtongue”非常少见，带有较强的文学/古风色彩；现代英语更常用 outtalk（压过对方的话）、talk over（打断并盖过对方）、outargue（在论辩上胜过）、shout down（用喊叫压制）等。
构词上是 out-（超过）+ tongue（舌头/言语），强调“靠嘴/口才”取胜；在语气上常暗示争执或言语交锋。

summary.en: Outtongued means “beaten in speaking or argument,” and it’s a rare, literary word related to the verb outtongue (“to outtalk/outargue”).
summary.zh: outtongued 指“在说话或争辩中被压过/说不过”，是较少见、偏文学的词，源自 outtongue（“比别人更能说/辩倒别人”）。

definition.en: (literary/rare) Defeated or surpassed in speaking—especially in argument, debate, or quick talk.
definition.zh: （文学用语/较少见）在说话、争辩或辩论中被压过、被说服（说不过对方）。

examples.en: In the debate, he felt outtongued by the more experienced speaker.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，他觉得自己被更有经验的演讲者说得哑口无言。

examples.en: She was rarely outtongued, even when the topic changed suddenly.
examples.zh: 即使话题突然转变，她也很少说不过别人。

definition.en: Past participle of the verb “outtongue”: to talk more than someone else, or to out-argue them.
definition.zh: 动词“outtongue”的过去分词：指比别人更能说、或在争辩中压倒对方。

examples.en: He tried to outtongue the interviewer with long answers.
examples.zh: 他试图用很长的回答来压过采访者。

examples.en: They outtongued their rivals in the meeting and won support.
examples.zh: 他们在会议上辩倒了对手，赢得了支持。

extraExplanation: “out-”作前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart, outwork）。因此 outtongue 字面意思是“在舌头/说话上胜过”。
这个词在现代英语里很少见，更偏文学或修辞性表达；日常更常用的说法是 “outtalk,” “outargue,” 或 “talk circles around someone（把某人说得团团转）”。

summary.en: Outtonguing means outtalking or out-arguing someone—surpassing them by talking more or more persuasively (rare word).
summary.zh: outtonguing 指“比别人更能说/把别人说赢”，可指话更多更快，也可指更有说服力（较少见用词）。

definition.en: talk more than someone else; outtalk someone (often by speaking faster, longer, or more loudly).
definition.zh: 比别人更能说／更爱说；把别人“说赢”（常指说得更快、更久或更大声）。

examples.en: In meetings, he keeps outtonguing everyone, so quieter teammates struggle to share ideas.
examples.zh: 在会议上他总是比所有人都更能说，比较安静的队友就很难表达想法。

examples.en: She tried to outtongue her opponent during the debate, but the judges valued clear points over nonstop talking.
examples.zh: 她在辩论中想用“更会说”压过对手，但评委更看重清晰的论点而不是不停地说。

definition.en: (figurative, rare) surpass someone by skillful or persuasive speech; out-argue or out-speak.
definition.zh: （比喻义，较少见）用更有技巧或更有说服力的言辞胜过某人；在口才/辩论上压过对方。

examples.en: The lawyer was known for outtonguing witnesses without raising his voice.
examples.zh: 那位律师以不提高嗓门就能用口才压住证人而出名。

examples.en: A sharp tongue can outtongue authority, but it can also create enemies.
examples.zh: 犀利的口才能在言语上压过权威，但也可能树敌。

extraExplanation: “outtonguing”是动词“outtongue”的现在分词/动名词形式。它由前缀 out-（超过、胜过）+ tongue（舌头，引申为说话能力）构成，因此语感上常带有“用话多、话快或口才把别人盖过去”的意味。
这个词在现代口语中不常见，更常见的替代说法有 outtalk / outargue / talk over someone。使用时注意语气：有时会暗示“抢话、压话”，在职场沟通里可能带负面评价。

summary.en: “Outtop” means to surpass or exceed someone or something; it’s relatively uncommon in everyday English.
summary.zh: “outtop”表示“超过、胜过”，但在日常英语中相对少见。

definition.en: to surpass or exceed; to do better than someone or something
definition.zh: 超过；胜过（某人或某事）

examples.en: Our team outtopped last year’s results by a wide margin.
examples.zh: 我们队的成绩大幅超过了去年的结果。

examples.en: It’s hard to outtop her performance in the final round.
examples.zh: 很难在决赛中超越她的表现。

definition.en: to be higher than; to rise above the top of something (less common)
definition.zh: 高过……的顶部；高于（较少见）

examples.en: A thin layer of mist outtopped the trees.
examples.zh: 一层薄雾高过了树梢。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，常表示“比……更”“超过……”，如 outdo（胜过）、outperform（表现更好）、outnumber（数量超过）。因此 outtop 直观上就是“超过顶峰/最高点”，但它在日常英语中不如 outdo 或 outperform 常用。

summary.en: Outtopped means “was higher than” or “surpassed,” as the past form of outtop.
summary.zh: outtopped 是 outtop 的过去式/过去分词，表示“高于……、超过……（也可引申为胜过）”。

definition.en: (Past tense / past participle of outtop) to be higher than something else; to rise above and exceed it in height or level.
definition.zh: （outtop 的过去式/过去分词）高于某物；在高度或水平上超过、凌驾于……之上。

examples.en: Skyscrapers have outtopped most older buildings in the city center.
examples.zh: 摩天大楼已经在高度上超过了市中心的大多数老建筑。

examples.en: From the ridge, we could see one peak that outtopped all the others.
examples.zh: 从山脊上，我们能看到一座山峰高出其他所有山峰。

definition.en: (Figurative) to surpass or outdo someone or something, especially in an obvious way.
definition.zh: （引申义）明显地胜过、超越（某人/某事）；比……更出色。

examples.en: Her final performance outtopped the rest of the competition.
examples.zh: 她的最后一场表演明显胜过其他参赛者。

examples.en: It’s hard to outtop last year’s results, but the team is trying.
examples.zh: 要超越去年的成绩很难，但团队正在努力。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outgrow, outnumber）。outtop 比较书面、少见，更常见的替代说法有 be taller than / rise above / surpass。

summary.en: “Outtopping” means rising above or exceeding something, especially in height; it’s the -ing form of “outtop.”
summary.zh: “outtopping”意为高出于……、超过……（尤指高度）；是动词“outtop”的 -ing 形式。

definition.en: Rising above; surpassing something (often in height or prominence).
definition.zh: 高出于……的；（常指高度或显眼程度上）超过……的。

examples.en: The outtopping cliffs made the village look tiny below.
examples.zh: 高耸的悬崖让下面的村庄显得很渺小。

examples.en: An outtopping skyscraper dominates the city skyline.
examples.zh: 一座高出众楼的摩天大楼主宰了城市天际线。

definition.en: The present participle of “outtop”: to be higher than or exceed something.
definition.zh: “outtop”的现在分词：高于；超过（尤指高度）。

examples.en: From the ridge, the peak is outtopping every other mountain in sight.
examples.zh: 从山脊望去，那座山峰高出视野中所有其他山。

examples.en: The cathedral’s tower is outtopping the surrounding buildings.
examples.zh: 大教堂的塔楼高于周围的建筑。

extraExplanation: “outtopping”来自较少见的动词 outtop（out- 表示“超过/胜过” + top “顶部/最高处”）。它多见于较文学化或描写景物的语境，用来强调“高出一截、凌驾其上”的画面感。日常英语更常用 taller than / higher than / towering over / surpassing。

summary.en: “outtore” is likely a misspelling of “outdoor/outdoors,” meaning outside rather than inside.
summary.zh: “outtore”很可能是“outdoor/outdoors”的拼写错误，意思是“在室外/户外”。

definition.en: (Commonly spelled “outdoor”) relating to, happening in, or meant to be used outside rather than inside a building.
definition.zh: （常见拼写为 outdoor）与户外有关的；发生在室外的；供室外使用的。

examples.en: We had an outdoor picnic in the park.
examples.zh: 我们在公园里进行了一次户外野餐。

examples.en: Outdoor clothing should be warm and waterproof.
examples.zh: 户外服装应该保暖且防水。

definition.en: the outside (outdoors), especially as a place where you spend time or do activities.
definition.zh: 户外；室外（指进行活动或待着的地方）。

examples.en: The kids love the outdoors.
examples.zh: 孩子们很喜欢户外。

examples.en: I prefer working outdoors in the fresh air.
examples.zh: 我更喜欢在户外的新鲜空气中工作。

extraExplanation: “outtore”不是常见英文单词，最可能是把“outdoor / outdoors”拼错了。
区分：outdoor（形容词）修饰名词：outdoor activities（户外活动）；outdoors（副词/名词）作状语或名词：go outdoors（到户外去）/ the outdoors（户外）。

summary.en: “Outtorn” is a rare/literary word meaning “torn out/away” or “badly torn.”
summary.zh: “outtorn” 是较罕见/偏文学的词，表示“被撕出/撕下”或“被撕得很破烂”。

definition.en: (Literary/rare) torn out; torn away from something, often leaving a gap or loss.
definition.zh: （文学用语/罕见）被扯出；被撕扯下来，常暗示留下空缺或失落。

examples.en: A page lay outtorn from the old diary, and the story stopped mid-sentence.
examples.zh: 旧日记里有一页被撕掉了，故事在半句话处戛然而止。

examples.en: She found an outtorn photograph in the box—someone had been removed from the picture.
examples.zh: 她在盒子里发现一张被撕扯过的照片——照片里有人被撕掉了。

definition.en: torn to pieces; badly ripped and ragged from tearing.
definition.zh: 被撕得很碎；破烂不堪（因撕扯而破）。

examples.en: His coat was outtorn after the fall, hanging in strips.
examples.zh: 他摔倒后外套被撕得破破烂烂，成条状垂着。

examples.en: The flag looked outtorn from years of wind and storms.
examples.zh: 那面旗子被多年风雨吹打得破烂不堪。

definition.en: past participle of the rare verb “outtear” (to tear out or tear away).
definition.zh: 罕见动词 outtear 的过去分词（意为“撕出/撕下来”）。

examples.en: The note was outtorn from the book and hidden in a pocket.
examples.zh: 那张纸条从书里被撕下，藏进了口袋里。

extraExplanation: “outtorn”多见于较老的英文或文学语境中，用来强调“被撕出来/被撕得很惨”的结果；现代英语里更常用 torn out（被撕下/撕出）、ripped out 或 badly torn。
注意不要和更常见的 “outworn”（穿旧的；过时的）混淆。

summary.en: Outtower means to tower above something in height, or (figuratively) to overshadow it in importance or influence.
summary.zh: outtower 指在高度上高出于……之上，也可比喻在重要性或影响力上压过、使相形见绌。

definition.en: to be taller than something; to tower above it
definition.zh: 比……更高；高耸于……之上

examples.en: The old cathedral outtowers the houses around it.
examples.zh: 那座古老的大教堂高过周围的房子。

examples.en: From the hill, a single pine outtowers the rest of the trees.
examples.zh: 从山坡上看，有一棵松树比其他树都高。

definition.en: (figurative) to surpass or overshadow someone or something in importance, influence, or ability
definition.zh: （比喻）在重要性、影响力或能力上胜过；使相形见绌

examples.en: Her calm confidence outtowers the noisy criticism online.
examples.zh: 她冷静的自信让网上的喧嚣批评显得不值一提。

examples.en: In the debate, his experience outtowered his opponent’s enthusiasm.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，他的经验让对手的热情显得相形见绌。

extraExplanation: “outtower”比较少见，写作中更常用的表达是“tower over（高出；凌驾于）”或“rise above（高出）”。你也可能看到带连字符的形式“out-tower”。
构词：out-（超过）+ tower（高耸）。因此它既可表示“高度上超过”，也可引申为“在地位/影响上压过”。

summary.en: Outtowered means “was higher than” and can also mean “greatly surpassed” in a figurative sense.
summary.zh: outtowered 表示“在高度上高于……”，也可比喻“远远胜过、压倒……”。

definition.en: was taller than something or someone; rose above in height.
definition.zh: （在高度上）比……更高；高耸于……之上。

examples.en: The cathedral outtowered the surrounding houses.
examples.zh: 大教堂高耸在周围的房屋之上。

examples.en: Snowy peaks outtowered the village in the valley.
examples.zh: 积雪的山峰高过山谷里的村庄。

definition.en: was far more impressive, powerful, or important than others (figurative).
definition.zh: （比喻）在气势、能力或重要性上远胜于……；压倒……

examples.en: Her achievements outtowered those of her competitors.
examples.zh: 她的成就远远超过竞争对手。

examples.en: In the debate, his calm confidence outtowered the shouting around him.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，他沉着的自信压过了周围的喧嚷。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outtower（较少见）字面意思就是“在高度上超过”，也常用于文学描写来强调建筑/山峰的宏伟，或用作比喻强调“气势上压倒”。
outtowered 是过去式/过去分词形式。常见搭配：outtowered the skyline（高出天际线）、outtowered by + 名词（被……高高耸立着压过）。

summary.en: Outtowering means extremely tall and standing above or surpassing others in height.
summary.zh: outtowering 指“非常高耸、明显高于其他事物（在高度上超过、凌驾于……之上）”。

definition.en: (rare) Rising or projecting high above others; towering over something in a way that clearly exceeds it.
definition.zh: （较少见）高高耸立、明显高于周围或其他事物；凌驾于……之上。

examples.en: The outtowering cliffs made the village look tiny.
examples.zh: 高耸入云的悬崖让村庄显得很渺小。

examples.en: An outtowering skyscraper dominated the skyline.
examples.zh: 一座高耸的摩天大楼主宰了天际线。

extraExplanation: “outtowering”通常来自动词“outtower”（out- 表示“超过/胜过” + tower “高耸”），意思是“比……更高、更突出”。在现代日常英语里更常用“towering”“looming”“soaring”，而“outtowering”更偏文学或描写性语境，用来强调“明显高出一截、压倒性地高”。

summary.en: Outtowers means “is taller than” or “towers above,” often suggesting dominance.
summary.zh: outtowers 表示“比……更高/高高耸立于……之上”，常带有“显得压倒性突出”的意味。

definition.en: to be taller than something else; to tower above and seem to dominate it
definition.zh: 比……更高；高高耸立于……之上，显得压倒性突出

examples.en: The new skyscraper outtowers every building in the old town.
examples.zh: 这座新摩天大楼比老城区的所有建筑都高。

examples.en: A snow-covered peak outtowers the valley below.
examples.zh: 一座覆雪的山峰高高耸立在下方的山谷之上。

extraExplanation: “outtowers”通常是动词“outtower”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outtowers）。这个词比较少见，更常用的表达是“tower over”。
词缀“out-”常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量、outshine 更出色），所以 outtower 字面意思就是“在高度上超过”。

summary.en: Outtrade means to trade more (or more actively) than another person, company, or country.
summary.zh: Outtrade 指在贸易量/交易活跃度上超过他人、他企或他国。

definition.en: to trade more than another person, company, or country; to have a higher volume or value of trade than someone else
definition.zh: （在贸易量或贸易额上）超过（他人/他国）；比……交易更多

examples.en: In the 1990s, Japan outtraded many countries in electronics.
examples.zh: 在20世纪90年代，日本在电子产品方面的贸易量超过了许多国家。

examples.en: The company outtraded its rivals during the holiday season.
examples.zh: 这家公司在假日季的交易额超过了竞争对手。

definition.en: to trade faster or more frequently than someone else (often in markets)
definition.zh: （尤指市场中）交易更快/更频繁，胜过他人

examples.en: Some high-frequency firms try to outtrade others by using faster systems.
examples.zh: 一些高频交易公司试图用更快的系统在交易速度上胜过他人。

examples.en: It’s hard to outtrade experienced investors day after day.
examples.zh: 要日复一日地在交易上胜过有经验的投资者很难。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过人数、outperform 表现更好、outgrow 长得比……快）。因此 outtrade 通常直观理解为“在贸易/交易方面超过”。该词在新闻与学术写作中相对少见，更常见的替代表达有 trade more than / surpass in trade / have a larger share of trade。

summary.en: “Outtraded” means “traded more or better than others,” and it is the past form of “outtrade.”
summary.zh: “Outtraded”表示“在交易上超过别人/市场”，是 outtrade 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of outtrade; traded more than someone else, or traded in a way that surpassed others (in volume, value, or effectiveness).
definition.zh: outtrade 的过去式/过去分词；（在交易量、交易额或交易效果上）交易得比别人更多/更强。

examples.en: Our company outtraded its competitors in the final quarter.
examples.zh: 我们公司在最后一个季度的交易量/业绩超过了竞争对手。

examples.en: The fund outtraded the market during a volatile week.
examples.zh: 这只基金在市场剧烈波动的一周里表现得比大盘更好（交易结果更占优）。

extraExplanation: “out-”前缀常表示“超过/胜过”（如 outnumber, outperform）。因此 outtrade 多用于比较：outtrade someone（在交易上胜过某人/某机构）或 outtrade the market（交易表现优于市场）。
该词在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的表达有: traded more than, outperformed in trading, had higher trading volume。

summary.en: “Outtrades” means “trades more or better than others,” usually about business or investing.
summary.zh: “Outtrades”指“在贸易/交易上比别人更多或更成功”，常用于商业或投资语境。

definition.en: (third-person singular of outtrade) to trade more successfully or in a greater amount than another person, company, or country; to outperform in trading.
definition.zh: （outtrade 的第三人称单数）在交易/贸易中比他人、公司或国家更成功或交易量更大；在贸易上胜过。

examples.en: The company outtrades most of its competitors in the region.
examples.zh: 这家公司在该地区的交易表现超过大多数竞争对手。

examples.en: In some years, Country A outtrades Country B in agricultural exports.
examples.zh: 在某些年份，A 国在农产品出口贸易上超过 B 国。

examples.en: She outtrades many experienced investors by sticking to a simple plan.
examples.zh: 她坚持简单的策略，交易表现超过许多经验丰富的投资者。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 超过别人工作、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outtrade 字面意思就是“在交易/贸易方面胜过”。
outtrade/outtrades 在日常英语里不算常用，更常见的表达有 outperform in trading、trade more than、have higher trade volume 等。

summary.en: Outtrading usually refers to either (1) trading more successfully than competitors or (2) trading beyond safe/allowed limits, depending on context.
summary.zh: Outtrading 通常指（1）交易表现胜过竞争对手，或（2）交易超出安全/规定限额，需结合语境判断。

definition.en: the act of trading more successfully or in greater volume than a competitor
definition.zh: （在交易上）胜过对手；交易量或交易表现超过竞争者

examples.en: The firm’s outtrading of its rivals was driven by better pricing and faster execution.
examples.zh: 这家公司之所以能在交易上胜过竞争对手，是因为定价更有优势、成交更迅速。

examples.en: Outtrading in a quiet market can still happen if one desk has better information and tools.
examples.zh: 即使在清淡的市场里，如果某个交易团队拥有更好的信息和工具，也仍然可能出现“胜过对手的交易”。

definition.en: trading beyond what is safe or allowed (for example, taking on too much risk or exceeding limits)
definition.zh: （交易上）超出安全范围或规定限额；过度交易

examples.en: The bank was criticized for outtrading its risk limits during the volatile period.
examples.zh: 该银行因在市场剧烈波动期间交易超出风险限额而受到批评。

examples.en: Strong oversight helps prevent outtrading by individual traders.
examples.zh: 严格的监管有助于防止交易员进行过度交易。

definition.en: used to describe results or performance that are better than competitors’ in trading
definition.zh: 用来形容（交易）表现或结果优于竞争对手的

examples.en: They reported outtrading performance in rates and currencies this quarter.
examples.zh: 他们报告称本季度在利率和外汇交易上的表现优于同行。

extraExplanation: “outtrading”在真实语境里多见于财经新闻、投行/券商报告或风控文件中，既可能指“交易表现超过同业”，也可能被用来指“交易超限/过度交易”。具体含义通常要看上下文（比如是否提到risk limits、controls、breach等词）。
拼写上常见两种：outtrading（更像一般写法）与 out-trading（更强调构词结构）。
基础动词是 outtrade（在交易上胜过），但日常英语里不算高频，更常用表达包括 “trade more than…/perform better than…” 或 “exceed trading limits”。

summary.en: “Outtrail” means to go ahead of others on a trail by moving faster, or (less commonly) to be better at following a trail when tracking.
summary.zh: “Outtrail”指在步道上速度更快而超过他人；较少见时也指在追踪循迹方面更擅长、胜过对方。
