definition.en: to move faster than someone or something so that you go ahead of them, especially on a trail or in an outdoor race; to leave someone behind by being quicker
definition.zh: （尤指在步道或户外比赛中）跑得/走得更快而超过（某人或某物）；把对方甩在后面

examples.en: She outrails most hikers on steep climbs because she keeps a steady pace.
examples.zh: 在陡坡上她常常把大多数徒步者甩在后面，因为她节奏很稳。

examples.en: Our dog outrails us every time and reaches the lookout first.
examples.zh: 我们的狗每次都比我们快，总是先到观景点。

definition.en: to be better than someone else at finding or following a trail (for example, when tracking a person or animal)
definition.zh: （追踪时）更擅长发现或跟随踪迹；在循迹方面胜过对方

examples.en: In thick brush, a trained hound can outrail an inexperienced tracker.
examples.zh: 在灌木丛很密的地方，训练有素的猎犬在循迹上能胜过没经验的追踪者。

extraExplanation: “outrail”由前缀 out-（表示“超过、胜过”）+ trail（小径/踪迹）构成，多见于户外运动（徒步、越野跑）或追踪语境。日常口语里更常用 outrun（跑得更快）或 outpace（速度更快）。

summary.en: Outtravel means to travel farther or more often than someone else; it can also mean to exceed another in travel range or distance.
summary.zh: Outtravel 指在旅行次数或距离上超过别人；也可指在行程范围/距离上胜过他者。

definition.en: to travel farther or more often than someone else
definition.zh: （比别人）走得更远；旅行更多/更频繁

examples.en: In her twenties, she outtraveled most of her friends.
examples.zh: 在二十多岁时，她比大多数朋友旅行得更多。

examples.en: Because of his job, he outtravels everyone on the team.
examples.zh: 因为工作原因，他比团队里任何人都更常出差。

definition.en: to surpass someone in travel distance or range (sometimes implying greater speed or endurance)
definition.zh: 在行程距离或范围上超过（有时暗含更快或更能坚持）

examples.en: With better supplies, their expedition outtraveled the earlier one.
examples.zh: 由于补给更充足，他们的探险队走得比之前那支更远。

examples.en: The new electric bike can outtravel the old model on a single charge.
examples.zh: 这款新电动自行车一次充电的续航里程比旧款更长。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outlive 活得更久）。因此 outtravel 就是“在旅行/行程上超过”。
这个词在日常口语里不算最常见；更自然的表达常用 travel more than / travel farther than / travel more often than。

summary.en: Outtraveled means “traveled more than others” or “went farther than a plan/limit.”
summary.zh: outtraveled 表示“旅行经历超过他人”，也可指“走得比计划或界限更远”。

definition.en: traveled more widely or more often than someone else; surpassed others in travel experience.
definition.zh: 比别人旅行得更多、更广；在旅行经历上胜过他人。

examples.en: By the time she graduated, she had outtraveled most of her classmates.
examples.zh: 她毕业时，旅行经历已经超过了大多数同学。

examples.en: He outtraveled everyone in the team and could navigate new cities easily.
examples.zh: 他比团队里任何人都更常旅行，因此能轻松适应陌生城市。

definition.en: traveled beyond a place or limit; went farther than something else.
definition.zh: 旅行到更远处；走得比某个地点或界限更远。

examples.en: Their route outtraveled the original plan by nearly 200 miles.
examples.zh: 他们的路线比原计划多走了将近200英里。

examples.en: The explorers outtraveled the known maps of their time.
examples.zh: 探险家们走出了当时已知地图的范围。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 工作得更多/更努力，outsmart 更聪明地取胜）。因此 outtravel 的核心意思就是“在旅行数量或距离上超过”。
outtravel 并不是非常高频的日常用词，更常见的表达是 “have traveled more than … / have been to more places than …”。在写作里用 outtraveled 会更简洁、有比较感。

summary.en: Outtraveling means traveling more (farther, more often, or more widely) than others.
summary.zh: Outtraveling 指在旅行方面“超过他人”，如更频繁、更远或更广地旅行。

definition.en: traveling more (more often, farther, or more widely) than someone else; surpassing others in travel
definition.zh: 比别人旅行得更多（更频繁、更远或更广）；在旅行方面胜过他人

examples.en: She’s outtraveling everyone on the team this year, visiting three continents for work.
examples.zh: 今年她在团队里最“会跑”，因为工作去了三大洲。

examples.en: Outtraveling his friends, he always had a new story to tell.
examples.zh: 他比朋友们更常出门旅行，所以总有新故事可讲。

definition.en: the act of traveling more than others; a present participle form of the verb “outtravel”
definition.zh: “outtravel（旅行超过/胜过）”的现在分词形式；表示“旅行得比别人更多”的动作

examples.en: He’s been outtraveling his colleagues since the new project started.
examples.zh: 新项目开始后，他一直比同事们出差/旅行更多。

examples.en: They are outtraveling their budget, so they need to cut back next month.
examples.zh: 他们的旅行开销已经超出预算了，所以下个月得缩减。

extraExplanation: “outtraveling”来自动词“outtravel”（out- 表示“超过/胜过”）。这个词在日常口语里不算常见，更常见的表达是“travel more than… / travel farther than… / travel extensively”。写作中有时会写成“out-traveling”，更清晰。
语感上，它常带一点“比较/竞赛”的意味：不是单纯“在旅行”，而是“比别人更常、更远、更广”。在文学或游记风格的句子里，用它能让节奏更紧凑。

summary.en: Outtrick means to beat someone by using better tricks or deception.
summary.zh: outtrick 指用更高明的计策或欺骗手段胜过对方。

definition.en: to defeat or surpass someone by using better tricks, tactics, or clever moves
definition.zh: 用更高明的计策或小聪明胜过（某人）；在耍花招/策略上胜出

examples.en: The detective outtricked the thief by planting a fake clue.
examples.zh: 侦探放出一条假线索，在计策上胜过了小偷。

examples.en: Don’t try to outtrick your opponent; play fairly and focus on skill.
examples.zh: 别想着靠小花招赢对手；公平比赛，把重点放在实力上。

definition.en: to trick someone successfully; to get the better of someone through deception
definition.zh: 成功欺骗（某人）；用诡计占上风

examples.en: He thought he could outtrick the system, but the rules were stricter than he expected.
examples.zh: 他以为能骗过系统，但规则比他想的更严格。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“比……更……、超过……”。所以 outtrick 字面意思就是“在耍计策这件事上超过对方”。类似构词：outsmart（智胜）、outplay（技胜）、outnumber（数量超过）。
outtrick 属于相对不常用的词，更常见的表达是 outsmart（更强调智谋）或 outwit（更偏机智地胜过）。

summary.en: “Outtricked” means someone was beaten or outdone by trickery (past tense/past participle of outtrick).
summary.zh: “outtricked”表示“用更高明的计谋骗过/胜过了某人”，是 outtrick 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: Past tense / past participle of “outtrick”: to defeat or get the advantage over someone by using clever tricks or deception.
definition.zh: “outtrick”的过去式/过去分词：用更高明的计谋或欺骗手段胜过某人、占上风。

examples.en: The con artist outtricked the tourists and took their money.
examples.zh: 骗子用更高明的手段骗过游客，把钱拿走了。

examples.en: She realized she had been outtricked in the negotiation.
examples.zh: 她意识到自己在谈判中被对方算计了。

definition.en: To surpass someone in the ability to play tricks (often in a competitive, playful, or narrative context).
definition.zh: （常用于竞争、玩笑或故事语境）在耍花招/使计方面胜过某人。

examples.en: In the story, the fox outtricked every hunter who tried to catch him.
examples.zh: 在故事里，狐狸把每个想抓他的猎人都耍得团团转。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart, outplay）。所以 outtrick 字面意思就是“用计谋胜过”。
outtrick / outtricked 在现代英语中不算高频词，更常见的表达有: outsmart（智取）、trick someone（骗某人）、outmaneuver（在策略上胜过）。

summary.en: Outtricking means outsmarting someone by using a better trick or plan.
summary.zh: outtricking 指用更高明的计策胜过对方（智取、反套路）。

definition.en: tricking someone more successfully than they trick you; outsmarting by using a clever trick or plan
definition.zh: 用更高明的计谋戏弄对方；以诡计胜过对方（更聪明地“反套路”）

examples.en: The detective won by outtricking the suspect with a fake phone call.
examples.zh: 侦探用一通假电话反将嫌疑人一军，成功胜出。

examples.en: In the story, the fox survives by outtricking the hunter.
examples.zh: 在故事里，狐狸靠智取猎人而活了下来。

definition.en: surpassing others in trick-based skill, mischief, or playful deception (often in games or stories)
definition.zh: 在“耍花招/恶作剧/游戏计策”方面胜过别人（常见于游戏或故事语境）

examples.en: He kept changing strategies, outtricking everyone at the card table.
examples.zh: 他不断换策略，在牌桌上把大家都“算计”了。

examples.en: They tried outtricking each other, but it stayed friendly and playful.
examples.zh: 他们互相斗智斗勇，但气氛一直友好又好玩。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart, outrun）。因此 outtrick 的核心意思就是“在耍计谋/设圈套上胜过对方”。
outtrick 比 trick 语气更强调“对抗性”和“比对方更高明”。在日常口语里更常见的是 outsmart；outtrick 更像叙事、故事或游戏语境的用词。

summary.en: Outtricks means to beat someone by clever tricks or deception, or (in card games) to win more tricks.
summary.zh: Outtricks 指用计谋/小花招胜过别人；在纸牌游戏中也可指赢的“墩（tricks）”比对手多。

definition.en: to defeat or surpass someone by using clever tricks or deception; to outwit
definition.zh: 用诡计或小花招胜过（某人）；智胜

examples.en: In the end, she outtricks her rival and wins the deal.
examples.zh: 最后，她用计智胜对手，拿下了这笔交易。

examples.en: He thinks he can outtricks everyone, but people are starting to notice.
examples.zh: 他以为自己能用小聪明骗过所有人，但大家开始察觉了。

definition.en: (in card games) to win more tricks than an opponent
definition.zh: （纸牌游戏中）赢得比对手更多的墩（tricks）

examples.en: With strong trump cards, our team outtricks them easily.
examples.zh: 有强势主牌，我们队很轻松就赢的墩数比他们多。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”。所以 outtrick 的字面意思就是“在耍花招/赢墩这件事上胜过对方”。
你输入的 outtricks 通常是动词第三人称单数（he/she/it outtricks），也可能是复数名词，但最常见用法是动词形式。更常用的近义词是 outwit（智胜）或 outsmart（机智地胜过）。

summary.en: Outtrot means to surpass someone by trotting (and it’s rare). For the figurative idea of repeating/showing something, English usually uses “trot out.”
summary.zh: Outtrot 指“在小跑/快步中超过……”（较少见）。若表示“老调重弹/拿出来展示”，英语更常用短语“trot out”。

definition.en: to trot farther or faster than someone or something else; to surpass in trotting
definition.zh: （在小跑/马的快步中）跑得比……更远或更快；在小跑上超过……

examples.en: The younger horse outtrotted the older one easily.
examples.zh: 那匹年轻的马轻松地在小跑中超过了年老的马。

examples.en: On the trail, she outtrotted her friend for the last half mile.
examples.zh: 在小径上，她在最后半英里小跑时超过了朋友。

definition.en: to trot something out repeatedly in a showy or routine way (a rarer variant; more commonly written as “trot out”)
definition.zh: 反复把某事拿出来展示或照例搬出来（较少见的写法；更常见写作“trot out”）

examples.en: During the meeting, he trotted out the same old excuses again.
examples.zh: 在会议上，他又照例搬出了那些老借口。

examples.en: The article trotted out a familiar quote to support its point.
examples.zh: 那篇文章搬出了一句老生常谈的引语来支撑观点。

extraExplanation: “outtrot”不是常见日常词，更多出现在描写马、跑步或竞速的语境中，意思是“在小跑上超过”。
如果你想表达“把某个观点/借口老调重弹、拿出来展示”，英语里更自然的搭配是短语动词“trot out”（分开写更常见）。
拼写上也常有人把“trot out”误写成连写形式；正式写作建议用更常见的“trot out”。

summary.en: “Outtrots” is a rare verb form meaning “trot faster than; outpace (often literally with horses, sometimes figuratively).”
summary.zh: “outtrots”是较少见的动词形式，表示“小跑得更快而超过；在速度上超越”（多用于马匹等字面语境，也可作比喻）。

definition.en: (Rare) third-person singular of “outtrot”: to trot faster than someone or something; to surpass in speed while trotting.
definition.zh: （较少见）“outtrot”的第三人称单数：在小跑（trotting）时跑得更快；在小跑速度上超过某人或某物。

examples.en: In the final stretch, her horse outtrots the others and wins by a length.
examples.zh: 在最后冲刺阶段，她的马小跑速度超过其他马，领先一个马身夺冠。

examples.en: With steady training, he outtrots his rivals in the warm-up laps.
examples.zh: 通过稳定训练，他在热身圈的小跑中超过了对手。

definition.en: (Figurative, rare) to outperform or outpace someone in a steady, not-sprinting way.
definition.zh: （比喻，较少见）以稳定而非冲刺的方式胜过、超过某人（强调“稳稳地跑赢”）。

examples.en: She doesn’t rush—she just outtrots everyone with consistency.
examples.zh: 她不急不躁——但凭借稳定性，她照样稳稳地超过所有人。

examples.en: Small improvements each day can outtrot sudden bursts of effort.
examples.zh: 每天一点点的进步，往往能“稳稳跑赢”一时的爆发式努力。

extraExplanation: “outtrots”在现代英语中非常少见，更常见的表达是“outpace / outrun / outstrip”。如果你在文学作品或描写马术、赛马的语境里看到它，通常是强调“trotting（小跑）”这种步态，而不是全速奔跑。
拼写上有时会写成“out-trots / outtrots”，两种都可能出现；作为词条更常见的基础形式是“outtrot”。

summary.en: “Outtrotted” means “troted faster than” or “passed by trotting.”
summary.zh: “outtrotted”表示“（用小跑）比……更快”或“（用小跑）超过……”。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of outtrot) to trot faster than someone or something; to go past by trotting.
definition.zh: （outtrot 的过去式/过去分词）小跑得比……更快；用小跑超过/跑在……前面。

examples.en: The pony outtrotted the larger horse on the narrow trail.
examples.zh: 在狭窄的小路上，那匹小马小跑着超过了那匹更大的马。

examples.en: Even in heavy boots, she outtrotted the others to the station.
examples.zh: 即使穿着很重的靴子，她也小跑着把其他人甩在后面赶到车站。

extraExplanation: “outtrotted”由 out-（表示“超过/胜过”）+ trotted（trot 的过去式）构成，属于比较少见、偏文学或叙述性的用法。日常更常说：ran past / ran ahead of / outran。

summary.en: “Outtrotting” means trotting ahead of others—outpacing them at a trot.
summary.zh: “outtrotting”指以小跑的方式超过别人/领先。

definition.en: the act of trotting faster than someone or something; moving at a trot and leaving others behind
definition.zh: （以小跑步的速度）超过别人；小跑着把别人甩在后面

examples.en: The young horse was outtrotting the older ones with ease.
examples.zh: 那匹小马轻松地小跑着超过了那些年长的马。

examples.en: She kept outtrotting her teammates during warm-ups.
examples.zh: 热身时她一直小跑着超过队友。

definition.en: describing someone or something that is trotting ahead of others
definition.zh: 形容（人或动物）小跑在前、超过他人的

examples.en: An outtrotting runner led the group down the path.
examples.zh: 一位小跑领先的跑者带着队伍沿小路前进。

extraExplanation: “outtrotting”并不是非常常见的日常词，更常见的说法是“outpace / outrun”。它由前缀“out-（超过）”+“trot（小跑）”构成，常见于描写赛马、动物行动或带一点文学色彩的叙述。

summary.en: Outtrump means to outdo someone—often Trump—in a Trump-like, provocative style; it can also mean to beat someone by playing a higher trump card in a card game.
summary.zh: Outtrump 指在“特朗普式”的挑衅/民粹风格上压过别人（常指压过特朗普）；也可指在牌戏中用更大的将牌压过对方。

definition.en: to outdo or surpass someone—especially Donald Trump—in blunt, provocative, or populist style, statements, or policies
definition.zh: 在言论或政策上（尤其指在“特朗普式”的直白、挑衅、民粹风格方面）胜过、压过某人/特朗普本人

examples.en: Some candidates tried to outtrump Trump by using even harsher language on immigration.
examples.zh: 一些候选人试图用更强硬的移民言论来“比特朗普还特朗普”。

examples.en: The headline suggests the governor is trying to outtrump his rivals with tougher promises.
examples.zh: 这条标题暗示州长在用更强硬的承诺来压过对手。

definition.en: (card games) to play a higher trump card than someone else’s trump, thereby winning the trick
definition.zh: （牌类游戏）用更大的将牌压过对方的将牌，从而赢得这一墩/这一轮

examples.en: She outtrumped him with the ace of spades, taking the trick.
examples.zh: 她用黑桃A（将牌）压过了他，赢下这一墩。

extraExplanation: “outtrump”在政治语境中常带有新造词/媒体用语的味道，意思是“比特朗普更特朗普”，常见写法也有“out-Trump”（加连字符）来突出其来源。
这种用法通常带一点讽刺或批评色彩，用来形容竞选或公共讨论中不断升级的极端表态（rhetoric escalation）。

summary.en: “Outtrumped” means “surpassed or beaten,” either figuratively or by playing a higher trump card in a card game.
summary.zh: “Outtrumped”表示“胜过/压过/超过”；也可指在纸牌游戏中用更大的王牌压过对方。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “outtrump”: to beat someone by doing something stronger, more impressive, or more effective; to surpass.
definition.zh: “outtrump”的过去式/过去分词：以更强、更精彩或更有效的方式胜过；超过。

examples.en: Her final argument outtrumped all the objections in the room.
examples.zh: 她最后的论点压过了屋里所有的反对意见。

examples.en: The new phone’s battery life outtrumped last year’s model.
examples.zh: 这款新手机的续航超过了去年的型号。

definition.en: (cards) past tense / past participle of “outtrump”: to play a higher trump card than another player and win the trick.
definition.zh: （纸牌）“outtrump”的过去式/过去分词：出更大的王牌（将牌）压过对方，赢下一墩。

examples.en: He outtrumped my jack with the ace of trumps.
examples.zh: 他用王牌A压过了我出的王牌J。

examples.en: She waited, then outtrumped at the perfect moment.
examples.zh: 她等了一下，然后在最关键的时刻用更大的王牌反压。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outrun）。因此 outtrump 在比喻用法里就是“拿出更厉害的一招来压过对方/更胜一筹”。
trump 原本来自纸牌用语，指“王牌/将牌”（能压过同花色的牌）；后来引申为“制胜因素、王牌”。因此 outtrumped 常用于辩论、比较、竞争等语境。
outtrump 这个动词在现代英语里相对少见，更常见的表达是 “outdo / surpass / outshine / one-up”。

summary.en: “Outtrumping” means surpassing or topping someone/something—doing even better or making a stronger move.
summary.zh: “outtrumping”表示“胜过、压过”：做得更好、提出更强的招数或理由来超过对方。

definition.en: present participle of outtrump: surpassing or beating someone by doing better, offering something stronger, or topping what they did.
definition.zh: outtrump 的现在分词：超过、胜过某人；用更强的表现/更有力的理由“压过”对方。

examples.en: She kept outtrumping her competitors with better customer service.
examples.zh: 她用更好的客户服务不断胜过竞争对手。

examples.en: In the debate, he tried outtrumping her point with stronger evidence.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，他试图用更有力的证据压过她的观点。

examples.en: They were outtrumping each other with bigger and bigger promises.
examples.zh: 他们互相“压过”对方，承诺一个比一个更夸张。

extraExplanation: “trump”原本常见于纸牌游戏，作动词有“用王牌压过、胜过”的意思；加上前缀 out- 表示“在……之上、超过”。所以 outtrump 很自然地表示“胜过、压过”。
近年因为美国前总统姓氏 Trump 与单词 trump 同形，有时在政治语境里会引发双关或调侃；但 outtrump 的核心意思仍是“超越/压过”，不一定指某个人。

summary.en: “Outtrumps” means “beats/surpasses,” often by having a stronger advantage (from the idea of a trump card).
summary.zh: “outtrumps”表示“胜过/压倒”，常指凭更强的优势取胜（源自“王牌压制”这一概念）。

definition.en: to beat or surpass someone or something by having a stronger advantage or a better “trump” (originally from card games).
definition.zh: 凭借更强的优势或“王牌”（源自纸牌游戏）击败、胜过某人或某事。

examples.en: Her experience outtrumps his confidence in this role.
examples.zh: 在这个职位上，她的经验胜过他的自信。

examples.en: A last-minute endorsement outtrumps negative headlines.
examples.zh: 一份最后时刻的背书胜过负面新闻。

definition.en: (in card games) to play a trump card that defeats another card; to win a trick against another play.
definition.zh: （纸牌游戏中）出王牌压过对方的牌；赢下一墩（赢一轮出牌）。

examples.en: He outtrumps her with the ace of spades.
examples.zh: 他用黑桃A出王牌压过她。

examples.en: If you can outtrump that card, you take the trick.
examples.zh: 如果你能用王牌压过那张牌，你就赢这一墩。

extraExplanation: “outtrumps”通常是动词“outtrump”的第三人称单数（he/she/it outtrumps）。词根“trump”来自纸牌中的“王牌/主牌”，引申为“压倒性的优势”。因此在日常写作里，outtrump 多用于比喻：某个因素（经验、证据、规则等）“更能决定胜负”。
注意：在很多场合，英语更常用的表达是“outdo / surpass / outweigh / trump”。例如：Experience trumps confidence.（经验胜过自信。）

summary.en: Outturn means a result, the amount produced (output), or the number of people who show up (turnout), often in formal or business contexts.
summary.zh: Outturn可指结果、产量（产出），或到场/参与人数（出席率、投票率），多用于正式或商业语境。

definition.en: the result or outcome of an event, process, or vote
definition.zh: （事件、过程或投票的）结果；结局

examples.en: The outturn of the election surprised many analysts.
examples.zh: 这次选举的结果让很多分析人士感到意外。

examples.en: We are waiting for the final outturn of the investigation.
examples.zh: 我们正在等待调查的最终结果。

definition.en: the amount produced; output (often used in business, economics, or manufacturing)
definition.zh: （常用于商业/经济/制造业）产量；产出

examples.en: This year’s outturn is higher than last year’s.
examples.zh: 今年的产量比去年更高。

examples.en: The factory increased its outturn by upgrading its machines.
examples.zh: 工厂通过升级机器提高了产出。

definition.en: the number of people who attend or participate; turnout
definition.zh: （参加的人数）到场人数；投票率/出席率

examples.en: The event had a strong outturn despite the rain.
examples.zh: 尽管下雨，这次活动到场人数仍然很多。

examples.en: Student outturn was low during the early morning session.
examples.zh: 清晨那场活动学生出席率很低。

extraExplanation: “outturn”在现代英语中偏正式，尤其常见于英式英语的政府财政文件（如预算执行结果）或商业/制造业语境；日常口语里更常用“result/outcome”“output”“turnout”。
在公共财政里，“budget outturn”常指“预算最终执行结果/决算”，强调实际发生的收入与支出，而不只是计划数。

summary.en: Outturned usually means “turned outward” (like a collar or feet). Less commonly, it’s the past form of outturn meaning “produced/resulted in.”
summary.zh: outturned通常表示“向外翻/向外转”（如外翻衣领、外开的脚）。较少见时它是动词outturn的过去式，表示“产出/结果是”。

definition.en: (of a part of the body or an object) turned outward, away from the center or main direction.
definition.zh: （身体部位或物体）向外翻的；朝外转的。

examples.en: She wore a coat with an outturned collar.
examples.zh: 她穿着一件衣领外翻的大衣。

examples.en: The dancer kept her feet outturned in first position.
examples.zh: 舞者在第一位时保持双脚外开（向外转）。

examples.en: The outturned edge of the bowl makes it easier to grip.
examples.zh: 碗口外翻的边缘更容易拿稳。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of outturn: to produce or result in (an amount); to turn out.
definition.zh: outturn 的过去式/过去分词：产出（某数量）；结果是；生产。

examples.en: The factory outturned 5,000 units last week.
examples.zh: 那家工厂上周产出了5,000件产品。

examples.en: The harvest outturned better than expected.
examples.zh: 收成结果比预期更好。

extraExplanation: “outturned”作形容词时在服装与舞蹈语境很常见：例如“outturned collar（外翻衣领）”。在芭蕾中常说“turned out / turnout”，指髋部带动腿和脚向外旋转的“外开”。
作动词时（outturn 的过去式）在美式日常口语里不算常见，更多见于较正式的商业/农业/统计写作中，意思接近“produce/turn out（产出/结果是）”。

summary.en: Outturns = amounts produced or results (plural).
summary.zh: outturns 指“产量/产出”或“结果/到场人数”等（复数）。

definition.en: plural of “outturn”: an amount produced (output) or the result/turnout of an activity.
definition.zh: “outturn”的复数：产量（产出）；或某项活动的结果/到场人数（出席率）。

examples.en: This year’s factory outturns were higher than last year’s.
examples.zh: 今年工厂的产量比去年更高。

examples.en: The election’s outturns surprised many analysts.
examples.zh: 选举结果让许多分析人士感到意外。

extraExplanation: “outturn”在英式英语里更常见，尤其用于商业、制造业（产量）或统计语境（结果、到场人数）。在美式英语中，更常用的替代说法是 “output” (产出/产量)、“results” (结果) 或 “turnout” (到场人数/投票率)。

summary.en: Outtwine means to twist or wind around something more than another does (a rare, literary verb).
summary.zh: outtwine 指“比……缠绕得更紧/更彻底；在缠绕方面胜过”，较少见，偏文学用法。

definition.en: to twist, wind, or coil around something more tightly or more completely than another thing; to surpass in twining
definition.zh: 比……缠绕得更紧/更彻底；在“缠绕、盘绕”方面胜过

examples.en: The vine outtwined the weak fence and climbed into the tree.
examples.zh: 藤蔓把脆弱的篱笆缠得更紧，爬上了树。

examples.en: In the old poem, ivy is said to outtwine the stone, showing time’s slow power.
examples.zh: 在那首旧诗里，常春藤被写成能“胜过”石头的缠绕，表现时间缓慢的力量。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outgrow 超越成长、outshine 更出色）。因此 outtwine 的字面意思就是“在 twine（缠绕）这件事上胜过”。
这个词比较少见，更多出现在文学或仿古的表达里。日常英语更常用 twist around / coil around / wrap around / entwine。

summary.en: Outtyrannize means to surpass someone in tyranny or oppressive cruelty.
summary.zh: outtyrannize 指在暴虐或压迫统治方面“比……更甚”，即在暴政上胜过对方。

definition.en: to be more tyrannical than; to surpass someone in cruelty or oppressive rule
definition.zh: 比……更暴虐；在残酷或压迫统治上胜过（某人）

examples.en: The new ruler tried to outtyrannize his predecessor by imposing harsher laws.
examples.zh: 新统治者试图用更严苛的法律来比前任更暴虐。

examples.en: In the play, each villain competes to outtyrannize the others.
examples.zh: 在这部戏里，每个反派都在较劲，想在暴虐程度上压过别人。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见、带文学色彩的动词，常见于较早的英语文本或刻意夸张的写作中；现代英语更常用 be more tyrannical than、outdo someone in cruelty、oppress more harshly 等表达。
词缀 out- 在这里表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过……数量、outshine 胜过……更出色）。因此 outtyrannize 直译就是“在暴政/暴虐上胜过”。

summary.en: Outtyrannized means “became or acted more tyrannical than someone else.”
summary.zh: Outtyrannized 指“在暴虐/专横上超过别人（更残暴地统治或对待）”。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of outtyrannize) to rule or treat people more cruelly or oppressively than someone else; to outdo another person in tyranny.
definition.zh: （outtyrannize 的过去式/过去分词）比别人更残暴、更专横地统治或欺压；在暴政上胜过某人。

examples.en: The new governor outtyrannized his predecessor, jailing critics and silencing newspapers.
examples.zh: 新总督比前任更专横，关押批评者并封杀报纸。

examples.en: In the novel, each warlord tries to outtyrannize the others to prove his power.
examples.zh: 在小说里，每个军阀都试图在暴虐上压过别人，以证明自己的权力。

extraExplanation: “outtyrannized”来自动词 outtyrannize，由前缀 out-（“胜过、超过”）+ tyrannize（“暴虐统治、专横对待”）构成。它非常少见，多见于修辞性写作、政治评论或文学语境，用来强调“更过分、更残酷”的对比。
拼写上常见 outtyrannize / out-tyrannize 两种形式；含义相同。日常英语更常用更自然的说法包括: be more tyrannical than, oppress more harshly, outdo (someone) in cruelty。

summary.en: Outtyrannizing means being more tyrannical than someone else (a rare, literary-sounding form).
summary.zh: outtyrannizing 指“在专横暴虐上胜过他人”，很少见，偏文学修辞。

definition.en: (present participle/gerund of outtyrannize) acting more tyrannically than someone else; surpassing another person or group in oppression or abuse of power.
definition.zh: （outtyrannize 的现在分词/动名词）比他人更专横、更暴虐；在压迫或滥用权力方面“胜过”对方。

examples.en: The new ruler was outtyrannizing the old one within a few months.
examples.zh: 新统治者在几个月内就比旧统治者更为暴虐。

examples.en: In the novel, rival factions keep outtyrannizing each other, and ordinary people suffer most.
examples.zh: 小说里，对立派系彼此争相更专横，受苦最深的是普通人。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见、带有文学或修辞色彩，通常用于强调“更过分的暴政/压迫”。
前缀 out- 常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo, outnumber），所以 outtyrannize 就是“在暴虐上超过”。

summary.en: “Outsource” means to have outside people or companies do work for you instead of doing it in-house.
summary.zh: “Outsource” 指把工作交给外部的人或公司来做，而不是由内部完成。

definition.en: to hire another company or person to do work that your organization could do itself (often to save money or get expert skills)
definition.zh: 把（本可由本组织完成的工作）外包给其他公司或个人（常为节省成本或获取专业技能）

examples.en: The company decided to outsource customer service to a call center abroad.
examples.zh: 公司决定把客服外包给海外的呼叫中心。

examples.en: We outsource our payroll to an accounting firm.
examples.zh: 我们把工资核算外包给一家会计师事务所。

examples.en: Some teams outsource design work when they are short on time.
examples.zh: 有些团队在时间不够时会把设计工作外包出去。

definition.en: work done by another company for you; the practice of outsourcing
definition.zh: 外包的工作；外包行为

examples.en: Outsourcing can reduce costs, but it may also reduce control.
examples.zh: 外包能降低成本，但也可能减少可控性。

examples.en: They rely on outsourcing for IT support.
examples.zh: 他们依靠外包来做 IT 支持。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **outusure** 很可能是拼写错误；常见正确拼写是 **outsource**。
在商业语境中，outsource 常与 **manufacturing（制造）/ customer service（客服）/ IT（信息技术）/ payroll（薪资）** 等搭配。
常见相关词：**outsourcing（外包，名词）**；反义概念常说 **in-house（内部完成的）** 或 **insource（收回内部做）**。

summary.en: Outvalue means “to be worth more than” or “to be more valuable than.”
summary.zh: Outvalue 意为“比……更有价值/更值钱”。

definition.en: to be worth more than something else; to exceed in value
definition.zh: 比……更有价值；价值超过……

examples.en: People often say that health outvalues wealth.
examples.zh: 人们常说健康比财富更有价值。

examples.en: In the long run, trust can outvalue short-term profits.
examples.zh: 从长远来看，信任可能比短期利润更有价值。

examples.en: Good relationships outvalue expensive gifts.
examples.zh: 良好的人际关系比昂贵的礼物更有价值。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过/胜过”（如 outnumber 数量超过、outperform 表现胜过）。因此 outvalue 的核心意思就是“在价值上胜过”。
在实际写作中，outvalue 比较少见；更常见的表达是 be worth more than（更值钱/更有价值）或 be more valuable than（更有价值）。
拼写上有时也会看到 out-value（带连字符）的形式，意思相同。

summary.en: “Outvalued” means either (1) valued something more than another thing, or (2) was valued less than something else, depending on context.
summary.zh: “outvalued”表示（1）更看重/更重视某事物，或（2）被认为不如别的事物有价值，具体看上下文。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of outvalue) to value something more highly than something else; to consider it more important or worth more.
definition.zh: （outvalue 的过去式/过去分词）比另一样东西更重视；认为更重要或更有价值。

examples.en: In the interview, the manager outvalued experience over formal education.
examples.zh: 在面试中，经理更看重经验而不是学历。

examples.en: She outvalued her family’s opinions more than her own wishes.
examples.zh: 她更看重家人的意见，而不是自己的愿望。

definition.en: valued less than another thing; judged to be of lower worth (often used in comparisons).
definition.zh: 被认为不如另一事物有价值；价值较低（常用于比较语境）。

examples.en: In some markets, local brands are outvalued by global names.
examples.zh: 在一些市场里，本土品牌往往被认为不如国际品牌有价值。

examples.en: His quiet contributions were outvalued by more visible achievements.
examples.zh: 他低调的贡献被那些更显眼的成就比下去了。

extraExplanation: “outvalue”较常见于商业、经济或谈判语境，例如比较两家公司估值（valuation）、某项资产的市场价值，或在决策时强调“更看重什么”（如 outvalue stability over speed）。在日常口语里，更常用的表达是 “value A more than B” 或 “prioritize A over B”。

summary.en: “Outvalues” means “is worth more than” or “has greater value than.”
summary.zh: “outvalues”表示“比……更值钱/更有价值”。

definition.en: to be worth more than something else; to have a higher value than
definition.zh: 比……更有价值；价值高于……

examples.en: In many collectors’ markets, rarity often outvalues size.
examples.zh: 在许多收藏市场中，稀有性往往比体积更有价值。

examples.en: Her experience outvalues any certificate for this job.
examples.zh: 对这份工作来说，她的经验比任何证书都更有价值。

extraExplanation: “outvalues”是动词“outvalue”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outvalues）。常用于比较两者价值高低，语气比“is more valuable than”更简洁、更偏正式一些。
用法提示：常见结构是“A outvalues B”，其中A、B可以是具体物品（gold, land）或抽象事物（experience, trust, time）。

summary.en: Outvaluing means either being worth more than something else or valuing one thing more than another.
summary.zh: outvaluing 指“价值更高、胜过别的东西”，也可指“更看重某事胜过另一事”。

definition.en: having a higher value than something else; being worth more (the present participle/gerund of “outvalue”)
definition.zh: 比……更有价值；价值更高（动词 outvalue 的现在分词/动名词）

examples.en: In many markets, reliability is outvaluing novelty.
examples.zh: 在许多市场中，可靠性正比新奇更重要/更有价值。

examples.en: Their long-term benefits are outvaluing the short-term costs.
examples.zh: 它们的长期收益正在超过短期成本的价值。

definition.en: valuing one thing more than another; treating something as more important (the present participle/gerund of “outvalue”)
definition.zh: 更看重……；认为……比……更重要（动词 outvalue 的现在分词/动名词）

examples.en: She is outvaluing her health by working nonstop.
examples.zh: 她为了不停工作而把健康放在了更不重要的位置（更看重工作胜过健康）。

examples.en: We shouldn’t be outvaluing speed over safety.
examples.zh: 我们不该把速度看得比安全更重要。

extraExplanation: “out-” 是常见前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outvalue=“在价值上超过”。在实际写作中也常用更自然的表达：be worth more than（更值钱）、value A over B（更重视A而不是B）。

summary.en: “Outvanish” means to disappear more completely or faster than something else.
summary.zh: “outvanish”表示“比……更快或更彻底地消失”。

definition.en: to disappear more completely or more quickly than someone or something else; to surpass in vanishing.
definition.zh: 比……消失得更彻底或更快；在“消失”这件事上超过（某人/某物）。

examples.en: In the fog, the small boat seemed to outvanish the larger ship.
examples.zh: 在浓雾中，那艘小船似乎比大船更快地消失不见。

examples.en: Over time, the details outvanish the main memory, leaving only a feeling.
examples.zh: 随着时间推移，细节比主要记忆更先消失，只剩下一种感觉。

extraExplanation: “outvanish”很少见，多用于文学或修辞语境，强调“比……更快/更彻底地消失”的比较意味。
构词：out-（超过、胜过）+ vanish（消失）。类似构词还有 outshine（比……更耀眼）、outgrow（长得比……更快/大）。

summary.en: Outvaunt means to boast more than others, or to surpass someone in a showy, proud way.
summary.zh: Outvaunt 指“比别人更会吹嘘”，也可指以张扬、自夸的方式“胜过、压倒”他人。

definition.en: to boast more than someone else; to outdo others in bragging
definition.zh: 比别人更爱吹嘘；在夸口方面胜过他人

examples.en: He tried to outvaunt his rivals with stories of his success.
examples.zh: 他试图用自己的成功经历来压过对手的吹嘘。

examples.en: In arguments online, people often outvaunt each other instead of sharing facts.
examples.zh: 在网上争论时，人们常常互相攀比吹嘘，而不是分享事实。

definition.en: to surpass or outshine (someone or something), often in a proud or showy way
definition.zh: 胜过；压倒（常带自夸或张扬的意味）

examples.en: The new athlete outvaunted the old champion in speed and confidence.
examples.zh: 这位新运动员在速度和自信上都压过了老冠军。

examples.en: No speech could outvaunt the simple courage of the volunteers.
examples.zh: 任何演讲都无法胜过志愿者们朴素的勇气。

extraExplanation: “outvaunt”较为少见，带有文学/古风色彩：out-（超过）+ vaunt（夸耀、吹嘘）。在现代英语中更常用的表达是“outdo someone in bragging / boast more than… / outshine…”。
“vaunt”这个词在文学作品（如莎士比亚等较早期英语）中更常见，因此“outvaunt”也常出现在偏文学或修辞感更强的语境里。

summary.en: Outvaunted means excessively praised or boasted about—often more than is deserved, in a literary style.
summary.zh: Outvaunted 指“被过度吹捧/夸赞的”（常带“名不副实”的意味，偏文学用法）。

definition.en: (literary) Praised or boasted about more than others; made to seem superior by excessive praise.
definition.zh: （文学用语）被过度称赞的；被夸得比别的更好、仿佛更优越的。

examples.en: The movie was outvaunted in the press, but many viewers found it disappointing.
examples.zh: 这部电影在媒体上被夸得天花乱坠，但很多观众却觉得失望。

examples.en: Her quiet skill outshone the outvaunted “star” of the team.
examples.zh: 她低调的实力反而盖过了队里那位被大肆吹捧的“明星”。

definition.en: Past form of “outvaunt”: to boast about or praise something more than someone or something else.
definition.zh: “outvaunt”的过去式/过去分词：比别人更夸口或更夸赞；把某物吹捧得超过他人或他物。

examples.en: Rival brands outvaunted one another in ads, each claiming to be the best.
examples.zh: 竞争品牌在广告里互相吹捧压过对方，都宣称自己最好。

examples.en: He outvaunted his achievements, and it made others uncomfortable.
examples.zh: 他把自己的成就夸得太过，弄得别人不太舒服。

extraExplanation: “outvaunted”比较少见，偏文学或修辞风格。常见的近义表达有 overpraised（被过度称赞的）、overhyped（被过度炒作的）、much-vaunted（广受吹捧的）。
构词上：out- 表示“超过/胜过”，vaunt 表示“夸耀/吹嘘/称赞”。因此 outvaunt 有“夸得比别人更厉害”或“让某物的名声盖过别的”的感觉。

summary.en: Outvaunting means boasting more than others—trying to outdo someone in bragging.
summary.zh: outvaunting 指“比别人更会吹嘘”，在夸耀上想压过他人。

definition.en: (present participle of outvaunt) boasting more than someone else; trying to surpass others in bragging.
definition.zh: （outvaunt 的现在分词）比别人更爱吹嘘；在夸耀、炫耀上压过他人。

examples.en: He kept outvaunting his teammates, turning a small success into a loud speech.
examples.zh: 他不断压过队友地吹嘘，把一点小成绩讲成了一场高调演说。

examples.en: In the meeting, outvaunting didn’t impress anyone—clear results did.
examples.zh: 在会议上，逞强式的炫耀并没有打动任何人——真正有说服力的是清晰的成果。

definition.en: (as an adjective) characterized by excessive or competitive boasting.
definition.zh: （作形容词）带有争强好胜式吹嘘的；夸耀过度的。

examples.en: His outvaunting tone made the conversation uncomfortable.
examples.zh: 他那种争着炫耀的语气让谈话变得不自在。

extraExplanation: “out-”常表示“胜过、超过”（如 outdo / outshine）。因此 outvaunt = “在 vaunt（夸耀）这件事上超过别人”。
vaunt 本身较偏文学/正式语体，现代日常英语更常用 boast, brag。outvaunting 多见于修辞性文字或文学语境，用来强调“互相攀比式的吹嘘”。

summary.en: “Outvaunts” means “boasts more than someone else” (a rare, literary word).
summary.zh: “outvaunts”意为“比别人更爱吹嘘/在夸耀上胜过别人”（较少见、偏文学用法）。

definition.en: to boast more than someone else; to surpass someone in bragging
definition.zh: 比别人更爱吹嘘；在夸耀上胜过（某人）

examples.en: He outvaunts his rivals whenever the topic turns to money.
examples.zh: 一谈到钱，他就比对手更爱吹嘘。

examples.en: On social media, brands sometimes outvaunt one another with flashy claims.
examples.zh: 在社交媒体上，品牌有时会用夸张的宣传互相攀比。

definition.en: third-person singular present of “outvaunt” (used with he/she/it); meaning “boasts more than” or “outboasts”
definition.zh: “outvaunt”的一般现在时第三人称单数形式（he/she/it 用）；意思是“更爱吹嘘/吹得比……更厉害”

examples.en: She outvaunts everyone in the office about her connections.
examples.zh: 她在办公室里吹嘘人脉时，谁都比不过她。

extraExplanation: “outvaunt”属于比较少见、偏文学/修辞的用词，日常英语里更常用 outboast、brag more than 或 boast about… more than… 来表达同样意思。
前缀 out- 常表示“超过/胜过”（如 outshine 胜过、outperform 表现优于），vaunt 表示“夸耀、吹嘘”。合起来就是“在夸耀上胜过别人”。

summary.en: Outvelvet means to surpass in velvet-like softness or luxurious richness, and (rarely) to outdo someone in polished refinement.
summary.zh: Outvelvet 指在“天鹅绒般的柔软/华丽质感”上胜过；（少见）也可比喻在圆滑、精致的风格上压过别人。

definition.en: to surpass someone or something in velvet-like softness, richness, or luxurious appearance; to be more “velvety” than
definition.zh: 在柔软、华丽或“天鹅绒般”的质感与外观上胜过（某人/某物）；比……更“绒”更奢华

examples.en: The new fabric outvelvets the old one—it feels softer and looks richer under the light.
examples.zh: 这种新面料比旧的更“绒”——摸起来更软，在灯光下看起来更有质感。

examples.en: With careful lighting and color, the set design outvelveted everything else on stage.
examples.zh: 通过精心的灯光和配色，这个布景的“华丽绒感”压过了舞台上的其他元素。

definition.en: (figurative, rare) to outdo someone in refinement, smoothness, or polished style
definition.zh: （比喻义，少见）在优雅、圆滑或精致风格上胜过（某人）

examples.en: He tried to outvelvet his rivals with perfectly courteous speeches.
examples.zh: 他试图用无可挑剔的礼貌演讲在风度上压过对手。

examples.en: Her writing can outvelvet others—smooth, glossy, and carefully controlled.
examples.zh: 她的写作能在“精致顺滑”上胜过他人——流畅、亮泽、克制。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见的构词，常见于较老的文学或修辞性写作中。前缀 out- 表示“超过/胜过”，velvet 作为动词时可表示“使如天鹅绒般柔软/光滑”，合起来就是“在绒感或华丽感上胜过”。
日常英语里通常不用 outvelvet；更常见的表达是：be softer than, look more luxurious than, outshine, surpass, outdo 等。

summary.en: Outvenom means to surpass someone in venom—being more spiteful, bitter, or malicious (usually in words), and rarely it can mean more literally “more venomous.”
summary.zh: outvenom 指在“毒辣/恶意”方面胜过他人（多指言语更刻薄），少数情况下也可字面指“更有毒”。

definition.en: to surpass someone in venom (spite, bitterness, or maliciousness), especially in speech or writing; to be more poisonous or hateful than.
definition.zh: 在“毒辣、刻薄、恶意（言语或态度）”方面胜过某人；比……更恶毒/更刻薄。

examples.en: In online arguments, people sometimes try to outvenom each other with harsher and harsher insults.
examples.zh: 在网络争吵中，人们有时会用越来越刻薄的辱骂来互相“比毒”。

examples.en: She refused to outvenom her critics and answered calmly instead.
examples.zh: 她拒绝和批评者比谁更恶毒，而是选择冷静回应。

definition.en: (rare, literal) to be more venomous than; to exceed in poisonous effect.
definition.zh: （罕见，字面）比……更有毒；在毒性/毒效方面超过。

examples.en: This species doesn’t outvenom its rival, but it is faster.
examples.zh: 这种物种并不比它的对手更毒，但速度更快。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outdo 胜过，outshine 更出色）。因此 outvenom = out- + venom（毒液/恶意），常用于比喻“言语更刻薄、更恶毒”。
这个词比较少见，写作中更常用的表达有 outdo someone in spite / be more venomous / be more vitriolic（更尖刻）。

summary.en: A rare/poetic verb meaning “to defeat; to win over.”
summary.zh: 一个罕见/诗歌化的动词，意思是“击败；战胜”。

definition.en: (rare, poetic) To defeat someone; to win over someone in a contest or struggle.
definition.zh: （罕见/诗歌用语）击败某人；在竞争或斗争中胜过某人。

examples.en: They hoped to outvictor their rivals in the final match.
examples.zh: 他们希望在决赛中击败对手。

examples.en: No army could outvictor them on that rough terrain.
examples.zh: 在那种崎岖地形上，没有军队能战胜他们。

extraExplanation: “outvictor”非常少见，现代英语里更常用的是“defeat / beat / overcome / outdo”。它带有把“out-（胜过）+ victor（胜利者）”拼在一起的造词感，常见于较夸张、修辞性或仿古的表达。
如果你是在古诗、戏剧或较旧的文本里看到它，可以把它理解为“to defeat”。在日常写作中用更常见的动词会更自然。

summary.en: Outvie means to outlive someone or to surpass them in competition or strength.
summary.zh: outvie 指“比某人活得更久”，也可指“在竞争或能力上胜过、超越”。

definition.en: to live longer than someone; to outlive someone
definition.zh: 比某人活得更久；比某人长寿（同 outlive）

examples.en: She outvied most of her friends and lived into her nineties.
examples.zh: 她比大多数朋友都长寿，活到九十多岁。

examples.en: Many of the old trees outvied the buildings around them.
examples.zh: 许多老树比周围的建筑存在得更久。

definition.en: to surpass or exceed (someone or something), especially in energy, success, or endurance
definition.zh: 胜过；超越（尤指在精力、成就或耐力方面）

examples.en: In the second half, the younger team outvied their rivals in speed.
examples.zh: 下半场，年轻的球队在速度上胜过了对手。

examples.en: Her curiosity outvied her fear, so she kept exploring.
examples.zh: 她的好奇心压过了恐惧，于是继续探索。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，常表示“超过、胜过、比……更……”。因此 outvie 字面意思就是“在 vie（竞争、争胜）上胜过”。
outvie 在现代英语中不算常用；日常表达里更常用 outlive（比……活得久）或 outdo / surpass（超过、胜过）。

summary.en: “Outvied” means “surpassed someone in competition”; it’s the past form of “outvie.”
summary.zh: “outvied”表示“在竞争中胜过某人”，是“outvie”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “outvie”: to compete with someone and do better than them; to surpass in rivalry or effort.
definition.zh: “outvie”的过去式和过去分词：在竞争中胜过对方；在较量或努力上超越。

examples.en: She outvied her rivals in the final round and won the prize.
examples.zh: 她在决赛中胜过对手，赢得了奖项。

examples.en: The two teams outvied each other for control of the ball.
examples.zh: 两支球队为争夺控球权展开较量，互不相让。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“在……方面超过/胜过”（如 outdo 超过、outnumber 数量超过）。因此 outvie 的核心意思就是“在竞争中胜过（vie=竞争）”。
拼写提示：vie 的过去式/过去分词是 vied，所以 outvie 变为 outvied。

summary.en: “Outvier” is not standard; you probably mean “outvie,” meaning to outcompete or surpass someone.
summary.zh: “outvier” 不是标准用法；你可能想写 “outvie”，意思是在竞争中胜过或超过某人。

definition.en: (Not standard) Likely a misspelling of “outvie.”
definition.zh: （不标准）很可能是 “outvie” 的拼写错误。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “outvier” in standard dictionaries; did you mean “outvie”?
examples.zh: 我在标准词典里找不到 “outvier”；你是不是想写 “outvie”？

examples.en: They tried to outvie their rivals in speed.
examples.zh: 他们试图在速度上胜过对手。

definition.en: To surpass or defeat someone by competing harder or better; to do better than another person in a competition.
definition.zh: 在竞争中胜过、压过（某人）；比别人更努力或表现更好。

examples.en: Two companies are trying to outvie each other for customers.
examples.zh: 两家公司正互相竞争，争夺顾客。

examples.en: She outvied the other applicants with her experience.
examples.zh: 她凭借经验胜过了其他申请者。

examples.en: The teams outvied one another in a close final.
examples.zh: 两支队伍在势均力敌的决赛中激烈较量。

extraExplanation: “outvie” 由 out-（超过）+ vie（竞争）组成，语气偏正式，常见搭配是 “outvie someone” 或 “outvie each other / one another”。
“outvier” 不是常见的英语词形。如果你想表达“更能竞争/更胜一筹”，英语通常不用 *outvier* 这种比较级形式，而会说 “more competitive” 或直接用动词 “outvie”。

summary.en: “Outvies” is the third-person singular form of “outvie,” meaning to outcompete or surpass someone (or something).
summary.zh: “outvies”是动词“outvie”的第三人称单数形式，意思是“胜过、超过（某人或某事物）”。

definition.en: to defeat someone by doing better than them, especially in competing for attention, success, or praise
definition.zh: 在竞争中胜过（某人）；（尤指争夺关注、成功或赞赏时）比……更出色

examples.en: The new café tried to outvie its rivals with better coffee and lower prices.
examples.zh: 这家新咖啡馆试图用更好的咖啡和更低的价格胜过竞争对手。

examples.en: On social media, people sometimes outvie one another for likes and attention.
examples.zh: 在社交媒体上，人们有时会互相较劲，争夺点赞和关注。

definition.en: (less common) to surpass something else; to be better or more impressive than it
definition.zh: （较少见）超过（某事物）；比……更令人印象深刻

examples.en: The sequel outvied the original in visual effects.
examples.zh: 续集在视觉特效上超过了原作。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“outvies”通常是动词 outvie 的第三人称单数（he/she/it outvies）。原形是 outvie，过去式/过去分词是 outvied，现在分词是 outvying。
out- 这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”，类似的词有 outdo（胜过）、outperform（表现优于）、outshine（更出色）。

summary.en: “Outvigil” means to keep watch longer than someone else or to be more vigilant than them.
summary.zh: “outvigil”表示在守夜/警戒中比别人坚持更久，或比别人更警觉（较少见的用法）。

definition.en: to keep watch (stay awake and alert) longer than someone else; to outlast someone in a vigil
definition.zh: （在守夜/警戒中）比别人坚持得更久；守得比别人更久

examples.en: The nurse outvigiled everyone, staying beside the patient all night.
examples.zh: 那位护士比所有人都守得更久，整夜陪在病人身边。

examples.en: He tried to outvigil his rival during the night watch.
examples.zh: 他试图在夜间值守中比对手更能熬。

definition.en: to watch more carefully or more vigilantly than someone else
definition.zh: 比别人观察得更仔细/更警觉

examples.en: In a tense meeting, she outvigiled the room, noticing every small reaction.
examples.zh: 在紧张的会议上，她比所有人都更警觉，注意到每一个细微反应。

extraExplanation: “outvigil”很少见，属于可理解但不常用的构词：out-（胜过、超过）+ vigil（守夜、警戒）。日常英语里更常说：“stay up later than… / keep watch longer than… / be more vigilant than…”。

summary.en: Outvillage means a smaller, outlying village away from the main town or central village.
summary.zh: outvillage 指远离主镇或中心村的外村、偏远小村。

definition.en: an outlying or smaller village located away from the main town or central village
definition.zh: （相对主镇或中心村）偏远的外村、边远小村

examples.en: The clinic serves the town and several outvillages in the surrounding hills.
examples.zh: 这家诊所服务镇上以及周围山里的几个外村。

examples.en: She grew up in an outvillage, so traveling to the city took a full day.
examples.zh: 她在外村长大，所以去一趟城里要花一整天。

extraExplanation: “outvillage”在现代标准英语里不算常用词，更常见的写法是“outlying village”或“out-village”（加连字符）。在一些地区性英语（例如某些北美偏远地区、或特定历史/行政语境）里，可能会用它来指“主聚落之外的村落”。
如果你是在文章或地名资料里看到它，建议结合上下文判断：它通常强调“距离中心更远、资源与交通更不便利”的含义，而不一定表示“村外面”（字面意思）。

summary.en: Outvillain means to surpass someone in wickedness or cruelty.
summary.zh: outvillain 指在邪恶或残忍方面胜过他人。

definition.en: to be even more villainous, cruel, or wicked than someone else; to surpass in wrongdoing
definition.zh: 比别人更邪恶、更残忍；在作恶方面胜过（某人）

examples.en: In the story, the new tyrant tries to outvillain his predecessor with harsher laws.
examples.zh: 在故事里，新暴君用更严苛的法律试图在邪恶程度上胜过前任。

examples.en: He thought he could outvillain everyone, but the truth exposed him.
examples.zh: 他以为自己能比所有人更坏，但真相揭穿了他。

extraExplanation: 这个词由 out-（“超过、胜过”）+ villain（“恶棍”）构成，常见于文学或评论性写作中，用来强调“在坏这件事上还要更坏”的夸张对比。
多用于描述故事人物或政治讽刺语境，带有强烈的评价色彩；日常口语中更常用 outdo / be worse than 或更具体的动词（如 betray, harm, intimidate）。

summary.en: Outvociferate means to be louder than someone else—to outshout them.
summary.zh: outvociferate 指“用更大的嗓门压过别人”，相当于 outshout。

definition.en: to be louder than someone else; to outshout or outcry
definition.zh: （在声音上）盖过别人；比别人喊得更响；压过别人的叫喊

examples.en: The candidates tried to outvociferate each other during the debate.
examples.zh: 辩论中，候选人试图用更大的嗓门压过对方。

examples.en: In the noisy stadium, fans outvociferated the referee’s announcements.
examples.zh: 在嘈杂的体育场里，球迷的喊声盖过了裁判的广播。

examples.en: He didn’t want to outvociferate her—he wanted to listen.
examples.zh: 他不想用更大的嗓门压过她——他想听她说。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见、偏书面/幽默的词，由前缀 out-（“胜过、超过”）+ vociferate（“大声叫喊”）构成。日常英语里更常用 outshout, shout down, be louder than。
带有“用音量取胜”的语气，常用于描述争吵、辩论、公众场合的喧闹等情境。

summary.en: “Outvociferated” means “shouted louder than others,” overpowering their voices.
summary.zh: “Outvociferated”表示“喊得比别人更大声”，从而把别人的声音压过去。

definition.en: past tense of outvociferate: to shout louder than someone else; to drown out another voice by louder shouting.
definition.zh: outvociferate 的过去式：比别人喊得更大声；用更大的喊叫声压过他人的声音。

examples.en: The protesters outvociferated the speakers on the stage, so the announcements were hard to hear.
examples.zh: 抗议者的喊声压过了台上的演讲者，所以公告很难听清。

examples.en: In the heated meeting, one manager outvociferated the rest and dominated the room.
examples.zh: 在那场激烈的会议里，一位经理的声音压过其他人，掌控了整个场面。

extraExplanation: 这是一个比较少见、偏书面或文学感的词。由前缀 out-（“胜过、超过”）+ vociferate（“大声叫喊”）构成，常用来强调“在吵闹的场合里用更大的声音压过别人”。日常口语更常说 shout louder than / drown out / outshout。

summary.en: Outvociferating means shouting louder than others to overpower their voices.
summary.zh: outvociferating 指“喊得比别人更大声，用噪音压过别人”。

definition.en: shouting louder than someone else; trying to drown out another person’s voice by being noisier
definition.zh: 比别人喊得更大声；用更吵的声音压过他人的声音

examples.en: In the heated debate, he kept outvociferating the others instead of listening.
examples.zh: 在激烈的辩论中，他一直用更大的嗓门压过别人，而不是认真听。

examples.en: The two fans were outvociferating each other from opposite sides of the stadium.
examples.zh: 两个球迷在体育场两侧互相“比嗓门”，谁也不让谁。

definition.en: speaking or protesting with increasingly loud and angry shouting (an uncommon, literary-style use)
definition.zh: 用越来越大、越来越激动的喊叫方式说话或抗议（较少见，偏书面/文学用法）

examples.en: The crowd began outvociferating as the announcement continued.
examples.zh: 随着公告继续宣读，人群开始越喊越凶。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outvociferate 字面意思就是“在喊叫上胜过别人”。
outvociferating 是 outvociferate 的现在分词/动名词形式，常用来强调“当下正在用更大的声音压过别人”，语体上比较少见，写作中更可能见到 louder than / shout over / drown out 等更常用表达。

summary.en: Outvoice means to be louder than someone else or to drown out another voice; less commonly, to express something more strongly than others.
summary.zh: Outvoice 指说话/唱歌声音更大以盖过他人；较少见时也可指表达得比别人更强烈、更有力。

definition.en: to speak or sing louder than someone else; to drown out another voice
definition.zh: （在说话或唱歌时）声音比别人更大；盖过别人的声音

examples.en: In the crowded hall, she tried to outvoice the noise so everyone could hear the instructions.
examples.zh: 在拥挤的大厅里，她努力提高音量盖过噪声，好让大家听清指示。

examples.en: Fans outvoiced the announcer during the final minutes of the game.
examples.zh: 比赛最后几分钟，球迷的喊声盖过了播音员的声音。

definition.en: to express or state more strongly or clearly than others (less common)
definition.zh: （较少见）比别人表达得更强烈或更清楚

examples.en: In the debate, he outvoiced his opponents with a simple, direct message.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，他用简洁直接的信息更有力地表达观点，压过了对手。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber, outwork）。因此 outvoice 字面意思就是“在声音/表达上胜过”。
这个词在日常英语里比较少见，更常用的表达是 “speak louder than… / drown out… / overpower…”（盖过、压过）。在写作中用 outvoice 会显得更书面或更强调“胜过”。

summary.en: Outvoiced means someone’s voice was louder and more heard than others (past form of outvoice).
summary.zh: outvoiced 指（outvoice 的过去式/过去分词）声音比别人更大、更能被听见，盖过对方。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of outvoice) spoke more loudly than someone else, so your voice was heard over theirs.
definition.zh: （outvoice 的过去式/过去分词）比别人说得更大声，使自己的声音盖过对方。

examples.en: In the noisy meeting, she outvoiced everyone and pushed her idea through.
examples.zh: 在嘈杂的会议上，她的声音盖过了所有人，把自己的想法推进了。

examples.en: He was outvoiced by the crowd, so he raised his hand instead of shouting.
examples.zh: 他的声音被人群盖过去了，所以他举手而不是继续喊。

definition.en: (as a verb form) to outvoice someone: to speak louder than them; to drown out their voice.
definition.zh: （作动词形式）outvoice 某人：比对方说得更大声；用更大的声音压过对方。

examples.en: Don’t try to outvoice your classmates—take turns speaking.
examples.zh: 别试图用更大的声音压过同学——轮流发言。

examples.en: The singer outvoiced the band during the chorus.
examples.zh: 副歌时，这位歌手的声音盖过了乐队。

extraExplanation: “out-”常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outnumber 数量超过）。所以 outvoice 字面就是“在声音上胜过/盖过”。
outvoice 比较少见，更常用的表达有 speak louder than, talk over, drown out, overpower someone’s voice。

summary.en: Outvoice means to be louder than someone else and drown out their voice.
summary.zh: outvoice 指声音比别人更大，从而压过对方的声音。

definition.en: to speak, shout, or sing more loudly than someone else; to drown out another voice
definition.zh: 比别人说得更大声；用更大的声音压过他人的声音

examples.en: The crowd outvoiced the speaker, so we couldn’t hear the announcement.
examples.zh: 人群的声音压过了演讲者，所以我们听不清公告。

examples.en: She tried to outvoice her teammates during the chant.
examples.zh: 她在口号声中试图比队友喊得更大声。

examples.en: In the noisy bar, you have to outvoice the music to be understood.
examples.zh: 在吵闹的酒吧里，你得用更大的声音盖过音乐，别人才能听懂。

extraExplanation: “outvoice”由 out-（超过）+ voice（声音）构成，意思直观，但在现代英语里相对少见；更常见的表达是 “speak louder than …” 或 “raise your voice over …”。

summary.en: Outvoicing can mean overpowering another person’s voice, or (in linguistics) voicing a sound that is normally voiceless because of context.
summary.zh: outvoicing 可以指“声音盖过别人”，也可指（语言学中）把通常应为清音的声音读成浊音的“浊化”现象。

definition.en: The act of speaking or singing louder than someone else; overpowering another voice.
definition.zh: （说话或唱歌时）声音盖过别人；压过他人的声音。

examples.en: In the noisy café, he kept outvoicing everyone to make his point.
examples.zh: 在嘈杂的咖啡馆里，他一直提高嗓门，声音盖过所有人来表达观点。

examples.en: The choir practiced balance so no section was outvoicing the others.
examples.zh: 合唱团练习声部平衡，避免某个声部把其他声部盖过去。

definition.en: In phonetics/linguistics, the production of voicing (vocal-cord vibration) where a sound is expected to be voiceless, or becomes voiced because of its context.
definition.zh: （语音学/语言学）在本应清音的地方出现“浊化”（声带振动）；或因语音环境影响而变成浊音的现象。

examples.en: Some learners show outvoicing when they pronounce /s/ more like /z/ in certain words.
examples.zh: 一些学习者在某些词里会出现“浊化”，把 /s/ 读得更像 /z/。

examples.en: The teacher pointed out outvoicing in his pronunciation and asked him to keep the sound voiceless.
examples.zh: 老师指出他发音里有“浊化”，并让他把这个音保持为清音。

extraExplanation: “outvoicing”由 out-（超过、胜过）+ voice（声音）构成，因此在一般语境里可理解为“声音压过别人”。
在语言学语境中，它常被用来描述“清音变浊音”的现象（与 voicing/ devoicing 等术语相关）。具体是否算“错误”取决于语言规则与口音/方言。

summary.en: Outvote means to get more votes than someone else, or to defeat a proposal/person by majority vote.
summary.zh: outvote 指在投票中票数多于对方，从而在表决中压倒对方或使某项提案/某人落败。

definition.en: to defeat someone or something in a vote by getting more votes than them
definition.zh: 在投票中以更多票数胜过（某人/某方）；把……投下去（使对方落败）

examples.en: The proposal was outvoted 6–3.
examples.zh: 该提案以3比6被否决（在投票中落败）。

examples.en: She was outvoted by the rest of the committee.
examples.zh: 她被委员会其他成员投票压倒了。

examples.en: If enough members disagree, they can outvote the chair.
examples.zh: 如果足够多的成员不同意，他们可以在投票中压过主席。

definition.en: to vote in greater numbers than another group; to have more votes
definition.zh: （某一方）投票人数更多；获得更多票数

examples.en: In the final round, the younger voters outvoted the older voters.
examples.zh: 在最后一轮中，年轻选民的票数超过了年长选民。

examples.en: Urban areas outvote rural areas in this district.
examples.zh: 在这个选区里，城市地区的票数多于农村地区。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过人数，outperform 表现更好）。因此 outvote 很直观：在投票数量上“超过对方”。
常见搭配：outvote someone / outvote a proposal（使提案在投票中失败）。注意：outvote 不等于“upvote”（网络上点赞/顶贴）。
在英美议会或委员会语境里很常见，强调“少数服从多数”的结果，有时也带一点无奈的语气：I was outvoted.（我被投票否了/我少数服从多数了。）

summary.en: “Outvoted” means someone was defeated in a vote (or it’s the past form of “outvote”).
summary.zh: “outvoted”表示在投票中票数不够而落败（也是“outvote”的过去式/过去分词）。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “outvote”: to defeat someone in a vote by getting more votes than they do.
definition.zh: “outvote”的过去式和过去分词：在投票中以更多票数战胜对方。

examples.en: The proposal was outvoted 8–3, so it won’t move forward.
examples.zh: 该提案以8比3的票数被否决，因此不会继续推进。

examples.en: She outvoted her opponent in the final round.
examples.zh: 她在最后一轮投票中以更多票数击败了对手。

definition.en: (as an adjective) having lost a vote; defeated by more votes.
definition.zh: （作形容词）在投票中落败的；因票数较少而被否决的。

examples.en: The outvoted members asked for their concerns to be recorded in the minutes.
examples.zh: 投票落败的成员要求把他们的顾虑写入会议记录。

examples.en: Feeling outvoted, he agreed to follow the group’s decision.
examples.zh: 尽管觉得自己这边票数不足，他仍同意遵从团队决定。

extraExplanation: “outvoted”常用于会议、委员会、议会等正式场合，强调“少数服从多数”的结果：你可以不同意，但投票结果决定走向。
在美式英语里也常用“be/feel outvoted”（被/感觉被投票压过）来描述自己意见成了少数。

summary.en: “Outvoter” means a person or group that gets more votes than others.
summary.zh: “outvoter”指在投票中得票更多、票数压过对方的人或团体。

definition.en: a person or group that outvotes others (gets more votes than the opposition).
definition.zh: （人或团体）在投票中胜过对方的一方；得票更多的一方。

examples.en: In rural districts, the party’s loyal supporters were the outvoters in most local elections.
examples.zh: 在农村选区，该党的忠实支持者在多数地方选举中都是“得票更多的一方”。

examples.en: They didn’t persuade many new voters—they simply relied on being the outvoters on Election Day.
examples.zh: 他们并没有说服很多新选民——只是指望在选举日成为得票更高的一方。

extraExplanation: “outvoter”在日常英语里并不常见，更常用的是动词“outvote”（在表决中票数压过/否决）或名词短语“the majority / the winning side”。
构词上是 out-（超过）+ vote（投票）+ -er（做某事的人/物），意思直观，但正式写作中通常会换成更常见的表达。

summary.en: “Outvotes” means gets more votes than someone else, or defeats another side in a vote.
summary.zh: “outvotes”表示在投票中得票更多，从而在表决中压过对方或击败对手。

definition.en: to get more votes than another person or group; to defeat someone in a vote
definition.zh: 在投票中获得比他人/他方更多的票；以票数优势战胜对方

examples.en: She outvotes her opponent in almost every district.
examples.zh: 她在几乎每个选区的得票数都超过了对手。

examples.en: The proposal passes because supporters outvote the critics.
examples.zh: 该提案通过了，因为支持者的票数多于反对者。

examples.en: If we outvote them, the committee will approve the plan.
examples.zh: 如果我们的票数超过他们，委员会就会批准这个计划。

definition.en: to vote in greater numbers than another side (often used with “to be outvoted”)
definition.zh: （常用于被动）在投票人数或票数上处于劣势；被对方以票数压过

examples.en: They were outvoted 7 to 3.
examples.zh: 他们以3比7被否决（票数落败）。

examples.en: Minority members worry they will be outvoted on key issues.
examples.zh: 少数派成员担心在关键议题上会被多数派以票数压过。

extraExplanation: “outvotes”是动词“outvote”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outvotes）。常见搭配：outvote someone；be outvoted；outvote the opposition。
在口语或新闻中，常用具体数字表达结果：be outvoted 7–3（以7比3被对方票数压过）。

summary.en: Outvoting means winning a vote by getting more votes than another person or group.
summary.zh: outvoting 指在投票中以更多票数胜过他人或另一方。

definition.en: defeating someone in a vote by getting more votes than they do; winning a decision because your side has the majority.
definition.zh: 在投票中获得比对方更多的票而胜出；因占多数而让某项决定通过。

examples.en: The proposal passed by outvoting the opposition 8–3.
examples.zh: 该提案以 8 比 3 的票数在投票中胜过反对方而通过。

examples.en: They felt ignored because the larger group kept outvoting them.
examples.zh: 他们觉得被忽视，因为人数较多的一方总是在投票中压过他们。

examples.en: Outvoting your critics doesn’t always mean your plan is the best one.
examples.zh: 在投票中压过批评者并不总意味着你的方案就是最好的。

definition.en: the act or process of winning by having more votes than another person or group.
definition.zh: 以票数优势取胜的行为或过程。

examples.en: Outvoting can settle an argument quickly in a committee.
examples.zh: 在委员会里，用票数优势取胜可以很快结束争论。

examples.en: The meeting ended with outvoting rather than compromise.
examples.zh: 会议以投票压过对方而结束，而不是通过妥协。

extraExplanation: “outvoting”常见于会议、董事会、议会等需要表决的场景，强调“人数/票数优势”带来的结果。它有时带有负面语气：虽然赢了表决，但可能让少数意见觉得被压制（比如被多数派“碾压”）。
相关常见搭配：outvote the opposition（在表决中压过反对派）、be outvoted（被投票压过/处于少数而输）。

summary.en: Outvoyage means to sail or travel farther/faster or more successfully than others.
summary.zh: outvoyage 指在航行或旅程中比别人走得更远、更快或更顺利。

definition.en: to sail or travel farther, faster, or more successfully than someone else; to outdistance on a voyage
definition.zh: （航行中）比……航行得更远/更快/更顺利；在航程上胜过、超过

examples.en: In the strong wind, the smaller ship outvoyaged the heavier vessel.
examples.zh: 在大风中，那艘较小的船比那艘更重的船航行得更快。

examples.en: They hoped to outvoyage their rivals and reach the harbor first.
examples.zh: 他们希望在航程上超过对手，先到达港口。

definition.en: to travel farther than (another person or group)
definition.zh: （更一般地）走得比……更远；远行超过

examples.en: Over the years, she outvoyaged most of her classmates, working in three different countries.
examples.zh: 这些年里，她远行的范围超过了大多数同学，在三个不同国家工作过。

extraExplanation: 这是一个较少见、偏文学/航海语境的词，由 out-（“超过”）+ voyage（“航行/旅程”）组成。日常英语更常用 outtravel（旅行超过）、outdistance（甩开距离）、outrun（跑得更快）等。

summary.en: Outvoyaged means “surpassed others by voyaging farther or leaving them behind,” and it’s a rare, literary past form of outvoyage.
summary.zh: Outvoyaged 指“在远航/旅行上超过他人或把别人甩在后面”，是较少见、偏文学色彩的 outvoyage 过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of outvoyage) to travel farther or more widely than someone else; to surpass in voyaging.
definition.zh: （outvoyage 的过去式/过去分词）在航行/旅行的距离或范围上超过某人；比别人走得更远、航行得更广。

examples.en: By the end of the expedition, their ship had outvoyaged all the others in the fleet.
examples.zh: 远征结束时，他们的船在航程上超过了舰队里的其他船只。

examples.en: She felt she had outvoyaged her peers—not just in miles, but in experience.
examples.zh: 她觉得自己在“航行”上超越了同龄人——不仅是里程，更是经历。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of outvoyage) to sail beyond and leave another vessel or traveler behind; to outdistance at sea or on a journey.
definition.zh: （outvoyage 的过去式/过去分词）在航行或旅途中航得更快、更远，从而把另一艘船或旅行者甩在后面；在海上/旅途中拉开距离。

examples.en: In rough weather, the smaller ship was outvoyaged and arrived days later.
examples.zh: 在恶劣天气里，那艘较小的船被甩在后面，晚了好几天才到。

examples.en: The modern route outvoyaged the old one by weeks.
examples.zh: 现代航线比旧航线快了好几周。

extraExplanation: “outvoyaged”来自动词 outvoyage（out- 表示“超过/胜过” + voyage “航行/远行”）。这个词在现代日常英语里很少见，更常见的是 outtravel、outdistance、surpass 等。
它带一点文学或历史航海叙事的味道，常用于描写探险、远航或象征意义上的“走得更远、见得更多”。

summary.en: Outvoyaging means traveling farther/longer by sea than others, or the act of doing so.
summary.zh: outvoyaging 指（尤指海上）航行得比别人更远/更久，或指这种“远航超越”的行为。

definition.en: traveling (especially by sea) farther or longer than others; surpassing others in voyaging
definition.zh: （尤指海上）航行得比别人更远或更久；在远航方面超过他人

examples.en: The novel praises Polynesian navigators for outvoyaging many European explorers across the Pacific.
examples.zh: 这部小说称赞波利尼西亚航海者在太平洋上的远航能力，超过了许多欧洲探险家。

examples.en: By the end of the season, her crew was outvoyaging every other team in the region.
examples.zh: 到赛季末，她的船员远航表现领先该地区所有其他队伍。

definition.en: the act of making a longer or more ambitious voyage than others (used as a gerund)
definition.zh: （动名词）进行比他人更长或更大胆的航行；远航超越

examples.en: Outvoyaging was necessary if they wanted to reach new trading ports before winter.
examples.zh: 如果他们想在冬天前到达新的贸易港口，就必须进行更远的航行。

examples.en: Their outvoyaging changed the map of what people thought was possible.
examples.zh: 他们的更远航行改变了人们对“可能范围”的认知地图。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过数量、outperform 表现胜过）。因此 outvoyage / outvoyaging 的核心意思是“在航行距离、时长或成就上胜过别人”。
这是一个较少见、偏文学或历史叙述（航海史、探险故事）中的用词；日常英语更常说 travel farther/longer by sea、go on a longer voyage、sail farther than 等。

summary.en: Outvying means competing and surpassing others.
summary.zh: outvying 意为在竞争中胜过他人、超越对手。

definition.en: competing with someone and doing better than them; surpassing a rival through competition.
definition.zh: 在竞争中胜过对方；通过较量超越竞争者。

examples.en: The new model is outvying its competitors in battery life.
examples.zh: 新款机型在续航方面正在胜过竞争对手。

examples.en: She is outvying other candidates by showing stronger leadership.
examples.zh: 她凭借更强的领导力正在胜过其他候选人。

examples.en: Several apps are outvying each other to attract users.
examples.zh: 好几款应用正在相互竞争以吸引用户。

extraExplanation: “outvying”是动词“outvie”的现在分词形式；“out-”表示“超过/胜过”，而“vie”意为“竞争”。“outvie”在现代英语中不算特别常见，更常用的近义表达有“outdo”“outperform”“beat”“surpass”。
用法上，“outvie”常与“in + 方面/领域”搭配：outvie someone in speed/quality/price。也可用“outvie someone for + 目标”：outvie others for the top spot（为第一名而胜出）。

summary.en: Outwait means to wait longer than someone else or to keep waiting until a situation changes, often to gain an advantage.
summary.zh: Outwait 指“比别人等得更久”或“一直等到局势变化”，常带有“用耐心耗到最后以取得优势”的意味。

definition.en: to wait longer than someone else, or to keep waiting until something happens (often to gain an advantage)
definition.zh: 比别人等得更久；一直等到某事发生（常为占优势）

examples.en: We can outwait the storm, but we can’t outfight it.
examples.zh: 我们可以等风暴过去，但我们无法硬拼过去。

examples.en: The defense tried to outwait the protesters until they ran out of energy.
examples.zh: 防守方试图耗到抗议者没力气为止。

examples.en: I’ll outwait the traffic and leave after rush hour.
examples.zh: 我会等到拥堵过去，再在高峰后出发。

definition.en: to endure by waiting; to survive a difficult period through patience
definition.zh: 靠等待来熬过；以耐心撑过困难时期

examples.en: They outwaited months of uncertainty until the project was approved.
examples.zh: 他们熬过了数月的不确定，直到项目获批。

examples.en: In hard times, some businesses try to outwait the downturn.
examples.zh: 在困难时期，一些企业试图熬过经济下行。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“比……更”“胜过……”，如 outwork（比别人更努力工作）、outlive（比别人活得久）、outsmart（更聪明、智胜）。因此 outwait 的核心感觉就是“在等待这件事上胜过对方/撑得更久”。
outwait 在现代英语里不算高频，更常见的表达有 wait longer than、wait it out（等到结束）、hold out（坚持到最后）。但 outwait 很适合用在强调“耐力对抗”的语境（谈判、比赛、抗议、市场等）。

summary.en: “Outwaited” means “waited longer than someone else” or “stayed patient until a situation ended.”
summary.zh: “outwaited”表示“比别人等得更久”或“耐心撑到某种局面结束”。

definition.en: (past tense of outwait) to wait longer than someone else, so you are still waiting when the other person stops or gives up.
definition.zh: （outwait 的过去式）比别人等得更久；一直等到对方不再等或放弃。

examples.en: She outwaited everyone in line and finally got the last ticket.
examples.zh: 她比队伍里所有人都等得久，最后买到了最后一张票。

examples.en: They tried to outwait the storm, but it lasted all night.
examples.zh: 他们想等风暴过去（比风暴更能等），但风暴持续了一整夜。

definition.en: (past tense of outwait) to remain patient longer than a difficult situation, until it changes or ends.
definition.zh: （outwait 的过去式）耐心撑过一段困难局面，直到形势改变或结束。

examples.en: He outwaited months of uncertainty before the company finally approved the project.
examples.zh: 他撑过了数月的不确定，直到公司终于批准了项目。

examples.en: Sometimes the best choice is to outwait the panic and make decisions calmly.
examples.zh: 有时最好的选择是等恐慌过去，再冷静做决定。

extraExplanation: “out-”常见意思是“超过/胜过”（如 outwork 工作得更努力、outlive 活得更久）。outwait = “在等待这件事上胜过对方/局面”。
outwaited 是过去式/过去分词，常见结构：outwaited + someone（比某人更能等）/ outwaited + the situation/storm（撑过某种情况）。

summary.en: Outwaiting is the -ing form of outwait, meaning to wait longer than someone else or to wait until something difficult passes.
summary.zh: outwaiting 是 outwait 的 -ing 形式，意思是“比别人更能等”或“等到困难过去”。

definition.en: to wait longer than someone else, so that you are still waiting after they give up or leave
definition.zh: 比别人等得更久；靠“等到对方放弃/离开”来赢

examples.en: They tried to outwait each other in the negotiation.
examples.zh: 在谈判中，他们都想比对方更能耗时间。

examples.en: I’ll outwait the rain and leave when it stops.
examples.zh: 我会等雨停了再走。

definition.en: to remain waiting longer than a difficult situation lasts (often used with an object like “a storm” or “a crisis”)
definition.zh: 等到（风暴/危机等）过去；把困难“熬过去”（常接宾语）

examples.en: The campers outwaited the storm in a small cabin.
examples.zh: 露营者在小木屋里等风暴过去。

extraExplanation: “outwaiting”通常是动词 outwait 的现在分词/动名词形式（如：He is outwaiting them. / Outwaiting your opponent takes patience.）。这个词在日常英语里不算常见，更常用的表达是 wait out（如：wait out the storm=等风暴过去）。
在竞争或谈判语境里，outwait 带有“用耐心拖到对方先撑不住”的策略意味。

summary.en: “Outwaits” means “waits longer than someone else” or “endures longer by waiting.”
summary.zh: “outwaits”表示“比别人等得更久”，也可指“靠等待更能熬、更能坚持到最后”。

definition.en: to wait longer than someone else (so you are still waiting after they stop or leave)
definition.zh: 比别人等得更久（对方先走或先放弃，你还在等）

examples.en: She outwaits everyone in line because she arrives early and never leaves her spot.
examples.zh: 她在队伍里比所有人都等得久，因为她来得早，而且从不离开自己的位置。

examples.en: If you outwait your competitors, you may get the last tickets.
examples.zh: 如果你比竞争者更能等，可能就能买到最后的票。

definition.en: to endure a delay or difficult situation longer than someone else; to outlast by waiting
definition.zh: 在延误或艰难处境中比别人更能熬、更能等；靠等待坚持到最后

examples.en: The team outwaits the storm and then continues the hike.
examples.zh: 队伍熬过暴风雨后继续徒步。

examples.en: He outwaits the pressure from critics and keeps working quietly.
examples.zh: 他顶住批评带来的压力，继续默默做事。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outlast 熬过、outnumber 数量超过）。因此 outwait 的核心意思就是“在等待这件事上胜过别人”。
“outwaits”是第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outwaits）。原形是 outwait，过去式/过去分词通常是 outwaited。

summary.en: A rare verb meaning “to stay awake longer than someone.”
summary.zh: 一个罕见动词，表示“比某人醒得更久／更能熬夜”。

definition.en: (Rare) to stay awake longer than someone; to outlast another person in wakefulness.
definition.zh: （罕见）比某人醒得更久；在不睡觉这件事上“熬”过别人。

examples.en: I tried to outwake my roommate during finals week, but I fell asleep first.
examples.zh: 期末周我想比室友更能熬夜，但我先睡着了。

examples.en: The baby outwoke everyone in the house, crying through the night.
examples.zh: 宝宝比家里所有人都更“熬”，整夜哭个不停。

extraExplanation: “outwake”在现代英语里非常少见，读者更常用的表达是“stay awake longer than … / outlast …”或口语里的“outlast someone”来表示“比某人更能熬夜”。
构词上是“out-（超过）+ wake（醒着）”，语感上像“outlive（比……活得久）/ outwork（比……更拼命工作）”。写作中使用它会显得偏文学或刻意，日常交流建议用更常见的说法。

summary.en: Outwale means the outer reinforcing strip along the top edge of a canoe or small boat.
summary.zh: Outwale 指独木舟或小船上沿外侧的加固/保护条。

definition.en: the outer strip of wood, plastic, or metal along the top edge of a canoe or small boat, used to strengthen and protect the side (often paired with an inwale on the inside)
definition.zh: （独木舟或小船）舷缘外侧的加固条/护舷条（通常与内侧的 inwale 成对），用于加固并保护船身上沿

examples.en: The outwale cracked after the canoe hit a rock.
examples.zh: 独木舟撞到岩石后，舷缘外侧的加固条裂了。

examples.en: We replaced the outwales to make the boat’s sides stronger.
examples.zh: 我们更换了外舷条，让船身两侧更牢固。

extraExplanation: “Outwale”主要用于北美的独木舟/皮划艇与小型船只语境里，属于船体结构词汇；日常英语里不常见。
拼写提示：与“gunwale”（读音像“GUN-nl”）相关概念相近；outwale 是外侧，inwale 是内侧。

summary.en: Outwalk means to walk farther/longer or faster than someone, often leaving them behind.
summary.zh: Outwalk 指走得比别人更远/更久或更快，常带有把对方甩在后面的意思。

definition.en: to walk farther, longer, or more than someone else (often so they cannot keep up)
definition.zh: 走得比别人更远／更久／更多（常指把对方甩开、让对方跟不上）

examples.en: On the hike, she outwalked everyone and reached the lake first.
examples.zh: 徒步时，她走得比所有人都快，最先到达湖边。

examples.en: If you’re tired, don’t try to outwalk your friends—take a break.
examples.zh: 如果你累了，就别硬要走得比朋友更久；休息一下吧。

definition.en: to walk faster than someone and pass them
definition.zh: 走得比别人快并超过对方

examples.en: He outwalked me on the sidewalk even though I was hurrying.
examples.zh: 尽管我在赶路，他还是在人行道上走得比我快并超过了我。

examples.en: The crowd outwalked us, so we arrived later.
examples.zh: 人群走得比我们快，所以我们到得更晚。

extraExplanation: “out-” 是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“在某方面超过、胜过”。类似的词还有 outsmart（比……更聪明、智胜）、outnumber（数量超过）、outwork（比……更努力/更能干）。
outwalk 常用于日常场景（散步、徒步、逛街）和描写节奏/体力的语境；比 walk faster 更强调“超过别人”或“走得更多”。

summary.en: Outwalked means “walked faster/farther/longer than someone,” so you surpassed them on foot.
summary.zh: outwalked 指“走得比别人更快/更远/更久”，因此在步行上超过了对方。

definition.en: (Past tense/past participle of outwalk) to walk faster, farther, or longer than someone and therefore surpass or leave them behind.
definition.zh: （outwalk 的过去式/过去分词）走得比某人更快、更远或更久，从而超过或甩开对方。

examples.en: She outwalked everyone on the hike and reached the top first.
examples.zh: 徒步时她走得比所有人都快，最先到达山顶。

examples.en: By the last mile, he had outwalked his friend and was already waiting at the finish.
examples.zh: 到最后一英里时，他已经把朋友甩在后面，并在终点等着了。

definition.en: (Less common) to walk beyond a place or limit; to go past an area by walking.
definition.zh: （较少用）走出某个地点或界限；步行越过某个范围。

examples.en: We outwalked the town and ended up on a quiet country road.
examples.zh: 我们走出了小镇，最后来到一条安静的乡间小路。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 工作更努力、outnumber 数量超过）。因此 outwalked 通常不是“走出去”，而是“走得比别人更快/更远/更久”。

summary.en: Outwalking most commonly means surpassing someone by walking faster or farther; less commonly, it can mean going out for a long walk.
summary.zh: outwalking 最常指走得比别人更快或更远；较少见时也可指外出长时间散步。

definition.en: the act of walking faster or farther than someone; surpassing someone by walking
definition.zh: 走得比别人更快或更远；用走路的方式超过别人

examples.en: She was outwalking everyone on the hike, even the people in better shape.
examples.zh: 徒步时她走得比所有人都快，甚至超过了那些体能更好的人。

examples.en: He kept outwalking his friends, so they asked him to slow down.
examples.zh: 他一直走得比朋友们快，所以他们请他放慢一点。

definition.en: walking for a long time as exercise or for enjoyment (a less common sense, often used as a noun-like -ing form)
definition.zh: 长时间步行（作为锻炼或消遣）（较少见，用作类似名词的 -ing 形式）

examples.en: After dinner, they went outwalking along the river to relax.
examples.zh: 晚饭后，他们沿着河边散步来放松。

examples.en: Weekend outwalking became her favorite way to clear her mind.
examples.zh: 周末的长时间散步成了她最喜欢的清理思绪的方法。

synonyms: go for a walk (for the leisure sense)
extraExplanation: “outwalking”通常是动词“outwalk”的现在分词/进行时形式，最常见的意思是“走得比……快/远”，常用于比较或带点竞争意味（不一定是比赛，也可以是日常走路的节奏差异）。
在表示“外出散步”时，英语里更常说“go for a walk / go walking”。直接说“go outwalking”可以理解，但在现代日常口语中相对少见，听起来更像是强调“走出去（在户外）走很久”。

summary.en: Outwalks means ‘walks farther/faster/longer than others’ (third-person singular of outwalk).
summary.zh: outwalks 表示“走得比别人更远/更快/更久”，是 outwalk 的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: (Third-person singular of outwalk) to walk farther, faster, or longer than someone else; to surpass someone by walking.
definition.zh: （outwalk 的第三人称单数）走得比别人更远/更快/更久；在步行上超过别人。

examples.en: She outwalks most of her friends on weekend hikes.
examples.zh: 周末徒步时，她走得比大多数朋友都快/都远。

examples.en: With his long legs, he easily outwalks his teammates.
examples.zh: 他腿长，所以很容易走得比队友快。

definition.en: (Less common) to walk past someone or something and leave them behind.
definition.zh: （较少见）从某人/某物旁边走过，把对方甩在身后。

examples.en: He outwalks the crowd and reaches the exit first.
examples.zh: 他把人群甩在后面，第一个到达出口。

extraExplanation: “outwalks”是动词“outwalk”的一般现在时第三人称单数形式（he/she/it outwalks）。常用来描述体力、步速或耐力上的优势。
构词上由“out-（超过）+ walk（走路）”组成，类似的还有“outwork（比……更努力）”“outperform（表现胜过）”。

summary.en: Outwall means an outer wall, especially an outer defensive wall of a fort or city.
summary.zh: outwall 指外墙，尤指城防或要塞的外层城墙。

definition.en: an outer wall, especially the outer defensive wall of a castle, city, or fortification
definition.zh: 外墙；（尤指城堡、城镇或要塞的）外层城墙

examples.en: The attackers reached the outwall before they met heavy resistance at the gate.
examples.zh: 进攻者到达外城墙后，才在城门处遭遇猛烈抵抗。

examples.en: Archaeologists found traces of an outwall that once protected the settlement.
examples.zh: 考古学家发现了曾保护该聚落的外城墙遗迹。

extraExplanation: “outwall”在现代日常英语中很少用，更常见的说法是“outer wall”或“perimeter wall”。它多出现在历史、考古、军事防御工事或建筑类文本中，用来强调“内外两道墙”中的外侧那一道。

summary.en: Outwallop means to defeat or hit someone with greater force or by a large margin.
summary.zh: outwallop 指以更大优势或更强力道击败/压制（较口语）。

definition.en: to beat or defeat someone decisively; to overpower (often in a rough, energetic way).
definition.zh: 彻底打败；压倒性胜过（常含“狠狠收拾/痛击”的口语色彩）。

examples.en: Our team outwalloped the competition in the second half.
examples.zh: 我们队在下半场把对手打得落花流水。

examples.en: She outwalloped her opponent and won the match easily.
examples.zh: 她轻松压制对手，赢下了比赛。

definition.en: to hit, strike, or punish more strongly or more often than someone else.
definition.zh: 比别人打得更狠/更频繁；下手更重。

examples.en: In the snowball fight, he outwalloped everyone with rapid throws.
examples.zh: 在打雪仗时，他连珠炮似地扔雪球，把所有人都“打”过了。

examples.en: The bigger dog outwalloped the smaller one until it backed off.
examples.zh: 那只更大的狗把小狗压制得连连后退。

extraExplanation: “out-”是常见前缀，表示“比……更、超过”。“wallop”是比较口语的词，既可指“猛击/痛打”，也可引申为“轻松大胜”。因此“outwallop”整体带有较强的口语、夸张色彩，书面正式写作中更常用“defeat soundly / overpower / outclass”。

summary.en: Outwander means to wander farther/longer than others, or to stray beyond a boundary.
summary.zh: outwander 指走得比别人更远/更久，或游荡越过某个界限。

definition.en: to wander farther, longer, or more widely than someone or something else
definition.zh: 比（他人/他物）走得更远、游荡得更久或更广

examples.en: During the hike, Lena outwandered the group and reached the ridge first.
examples.zh: 徒步时，莉娜走得比队伍更远，先到达了山脊。

examples.en: If you outwander your guide, you might get lost.
examples.zh: 如果你走得比向导更远，可能会迷路。

definition.en: to wander beyond a certain place or boundary
definition.zh: 游荡到某个地点或边界之外

examples.en: The child outwandered the park and ended up on a busy street.
examples.zh: 孩子走出了公园，最后到了繁忙的街道上。

examples.en: The goats sometimes outwander the fence line in search of grass.
examples.zh: 山羊有时会越过栅栏边界去找草吃。

extraExplanation: “out-”这个前缀常表示“超过、胜过”（如 outwork 比别人更努力工作，outgrow 长得超过/不再适合）或“超出范围”（如 outrun 跑出/跑得比……快）。因此 outwander 多用于强调“走得比……更远/更久”或“走出界限”。该词较少见，写作中也常用 wander farther/stray beyond 来替代。

summary.en: Outwar is a rare verb meaning “defeat in war,” and it is also the name of an online game (Outwar).
summary.zh: outwar 既可作罕见动词表示“在战争中击败”，也可指网络游戏名《Outwar》。

definition.en: (rare) to defeat someone in war; to win a war against someone.
definition.zh: （罕见用法）在战争中击败某人；战胜某国/某方。

examples.en: They believed they could outwar their enemies through better strategy.
examples.zh: 他们相信自己可以凭借更好的战略在战争中击败敌人。

examples.en: No nation can outwar every rival forever.
examples.zh: 没有哪个国家能永远在战争中战胜所有对手。

definition.en: a title/name used for an online game called Outwar.
definition.zh: 网络游戏《Outwar》的名称。

examples.en: He used to play Outwar after school.
examples.zh: 他以前放学后常玩《Outwar》。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“比……更…… / 超过……”，例如 outsmart（比……更聪明）、outwork（比……更努力）。因此 outwar 按构词法可以理解为“在战争上压过对方”，但在现代英语里并不常用，更多时候人们会说 defeat in war / win a war against / militarily defeat。
如果你指的是游戏名，通常需要首字母大写写作 Outwar，并把它当作专有名词使用。

summary.en: Outwarble means to outsing or surpass someone (often in a trilling, birdlike way).
summary.zh: outwarble 指在婉转的歌唱（常像鸟鸣般颤音）上胜过别人。

definition.en: to sing or warble better, longer, or more loudly than someone else; to surpass in trilling song (often used playfully or in writing about birds).
definition.zh: （常带俏皮或文学色彩）比别人唱得更婉转/更久/更响；在颤音般的歌唱上胜过（常用于鸟鸣描写）。

examples.en: The nightingale seemed to outwarble every other bird in the garden.
examples.zh: 那只夜莺似乎把花园里其他鸟都“唱”赢了。

examples.en: She tried to outwarble her sister during karaoke, turning the ballad into a contest.
examples.zh: 她在卡拉OK时想把姐姐比下去，把情歌唱成了比赛。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outsmart 胜过、outperform 表现优于）。因此 outwarble = out- + warble（婉转歌唱/鸟儿啁啾）。
这个词不算常见，更像是写作中为了形象或幽默而造出来的动词；日常更常说 sing better than / outsing。

summary.en: “Outwarbled” means “surpassed in warbling,” i.e., sang or trilled more beautifully or loudly than another.
summary.zh: “outwarbled”表示“在婉转的颤音式歌唱/鸣叫上胜过……”，即比别人唱得/叫得更婉转或更响亮。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle) sang or produced trilling sounds better, more beautifully, or more loudly than someone/something else; surpassed in warbling.
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词）在颤音般的歌唱或鸣叫上胜过……；唱得/叫得比……更婉转或更响亮。

examples.en: The nightingale outwarbled the other birds at dawn.
examples.zh: 黎明时分，夜莺的歌声比其他鸟都更婉转。

examples.en: On that track, the young singer outwarbled her rivals with effortless runs.
examples.zh: 在那首歌里，那位年轻歌手用轻松的转音胜过了对手。

examples.en: Even the small stream outwarbled the distant traffic in the quiet morning.
examples.zh: 在安静的清晨，连小溪的潺潺声都盖过了远处的车流声。

extraExplanation: “out-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“超过、胜过”（如 outnumber 超过人数、outperform 表现更好）。因此 outwarble 就是“在 warble（婉转地唱/鸣叫）方面胜过”。
outwarble / outwarbled 属于比较少见、偏文学或描写性（尤其写自然与鸟鸣）的用法；日常口语更常用 sing better, outsing, outperform in singing。

summary.en: “Outwarbling” means surpassing others in sweet, musical singing or birdsong (and sometimes in expressive speech).
summary.zh: “outwarbling”指在婉转歌唱或鸟鸣方面胜过别人，也可比喻在声情并茂的表达上压过他人。

definition.en: sing or whistle more sweetly, more skillfully, or louder than someone/something else; surpass in warbling (often used in a playful or poetic way)
definition.zh: （唱歌/啁啾）比别人更婉转、更动听或更响亮；在“啭鸣/婉转歌唱”方面胜过（常带俏皮或诗意）

examples.en: The robin was outwarbling every other bird in the yard.
examples.zh: 那只知更鸟的啼声比院子里其他鸟都更婉转动听。

examples.en: She kept outwarbling her friends at karaoke, turning it into a friendly competition.
examples.zh: 她在KTV一直唱得比朋友更出彩，结果变成了一场友好的比拼。

examples.en: In spring, the garden feels alive, outwarbling the silence of winter.
examples.zh: 到了春天，花园仿佛活了过来，用鸟鸣把冬天的寂静都“唱”过去了。

definition.en: (figurative) outdo someone in expressive, musical, or enthusiastic speech
definition.zh: （比喻）在表达、语气或热情的“抑扬顿挫/声情并茂”上胜过别人

examples.en: In the debate, he wasn’t just arguing—he was outwarbling the room with dramatic speeches.
examples.zh: 在辩论中他不只是论证，还用很有戏剧性的发言把全场的气势都压住了。

examples.en: The headlines were outwarbling one another with bigger and bigger claims.
examples.zh: 各家标题越写越夸张，像是在互相“唱高调”比谁更吸睛。

extraExplanation: “outwarbling”通常是动词“outwarble”的现在分词/动名词形式。前缀 out- 表示“超过、胜过”，warble 指“鸟儿婉转鸣叫”或“用颤音轻快地唱”。因此这个词整体带有一种文学/诗意的感觉，日常口语里不算常见。

summary.en: Outward means “toward the outside” or “on/related to the outside,” and it can also describe a person’s visible behavior that may hide inner feelings.
summary.zh: outward既可表示“向外（移动）/外部的”，也可指“外在表现（可能掩盖内心真实感受）”。

definition.en: Moving away from the center; toward the outside.
definition.zh: 向外的；离中心越来越远的。

examples.en: The door opens outward, not inward.
examples.zh: 这扇门是向外开，不是向内开。

examples.en: The explosion pushed debris outward in all directions.
examples.zh: 爆炸把碎片向四面八方推开。

definition.en: Relating to the outside or surface of something; external.
definition.zh: 外部的；外表的；外面的。

examples.en: The building has an outward appearance of strength.
examples.zh: 这座建筑外观看起来很坚固。

examples.en: Outward signs of stress can include lack of sleep.
examples.zh: 压力的外在迹象可能包括睡眠不足。

definition.en: Visible behavior or expression that may not match true feelings; apparent rather than inner.
definition.zh: 外在表现（未必反映真实内心）；表面的。

examples.en: He stayed outwardly calm, though he was nervous inside.
examples.zh: 他表面上很冷静，但内心其实很紧张。

examples.en: Her outward confidence hid her doubts.
examples.zh: 她外在的自信掩盖了内心的怀疑。

extraExplanation: “outward”常与“inward”对比：outward强调外部/外在/向外，inward强调内部/内在/向内。例如：outward appearance（外表）vs. inward feelings（内心感受）。
常见搭配：outward appearance（外貌/外观），outward signs（外在迹象），outward motion（向外运动），outwardly calm（表面冷静）。其中“outwardly”是副词形式，更常用来修饰人的状态或情绪。

summary.en: “Outwardly” means “on the outside/according to appearance,” and can also mean “toward the outside.”
summary.zh: “outwardly”意为“表面上/从外表看来”，也可指“向外地/朝外部”。

definition.en: In a way that shows how someone or something appears on the outside (not necessarily how it truly is inside).
definition.zh: 在外表上；从表面看来（不一定反映内在真实情况）。

examples.en: Outwardly, she seemed calm, but she was actually nervous.
examples.zh: 表面上她看起来很冷静，但其实很紧张。

examples.en: The house looks old outwardly, yet it has been fully renovated inside.
examples.zh: 这房子外观看起来很旧，但里面已经彻底翻新了。

definition.en: Toward the outside; away from the center or inside.
definition.zh: 向外地；朝外部（远离中心或内部）。

examples.en: The door opens outwardly into the hallway.
examples.zh: 门向外开，通向走廊。

examples.en: The flower’s petals curve outwardly as it blooms.
examples.zh: 花开时花瓣向外弯曲。

extraExplanation: “outwardly”常与“inwardly（内心地）”形成对比，用来强调“外在表现 vs. 内在真实感受”。写作中常见搭配：outwardly calm/quiet/confident（表面冷静/安静/自信）。
语气上，“Outwardly, …”常用于转折铺垫：先说表象，再揭示真实情况（常与 but/though 连用），在叙事和人物描写中很常见。

summary.en: “Outwardmost” means the farthest to the outside (or located at the outer edge).
summary.zh: “outwardmost”表示“最外面的/在最外侧的（或最外缘处）”。

definition.en: Farthest to the outside; at the greatest distance from the center or inside.
definition.zh: 最外面的；离中心（或内部）最远的。

examples.en: The outwardmost layer of the skin helps protect the body.
examples.zh: 皮肤最外层有助于保护身体。

examples.en: We painted the outwardmost edge of the frame first.
examples.zh: 我们先给画框最外侧的边缘上漆。

definition.en: At the farthest outside position or point.
definition.zh: 在最外侧；在离中心最远处。

examples.en: Place the label outwardmost so it’s easy to see.
examples.zh: 把标签放在最外侧，这样更容易看到。

examples.en: The crack began outwardmost and moved inward.
examples.zh: 裂缝从最外侧开始，向内延伸。

extraExplanation: “outwardmost”在现代英语里比较少见，更常用的是“outermost”。在科学写作或较正式的描述中偶尔会看到“outwardmost”，强调“朝外方向的最外层/最外点”。
构词上：outward（向外的）+ -most（最……的）。类似的有：inwardmost（最内侧的，较少见）、uppermost（最上面的）。

summary.en: Outwardness means someone’s outer appearance or external show, often contrasted with their inner feelings or true character; it can also mean a focus on external matters.
summary.zh: Outwardness 指外表或外在表现（常与内心真实相对）；也可指关注外界、偏重外在事务的倾向。

definition.en: A person’s outer appearance or behavior, especially as contrasted with their inner feelings, character, or intentions; external show.
definition.zh: 外表；外在表现（常与内心感受、品格或真实意图相对）。

examples.en: Her outwardness was calm, but inside she felt nervous.
examples.zh: 她外表很镇定，但内心其实很紧张。

examples.en: Don’t judge people only by their outwardness.
examples.zh: 不要只凭外表评价别人。

definition.en: The quality of being outward-facing or directed toward what is outside; focus on external matters rather than inner life.
definition.zh: 外向性；关注外界与外在事务的倾向（相对内省/内在生活）。

examples.en: The community values service and outwardness rather than private pride.
examples.zh: 这个社区重视服务与对外的行动，而不是私人的骄傲。

examples.en: In the essay, he criticizes modern life’s outwardness and lack of reflection.
examples.zh: 在文章中，他批评现代生活过于追求外在、缺少反思。
